translated: what is meant is that he turns over and has turned over, and he matures and has matured,

original: nibbānapakkhandanavossaggatthañca paripaccati, yathā ca paripakko hoti, tathā naṃ
analyzed: nibbāna pakkhandana vossagga ttham ca paripaccati yathā ca paripakkaḥ hoti tathā nam
translated: for the sake of relinquishment. For this bhikkhu who is devoted to the development of the enlightenment factors turns over the enlightenment factor of mindfulness for the sake of relinquishing defilements and for the sake of surrendering to Nibbāna,

original: bhāvetīti. Esa nayo sesabojjhaṅgesu.🔽Idha pana nibbānaṃyeva sabbasaṅkhatehi vivittattā viveko, sabbesaṃ virāgabhāvato
analyzed: bhāva iti iti esa nayaḥ sesa bojjhaṅgesu  idha pana nibbānam yeva sabba saṅkhatehi vivitta ttā vivekaḥ sabbesam virāga bhāvato
translated: and he develops it in such a way that it becomes mature. The same method applies in the case of the other enlightenment factors.🔽Herein, Nibbāna is secluded since it is secluded from all determinations,🔽it is dispassion since it is the dispassion of all, and it is cessation since it is the cessation of all.

original: virāgo, nirodhabhāvato nirodhoti vuttaṃ. Maggo eva ca vossaggapariṇāmī, tasmā satisambojjhaṅgaṃ
analyzed: virāgaḥ nirodha bhāvataḥ nirodhaḥ ti vuttam maggaḥ eva ca vossagga pariṇāmī tasmā sati sambojjhaṅgam
translated: And the path itself is that which turns over into relinquishment. Therefore the enlightenment factor of mindfulness

original: bhāveti vivekaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā pavattiyā vivekanissitaṃ, tathā virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ.
analyzed: bhāveti vivekam ārammaṇam katvā pavattiyā viveka nissitam tathā virāga nissitam nirodha nissitam
translated: is “based on seclusion” since it occurs making seclusion its object, and likewise it is “based on dispassion” and “based on cessation.”

original: Tañca kho ariyamaggakkhaṇuppattiyā kilesānaṃ samucchedato pariccāgabhāvena ca nibbānapakkhandanabhāvena
analyzed: tat ca kho ariya magga kkhaṇa uppattiyā kilesānam samucchedataḥ pariccāga bhāvena ca nibbāna pakkhandana bhāvena
translated: And that is to be regarded as matured and developed in the sense of being given up as a result of the cutting off of defilements at the moment of the arising of the noble path and in the sense of tending towards Nibbāna.

original: ca pariṇataṃ paripakkanti ayameva attho daṭṭhabbo. Esa nayo sesabojjhaṅgesu. Iti🔽ime satta bojjhaṅgā lokiyalokuttaramissakā kathitā. Imesupi dvīsu balesu etadaggabhāvo
analyzed: ca pariṇatam paripakkam ti ayam eva attho daṭṭhabbo esa nayo sesa bojjhaṅgesu iti  ime satta bojjhaṅgāḥ lokiya lokuttara missakā kathitāḥ imesu pi dvīsu balesu etad agga bhāvaḥ
translated: The same method of explanation applies in the case of the other factors of enlightenment.🔽So these seven factors of enlightenment are called mundane and supramundane mixed.

original: vuttanayeneva veditabbo.🔽13. Tatiye vivicceva kāmehītiādīnaṃ catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ pāḷiattho ca bhāvanānayo ca🔽sabbo sabbākārena visuddhimagge vitthāritoyeva. Imāni pana cattāri jhānāni eko bhikkhu🔽cittekaggatthāya bhāveti, eko vipassanāpādakatthāya, eko abhiññāpādakatthāya, eko
analyzed: vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ  tatiye vivicca iva kāmehi iti ādīnam catunnam jhānānam pāḷi attho ca bhāvanā nayo ca  sabbaḥ sabba ākārena visuddhi magge vitthāritaḥ yeva imāni pana cattāri jhānāni ekaḥ bhikkhu  citta ekagga tthāya bhāveti ekaḥ vipassanā pādaka tthāya ekaḥ abhiññā pādaka tthāya ekaḥ
translated: And the pre-eminent position of these two kinds of power should be understood in the way already stated.🔽In the case of the three kinds of concentration, the meaning of the words in the description of the four jhānas beginning with “Quite secluded from sensual desires, secluded from unprofitable things” and the method of their development have all been given in detail in the Visuddhimagga in the Description of the Jhanas.

original: nirodhapādakatthāya, eko bhavavisesatthāya. Idha pana tānipi vipassanāpādakāni adhippetāni.
analyzed: nirodha pādaka tthāya ekaḥ bhava visesa tthāya idha pana tāni pi vipassanā pādakāni adhippetāni
translated: But while one bhikkhu develops these four jhānas for the purpose of unification of mind, another does so for the purpose of acquiring the kinds of direct-knowledge, another for the purpose of acquiring the meditations, another for the purpose of acquiring the deliverance, and another for the purpose of the distinction of meaning.🔽Herein, those that are for the purpose of acquiring the meditations are intended.

original: Ayaṃ hi bhikkhu imāni jhānāni samāpajjitvā samāpattito vuṭṭhāya saṅkhāre sammasitvā
analyzed: ayam hi bhikkhu imāni jhānāni samāpajjitvā samāpattitaḥ vuṭṭhāya saṅkhāre sammasitvā
translated: For when a bhikkhu has attained these jhānas and emerged from them, he comprehends formations,

original: hetupaccayapariggahaṃ katvā sappaccayaṃ nāmarūpañca vavatthapetvā indriyabalabojjhaṅgāni
analyzed: hetu paccaya pariggaham katvā sappaccayam nāma rūpañca vavatthapetvā indriya bala bojjhaṅgāni
translated: and after discerning the conditions, he defines mentality-materiality with its conditions. Then he combines the faculties, powers, and enlightenment factors,

original: samodhānetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇāti. Evametāni jhānāni lokiyalokuttaramissakāneva kathitāni.
analyzed: samodhānetvā arahattam pāpuṇāti evam etāni jhānāni kathitāni
translated: and he reaches Arahantship. So these jhānas are called “mundane and supramundane mixed.”

original: Imasmimpi baladvaye etadaggabhāvo vuttanayeneva veditabbo.🔽14. Catutthe saṃkhittena ca vitthārena cāti saṃkhittadhammadesanā vitthāradhammadesanā
analyzed: imasmim pi bala dvaye etad agga bhāvaḥ vutta nayena iva veditabbo  catutthe saṃkhittena ca vitthārena ca ati saṃkhitta dhamma desanā vitthāra dhamma desanā
translated: The meaning of the foremost position should be understood in the same way in this pair of powers too.🔽In the fourth case, “in brief and in detail” shows that there are only two kinds of teaching of the Dhamma,

original: cāti dveyeva dhammadesanāti dasseti. Tattha mātikaṃ uddisitvā kathitā desanā saṃkhittadesanā🔽nāma. Tameva mātikaṃ vitthārato vibhajitvā kathitā vitthāradesanā nāma. Mātikaṃ vā
analyzed: ca ati dveyā iva dhamma desanā ti dasseti tattha mātikam uddisitvā kathitā desanā saṃkhitta desanā  nāma tam eva mātikam vitthārataḥ vibhajitvā kathitā vitthāradesanā nāma mātikam vā
translated: that is to say, teaching in brief and teaching in detail. Herein, a teaching given by stating the mātikā is called “teaching in brief.”🔽A teaching given by analysing in detail the very same mātikā is called “teaching in detail.” A teaching given by analysing in detail without stating a mātikā is also called “teaching in detail.”

original: ṭhapetvāpi aṭṭhapetvāpi vitthārato vibhajitvā kathitā vitthāradesanā nāma. Tāsu saṃkhittadesanā
analyzed: ṭhapetvā api aṭṭhapetvā api vitthārataḥ vibhajitvā kathitāḥ vitthāradesanā nāma tāsu saṃkhitta desanā
translated: Of these, a teaching in brief is

original: nāma mahāpaññassa puggalassa vasena kathitā, vitthāradesanā nāma mandapaññassa. Mahāpaññassa
analyzed: nāma mahāpaññassa puggalassa vasena kathitā vitthāradesanā nāma manda paññassa mahāpaññassa
translated: The detailed explanation is for the person of dull understanding.

original: hi vitthāradesanā atipapañco viya hoti. Mandapaññassa saṅkhepadesanā sasakassa uppatanaṃ
analyzed: hi vitthāra desanā atipapañcaḥ viya hoti manda paññassa saṅkhepa desanā sasakassa uppatanaṃ
translated: For the person of great understanding, the detailed explanation is too much like a lot of fuss. For the person of dull understanding, the brief explanation is like a bird’s flight path that

original: viya hoti, neva antaṃ na koṭiṃ pāpuṇituṃ sakkoti. Saṅkhepadesanā ca ugghaṭitaññussa
analyzed: viya hoti nā iva antam na koṭim pāpuṇitum sakkoti saṅkhepa desanā ca ugghaṭita ññussa
translated: cannot reach either end or middle. The brief explanation is given for the person of quick understanding,

original: vasena kathitā, vitthāradesanā itaresaṃ tiṇṇaṃ vasena. Sakalampi hi tepiṭakaṃ saṅkhepadesanā
analyzed: vasena kathitā vitthāra desanā itaresam tiṇṇam vasena sakalam pi hi tepiṭakam saṅkhepa desanā
translated: the detailed explanation for the other three. For all of them, the entire Tipitaka is a brief explanation

original: vitthāradesanāti ettheva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.🔽15. Pañcame yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇeti vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ,
analyzed: vitthāra desanā ti etthā iva saṅkham gacchati  pañcame yasmim bhikkhave adhikaraṇā iti vivāda adhikaraṇam anuvāda adhikaraṇam
translated: or a detailed explanation.🔽. In the fifth, in whatever legal issue: in one of the four kinds of legal issues, that is, legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations,

original: āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, kiccādhikaraṇanti imesaṃ catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ yasmiṃ adhikaraṇe.
analyzed: āpattādhikaraṇam imesam catunnam adhikaraṇānam yasmin adhikaraṇe
translated: legal issues arising from offenses, and legal issues arising from business.

original: Āpanno ca bhikkhūti āpattiṃ āpanno bhikkhu ca. Tasmetanti tasmiṃ etaṃ. Dīghattāyāti
analyzed: āpannaḥ ca bhikkhu iti āpattim āpannaḥ bhikkhu ca tasma itanti tasmin etam dīgha ttāya ati
translated: And a monk who has fallen into an offense: a monk who has fallen into an offense. Because of that: because of that. For a long time:

original: dīghaṃ addhānaṃ tiṭṭhanatthāya. Kharattāyāti dāsa-koṇḍa-caṇḍāla-venāti evaṃ kharavācāpavattanatthāya.
analyzed: dīgham addhānam tiṭṭhana tthāya khara ttāya ati dāsa koṇḍa caṇḍāla vena ati evam khara vācā apavattana tthāya
translated: for the sake of lasting for a long time. For the sake of harshness: for the sake of the occurrence of harsh speech such as “slave,” “contemptible,” “outcaste,” “barbarous.”

original: Vāḷattāyāti pāṇi leḍḍudaṇḍādīhi paharaṇavasena kakkhaḷabhāvatthāya. Bhikkhū ca na🔽phāsuṃ viharissantīti aññamaññaṃ vivādāpanne bhikkhusaṅghe yepi uddesaṃ vā paripucchaṃ
analyzed: vāḷattāya ati pāṇi leḍḍu daṇḍa ādīhi paharaṇa vasena kakkhaḷa bhāva tthāya bhikkhū ca na  phāsum viharissanti iti aññamaññam vivāda āpanne bhikkhu saṅghe ye pi uddesam vā paripuccham
translated: For the sake of roughness: for the sake of the state of being rough by way of striking with hands, clods, sticks, etc.

original: vā gahetukāmā padhānaṃ vā anuyuñjitukāmā, te phāsuṃ na viharissanti. Bhikkhusaṅghasmiṃ
analyzed: vā gahetu kāmā padhānam vā anuyuñjitu kāmā te phāsum na viharissanti bhikkhu saṅghasmiṃ
translated: The bhikkhus will not live comfortably: when the Community of Bhikkhus is divided into factions, even those who want to learn the recitation or the interrogation or the meditation will not live comfortably.

original: hi uposathapavāraṇāya ṭhitāya uddesādīhi atthikā uddesādīni gahetuṃ na sakkonti,
analyzed: hi uposatha pavāraṇāya ṭhitāya uddesa ādīhi atthikāḥ uddesa ādīni gahetum na sakkonti
translated: For when the Community of Bhikkhus is engaged in the Uposatha and Pavarana ceremonies, those who want the recitation, etc., cannot get it,

original: vipassakānaṃ cittuppādo na ekaggo hoti, tato visesaṃ nibbattetuṃ na sakkonti. Evaṃ
analyzed: vipassakānam cittuppādaḥ na ekaggaḥ hoti tatas visesam nibbattetum na sakkonti evam
translated: and the thought of those who want to reflect is not unified, so they cannot produce any distinction. Thus

original: bhikkhū ca na phāsuṃ viharissanti. Na dīghattāyātiādīsu vuttapaṭipakkhanayena attho veditabbo.
analyzed: bhikkhū ca na phāsum viharissanti na dīgha ttāya ati ādīsu vutta paṭipakkha nayena atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: the bhikkhus will not live comfortably. The meaning of the phrases beginning with “for the sake of non-longevity” should be understood in the opposite sense to that of the phrases beginning with “for the sake of longevity.”

original: Idhāti imasmiṃ sāsane. Iti paṭisañcikkhatīti evaṃ paccavekkhati. Akusalaṃ āpannoti
analyzed: idha ati imasmim sāsane iti paṭisañcikkhati iti evam paccavekkhati akusalam āpannaḥ ti
translated: Herein: in this Dispensation. He reflects thus: he considers thus. He has committed an offense:

original: ettha akusalanti āpatti adhippetā, āpattiṃ āpannoti attho. Kañcideva desanti na sabbameva
analyzed: ettha akusalanti āpatti adhippetā āpattim āpanno ti attho kañcid eva na sabbam eva
translated: Herein, unwholesome means an offence; the meaning is, he has fallen into an offence. Some part means

original: āpattiṃ, āpattiyā pana kañcideva desaṃ aññataraṃ āpattinti attho. Kāyenāti karajakāyena.
analyzed: āpattim āpattiyā pana kañcid eva desam aññataram āpattinti attho kāyena ati karaja kāyena
translated: not all the offence, but the meaning is, some one part of the offence, any one offence. With the body means with the physical body.

original: Anattamanoti atuṭṭhacitto. Anattamanavācanti atuṭṭhavācaṃ. Mamevāti maṃyeva. Tatthāti
analyzed: anatta manoti a tuṭṭha cittaḥ anatta mana vācam iti a tuṭṭha vācam mama iva ati maṃyā iva tattha ati
translated: Not pleased means with a dissatisfied mind. Not pleased with means dissatisfied with. With me alone means with me alone. Therein means

original: tasmiṃ adhikaraṇe. Accayo accagamāti aparādho atikkamitvā madditvā gato, ahamevettha🔽aparādhiko. Suṅkadāyakaṃva bhaṇḍasminti yathā suṅkaṭṭhānaṃ pariharitvā nīte bhaṇḍasmiṃ
analyzed: tasmin adhikaraṇe accayaḥ accagamā ati aparādhaḥ atikkamitvā madditvā gataḥ aham eva ittha  bhaṇḍasmin ti yathā suṅka ṭṭhānam pariharitvā nīte bhaṇḍasmin
translated: in that legal question. Fault, transgression means blame, gone beyond, gone over the top, gone beyond the top. I alone am

original: suṅkadāyakaṃ aparādho abhibhavati, so ca tattha aparādhiko hoti, na rājāno na rājapurisāti attho.
analyzed: suṅka dāyakam aparādhaḥ abhibhavati saḥ ca tattha aparādhikaḥ hoti na rājānaḥ na rāja purisā ati attho
translated: to blame there. As the one who gives the penalty in the case of goods means just as the one who gives the penalty is to blame when goods are taken away after avoiding the place where the penalty is kept, and he alone is to blame there, not the king or the king’s men.

original: Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – yo hi raññā ṭhapitaṃ suṅkaṭṭhānaṃ pariharitvā bhaṇḍaṃ harati,
analyzed: idam vuttam hoti yaḥ hi raññā ṭhapitam suṅka ṭṭhānam pariharitvā bhaṇḍam harati
translated: This is what is said: Whoever takes away goods after avoiding the place where the penalty is kept, which has been set aside by the king,

original: taṃ saha bhaṇḍasakaṭena ānetvā rañño dassenti. Tattha neva suṅkaṭṭhānassa doso atthi,
analyzed: tam saha bhaṇḍa sakaṭena ānetvā raññaḥ dassenti tattha na iva suṅka ṭṭhānassa doso atthi
translated: and they bring it with the cart and load to the King. There is no fault in the site for the pit,

original: na rañño na rājapurisānaṃ, pariharitvā gatasseva pana doso, evamevaṃ yaṃ so bhikkhu🔽āpattiṃ āpanno, tattha neva āpattiyā doso, na codakassa. Tīhi pana kāraṇehi tasseva
analyzed: na raññaḥ na rāja purisānam pariharitvā gatassa iva pana doso evam evam yam so bhikkhu  āpattim āpannaḥ tattha na iva āpattiyāḥ dosaḥ na codakassa tīhi pana kāraṇehi tassa iva
translated: nor in the King, nor in the King’s men, but there is fault in the one who has gone away after taking it away. In the same way, whatever offence that monk🔽has committed, there is no fault in the offence, nor in the one who accuses. But there is fault in that monk

original: bhikkhuno doso. Tassa hi āpattiṃ āpannabhāvenapi doso, codake anattamanatāyapi doso,🔽anattamanassa sato paresaṃ ārocanenapi doso. Codakassa pana yaṃ so taṃ āpattiṃ āpajjantaṃ
analyzed: bhikkhuno doso tassa hi āpattim āpanna bhāvena api doso ca udake doso  an atta manassa sataḥ paresam ārocanena api doso codakassa pana yam so tam āpattim āpajjantam
translated: for three reasons. For he has fault in that he has committed an offence, he has fault in that he is displeased with the one who accuses,🔽and he has fault in that he informs others when he is displeased. But there is no fault in the one who accuses in that he saw that he had committed that offence.

original: addasa, tattha doso natthi. Anattamanatāya codanāya pana doso. Tampi amanasikaritvā
analyzed: addasa tattha dosaḥ natthi anatta manatāya codanāya pana dosaḥ a manasikaritvā
translated: But there is fault in the accusation because of his displeasure. And after disregarding that,

original: ayaṃ bhikkhu attanova dosaṃ paccavekkhanto “iti mameva tattha accayo accagamā suṅkadāyakaṃva
analyzed: ayam bhikkhu attanā iva dosam paccavekkhantaḥ iti mama iva tattha accayaḥ accagamā suṅka dāyakam iva
translated: this monk reflects on his own fault, thinking: “Thus I have had a lapse, having had a lapse I am like one who has taken away a load.”

original: bhaṇḍasmi”nti evaṃ paṭisañcikkhatīti attho. Dutiyavāre codakassa anattamanatā ca
analyzed: bhaṇḍasmin ti evam paṭisañcikkhati iti attho dutiya vāre ca udakassa anatta mana tā ca
translated: The meaning is that he reflects in this way. In the second verse there is displeasure with the one who accuses,

original: anattamanatāya coditabhāvo cāti dve dosā, tesaṃ vasena “accayo accagamā”ti ettha🔽yojanā kātabbā. Sesamettha uttānamevāti.🔽16. Chaṭṭhe aññataroti eko apākaṭanāmo brāhmaṇo. Yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamīti yenāti🔽bhummatthe karaṇavacanaṃ. Tasmā yattha bhagavā, tattha upasaṅkamīti evamettha attho🔽veditabbo. Yena vā kāraṇena bhagavā devamanussehi upasaṅkamitabbo, tena kāraṇena🔽upasaṅkamīti evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo. Kena ca kāraṇena bhagavā upasaṅkamitabbo?🔽Nānappakāraguṇavisesādhigamādhippāyena, sāduphalūpabhogādhippāyena dijagaṇehi niccaphalitamahārukkho
analyzed: anatta manatāya codita bhāvaḥ ca ati dve dosā tesam vasena accayaḥ accagamā ati ettha  yojanā kātabbā sesam ettha uttānam eva ati  chaṭṭhe aññatarā ti ekaḥ apākaṭa nāmaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamīti yena ati  bhumma tthe karaṇa vacanam tasmai yattha bhagavā tattha upasaṅkami iti evam ettha atthaḥ  veditabbaḥ yena vā kāraṇena bhagavā deva manussehi upasaṅkamitabbaḥ tena kāraṇena  upasaṅkamī ti evam ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo kena ca kāraṇena bhagavā upasaṅkamitabbaḥ  nānā ppakāra guṇa visesa adhigama adhippāyena sādu phalu upabhoga adhippāyena dija gaṇehi nicca phalita mahā rukkho
translated: and the fact that he was reproved because of his discontent. The construction here is to be done according to the two faults. The rest is clear.

original: viya. Upasaṅkamīti gatoti vuttaṃ hoti. Upasaṅkamitvāti upasaṅkamanapariyosānadīpanaṃ.
analyzed: viya upasaṅkamīti gataḥ ti vuttam hoti upasaṅkamitvā iti upasaṅkamana pariyosāna dīpanam
translated: and the fact that he was accused because of his displeasure. The construction should be understood thus: “The transgression, the falling into transgression, the offence, the falling into an offence, the blame, the falling into blame, the guilt, the falling into guilt, the mistake, the falling into a mistake” . The rest is clear.

original: Atha vā evaṃ gato tato āsannataraṃ ṭhānaṃ bhagavato samīpasaṅkhātaṃ gantvātipi vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: atha vā evam gataḥ tatas āsannataram ṭhānam bhagavataḥ samīpa saṅkhātam gantvā iti pi vuttam hoti
translated: Or else, “having gone thus” means that he went to a place nearer to the Blessed One, that is, to a place near the Blessed One.

original: Bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodīti yathā ca khamanīyādīni pucchanto bhagavā tena, evaṃ sopi
analyzed: bhagavatā saddhim sammodi iti yathā ca khamanīya ādīni pucchantaḥ bhagavā tena evam saḥ api
translated: “He exchanged greetings with the Blessed One”: just as the Blessed One asked him about his well-being, etc., so he also🔽exchanged greetings with the Blessed One. He became glad and joyful,

original: bhagavatā saddhiṃ samappavattamodo ahosi, sītodakaṃ viya uṇhodakena sammoditaṃ ekībhāvaṃ🔽agamāsi. Yāya ca “kacci, bho gotama, khamanīyaṃ, kacci yāpanīyaṃ, kacci bhoto gotamassa
analyzed: bhagavatā saddhim sama pavatta modaḥ ahosi sīta udakam viya uṇha udakena sammoditam ekībhāvam  agamāsi yāya ca kacci bho gotama khamanīyam kacci yāpanīyam kacci bhotaḥ gotamassa
translated: and he became one with the Blessed One, like cold water with cold water.

original: ca sāvakānañca appābādhaṃ appātaṅkaṃ lahuṭṭhānaṃ balaṃ phāsuvihāro”tiādikāya kathāya
analyzed: ca sāvakānam ca appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāra iti ādikāya kathāya
translated: And because he exchanged greetings with the Blessed One by means of the conversation beginning with “I trust, good Gotama, that things are going well and that you are getting by. I trust that your exertion is successful and that entry into concentration is not difficult for you,”

original: sammodi, taṃ pītipāmojjasaṅkhātassa sammodassa jananato sammodituṃ yuttabhāvato ca
analyzed: sammodi tam pīti pāmojja saṅkhātassa sammodassa jananataḥ sammoditum yutta bhāvataḥ ca
translated: that conversation is called “exchanging greetings” because it is the cause for the arising of gladness and joy, and because it is suitable for exchanging greetings.

original: sammodanīyaṃ, atthabyañjanamadhuratāya sucirampi kālaṃ sāretuṃ nirantaraṃ pavattetuṃ
analyzed: sammodanīyam attha byañjana madhura tāya su ciram pi kālam sāretum nirantaram pavattetum
translated: And because it is sweet with meaning and phrasing, it is called “worthy of being exchanged” because it can be continued uninterruptedly for a long time.

original: araharūpato saritabbabhāvato ca sāraṇīyaṃ. Suyyamānasukhato vā sammodanīyaṃ, anussariyamānasukhato🔽sāraṇīyaṃ, tathā byañjanaparisuddhatāya sammodanīyaṃ, atthaparisuddhatāya sāraṇīyanti
analyzed: araha rūpataḥ saritabba bhāvataḥ ca sāraṇīyam suyyamāna sukhataḥ vā sammodanīyam anussariyamāna sukhataḥ  sāraṇīyam tathā byañjana parisuddha tāya sammodanīyam attha parisuddha tāya sāraṇīyanti
translated: It is endearing because it is worth keeping in mind and worth remembering. Or alternatively, it is endearing because it is pleasant to hear, and it is worth keeping in mind because it is pleasant to remember.

original: evaṃ anekehi pariyāyehi sammodanīyaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ kathaṃ vītisāretvā pariyosāpetvā niṭṭhapetvā
analyzed: evam anekehi pariyāyehi sammodanīyam sāraṇīyam katham vītisāretvā pariyosāpetvā niṭṭhapetvā
translated: And it is endearing because of the purity of the phrasing, and it is worth keeping in mind because of the purity of the meaning.🔽After he had thus gladdened and rejoiced the venerable Ānanda with a talk on dhamma,

original: yenatthena āgato, taṃ pucchitukāmo ekamantaṃ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantanti bhāvanapuṃsakaniddeso “visamaṃ candimasūriyā parivattantī”tiādīsu viya.
analyzed: yenatthena āgataḥ tam pucchitu kāmo ekamantam nisīdi  ekam antam ti bhāva napuṃsaka niddesaḥ visamam candima sūriyā parivattanti itiādīsu
translated: he sat down to one side.🔽“To one side”: this is a locative determinative in the sense of “at a place to one side.”

original: Tasmā yathā nisinno ekamantaṃ nisinno hoti, tathā nisīdīti evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo.🔽Bhummatthe vā etaṃ upayogavacanaṃ. Nisīdīti upāvisi. Paṇḍitā hi purisā garuṭṭhānīyaṃ
analyzed: tasmā yathā nisinnaḥ ekamantam nisinnaḥ hoti tathā nisīdi iti evam ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo  bhummatthe vā etam upayoga vacanam nisīdi iti upāvisi paṇḍitāḥ hi purisāḥ garuṭṭhānīyam
translated: So the meaning here should be regarded as “he sat down in such a way that he was to one side of the Blessed One.”🔽Or alternatively, this is a locative determinative in the sense of “in a place to one side.”

original: upasaṅkamitvā āsanakusalatāya ekamantaṃ nisīdanti. Ayañca nesaṃ aññataro, tasmā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā āsana kusala tāya ekamantam nisīdanti ayam ca na isam aññataraḥ tasmai ekamantam nisīdi
translated: “Sat down” means “sat down to one side after approaching.” For wise men approach one who is venerable and then sit down to one side, being skilled in paying respect. And this was one of them, so he sat down to one side.

original: Kathaṃ nisinno pana ekamantaṃ nisinno hotīti? Cha nisajjadose vajjetvā. Seyyathidaṃ
analyzed: katham nisinnaḥ pana ekamantam nisinnaḥ hoti iti nisajja dose
translated: How does one sit at one side? By avoiding the six faults of sitting. They are:

original: – atidūraṃ, accāsannaṃ, uparivātaṃ, unnatappadesaṃ, atisammukhaṃ atipacchāti. Atidūre
analyzed: ati dūram acca āsannam upari vātam unnata ppadesam ati sammukham ati pacchā ati ati dūre
translated: too far, too near, upwind, on high ground, too frontally, too behind.

original: nisinno hi sace kathetukāmo hoti, uccāsaddena kathetabbaṃ hoti. Accāsanne nisinno🔽saṅghaṭṭanaṃ karoti. Uparivāte nisinno sarīragandhena bādhati. Unnatappadese nisinno🔽agāravaṃ pakāseti. Atisammukhā nisinno sace daṭṭhukāmo hoti, cakkhunā cakkhuṃ āhacca
analyzed: nisinnaḥ hi sace kathetu kāmaḥ hoti uccāsaddena kathetabbam hoti accāsanne nisinnaḥ  saṅghaṭṭanam karoti upari vāte nisinnaḥ sarīra gandhena bādhati unnata ppadese nisinnaḥ  agāravam pakāseti atisammukhā nisinnaḥ sace daṭṭhu kāmo hoti cakkhunā cakkhum āhacca
translated: For if one sits too far away, if one wants to speak, one has to speak loudly. If one sits too near, one causes contact.🔽If one sits upwind, one is offended by the smell of the body. If one sits on high ground, one shows disrespect.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ hoti. Atipacchā nisinno sace daṭṭhukāmo hoti, gīvaṃ pasāretvā daṭṭhabbaṃ
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam hoti atipacchā nisinno sace daṭṭhu kāmo hoti gīvam pasāretvā daṭṭhabbam
translated: If one sits too frontally, if one wants to see, one has to look straight into the other’s eyes. If one sits too behind, if one wants to see, one has to turn one’s neck around.

original: hoti. Tasmā ayampi ete cha nisajjadose vajjetvā nisīdi. Tena vuttaṃ “ekamantaṃ nisīdī”ti.
analyzed: hoti tasmai ayam pi ete cha nisajja dose vajjetvā nisīdi tena vuttam ekamantam nisīdi iti
translated: Therefore, avoiding these six faults of sitting, he sat down. Hence it was said: “He sat down at one side.”

original: Etadavocāti duvidhā hi pucchā – agārikapucchā, anagārikapucchā ca. Tattha “kiṃ, bhante,
analyzed: etat avoca ati duvidhā hi pucchā agārika pucchā anagārika pucchā ca tattha kim bhante
translated: He spoke thus: There are two kinds of questions: questions asked by householders and questions asked by those gone forth into homelessness. Herein, “What, venerable sir, is the gratification, what is the danger, and what is the escape in the case of the eye? … in the case of forms? … in the case of eye-consciousness? … in the case of eye-contact? … In the case of any feeling whatsoever that arises with mind-contact as condition …

original: kusalaṃ, kiṃ akusala”nti iminā nayena agārikapucchā āgatā. “Ime nu kho, bhante, pañcupādānakkhandhā”ti🔽iminā nayena anagārikapucchā. Ayaṃ pana attano anurūpaṃ agārikapucchaṃ pucchanto
analyzed: kusalam kim akusalanti iminā nayena agārika pucchā āgatā ime nu kho bhante pañca upādānakkhandhā ti  iminā nayena anagārika pucchā ayam pana attanaḥ anurūpam agārika puccham pucchantaḥ
translated: “What is profitable? What is unprofitable?”🔽The questions of the house-dwellers are given in this way. The questions of the homeless ones are given in the way beginning, “Now, venerable sir, what are the five aggregates as objects of clinging?”

original: etaṃ “ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo”tiādivacanaṃ avoca. Tattha hetu paccayoti
analyzed: etam kaḥ nu kho bho gotama hetu ko paccayo ti ādi vacanam avoca tattha hetu paccayo ti
translated: But he who asked the questions of the house-dwellers in the way beginning, “What, Master Gotama, is the cause, what is the reason, why some beings here do not attain Nibbāna in this very life?”🔽Herein, cause and reason are a synonym for ground.

original: ubhayampetaṃ kāraṇavevacanameva. Adhammacariyāvisamacariyāhetūti adhammacariyāsaṅkhātāya
analyzed: kāraṇa vevacanam eva adhamma cariyā visama cariyā hetu uti adhamma cariyā saṅkhātāya
translated: The cause, the reason, for misconduct in action and misconduct in speech is misconduct in action and misconduct in speech.

original: visamacariyāya hetu, taṃkāraṇā tappaccayāti attho. Tatrāyaṃ padattho – adhammassa🔽cariyā adhammacariyā, adhammakāraṇanti attho. Visamaṃ cariyā, visamassa vā kammassa
analyzed: visama cariyāya tad kāraṇā tad paccayā ati tatra ayam padatthaḥ adhammassa  cariyā adhamma cariyā adhamma kāraṇanti atthaḥ visamam cariyā visamassa vā kammassa
translated: The meaning is that it is the ground, the reason, for that. Herein, the meaning of the terms is this.🔽Misconduct in action is action that is not in accordance with the True Ideal.🔽The meaning is that it is the ground for that. Misconduct in speech is either the action of one who misconducts himself in speech or the action of one who misconducts himself in both ways.

original: cariyāti visamacariyā. Adhammacariyā ca sā visamacariyā cāti adhammacariyāvisamacariyā.
analyzed: cariyā ati visama cariyā adhamma cariyā ca sā visama cariyā ca ati adhamma cariyā avisama cariyā
translated: The meaning is that it is the ground for that.🔽The meaning should be understood in this way in the case of the bright side too.

original: Etenupāyena sukkapakkhepi attho veditabbo. Atthato panettha adhammacariyāvisamacariyā
analyzed: etena upāyena sukka pakkhe pi atthaḥ veditabbaḥ atthataḥ pana ittha adhamma cariyā avisama cariyā
translated: But as to the meaning here, misconduct in action and misconduct in speech

original: nāma dasa akusalakammapathā, dhammacariyāsamacariyā nāma dasa kusalakammapathāti veditabbā.
analyzed: nāma dasa akusala kammapathā dhammacariyāsamacariyā nāma dasa kusala kammapathā ti veditabbā
translated: “Name” should be understood as the ten unprofitable courses of action, and “right conduct” as the ten profitable courses of action.

original: Abhikkantaṃ, bho gotamāti ettha ayaṃ abhikkantasaddo khayasundarābhirūpaabbhanumodanesu
analyzed: abhikkantam bho gotama ati ettha ayam abhikkanta saddaḥ khaya sundara abhirūpa abbha numodanesu
translated: “Excellent, Master Gotama!” Herein, this word abhikkanta is found in the sense of destruction, of beauty, of excellence, and of approval.

original: dissati. “Abhikkantā, bhante, ratti, nikkhanto paṭhamo yāmo, ciranisinno bhikkhusaṅgho”tiādīsu🔽hi khaye dissati. “Ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro cā”tiādīsu sundare.
analyzed: dissati abhikkantā bhante ratti nikkhantaḥ paṭhhamaḥ yāmaḥ cira nisinnaḥ bhikkhu saṅghaḥ ti ādīsu  hi khaye dissati ayam imesam catunnam puggalānam abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca ati ādīsu sundare
translated: In the passage “The night has become far advanced, venerable sir, it is time to end, the first watch of the night has passed away, the elders are seated long, the company of bhikkhus has been sitting long” ,🔽it is found in the sense of destruction. In the passage “This person is more distinguished and excellent than these four” ,

original: “Ko me vandati pādāni, iddhiyā yasasā jalaṃ;
analyzed: kaḥ me vandati pādāni id hiyā yasasā jalam
translated: it is found in the sense of beauty. In the passages “Who is it that worships my feet, radiant with psychic power and glory,

original: Abhikkantena vaṇṇena, sabbā obhāsayaṃ disā”ti. –
analyzed: abhikkantena vaṇṇena sabbāḥ obhāsayam disāti
translated: outshining all directions with his surpassing beauty?”

original: Ādīsu abhirūpe. “Abhikkantaṃ, bhante”tiādīsu abbhanumodane. Idhāpi abbhanumodaneyeva. Yasmā ca abbhanumodane, tasmā sādhu sādhu, bho gotamāti vuttaṃ hotīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: ādīsu abhirūpe abhikkantam bhante ti ādīsu ap bhanumodane idha api ap bhanumodaneya iva yasmai ca ap bhanumodane tasmai sādhu sādhu bho gotama ati vuttam hoti iti veditabbam
translated: and “Excellent, venerable sir! Excellent, venerable sir!” it is found in the sense of excellence. Here it is found in the sense of approval. And since it is found in the sense of approval, it should be understood that what is meant by “Excellent, Master Gotama! Excellent, Master Gotama!” is “Well done, well done, Master Gotama!”

original: “Bhaye kodhe pasaṃsāyaṃ, turite kotūhalacchare;
analyzed: bhaye kodhe turite
translated: In fear, in anger, in praise, in haste, in curiosity, in a question,

original: Hāse soke pasāde ca, kare āmeḍitaṃ budho”ti. –
analyzed: hāse soke pasāde ca kare āmeḍitam
translated: In laughter, in grief, and in faith.🔽And by this definition it should be understood that it is said twice here in the sense of faith and in the sense of praise.

original: Iminā ca lakkhaṇena idha pasādavasena pasaṃsāvasena cāyaṃ dvikkhattuṃ vuttoti veditabbo. Atha vā abhikkantanti abhikkantaṃ atiiṭṭhaṃ atimanāpaṃ, atisundaranti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: iminā ca lakkhaṇena idha pasāda vasena pasaṃsā vasena ca ayam dvi khattum vuttaḥ ti veditabbo atha vā abhikkantam iti abhikkantam ati iṭṭham ati manāpam ati sundaram ti vuttam hoti
translated: Or alternatively, abhikkantaṃ means abhikkantaṃ, very much liked, very much agreeable, very much beautiful, is what is said.🔽Herein, he extols the teaching with one abhikkantaṃ, and his own faith with the other. This is the

original: Tattha ekena abhikkantasaddena desanaṃ thometi, ekena attano pasādaṃ. Ayañhettha
analyzed: tattha ekena abhikkanta saddena desanam thometi ekena attanaḥ pasādam
translated: intention here:🔽“Excellent, Master Gotama, is the teaching of Master Gotama,

original: adhippāyo – abhikkantaṃ, bho gotama, yadidaṃ bhoto gotamassa dhammadesanā, abhikkantaṃ🔽yadidaṃ bhoto gotamassa dhammadesanaṃ āgamma mama pasādoti. Bhagavatoyeva vā vacanaṃ
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ abhikkantam bho gotama yat idam bhotaḥ gotamassa dhamma desanā abhikkantam  yat idam bhoto gotamassa dhamma desanam āgamma mama pasādaḥ iti vā vacanam
translated: excellent is the teaching! And it is enough, Master Gotama, to believe and have confidence in Master Gotama thus: ‘Master Gotama’s word is for renunciation,🔽for non-ill-will, for harmlessness.’ ” Or else the Blessed One’s words are extolled by him with reference to two pairs of meanings:🔽“Excellent, Master Gotama, is the teaching of Master Gotama,🔽excellent is the teaching! And it is enough, Master Gotama, to believe and have confidence in Master Gotama thus: ‘Master Gotama’s word is for renunciation,

original: dve dve atthe sandhāya thometi – bhoto gotamassa vacanaṃ abhikkantaṃ dosanāsanato,
analyzed: dve dve atthe sandhāya thoma iti bhoto gotamassa vacanam abhikkantam dosanāsanato
translated: for non-ill-will, for harmlessness.’ ” Or else the Blessed One’s words are extolled by him with reference to two pairs of meanings: “Master Gotama’s word is for abandoning hate,

original: abhikkantaṃ guṇādhigamanato, tathā saddhājananato, paññājananato, sātthato, sabyañjanato,
analyzed: abhikkantam guṇa adhigamanato tathā saddhā jananato paññā jananato sa atthato sa byañjanato
translated: for abandoning greed, for abandoning delusion, for abandoning the manifold, for the destruction of craving, for non-attraction, for dispassion, for cessation, for peace, for direct-knowledge, for enlightenment, for Nibbāna.”

original: uttānapadato, gambhīratthato, kaṇṇasukhato, hadayaṅgamato, anattukkaṃsanato, aparavambhanato,
analyzed: uttāna padataḥ gambhīra atthataḥ kaṇṇa sukhataḥ hadayaṅgamataḥ anattukkaṃsanataḥ apara vambhanataḥ
translated: As to the deep meaning, as to being pleasant to the ear, as to being heart-winning, as to not praising oneself, as to not disparaging others,

original: karuṇāsītalato, paññāvadātato, āpātharamaṇīyato, vimaddakkhamato, suyyamānasukhato,
analyzed: karuṇā sītalataḥ paññā avadātataḥ āpātha ramaṇīyataḥ vimadda khamataḥ suyyamāna sukhataḥ
translated: as to being cool through kindness, as to being pure through understanding, as to being captivating in its approach, as to being easy to enter upon, as to being bliss to attend to,

original: vīmaṃsiyamānahitatoti evamādīhi yojetabbaṃ.🔽Tato parampi catūhi upamāhi desanaṃyeva thometi. Tattha nikkujjitanti adhomukhaṭhapitaṃ,
analyzed: vīmaṃsiyamāna hitato ti evamādīhi yojetabbam  tato param pi catūhi upamāhi desanaṃyā iva thometi tattha nikkujjitanti adhomukha ṭhapitam
translated: as to being beneficial to ponder, and so on.

original: heṭṭhāmukhajātaṃ vā. Ukkujjeyyāti uparimukhaṃ kareyya. Paṭicchannanti tiṇapaṇṇādichāditaṃ.🔽Vivareyyāti ugghāṭeyya. Mūḷhassāti disāmūḷhassa. Maggaṃ ācikkheyyāti hatthe gahetvā
analyzed: heṭṭhā mukha jātam vā ukkujjeyya ati upari mukham kareyya paṭicchannam tiṇa paṇṇa ādi chāditam  vivareyya ati ugghāṭeyya mūḷhassa ati disā mūḷhassa maggam ācikkheyya ati hatthe gahetvā
translated: And after that he extols the teaching by means of four similes. Herein, overturned is what is turned face down or what has grown pointing downwards. He would put it right: he would make it face upwards. Covered: hidden by grass, leaves, etc.,🔽Uncovered: he would uncover it by removing the grass, leaves, etc. Confused: who is confused about the directions. He would point out the path: he would take him by the arm and say, “This is the path,”

original: “esa maggo”ti vadeyya. Andhakāreti kāḷapakkhacātuddasīaḍḍharattaghanavanasaṇḍameghapaṭalehi
analyzed: esa maggo ti vadeyya andhakāra iti
translated: Darkness: the fourfold darkness consisting of the dark fortnight, the night, the last watch of the night, and thick cloud, forest, and pall of darkness.

original: caturaṅge tame. Ayaṃ tāva anuttānapadattho.
analyzed: catur aṅge tame ayam tāva an uttāna padattho
translated: This is the meaning of the words in the first simile.

original: Ayaṃ pana adhippāyayojanā – yathā koci nikkujjitaṃ ukkujjeyya, evaṃ saddhammavimukhaṃ
analyzed: ayam pana adhippāya yojanā yathā koci nikkujjitam ukkujjeyya evam saddhamma vimukham
translated: But the interpretation intended here is this: Just as one might set upright what has been overturned, so he sets upright the true Dhamma that has lost its footing;🔽

original: asaddhamme patitaṃ maṃ asaddhammā vuṭṭhāpentena, yathā paṭicchannaṃ vivareyya, evaṃ
analyzed: asat dhamme patitam mam asat dhammā vuṭṭhāpentena yathā paṭicchannam vivareyya evam
translated: But the interpretation intended here is this: Just as one might set upright what has been overturned, so too, he has set me upright in the True Idea, which had been overturned for me and had fallen into wrong ideas;

original: kassapassa bhagavato sāsanantaradhānato pabhuti micchādiṭṭhigahanapaṭicchannaṃ sāsanaṃ
analyzed: kassapassa bhagavataḥ sāsana antaradhānataḥ pabhuti micchādiṭṭhi gahana paṭicchannam sāsanaṃ
translated: just as one might reveal what has been concealed, so too, he has revealed the Dispensation to me, which had been concealed by the thicket of wrong view since the time of the disappearance of the Dispensation of the Blessed One Kassapa;

original: vivarantena, yathā mūḷhassa maggaṃ ācikkheyya, evaṃ kummaggamicchāmaggappaṭipannassa🔽me saggamokkhamaggaṃ āvikarontena, yathā andhakāre telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, evaṃ mohandhakāre
analyzed: vivarantena yathā mūḷhassa maggam ācikkheyya evam kummaggam icchā magga ppaṭipannassa  me saggamokkha maggam āvikarontena yathā andhakāre tela pajjotam dhāreyya evam moha ndhakāre
translated: just as one might show the path to one who is lost, so too, he has shown me the path to heaven and to liberation, which I had lost because I was following a wrong path and a wrong track;

original: nimuggassa me buddhādiratanarūpāni apassato tappaṭicchādakamohandhakāraviddhaṃsakadesanāpajjotadhāraṇena
analyzed: nimuggassa me buddha ādi ratana rūpāni a passataḥ tad paṭicchādaka moha ndhakāra viddhaṃsaka desanā pajjota dhāraṇena
translated: just as one might hold up an oil-lamp in the dark, so too, he has held up the oil-lamp of the True Idea to me, which dispels the darkness of delusion that conceals the forms of the Buddha, etc., that I had failed to see because I was immersed in the darkness of delusion;

original: mayhaṃ bhotā gotamena etehi pariyāyehi pakāsitattā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsitoti.
analyzed: mayham bhotā gotamena etehi pariyāyehi pakāsita ttā aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito ti
translated: and so the True Idea has been revealed to me in many ways by the venerable Gotama’s revealing it by these modes.”

original: Evaṃ desanaṃ thometvā imāya desanāya ratanattaye pasannacitto pasannākāraṃ karonto🔽esāhantiādimāha. Tattha esāhanti eso ahaṃ. Bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmīti bhavaṃ
analyzed: evam desanam thometvā imāya desanāya rata nattaye pasanna cittaḥ pasanna ākāram karontaḥ  esāham iti ādim āha tattha esāham iti esaḥ aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi iti bhavam
translated: Having thus indicated the teaching, he, with a mind full of confidence in the Triple Gem, by this teaching, said “esāhaṃ,” etc. Herein, esāhaṃ = esāhaṃ.

analyzed: me gotamaḥ saraṇam parāyaṇam aghassa tātā hitassa ca vidhātā ati iminā adhippāyena bhavantam
translated: Bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmīti = bhavaṃ me gotamo saraṇaṃ parāyaṇaṃ aghassa tātā hitassa ca vidhātāti iminā adhippāyena bhavantaṃ

analyzed: dhātūnam gati atthaḥ tesam atthaḥ tasmā gacchāmi iti imassa jānāmi bujjhāmi iti
translated: dhātūnaṃ gati attho, buddhipi tesaṃ attho. Tasmā gacchāmīti imassa jānāmi bujjhāmīti

analyzed: ayam atthaḥ vuttaḥ dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca ati ettha pana adhigata magge sacchikata nirodhe
translated: ayamattho vutto. Dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañcāti ettha pana adhigatamagge sacchikatanirodhe

analyzed: ariya maggaḥ ca iva nibbānam ca vuttam ha etam yāvatā bhikkhave dhammāḥ saṅkhatāḥ ariyaḥ
translated: ariyamaggo ceva nibbānañca. Vuttañhetaṃ – “yāvatā, bhikkhave, dhammā saṅkhatā, ariyo

analyzed: aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo tesam aggam akkhāyati iti vitthāraḥ na kevalam ca ariya maggo ca iva nibbānam ca
translated: And not only the Noble Path and Nibbāna,

original: apica kho ariyaphalehi saddhiṃ pariyattidhammopi. Vuttañhetaṃ chattamāṇavakavimāne –
analyzed: apica kho ariya phalehi saddhim pariyatti dhammaḥ api vuttam ha etam chatta māṇavaka vimāne
translated: but also the scriptures together with the fruits of asceticism. For this is said in the Chatta-māṇava-vimāna:

original: “Rāgavirāgamanejamasokaṃ, dhammamasaṅkhatamappaṭikūlaṃ;
analyzed: rāga virāgam anejam asokam dhammam asaṅkhatam appaṭikūlam
translated: “The passionless, the griefless, the unstained, the sorrowless, the unformed, the unopposed,

original: Madhuramimaṃ paguṇaṃ suvibhattaṃ, dhammamimaṃ saraṇatthamupehī”ti. ;
analyzed: madhuram imam paguṇam su vibhattam dhammam imam saraṇa attham upehi iti
translated: The sweet, the rich, the well-proclaimed, this Dhamma I take as my refuge.”

original: Ettha rāgavirogoti maggo kathito. Anojamasokanti phalaṃ. Dhammamasaṅkhatanti nibbānaṃ.
analyzed: ettha rāga virogaḥ iti maggaḥ kathitaḥ phalam dhammam asaṅkhatanti nibbānam
translated: Herein, the “passionless, the griefless” is the path. “The unstained, the sorrowless” is the fruit. “The unformed” is Nibbāna.

original: Appaṭikūlaṃ madhuramimaṃ paguṇaṃ suvibhattanti piṭakattayena vibhattā sabbadhammakkhandhāti.
analyzed: a paṭikūlam madhuram imam paguṇam su vibhattanti piṭaka ttayena vibhattā sabba dhamma kkhandhā ti
translated: “The unopposed, the sweet, the rich” is the whole of the Dhamma in the three Piṭakas, which is “well-proclaimed” by being divided into the three sections.

original: Diṭṭhisīlasaṅghātena saṃhatoti saṅgho. So atthato aṭṭhaariyapuggalasamūho. Vuttañhetaṃ tasmiyeva vimāne –
analyzed: diṭṭhi sīla saṅghātena saṃhataḥ ti saṅgho so atthataḥ aṭṭha ariya puggala samūhaḥ vuttam ha etam tasmiya eva vimāne
translated: “The well-knit” is the Saṅgha. In the sense of “well-knit” it is the eight kinds of noble persons. For this is said in the same Vimāna:

original: “Yattha ca dinnamahapphalamāhu, catūsu sucīsu purisayugesu;
analyzed: ca dinna mahapphalam āhu catūsu sucīsu purisa yugesu
translated: “Where they say a gift is very fruitful, in the four pure pairs of men,

original: Aṭṭha ca puggaladhammadasā te, saṅghamimaṃ saraṇatthamupehī”ti. ;
analyzed: aṭṭha ca puggala dhamma dasā te saṅgham imam saraṇa attham upehi iti
translated: Go to the Saṅgha for refuge, the best of communities.”

original: Bhikkhūnaṃ saṅgho bhikkhusaṅgho. Ettāvatā brāhmaṇo tīṇi saraṇagamanāni paṭivedesi.
analyzed: bhikkhūnam saṅghaḥ bhikkhu saṅghaḥ ettāvatā brāhmaṇaḥ tīṇi saraṇa gamanāni paṭivedesi
translated: The Saṅgha of bhikkhus is the bhikkhu Saṅgha. So far the brahmin has declared the three kinds of going for refuge.

original: Idāni tesu saraṇagamanesu kosallatthaṃ saraṇaṃ, saraṇagamanaṃ, yo ca saraṇaṃ gacchati, saraṇagamanappabhedo, saraṇagamanaphalaṃ, saṃkileso, bhedoti ayaṃ vidhi veditabbo.🔽Seyyathidaṃ – padatthato tāva hiṃsatīti saraṇaṃ, saraṇagatānaṃ teneva saraṇagamanena🔽bhayaṃ santāsaṃ dukkhaṃ duggatiparikilesaṃ hanati vināsetīti attho, ratanattayassevetaṃ
analyzed: idāni tesu saraṇa gamanesu kosalla attham saraṇam saraṇa gamanam yaḥ ca saraṇam gacchati saraṇa gamana pabhedaḥ saraṇa gamana phalam saṃkilesaḥ bhedaḥ ti ayam vidhi veditabbo  sā iyyathidam hiṃsati iti saraṇam saraṇa gatānam tena iva saraṇa gamanena  bhayam santāsam dukkham duggati parikilesam hanati vināseti iti atthaḥ
translated: Now, in order to be skilled in the going for refuge, the following should be understood: what is the refuge, what is the going for refuge, who goes to the refuge, the classification of going for refuge, the fruit of the going for refuge, defilement and purification.

original: adhivacanaṃ. Atha vā hite pavattanena ahitā ca nivattanena sattānaṃ bhayaṃ hiṃsatīti
analyzed: adhivacanam atha vā hite pavattanena ahitā ca nivattanena sattānam bhayam hiṃsati iti
translated: The meaning is that it destroys, removes, the fear, terror, suffering, and defilement of bad destinations that there is for those who have gone for refuge by means of that very going for refuge. It is a designation for the Triple Gem. Or alternatively, it destroys fear in beings by causing them to enter upon what is beneficial and by turning them away from what is unbeneficial.🔽The Buddha destroys fear by delivering beings from the wilderness of the round,

original: buddho, bhavakantārā uttāraṇena lokassa assāsadānena ca dhammo, appakānampi kārānaṃ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhava kantārā uttāraṇena lokassa assāsa dānena ca dhammaḥ appakānam pi kārānam
translated: and the Dhamma by giving them hope through the gift of the crossing of the desert.

original: vipulaphalapaṭilābhakaraṇena saṅgho. Tasmā imināpi pariyāyena ratanattayaṃ saraṇaṃ.
analyzed: vipula phala paṭilābha karaṇena saṅghaḥ tasmai iminā api pariyāyena saraṇam
translated: and the Community is the refuge because it is the means of obtaining the great fruit. So the Triple Gem is the refuge in this way too.

original: Tappasādataggarutāhi vihatakileso tapparāyaṇatākārappavatto cittuppādo saraṇagamanaṃ.
analyzed: tad pasāda taggaru tāhi vihata kileso tad parāyaṇa tā ākāra ppavatto citta uppādo saraṇa gamanam
translated: The going for refuge is the occurrence of the thought of enlightenment in the mode of having the Triple Gem as its object and of having the faith in it as its predominance, with defilements suppressed.

original: Taṃsamaṅgīsatto saraṇaṃ gacchati, vuttappakārena cittuppādena “etāni me tīṇi ratanāni🔽saraṇaṃ, etāni parāyaṇa”nti evaṃ upetīti attho. Evaṃ tāva saraṇaṃ saraṇagamanaṃ yo
analyzed: tad samaṅgī sattaḥ saraṇam gacchati vutta ppakārena cittuppādena etāni me tīṇi ratanāni  saraṇam etāni evam upeti iti evam tāva saraṇam saraṇa gamanam
translated: The person who has the requisite equipment goes for refuge with the thought of enlightenment described thus, with the words “I go for refuge to these three gems,

original: ca saraṇaṃ gacchati idaṃ tayaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: ca saraṇam gacchati idam tayam veditabbam
translated: I make these my supreme resort” . This is the meaning. So firstly this is how the refuge, the going for refuge, and the person who goes for refuge should be understood.

original: Saraṇagamanappabhede pana duvidhaṃ saraṇagamanaṃ lokuttaraṃ lokiyañcāti. Tattha lokuttaraṃ🔽diṭṭhasaccānaṃ maggakkhaṇe saraṇagamanupakkilesasamucchedena ārammaṇato nibbānārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: saraṇa gamana pabhede pana duvidham saraṇa gamanam lokuttaram lokiyam ca ati tattha lokuttaram  diṭṭha saccānam magga kkhaṇe saraṇa gamana upakkilesa samucchedena ārammaṇataḥ nibbāna ārammaṇam
translated: But as regards the classification of the going for refuge, the going for refuge is twofold, namely, supramundane and mundane. Herein,

original: hutvā kiccato sakalepi ratanattaye ijjhati. Lokiyaṃ puthujjanānaṃ saraṇagamanupakkilesavikkhambhanena
analyzed: hutvā kiccataḥ sakale api rata nattaye ijjhati lokiyam puthujjanānam saraṇa gamana upakkilesa vikkhambhanena
translated: the supramundane goes for refuge by abandoning the defilements that are the stains on the going for refuge, and it succeeds in doing this by making Nibbāna its object through the act of apprehending the Triple Gem as Nibbāna. The mundane goes for refuge by temporarily suppressing the defilements that are the stains on the going for refuge,🔽and it succeeds in doing this by making the Triple Gem its object through the act of apprehending the Triple Gem as the means to Nibbāna.

original: ārammaṇato buddhādiguṇārammaṇaṃ hutvā ijjhati. Taṃ atthato buddhādīsu vatthūsu saddhāpaṭilābho,
analyzed: ārammaṇataḥ buddha ādi guṇa ārammaṇam hutvā ijjhati tam atthataḥ buddha ādīsu vatthūsu saddhā paṭilābhaḥ
translated: which in fact is the acquisition of faith in the Buddha, etc.,

original: saddhāmūlikā ca sammādiṭṭhi dasasu puññakiriyāvatthūsu diṭṭhijukammanti vuccati.
analyzed: saddhāmūlikā ca sammādiṭṭhi dasasu puñña kiriyā vatthūsu diṭṭhijukammanti vuccati
translated: and it is called “the action of one who is rightly seen” in the ten profitable courses of action.

original: Tayidaṃ catudhā pavattati attasanniyyātanena tapparāyaṇatāya sissabhāvūpagamanena🔽paṇipātenāti. Tattha attasanniyyātanaṃ nāma “ajja ādiṃ katvā ahaṃ attānaṃ buddhassa🔽niyyātemi, dhammassa, saṅghassā”ti evaṃ buddhādīnaṃ attapariccajanaṃ. Tapparāyaṇatā
analyzed: tayā idam catudhā pavattati atta sanniyyātanena tad parāyaṇa tāya sissa bhāva upagamanena  paṇipātena ati tattha attasanniyyātanam nāma ajja ādim katvā aham attānam buddhassa  dhammassa saṅghassa ati evam buddha ādīnam atta pariccajanam tad parāyaṇa tā
translated: It occurs in four ways: by the surrender of oneself, by the surrender of one’s belongings, by the acceptance of discipleship, and by the acceptance of the state of a lay follower.🔽Herein, the surrender of oneself is the handing over of oneself to the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha in this way: “From today onward I make over myself to the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha.”

original: nāma “ajja ādiṃ katvā ahaṃ buddhaparāyaṇo, dhammaparāyaṇo, saṅghaparāyaṇo iti maṃ🔽dhārethā”ti evaṃ tapparāyaṇabhāvo. Sissabhāvūpagamanaṃ nāma “ajja ādiṃ katvā ahaṃ
analyzed: nāma ajja ādim katvā aham buddha parāyaṇaḥ dhamma parāyaṇaḥ saṅgha parāyaṇaḥ iti maṃ  dhāretha iti evam tad parāyaṇa bhāvaḥ sissa bhāva upagamanam nāma ajja ādim katvā aham
translated: The surrender of one’s belongings is the handing over of one’s belongings in this way: “From today onward I make over to the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha the four requisite-conditions and the five requisites.”

original: buddhassa antevāsiko, dhammassa, saṅghassa iti maṃ dhārethā”ti evaṃ sissabhāvūpagamo.
analyzed: buddhassa antevāsikaḥ dhammassa saṅghassa iti mam dhāretha ati evam sissa bhāva upagamaḥ
translated: The acceptance of discipleship is the acceptance of the state of a disciple in this way: “From today onward I am a disciple of the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha.”🔽The acceptance of the state of a lay follower is the acceptance of the state of a lay follower in this way: “From today onward I am a lay follower who has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha.”

original: Paṇipāto nāma “ajja ādiṃ katvā ahaṃ abhivādana-paccuṭṭhāna-añjalikamma-sāmīcikammaṃ
analyzed: paṇipātaḥ nāma ajja ādim katvā aham abhivādana paccuṭṭhāna añjalikamma sāmīcikammam
translated: Bowing: “From today onwards I will do acts of respect, rising from one’s seat, raising one’s joined palms, and polite salutation,

original: buddhādīnaṃyeva tiṇṇaṃ vatthūnaṃ karomi iti maṃ dhārethā”ti evaṃ buddhādīsu paramanipaccakāro.
analyzed: buddha ādīnam yeva tiṇṇam vatthūnam karomi iti mam dhāretha ati evam buddha ādīsu parama nipacca kāraḥ
translated: The act of going for refuge is the highest respect shown to the Buddha, Dhamma, and Sangha, thinking: “From today onward I regard the Buddha, Dhamma, and Sangha as my supreme refuge.”

original: Imesañhi catunnampi ākārānaṃ aññatarampi karontena gahitaṃyeva hoti saraṇagamanaṃ.🔽Apica “bhagavato attānaṃ pariccajāmi, dhammassa, saṅghassa attānaṃ pariccajāmi, jīvitaṃ
analyzed: imesam hi catunnam pi ākārānam aññataram pi karontena gahitam yā iva hoti saraṇa gamanam  apica bhagavataḥ attānam pariccajāmi dhammassa saṅghassa attānam pariccajāmi jīvitaṃ
translated: One who performs any one of these four acts has gone for refuge.

original: pariccajāmi, pariccattoyeva me attā, pariccattaṃyeva me jīvitaṃ, jīvitapariyantikaṃ
analyzed: pariccajāmi pariccattaḥ yā iva me attā pariccattam yā iva me jīvitam jīvita pariyantikam
translated: Moreover, one should understand that the going for refuge is the giving up of oneself to the Buddha, Dhamma, and Sangha, the giving up of one’s life, the giving up of one’s self and life.

original: buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi, buddho me saraṇaṃ leṇaṃ tāṇa”nti evampi attasanniyyātanaṃ🔽veditabbaṃ. “Satthārañca vatāhaṃ passeyyaṃ, bhagavantameva passeyyaṃ, sugatañca vatāhaṃ
analyzed: buddham saraṇam gacchāmi buddhaḥ me saraṇam leṇam evam pi atta sanniyyātanam  veditabbam satthāram ca vata aham passeyyam bhagavantam eva passeyyam sugatam ca vata aham
translated: “I go for refuge to the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha. The Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha are my supreme refuge.”

original: passeyyaṃ, bhagavantameva passeyyaṃ, sammāsambuddhañca vatāhaṃ passeyyaṃ, bhagavantameva
analyzed: passeyyam bhagavantam eva passeyyam sammāsambuddham ca vata aham passeyyam bhagavantam eva
translated: “May I see the Teacher, may I see the Blessed One, may I see the Well-gone One, may I see the Buddha, the Accomplished and Fully Enlightened One.

original: passeyya”nti evampi mahākassapassa saraṇagamane viya sissabhāvūpagamanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: passeyya nti evam pi mahākassapassa saraṇa gamane viya sissa bhāva upagamanam daṭṭhabbam
translated: and he would see it. So too should the going forth for discipleship be regarded as the going for refuge in the Great Kassapa.

original: “So ahaṃ vicarissāmi, gāmā gāmaṃ purā puraṃ;
analyzed: saḥ aham vicarissāmi gāmā gāmam purā puram
translated: “I will wander from village to village, from town to town,

original: Namassamāno sambuddhaṃ, dhammassa ca sudhammata”nti. ;
analyzed: namassamānaḥ sambuddham dhammassa ca su dhamma tanti
translated: Honouring the Enlightened One, and the true Dhamma’s excellence” .

original: Evampi āḷavakādīnaṃ saraṇagamanaṃ viya tapparāyaṇatā veditabbā. “Atha kho brahmāyu
analyzed: evam pi āḷavaka ādīnam saraṇa gamanam viya tad parāyaṇa tā veditabbā atha kho brahma āyu
translated: So too should the going for refuge in the Alavaka, etc., be regarded as the going for refuge in the Alavaka, etc.

original: brāhmaṇo uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā🔽bhagavato pādāni mukhena ca paricumbati, pāṇīhi ca parisambāhati, nāmañca sāveti
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ uṭṭhāya āsanā ekaṃsam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā bhagavataḥ pādesu sirasā nipatitvā  bhagavataḥ pādāni mukhena ca paricumbati pāṇīhi ca parisambāhati nāmañca sāva iti
translated: Then the brahmin Brahmadatta rose from his seat, and after arranging his upper robe on one shoulder, he extended his hands in reverential salutation towards the Lord,

original: – ‘brahmāyu ahaṃ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇo; brahmāyu ahaṃ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇo”’ti evampi paṇipāto veditabbo.
analyzed: brahmāyu aham bho gotama brāhmaṇaḥ brahmāyu aham bho gotama brāhmaṇaḥ iti evam pi paṇipātaḥ veditabbo
translated: and he announced his name thus: ‘Lord, I am the brahmin Brahmadatta, I am the brahmin Brahmadatta!’ So too should the prostration be understood.

original: So panesa ñātibhayācariyadakkhiṇeyyavasena catubbidho hoti. Tattha dakkhiṇeyyapaṇipātena
analyzed: so pana esa ñāti bhaya ācariya dakkhiṇeyya vasena catubbidhaḥ hoti tattha dakkhiṇeyya paṇipātena
translated: And this is fourfold as due to kinship, fear, service, and respect. Herein, as due to kinship is that by King Pasenadi of Kosala to the Elder Anuruddha, and that by the Elder Piyadassana to King Panduvasudeva.🔽As due to fear is that by King Ajatasattu to the Elder Nāgasena.🔽As due to service is that by King Milinda to the Elder Nagasena.

original: saraṇagamanaṃ hoti, na itarehi. Seṭṭhavaseneva hi saraṇaṃ gaṇhāti, seṭṭhavasena ca
analyzed: saraṇa gamanam hoti na itarehi seṭṭha vasena iva hi saraṇam gaṇhāti seṭṭha vasena ca
translated: and the going for refuge is not by the other two. For one goes for refuge by way of the best, and one falls away by way of the best.

original: bhijjati. Tasmā yo sākiyo vā koliyo vā “buddho amhākaṃ ñātako”ti vandati, aggahitameva🔽hoti saraṇaṃ. Yo vā “samaṇo gotamo rājapūjito mahānubhāvo avandiyamāno anatthampi🔽kareyyā”ti bhayena vandati, aggahitameva hoti saraṇaṃ. Yo vā bodhisattakāle bhagavato
analyzed: bhijjati tasmai yaḥ sākiyaḥ vā koliyaḥ vā buddhaḥ amhākam ñātako ti vandati aggahitam eva  hoti saraṇam yaḥ vā samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ rāja pūjitaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ a vandiyamānaḥ anattham pi  kareyya iti bhayena vandati agga hitam eva hoti saraṇam yaḥ vā bodhisatta kāle bhagavataḥ
translated: Therefore, if a Sakyan or a Koliyan pays homage, thinking, “The Buddha is a relative of ours,” the going for refuge is not taken.🔽Or if one pays homage out of fear, thinking, “The ascetic Gotama is honored by kings; if he is not paid homage, he might do me harm,” the going for refuge is not taken.

original: santike kiñci uggahitaṃ saramāno buddhakāle vā –
analyzed: santike kiñci uggahitam saramānaḥ buddha kāle vā
translated: Or if one pays homage, remembering something one has learned from the Buddha when he was a Bodhisatta, or at the time of his Buddhahood,

original: “Ekena bhoge bhuñjeyya, dvīhi kammaṃ payojaye;
analyzed: ekena bhoge bhuñjeyya dvīhi kammam payojaye
translated: “One should enjoy one’s wealth, make merit with two,

original: Catutthañca nidhāpeyya, āpadāsu bhavissatī”ti. –
analyzed: catuttham ca nidhāpeyya āpadāsu bhavissati iti
translated: And keep the fourth for future needs.”

original: Evarūpaṃ anusāsaniṃ uggahetvā “ācariyo me”ti vandati, aggahitameva hoti saraṇaṃ. Yo pana “ayaṃ loke aggadakkhiṇeyyo”ti vandati, teneva gahitaṃ hoti saraṇaṃ.
analyzed: evarūpam anusāsanim uggahetvā ācariyaḥ mā iti vandati agga hitam eva hoti saraṇam yaḥ pana ayam loke agga dakkhiṇeyyaḥ ti vandati tena iva gahitam hoti saraṇam
translated: and one pays homage, thinking, “He is my teacher,” the going for refuge is not taken. But if one pays homage, thinking, “He is the most worthy person in the world,” the going for refuge is taken.

original: Evaṃ gahitasaraṇassa ca upāsakassa vā upāsikāya vā aññatitthiyesu pabbajitampi ñātiṃ
analyzed: evam gahita saraṇassa ca upāsakassa vā upāsikāya vā añña titthiyesu pabbajitam pi ñātim
translated: And if a lay devotee who has thus gone for refuge should pay homage to a relative who has gone forth among the sectarians,

original: “ñātako me aya”nti vandato saraṇagamanaṃ na bhijjati, pageva apabbajitaṃ. Tathā rājānaṃ🔽bhayavasena vandato. So hi raṭṭhapūjitattā avandiyamāno anatthampi kareyyāti. Tathā
analyzed: ñātakaḥ me vandato saraṇa gamanam na bhijjati pagā iva a pabbajitam tathā rājānam  bhaya vasena vandato saḥ hi raṭṭha pūjita ttā a vandiyamānaḥ anattham pi kareyyāti tathā
translated: thinking “He is my relative,” his refuge in the Buddha is not violated, much less if it is one who has not gone forth. Likewise if he pays homage to a king

original: yaṃ kiñci sippaṃ sikkhāpakaṃ titthiyaṃ “ācariyo me aya”nti vandatopi na bhijjatīti
analyzed: yam kiñci sippam sikkhāpakam titthiyam ācariyaḥ me vandataḥ api na bhijjati iti
translated: out of fear, thinking “He is powerful,” for if he were not to pay homage he might be punished. Likewise if he pays homage to a heretic teacher who teaches a craft, thinking “He is my teacher,” his refuge in the Buddha is not violated.

original: evaṃ saraṇagamanappabhedo veditabbo.
analyzed: evam saraṇa gamana pabhedaḥ veditabbo
translated: This is how the classification according to going for refuge should be understood.

original: Ettha ca lokuttarassa saraṇagamanassa cattāri sāmaññaphalāni vipākaphalaṃ, sabbadukkhakkhayo ānisaṃsaphalaṃ. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: ettha ca lokuttarassa saraṇa gamanassa cattāri sāmañña phalāni vipāka phalam sabba dukkha kkhayaḥ ānisaṃsa phalam vuttam ha etam
translated: And here the four fruits of asceticism are the fruit of ripening of supramundane going for refuge, while the destruction of suffering is the fruit of service. For this is said:🔽“He who has gone for refuge to the Buddha,

original: “Yo ca buddhañca dhammañca, saṅghañca saraṇaṃ gato;
analyzed: yaḥ ca buddhañca dhammañca saṅghañca saraṇam gataḥ
translated: The Dhamma, and the Saṅgha,🔽Seeing with right understanding

original: Cattāri ariyasaccāni, sammappaññāya passati. ;
analyzed: cattāri ariya saccāni sammappaññāya passati
translated: The four noble truths🔽Suffering, the arising of suffering,

original: “Dukkhaṃ dukkhasamuppādaṃ, dukkhassa ca atikkamaṃ;
analyzed: dukkham dukkha samuppādam dukkhassa ca atikkamam
translated: The ending of suffering,🔽And the noble eightfold path

original: Ariyañcaṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ, dukkhūpasamagāminaṃ. ;
analyzed: ariyam ca aṭṭhaṅgikam maggam dukkha upasama gāminam
translated: That leads to the end of suffering,

original: “Etaṃ kho saraṇaṃ khemaṃ, etaṃ saraṇamuttamaṃ;
analyzed: etam khalu saraṇam khemam etam saraṇam uttamam
translated: “This refuge is the safe one, this refuge is the supreme one;

original: Etaṃ saraṇamāgamma, sabbadukkhā pamuccatī”ti. ;
analyzed: etam saraṇam āgamma sabba dukkhā pamuccati iti
translated: Having come to this refuge, one is freed from all suffering.”

original: Apica niccato anupagamanādivasenapetassa ānisaṃsaphalaṃ veditabbaṃ. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: apica niccatas anupagamana ādi vasena apetassa ānisaṃsa phalam veditabbam vuttam ha etam
translated: Besides, the benefits of going for refuge should be understood as the fruit of the benefits beginning with the non-descent of suffering, etc. For this is said:

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso, yaṃ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo kañci saṅkhāraṃ niccato
analyzed: aṭṭhānam etam bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam diṭṭhi sampannaḥ puggalo kañci saṅkhāram niccatas
translated: “Monks, it is impossible that a person who has attained right view should regard any conditioned thing as permanent,

original: upagaccheyya, sukhato upagaccheyya, kañci dhammaṃ attato upagaccheyya, mātaraṃ jīvitā🔽voropeyya, pitaraṃ, arahantaṃ jīvitā voropeyya, paduṭṭhacitto tathāgatassa lohitaṃ
analyzed: upagaccheyya sukhataḥ upagaccheyya kañci dhammaṃ attataḥ upagaccheyya mātaram jīvitā  voropeyya pitaram arahantam jīvitā voropeyya paduṭṭha citto tathāgatassa lohitam
translated: as happiness, as self, or as his mother, father, or perfected being, or that he should deprive a living being of life,

original: uppādeyya, saṅghaṃ bhindeyya, aññaṃ satthāraṃ uddiseyya, netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: uppādeyya saṅgham bhindeyya aññam satthāram uddiseyya na itam ṭhānam vijjati iti
translated: or that he should defame the Buddha, Dhamma, or Sangha, or that he should hold wrong views, or that he should go to a lower realm. This is impossible.”

original: Lokiyassa pana saraṇagamanassa bhavasampadāpi bhogasampadāpi phalameva. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: lokiyassa pana saraṇa gamanassa bhava sampadā api bhoga sampadā api phalam eva vuttam ha etam
translated: But the fruit of mundane going for refuge is the attainment of existence and the attainment of wealth. For this is said:

original: “Ye keci buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gatāse,
analyzed: ye keci buddham saraṇam gatāse
translated: “Those who have gone for refuge to the Buddha,

original: Na te gamissanti apāyabhūmiṃ;
analyzed: na te gamissanti apāya bhūmim
translated: They will not go to the plane of misery;

original: Pahāya mānusaṃ dehaṃ,
analyzed: pahāya mānusam deham
translated: Having left the human body behind,

original: Devakāyaṃ paripūressantī”ti. ;
analyzed: deva kāyam paripūressanti iti
translated: they will fill up the deva-hosts.”

original: Aparampi vuttaṃ –
analyzed: aparam pi vuttam
translated: And it is said further:

original: “Atha kho sakko devānamindo asītiyā devatāsahassehi saddhiṃ yenāyasmā mahāmoggallāno
analyzed: atha kho sakkaḥ devānamindaḥ asītiyā devatā sahassehi saddhim yena ayasmai mahāmoggallāno
translated: Then Sakka, ruler of gods, together with eighty-thousand gods,🔽approached the venerable Maha Moggallana. …

original: tenupasaṅkami…pe… ekamantaṃ ṭhitaṃ kho sakkaṃ devānamindaṃ āyasmā mahāmoggallāno
analyzed: tena upasaṅkamipe ekamantam ṭhitam kho sakkam devānamindam āyasmā mahāmoggallānaḥ
translated: When he was standing at one side, the venerable Maha Moggallana

original: etadavoca – ‘sādhu kho, devānaminda, buddhasaraṇagamanaṃ hoti. Buddhasaraṇagamanahetu
analyzed: etat avoca sādhu khalu devānaminda buddha saraṇa gamanam buddha saraṇa gamana hetu
translated: said to him: ‘It is good, ruler of gods, to take refuge in the Buddha. Because of taking refuge in the Buddha,

original: kho devānaminda evamidhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ🔽upapajjanti. Te aññe deve dasahi ṭhānehi adhigaṇhanti dibbena āyunā dibbena vaṇṇena
analyzed: kho devānaminde evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokaṃ  upapajjanti te aññe deve dasahi ṭhānehi adhigaṇhanti dibbena āyunā dibbena vaṇṇena
translated: ruler of gods, after the dissolution of the body, after death, some beings

original: sukhena yasena ādhipateyyena dibbehi rūpehi saddehi gandhehi rasehi phoṭṭhabbehī”’ti.
analyzed: sukhena yasena ādhipateyyena dibbehi rūpehi saddehi gandhehi rasehi phoṭṭhabbehi iti
translated: reappear in a happy destiny, in the heavenly world. They surpass the other gods in ten respects: in divine life span, divine beauty, divine pleasure, divine fame, divine sovereignty, divine sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.’

original: Eseva nayo dhamme saṅghe ca. Apica velāmasuttādivasenāpi saraṇagamanassa phalaviseso veditabbo. Evaṃ saraṇagamanaphalaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: esa iva nayaḥ dhamme saṅghe ca apica velāma sutta ādi vasena api saraṇa gamanassa phala viseso veditabbaḥ evam saraṇa gamana phalam veditabbam
translated: And so too with the True Idea and the Community. Furthermore, the distinction in the fruit of going for refuge should be understood according to the Velama Sutta, etc. This is how the fruit of going for refuge should be understood.

original: Tattha lokiyasaraṇagamanaṃ tīsu vatthūsu aññāṇasaṃsayamicchāñāṇādīhi saṃkilissati,
analyzed: tattha lokiya saraṇa gamanam tīsu vatthūsu aññāṇa saṃsayam icchā ñāṇa ādīhi saṃkilissati
translated: Herein, the going for refuge in the mundane way is defiled by ignorance, doubt, wrong knowledge, etc., about the three objects of refuge,

original: na mahājutikaṃ hoti na mahāvipphāraṃ. Lokuttarassa natthi saṃkileso. Lokiyassa ca
analyzed: na mahājutikam hoti na mahā vipphāram lokuttarassa natthi saṃkilesaḥ lokiyassa ca
translated: and it is not very brilliant or effective. But that in the supramundane way is undefiled.

original: saraṇagamanassa duvidho bhedo sāvajjo anavajjo ca. Tattha sāvajjo aññasatthārādīsu
analyzed: saraṇa gamanassa duvidhaḥ bhedaḥ sāvajjaḥ anavajjaḥ ca tattha sāvajjaḥ añña satthārā ādīsu
translated: And the mundane going for refuge is of two kinds, namely, blameless and blamable. Herein, the blamable is the going for refuge in other teachers, etc., by renouncing the Enlightened One, etc., and accepting others;

original: attasanniyyātanādīhi hoti, so aniṭṭhaphalo. Anavajjo kālakiriyāya, so avipākattā
analyzed: atta sanniyyātana ādīhi hoti saḥ aniṭṭha phalaḥ anavajjaḥ kāla kiriyāya saḥ a vipāka ttā
translated: it has an undesirable result. The blameless has no result since it has no ripening.

original: aphalo. Lokuttarassa pana nevatthi bhedo. Bhavantarepi hi ariyasāvako aññaṃ satthāraṃ
analyzed: aphalaḥ lokuttarassa pana na iva atthi bhedaḥ bhavantare pi hi ariyasāvako aññam satthāram
translated: But the supramundane going for refuge has no breach. For a noble disciple does not choose another teacher even in a future existence.

original: na uddisatīti evaṃ saraṇagamanassa saṃkileso ca bhedo ca veditabbo.
analyzed: na uddisati iti evam saraṇa gamanassa saṃkileso ca bhedo ca veditabbo
translated: This is how the defilement and breach in the going for refuge should be understood.

original: Upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretūti maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo “upāsako aya”nti evaṃ dhāretu,
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu uti mam bhavam gotamaḥ upāsakaḥ ayanti evam dhāretu
translated: “May the venerable Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge for life” means “May the venerable Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge by undertaking the five training precepts for life.”🔽The meaning of “may he know” is “may he be aware.”

original: jānātūti attho. Upāsakavidhikosallatthaṃ panettha ko upāsako, kasmā upāsakoti vuccati,
analyzed: jānātu uti atthaḥ upāsaka vidhi kosalla attham pana ittha kaḥ upāsako kasmai upāsako ti vuccati
translated: But as to the skill in the requisites of a lay follower, here it may be asked: Who is a lay follower? Why is he called a lay follower?

original: kimassa sīlaṃ, ko ājīvo, kā vipatti, kā sampattīti idaṃ pakiṇṇakaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: kim assa sīlam kaḥ ājīvaḥ kā vipatti kā sampatti iti idam pakiṇṇakam veditabbam
translated: What is his virtue? What is his livelihood? What is his failure? What is his success? This is the miscellaneous section to be known.

original: Tattha ko upāsakoti yo koci saraṇagato gahaṭṭho. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: tattha kaḥ upāsakaḥ iti yaḥ koci saraṇa gataḥ gahaṭṭhaḥ vuttam ha etam
translated: Herein, who is a lay follower? Anyone who has gone for refuge, a householder. For this is said:

original: “Yato kho, mahānāma, upāsako buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato hoti, dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato, saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato hoti. Ettāvatā kho, mahānāma, upāsako hotī”ti.
analyzed: yatas kho mahānāmaḥ upāsakaḥ buddham saraṇam gataḥ hoti dhammam saraṇam gataḥ saṅgham saraṇam gataḥ hoti ettāvatā kho mahānāmaḥ upāsakaḥ hoti iti
translated: “When, Mahanama, a lay follower has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha, it is in this way he becomes a lay follower” .

original: Kasmā upāsakoti. Ratanattayassa upāsanato. So hi buddhaṃ upāsatīti upāsako. Dhammaṃ, saṅghaṃ upāsatīti upāsakoti.
analyzed: kasmai upāsakaḥ uti ratanattayassa upāsanataḥ saḥ hi buddham upāsati iti upāsakaḥ dhammam saṅgham upāsati iti upāsakaḥ uti
translated: Why is he called a lay follower? Because he follows by faith the Three Jewels. He is a lay follower because he follows the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha.

original: Kimassa sīlanti. Pañca veramaṇiyo. Yathāha –
analyzed: kim assa sīlanti pañca veramaṇiyaḥ yathā āha
translated: What is his virtue? The five abstinences, according as it is said:

original: “Yato kho, mahānāma, upāsako pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā, kāmesumicchācārā,
analyzed: yatas kho mahānāmaḥ upāsakaḥ pāṇa atipātā paṭivirataḥ hoti a dinna ādānā kāmesum icchā ācārā
translated: “When, Mahanama, a lay follower abstains from the destruction of life, from taking what is not given, from sexual misconduct,

original: musāvādā, surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti. Ettāvatā kho, mahānāma, upāsako sīlavā hotī”ti.
analyzed: musāvādā surā meraya majja ppamāda ṭṭhānā paṭivirataḥ hoti ettāvatā kho mahānāma upāsako sīlavā hoti iti
translated: from false speech, and from fermented and distilled intoxicants which are the basis for heedlessness, it is in this way he becomes virtuous” .

original: Ko ājīvoti. Pañca micchāvaṇijjā pahāya dhammena samena jīvikakappanaṃ. Vuttañhetaṃ –🔽“Pañcimā, bhikkhave, vaṇijjā upāsakena akaraṇīyā. Katamā pañca. Satthavaṇijjā, sattavaṇijjā,
analyzed: kaḥ ājīvaḥ ti pañca micchā vaṇijjāḥ pahāya dhammena samena jīvika kappanam vuttam ha etam  pañcimā bhikkhave vaṇijjā upāsakena a karaṇīyā katamā pañca sattha vaṇijjā satta vaṇijjā
translated: What is wrong livelihood? It is the pursuit of livelihood by the five kinds of wrong conduct. For this is said:

original: maṃsavaṇijjā, majjavaṇijjā, visavaṇijjā. Imā kho, bhikkhave, pañca vaṇijjā upāsakena akaraṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: maṃsa vaṇijjāḥ majja vaṇijjāḥ visa vaṇijjāḥ imāḥ kho bhikkhave pañca vaṇijjāḥ upāsakena a karaṇīyāḥ ati
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these five trades that a lay follower should not pursue. What five? Trading in weapons, trading in living beings, trading in meat, trading in intoxicants, and trading in poisons. These are the five trades that a lay follower should not pursue” .

original: Kā vipattīti. Yā tasseva sīlassa ca ājīvassa ca vipatti, ayamassa vipatti. Apica
analyzed: kā vipatti iti yā tassa iva sīlassa ca ājīvassa ca vipatti ayamassa vipatti apica
translated: What is failure? It is the failure of that virtue and that livelihood. Furthermore,

original: yāya esa caṇḍālo ceva hoti malañca patikuṭṭho ca, sāpi tassa vipattīti veditabbā.
analyzed: caṇḍālo ca iva hoti malaṃ ca patikuṭṭhaḥ ca sā api tassa vipatti iti veditabbā
translated: it should be understood as the failure by which he becomes a pariah and a blot on the Dispensation.

original: Te ca atthato assaddhiyādayo pañca dhammā honti. Yathāha –
analyzed: te ca atthataḥ pañca dhammāḥ honti yathā āha
translated: And these are, in fact, the five states beginning with lack of faith,

original: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato upāsako upāsakacaṇḍālo ca hoti upāsakamalañca
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave dhammehi samannāgataḥ upāsakaḥ upāsaka caṇḍālo ca hoti upāsaka malam ca
translated: “Bhikkhus, a lay follower endowed with five qualities is a lay follower who is a pariah and a blot on the Dispensation.

original: upāsakapatikuṭṭho ca. Katamehi pañcahi? Assaddho hoti, dussīlo hoti, kotūhalamaṅgaliko
analyzed: upāsaka pati kuṭṭho ca katamehi pañcahi assaddhaḥ hoti dussīlaḥ hoti kotūhala maṅgalikaḥ
translated: With what five? He is without faith, unvirtuous, mean, of low intelligence, and he associates with the families of bhikkhus and bhikkhunis in a way that is not proper for one who has entered on the way.

original: hoti, maṅgalaṃ pacceti no kammaṃ, ito ca bahiddhā dakkhiṇeyyaṃ pariyesati, tattha
analyzed: hoti maṅgalam pacceti no kammam itas ca bahiddhā dakkhiṇeyyam pariyesati tattha
translated: and he does not do meritorious deeds, and he seeks for one worthy of offerings outside, here,

original: ca pubbakāraṃ karotī”ti.
analyzed: ca pubba kāram karoti iti
translated: and he does not seek for an object of offering outside, and he does the preliminary work here. ”

original: Kā sampattīti. Yā cassa sīlasampadā ca ājīvasampadā ca, sā sampatti. Ye cassa ratanabhāvādikarā saddhādayo pañca dhammā. Yathāha –
analyzed: kā sampatti iti yā cassa sīla sampadā ca ājīva sampadā ca sā sampatti ye ca ssa ratana bhāva ādi karā saddhā ādayaḥ pañca dhammā yathā āha
translated: What is the gain? It is the gain of his virtue and his livelihood. And the five things beginning with faith that are the cause of his being a jewel, etc., of an upasaka, according as it is said:

original: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato upāsako upāsakaratanañca hoti upāsakapadumañca
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave dhammehi samannāgataḥ upāsakaḥ upāsaka ratanam ca hoti upāsaka padumam ca
translated: “Bhikkhus, an upasaka endowed with five things is a jewel of an upasaka, a lotus, a choice lotus.

original: upāsakapuṇḍarīkañca. Katamehi pañcahi? Saddho hoti, sīlavā hoti, na kotūhalamaṅgaliko🔽hoti, kammaṃ pacceti no maṅgalaṃ, na ito bahiddhā dakkhiṇeyyaṃ gavesati, idha ca
analyzed: upāsaka puṇḍarīkam ca katamehi pañcahi saddhaḥ hoti sīlavā hoti na kotūhala maṅgalikaḥ  hoti kammam pacceti naḥ maṅgalam naḥ itas bahiddhā dakkhiṇeyyam gavesati idha ca
translated: With what five? He has faith, virtue, a sense of moral shame, moral dread, and he is one who does not seek an object of offering outside.

original: pubbakāraṃ karotī”ti.🔽Ajjataggeti ettha ayaṃ aggasaddo ādikoṭikoṭṭhāsaseṭṭhesu dissati. “Ajjatagge samma,
analyzed: pubba kāram karoti iti  ajjatagge iti ettha ayam agga saddo ādi koṭi koṭṭhāsa seṭṭhesu dissati ajjatagge samma
translated: He does not seek for an object of offering outside, and he does the preliminary work here” .

original: dovārika, āvarāmi dvāraṃ nigaṇṭhānaṃ nigaṇṭhīna”ntiādīsu hi ādimhi dissati. “Teneva
analyzed: dovārika āvarāmi dvāram nigaṇṭhānam nigaṇṭhī nanti ādīsu hi ādimhi dissati tena iva
translated: Herein, the word “first” is found in the sense of beginning, of climax, of portion, and of best. For it is said in the passage beginning, “From today, door-keeper, bar the door against Niganthas and Niganthi women” , that it is found in the sense of beginning.🔽And in the passage beginning, “The first of my disciples to attain Arahatship is Vappa the Koliyan” , it is found in the sense of climax.

original: aṅgulaggena taṃ aṅgulaggaṃ parāmaseyya. Ucchaggaṃ veḷagga”ntiādīsu koṭiyaṃ. “Ambilaggaṃ🔽vā madhuraggaṃ vā tittakaggaṃ vā, anujānāmi, bhikkhave, vihāraggena vā pariveṇaggena🔽vā bhājetu”ntiādīsu koṭṭhāse. “Yāvatā, bhikkhave, sattā apadā vā…pe… tathāgato tesaṃ🔽aggamakkhāyatī”tiādīsu seṭṭhe. Idha panāyaṃ ādimhi daṭṭhabbo. Tasmā ajjataggeti ajjataṃ
analyzed: aṅgu laggena tam aṅgu laggam parāmaseyyaḥ ucchaggam veḷagganti ādīsu koṭiyam ambi laggam  vā madhuraggam vā tittakaggam vā anujānāmi bhikkhave vihāra aggena vā pariveṇa aggena  vā bhājetuṃ tiādīsu koṭṭhāse yāvatā bhikkhave sattāḥ apadā vāpe tathāgato tesaṃ  aggam akkhāyati iti ādīsu seṭṭhe idha pana ayam ādimhi daṭṭhabbo tasmai ajja taggā iti ajjatam
translated: in the sense of ‘tip’, as in ‘the tip of the finger’, ‘the tip of the bamboo’. In the sense of ‘part’, as in ‘sour part’, ‘sweet part’, ‘bitter part’, ‘I allow you, monks, to divide it by means of the dwelling-part, the walking-part,🔽the sitting-part, the lying-down-part’ . In the sense of ‘best’, as in ‘Monks, the Tathāgata is declared the best of all beings with or without feet,🔽of those that have come to be’ . Here it should be taken in the sense of ‘beginning’. Therefore ajjatagā means ‘from today onwards’.🔽

original: ādiṃ katvāti evamettha attho veditabbo. Ajjatanti ajjabhāvaṃ. Ajjadaggeti vā pāṭho,🔽dakāro padasandhikaro, ajja aggaṃ katvāti attho.
analyzed: ādim katvā iti evam ettha atthaḥ veditabbaḥ ajja tanti ajja bhāvam ajja daggā iti vā pāṭhaḥ  dakāraḥ pada sandhi karaḥ ajja aggam katvā iti attho
translated: in the passage, “He should touch that finger-end with the finger-end” , in the tip. In the passage, “The tip of the bamboo is bitter, the tip is sweet” , in the portion. In the passage, “Monks, the Tathāgata is declared the foremost of all beings, whether of divine or human birth, of ascetics and brahmans, of gods and men” , in the best. But here it should be taken in the beginning. Therefore, today, means beginning from today. Thus the meaning should be understood here in this way. Today means the state of today. Or the reading is ajja-aggaṃ katvā. The syllable da is a connector of words. The meaning is: making today the best.
