original: 7. Attabyābādhasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the sutta on affliction of self

original: 17. Sattame attabyābādhāyāti attadukkhāya. Parabyābādhāyāti paradukkhāya. Kāyasucaritantiādīni pubbabhāge dasakusalakammapathavasena āgatāni, upari pana yāva arahattā avāritāneva.
analyzed: sattame atta byābādhāya ati atta dukkhāya para byābādhāya ati para dukkhāya kāya su carita nti ādīni pubba bhāge dasa kusala kammapatha vasena āgatāni upari pana yāva arahattā a vāritāni eva
translated: In the seventh, affliction of self: for the suffering of self. Affliction of others: for the suffering of others. Good bodily conduct, etc., are given in the earlier stage as the ten profitable courses of action, but they are included here up to arahantship.

original: 8. Devalokasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: deva loka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the sutta on the world of the gods

original: 18. Aṭṭhame aṭṭīyeyyāthāti aṭṭā pīḷitā bhaveyyātha. Harāyeyyāthāti lajjeyyātha. Jiguccheyyāthāti🔽gūthe viya tasmiṃ vacane sañjātajigucchā bhaveyyātha. Iti kirāti ettha itīti padasandhibyañjanasiliṭṭhatā,
analyzed: aṭṭhame aṭṭīyeyyātha ati aṭṭā pīḍitā bhaveyyātha harāyeyyātha ati lajjeyyātha jiguccheyyātha ati 🔽tasmin vacane sañjāta jigucchā iti kirāti ettha iti iti pada sandhi byañjana siliṭṭha tā
translated: In the eighth, you would be ashamed: you would be ashamed, you would be embarrassed. You would be disgusted: you would be disgusted with that statement as with dung.

original: kirāti anussavatthe nipāto. Dibbena kira āyunā aṭṭīyathāti evamassa sambandho veditabbo.
analyzed: kira ati anussava atthe nipātaḥ dibbena kira āyunā evam assa sambandhaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: The word kira is a particle of report. The construction is: “He is afraid because of the divine life-span.”

original: Pageva kho panāti paṭhamataraṃyeva.🔽9. Paṭhamapāpaṇikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pagā iva kho panāti paṭhamataraṃyā iva  paṭhama pāpaṇika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: Paṇe va kho pan’ti means even more than that.🔽The first section for recitation on the merchant is finished.

original: 19. Navame pāpaṇikoti āpaṇiko, āpaṇaṃ ugghāṭetvā bhaṇḍavikkāyakassa vāṇijassetaṃ
analyzed: navame pāpaṇikaḥ oti āpaṇikaḥ āpaṇam ugghāṭetvā bhaṇḍa vikkāyakassa vāṇijassa etam
translated: In the ninth (story), the “merchant” (is a trader) who has opened a shop. This is a designation for a trader who sells goods.

original: adhivacanaṃ. Abhabboti abhājanabhūto. Na sakkaccaṃ kammantaṃ adhiṭṭhātīti yathā adhiṭṭhitaṃ
analyzed: adhivacanam abhabbaḥ ti abhājana bhūtaḥ na sakkaccam kammantam adhiṭṭhāti iti yathā adhiṭṭhitam
translated: He is not a fit vessel: he is not a suitable vessel. He does not carry out his work properly: he does not carry out what he has undertaken

original: suadhiṭṭhitaṃ hoti, evaṃ sayaṃ attapaccakkhaṃ karonto nādhiṭṭhāti. Tattha paccūsakāle
analyzed: su adhiṭṭhitam hoti evam sayam atta paccakkham karontaḥ na adhiṭṭhāti tattha paccūsa kāle
translated: as if he were his own witness. Here, he does not carry out his work properly in the morning time

original: padasaddena uṭṭhāya dīpaṃ jāletvā bhaṇḍaṃ pasāretvā anisīdanto pubbaṇhasamayaṃ na
analyzed: pada saddena uṭṭhāya dīpam jāletvā bhaṇḍam pasāretvā a nisīdantaḥ pubbaṇhasamayam na
translated: when he gets up at the time of the first watch, lights the lamp, spreads out the goods, and sits down.

original: sakkaccaṃ kammantaṃ adhiṭṭhāti nāma. Ayaṃ hi yaṃ corā rattiṃ bhaṇḍaṃ haritvā “idaṃ
analyzed: sakkaccam kammantam adhiṭṭhāti nāma ayam hi yam corāḥ rattim bhaṇḍam haritvā idam
translated: This is because thieves, having stolen goods during the night, go to the shop saying: “We will give back this (to you),”

original: amhākaṃ hatthato vissajjessāmā”ti āpaṇaṃ gantvā appena agghena denti, yampi bahuverino
analyzed: amhākam hatthataḥ vissajjessāma ati āpaṇam gantvā appena agghena denti yam pi bahu verinaḥ
translated: and sell it at dawn for a low price.

original: manussā rattiṃ nagare vasitvā pātova āpaṇaṃ gantvā bhaṇḍaṃ gaṇhanti, yaṃ vā pana
analyzed: manussāḥ rattim nagare vasitvā āpaṇam gantvā bhaṇḍam gaṇhanti yam vā pana
translated: People who have stayed in the town at night go to the market in the morning to buy goods,

original: janapadaṃ gantukāmā manussā pātova āpaṇaṃ gantvā bhaṇḍaṃ kiṇanti, tappaccayassa lābhassa assāmiko hoti.
analyzed: janapadam gantu kāmā manussā pātova āpaṇam gantvā bhaṇḍam kiṇanti tad paccayassa lābhassa assāmikaḥ hoti
translated: or people who want to go to the country go to the market in the morning to buy goods. He is not the owner of the profit that comes from that.

original: Aññesaṃ bhojanavelāya pana bhuñjituṃ āgantvā pātova bhaṇḍaṃ paṭisāmetvā gharaṃ gantvā
analyzed: aññesam bhojana velāya pana bhuñjitum āgantvā pātova bhaṇḍam paṭisāmetvā gharam gantvā
translated: But others, after coming to the market in the morning to buy goods at mealtime, put the goods aside, go home,

original: bhuñjitvā niddāyitvā sāyaṃ puna āpaṇaṃ āgacchanto majjhanhikasamayaṃ na sakkaccaṃ🔽kammantaṃ adhiṭṭhāti nāma. So hi yaṃ corā pātova vissajjetuṃ na sampāpuṇiṃsu, divākāle🔽pana paresaṃ asañcārakkhaṇe āpaṇaṃ gantvā appagghena denti, yañca bhojanavelāya puññavanto🔽issarā “āpaṇato idañcidañca laddhuṃ vaṭṭatī”ti pahiṇitvā āharāpenti, tappaccayassa
analyzed: bhuñjitvā niddāyitvā sāyam puna āpaṇam āgacchantaḥ majjhanhika samayam na sakkaccam  kammantam adhiṭṭhāti nāma saḥ hi yam corā vissajjetum na sampāpuṇiṃsu divākāle  pana paresam a sañcāra kkhaṇe āpaṇam gantvā appagghena denti yat ca bhojana velāya puññavanto  issarāḥ āpaṇataḥ idam ca idam ca laddhum vaṭṭati iti pahiṇitvā āhara āpenti tad paccayassa
translated: eat, and sleep. When they come back to the market in the evening, they do not do their business properly at midday.🔽For they go to the market in the daytime when there is no movement of people and sell at a low price what the thieves could not sell in the morning,

original: lābhassa assāmiko hoti.
analyzed: lābhassa assāmikaḥ hoti
translated: and they also sell at a low price what the meritorious, the powerful, have sent to be sold, saying, “Such and such things should be got from the market.” He is not the owner of the profit that comes from that.

original: Yāva yāmabherinikkhamanā pana antoāpaṇe dīpaṃ jālāpetvā anisīdanto sāyanhasamayaṃ
analyzed: yāva yāma bheri nikkhamanā pana antoāpaṇe dīpam jālāpetvā a nisīdanto sāyanha samayam
translated: But if he does not light a lamp in the shop and sit down till the time for closing it,

original: na sakkaccaṃ kammantaṃ adhiṭṭhāti nāma. So hi yaṃ corā pātopi divāpi vissajjetuṃ
analyzed: na sakkaccam kammantam adhiṭṭhāti nāma saḥ hi yam corā divā api vissajjetum
translated: he does not “make a proper effort to carry out a task.” For what thieves have missed even by day

original: na sampāpuṇiṃsu, sāyaṃ pana āpaṇaṃ gantvā appagghena denti, tappaccayassa lābhassa assāmiko hoti.
analyzed: na sampāpuṇiṃsu sāyam pana āpaṇam gantvā appagghena denti tad paccayassa lābhassa assāmikaḥ hoti
translated: he can get at night by going to the shop and taking it at a low price. He is not master of the gain that comes from that.

original: Na sakkaccaṃ samādhinimittaṃ adhiṭṭhātīti sakkaccakiriyāya samādhiṃ na samāpajjati.
analyzed: na sakkaccam samādhi nimittam adhiṭṭhāti iti sakkacca kiriyāya samādhim na samāpajjati
translated: He does not “make a proper effort to carry out the sign of concentration”: he does not attain concentration with proper effort.

original: Ettha ca pātova cetiyaṅgaṇabodhiyaṅgaṇesu vattaṃ katvā senāsanaṃ pavisitvā yāva bhikkhācāravelā,
analyzed: ettha ca pātova cetiya aṅgaṇa bodhiyaṅgaṇesu vattam katvā senāsanam pavisitvā yāva bhikkhā cāra velā
translated: Herein, if he does not enter the monastery and attain jhāna there from the time he has finished his duties in the shrine terrace and the Enlightenment tree terrace until the time for going into residence,

original: tāva samāpattiṃ appetvā anisīdanto pubbaṇhasamayaṃ na sakkaccaṃ samādhinimittaṃ adhiṭṭhāti
analyzed: tāva samāpattim appetvā a nisīdantaḥ pubbaṇhasamayam na sakkaccam samādhi nimittam adhiṭṭhāti
translated: he does not “make a proper effort to carry out the sign of concentration” in the morning.

original: nāma. Pacchābhattaṃ pana piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto rattiṭṭhānadivāṭṭhānaṃ pavisitvā yāva
analyzed: nāma pacchābhattam pana piṇḍapāta paṭikkantaḥ ratti ṭṭhāna divāṭṭhānam pavisitvā yāva
translated: But after his meal he goes to his day-quarters or night-quarters,

original: sāyanhasamayā samāpattiṃ appetvā anisīdanto majjhanhikasamayaṃ na sakkaccaṃ samādhinimittaṃ🔽adhiṭṭhāti nāma. Sāyaṃ pana cetiyaṃ vanditvā therūpaṭṭhānaṃ katvā senāsanaṃ pavisitvā
analyzed: sāyanha samayā samāpattim appetvā a nisīdantaḥ majjhanhika samayam na sakkaccam samādhi nimittam  adhiṭṭhāti nāma sāyam pana cetiyam vanditvā therū upaṭṭhānam katvā senāsanam pavisitvā
translated: He does not sit down after emerging from the attainment in the evening time. He does not establish the sign of serenity well in the middle watch.🔽But he does not sit down after paying homage at the shrine and rendering service to the elders and entering the dwelling in the evening time.

original: paṭhamayāmaṃ samāpattiṃ samāpajjitvā anisīdanto sāyanhasamayaṃ na sakkaccaṃ samādhinimittaṃ
analyzed: paṭhama yāmam samāpattim samāpajjitvā a nisīdantaḥ sāyanha samayam na sakkaccam samādhi nimittam
translated: He does not establish the sign of serenity well in the first watch after emerging from the attainment in the morning time.

original: adhiṭṭhāti nāma. Sukkapakkho vuttapaṭipakkhanayeneva veditabbo. Apicettha “samāpattiṃ🔽appetvā”ti vuttaṭṭhāne samāpattiyā asati vipassanāpi vaṭṭati, samādhinimittanti ca
analyzed: adhiṭṭhāti nāma sukka pakkhaḥ vutta paṭipakkha nayena iva veditabbaḥ api ca ittha samāpattim  appetvā ti vutta ṭṭhāne samāpattiyāḥ asati vipassanā api vaṭṭati samādhi nimittam ti ca
translated: The bright fortnight should be understood in the opposite sense to the dark fortnight.

original: samādhiārammaṇampi vaṭṭatiyeva. Vuttampi cetaṃ – “samādhipi samādhinimittaṃ, samādhārammaṇampi samādhinimitta”nti.
analyzed: samādhi ārammaṇam pi vaṭṭatiyā iva vuttam pi cetam samādhi samādhi nimittam samādha ārammaṇam pi samādhi nimittam ti
translated: And in the place where it is said, “after emerging from the attainment,” if there is no attainment, insight is also allowable. And the sign of serenity is also allowable as the object of concentration. For this is said: “Concentration is the sign of serenity; the object of concentration is also the sign of serenity” .

original: 10. Dutiyapāpaṇikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya pāpaṇika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . Commentary

original: 20. Dasame cakkhumāti paññācakkhunā cakkhumā hoti. Vidhuroti visiṭṭhadhuro uttamadhuro
analyzed: dasame cakkhumā ti paññācakkhunā cakkhumā hoti vidhuro ti visiṭṭha dhuraḥ uttama dhuro
translated: In the tenth, he is “endowed with eyes” in that he is endowed with the eye of wisdom. He is “unwearied” in that he is unwearied in the highest burden.

original: ñāṇasampayuttena vīriyena samannāgato. Nissayasampannoti avassayasampanno patiṭṭhānasampanno.🔽Paṇiyanti vikkāyikabhaṇḍaṃ. Ettakaṃ mūlaṃ bhavissati ettako udayoti tasmiṃ “evaṃ
analyzed: ñāṇa sampayuttena vīriyena samannāgataḥ nissaya sampanno ti avassaya sampanno patiṭṭhāna sampanno  paṇiyanti vikkāyika bhaṇḍam ettakam mūlam bhavissati ettakaḥ udayo ti tasmin evam
translated: He is endowed with energy associated with knowledge. He is endowed with a support: he is endowed with a support, he is endowed with a foundation.

original: kītaṃ evaṃ vikkāyamāna”nti vuttapaṇiye yena kayena taṃ kītaṃ, taṃ kayasaṅkhātaṃ mūlaṃ
analyzed: kītam evam vikkāyamānam ti vutta paṇiye yena kayena tam kītam tam kaya saṅkhātam mūlam
translated: Goods: merchandise. So much will be the capital and so much the profit: in that merchandise which is thus priced, thus sold, thus bought, the capital, that is to say, the buying, will be so much.

original: ettakaṃ bhavissati. Yo ca tasmiṃ vikkayamāne vikkayo, tasmiṃ vikkaye ettako udayo🔽bhavissati, ettikā vaḍḍhīti attho.
analyzed: ettakam bhavissati yaḥ ca tasmin vikkayamāne vikkayaḥ tasmin vikkaye ettakaḥ udayo  bhavissati ettikā vaḍḍhi iti attho
translated: And in the selling of that so much will be the profit, so much the increase, is the meaning.

original: Kusalo hoti paṇiyaṃ ketuñca vikketuñcāti sulabhaṭṭhānaṃ gantvā kiṇanto dullabhaṭṭhānaṃ gantvā vikkiṇanto ca ettha kusalo nāma hoti, dasaguṇampi vīsatiguṇampi lābhaṃ labhati.
analyzed: kusalaḥ hoti paṇiyam ketum ca vikketum ca ati sulabha ṭṭhānam gantvā kiṇantaḥ dullabha ṭṭhānam gantvā vikkiṇantaḥ ca ettha kusalaḥ nāma hoti dasaguṇam pi vīsatiguṇam pi lābham labhati
translated: He is skilled in buying and selling: he is skilled in buying after going to a place where it is easy to buy and in selling after going to a place where it is easy to sell, and he gets a profit of ten or twenty times.

original: Aḍḍhāti issarā bahunā nikkhittadhanena samannāgatā. Mahaddhanāti vaḷañjanakavasena
analyzed: issarā bahunā nikkhitta dhanena samannāgatā mahat hanāti vaḷañjanaka vasena
translated: Rich: powerful, possessing much stored wealth.

original: mahaddhanā. Mahābhogāti upabhogaparibhogabhaṇḍena mahābhogā. Paṭibaloti kāyabalena
analyzed: mahat dhanā mahā bhogā ati upabhoga paribhoga bhaṇḍena mahā bhogā paṭibalā ti kāya balena
translated: Greatly rich: greatly wealthy with wealth and property. Able: able because endowed with physical strength

original: ceva ñāṇabalena ca samannāgatattā samattho. Amhākañca kālena kālaṃ anuppadātunti
analyzed: ca iva ñāṇa balena ca samannāgata ttā samatthaḥ amhākam ca kālena kālam an uppadātunti
translated: and the strength of knowledge. To give us: to give us

original: amhākañca gahitadhanamūlikaṃ vaḍḍhiṃ kālena kālaṃ anuppadātuṃ. Nipatantīti nimantenti.
analyzed: amhākam ca gahita dhana mūlikam vaḍḍhim kālena kālam an uppadātum nipatanti iti nimantenti
translated: interest on the capital we have advanced from time to time. To invite: to invite.

original: Nipātentītipi pāṭho, ayameva attho.
analyzed: pāṭhaḥ ayam eva attho
translated: The reading nipātenti is also allowable; the meaning is the same.

original: Kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ upasampadāyāti kusaladhammānaṃ sampādanatthāya paṭilābhatthāya.
analyzed: kusalānam dhammānam upasampadāya ati kusala dhammānam sampādana tthāya paṭilābha tthāya
translated: To the realization of profitable states: for the realization of profitable states, for their acquisition.

original: Thāmavāti ñāṇathāmena samannāgato. Daḷhaparakkamoti thirena ñāṇaparakkamena samannāgato.
analyzed: thāmavā ati ñāṇa thāmena samannāgataḥ daḷha parakkamo ti thirena ñāṇa parakkamena samannāgataḥ
translated: Firm: endowed with the firmness of knowledge. Steadfast: endowed with the steadfastness of the effort of knowledge.

original: Anikkhittadhuroti “aggamaggaṃ apāpuṇitvā imaṃ vīriyadhuraṃ na ṭhapessāmī”ti evaṃ aṭṭhapitadhuro.
analyzed: a nikkhitta dhuraḥ ti aggamaggam apāpuṇitvā imam vīriya dhuram na ṭhapessāmi iti evam a ṭhapita dhuraḥ
translated: Unfaltering: unfaltering in the sense of “I will not lay aside this burden of energy until I have reached the path to enlightenment.”

original: Bahussutāti ekanikāyādivasena bahu buddhavacanaṃ sutaṃ etesanti bahussutā. Āgatāgamāti
analyzed: bahu ssutā ati eka nikāya ādi vasena bahu buddha vacanam sutam etesanti bahu ssutāḥ āgata āgamā iti
translated: Learned: they have heard much of the Buddha’s word classed as sutta, etc., in the various divisions of the scriptures. They have learned the scriptures:

original: eko nikāyo eko āgamo nāma, dve nikāyā dve āgamā nāma, pañca nikāyā pañca āgamā nāma,
analyzed: ekaḥ nikāyaḥ ekaḥ āgamaḥ nāma dve nikāyā dve āgamā nāma pañca nikāyā pañca āgamā nāma
translated: One collection, one source, is called one collection, one source. Two collections, two sources, are called two collections, two sources. Five collections, five sources, are called five collections, five sources.

original: etesu āgamesu yesaṃ ekopi āgamo āgato paguṇo pavattito, te āgatāgamā nāma. Dhammadharāti
analyzed: etesu āgamesu yesam ekaḥ api āgamaḥ āgataḥ paguṇaḥ pavattito te āgatāgamāḥ nāma dhamma dharā ti
translated: In these sources, those who have mastered one source are called those who have mastered the sources. Those who have mastered the Dhamma are

original: suttantapiṭakadharā. Vinayadharāti vinayapiṭakadharā. Mātikādharāti dvemātikādharā.
analyzed: suttanta piṭaka dharā vinaya dharā ati vinaya piṭaka dharā mātikā dharā ati dve mātikā dharā
translated: those who have mastered the Sutta Pitaka. Those who have mastered the Vinaya are those who have mastered the Vinaya Pitaka. Those who have mastered the mātikā are those who have mastered the two mātikās.

original: Paripucchatīti atthānatthaṃ kāraṇākāraṇaṃ pucchati. Paripañhatīti “imaṃ nāma pucchissāmī”ti
analyzed: paripucchati iti attha anattham kāraṇa akāraṇam pucchati paripañhati iti imam nāma pucchissāmi iti
translated: He asks about the meaning and the non-meaning, about the reason and the non-reason. He discusses: “I will ask about this.”

original: aññāti tuleti pariggaṇhāti. Sesamettha uttānatthameva.
analyzed: aññā ti tule iti pariggaṇhāti sesam ettha uttāna ttham eva
translated: He compares, he examines, he investigates. The rest is clear.

original: Imasmiṃ pana sutte paṭhamaṃ paññā āgatā, pacchā vīriyañca kalyāṇamittasevanā ca.
analyzed: imasmin pana sutte paṭhamam paññā āgatā pacchā vīriyam ca kalyāṇa mitta sevanā ca
translated: But in this sutta, understanding comes first, and then energy and the service of good friends.

original: Tattha paṭhamaṃ arahattaṃ patvā pacchā vīriyaṃ katvā kalyāṇamittā sevitabbāti na
analyzed: tattha paṭhamam arahattam patvā pacchā vīriyam katvā kalyāṇa mittā sevitabbā ati na
translated: Herein, it should not be regarded as meaning that one should first attain Arahantship and then afterwards, by exerting energy, serve good friends.

original: evaṃ attho daṭṭhabbo, desanāya nāma heṭṭhimena vā paricchedo hoti uparimena vā dvīhipi
analyzed: evam atthaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ desanāya nāma heṭṭhimena vā paricchedaḥ hoti uparimena vā
translated: The teaching is limited either by the lower or by the upper.

original: vā koṭīhi. Idha pana uparimena paricchedo veditabbo. Tasmā kathentena paṭhamaṃ kalyāṇamittaupanissayaṃ
analyzed: vā koṭīhi idha pana uparimena paricchedaḥ veditabbo tasmai kathentena paṭhamam kalyāṇa mitta upanissayam
translated: Therefore, when telling the story, the first thing to be done is to show the support of a good friend,

original: dassetvā majjhe vīriyaṃ dassetvā pacchā arahattaṃ kathetabbanti.
analyzed: dassetvā majjhe vīriyam dassetvā pacchā arahattam kathetabbanti
translated: then in the middle to show energy, and at the end arahatship.

original: Rathakāravaggo dutiyo.
analyzed: rathakāra vaggo dutiyaḥ
translated: The second sub-chapter on the chariot-maker is finished.

original: 3. Puggalavaggo
analyzed: puggala vaggaḥ
translated: The sub-chapter on persons

original: 1. Samiddhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: samiddha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Sutta on Samiddha

original: 21. Tatiyassa paṭhame jhānaphassaṃ paṭhamaṃ phusati, pacchā nirodhaṃ nibbānaṃ sacchikarotīti🔽kāyasakkhi. Diṭṭhantaṃ pattoti diṭṭhippatto. Saddahanto vimuttoti saddhāvimutto.🔽Khamatīti ruccati. Abhikkantataroti atisundarataro. Paṇītataroti atipaṇītataro. Saddhindriyaṃ
analyzed: tatiyassa paṭhame jhāna phassam paṭhamam phusati pacchā nirodham nibbānam sacchikaroti iti  kāya sakkhi diṭṭhantam patto ti diṭṭhi ppatto saddahantaḥ vimuttaḥ iti saddhā vimuttaḥ  khamati iti ruccati abhikkantataro iti ati sundarataro paṇītataro iti ati paṇītataro saddhindriyaṃ
translated: In the first of the third group, he first experiences the jhana, and afterwards he realizes cessation, Nibbāna.🔽He is a body witness. He has reached the seen, thus he is one who has reached by vision. He is liberated by faith, thus he is one liberated by faith.

original: adhimattaṃ hotīti samiddhattherassa kira arahattamaggakkhaṇe saddhindriyaṃ dhuraṃ🔽ahosi, sesāni cattāri sahajātindriyāni tasseva parivārāni ahesuṃ. Iti thero attanā
analyzed: adhimattam hoti iti samiddha therassa kira arahatta magga kkhaṇe saddhi indriyam dhuram 🔽ahosi sesāni cattāri sahajāti indriyāni tassa iva iti theraḥ attanā
translated: He approves, thus he likes. More excellent, more sublime, more penetrative, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime, more penetrative, more peaceful, more sublime

original: paṭividdhamaggaṃ kathento evamāha. Mahākoṭṭhikattherassa pana arahattamaggakkhaṇe
analyzed: paṭividdha maggam kathentaḥ evam āha mahākoṭṭhika therassa pana arahatta magga kkhaṇe
translated: He was speaking of the path he had himself penetrated. But when the Elder Maha Koṭṭhita was attaining Arahantship,

original: samādhindriyaṃ dhuraṃ ahosi, sesāni cattāri indriyāni tasseva parivārāni ahesuṃ.
analyzed: samādhi indriyam dhuram ahosi sesāni cattāri indriyāni tassa iva parivārāni ahesuṃ
translated: the faculty of concentration was his chief factor, and the other four faculties were its attendants.

original: Tasmā sopi samādhindriyaṃ adhimattanti kathento attanā paṭividdhamaggameva kathesi.
analyzed: tasmā saḥ api samādhi indriyam adhimatta nti kathentaḥ attanā paṭividdha maggam eva kathesi
translated: Therefore, when he said that the faculty of concentration was predominant in him, he was speaking of the path he had himself penetrated.

original: Sāriputtattherassa pana arahattamaggakkhaṇe paññindriyaṃ dhuraṃ ahosi. Sesāni cattāri🔽indriyāni tasseva parivārāni ahesuṃ. Tasmā sopi paññindriyaṃ adhimattanti kathento
analyzed: sāriputta therassa pana arahatta magga kkhaṇe paññindriyam dhuram ahosi sesāni cattāri  indriyāni tassa iva parivārāni ahesum tasmā saḥ api paññindriyam adhimatta nti kathento
translated: But when the Elder Sariputta was attaining Arahantship, the faculty of wisdom was his chief factor, and the other four faculties were its attendants.

original: attanā paṭividdhamaggameva kathesi.🔽Na khvetthāti na kho ettha. Ekaṃsena byākātunti ekantena byākarituṃ. Arahattāya paṭipannoti
analyzed: attanā paṭividdha maggam eva kathesi  na khu ettha iti na kho ettha ekaṃsena byākātum ekantena byākaritum arahattāya paṭipannaḥ ti
translated: Therefore, when he said that the faculty of wisdom was predominant in him, he was speaking of the path he had himself penetrated.

original: arahattamaggasamaṅgiṃ dasseti. Evametasmiṃ sutte tīhipi therehi attanā paṭividdhamaggova
analyzed: arahatta magga samaṅgim dasseti evam etasmim sutte tīhi pi therehi attanā paṭividdha maggaḥ uva
translated: “But this is not to be explained in this way”: na khvettha = na kho ettha. “To be explained in one way”: ekansena byākātun. “One who is practising for Arahantship”: arahattāya paṭipanno = one who is endowed with the Arahant path. Thus in this sutta the three Elders spoke of the path they had themselves penetrated,

original: kathito, sammāsambuddho pana bhummantareneva kathesi.
analyzed: kathitaḥ sammāsambuddhaḥ pana bhumma antarena iva kathesi
translated: but the Fully Enlightened One spoke of it in terms of the stages.

original: 2. Gilānasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: gilāna sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: 2. The second sick-nurse-advice

original: 22. Dutiye sappāyānīti hitāni vuddhikarāni. Patirūpanti anucchavikaṃ. Neva vuṭṭhāti🔽tamhā ābādhāti iminā atekicchena vātāpamārādinā rogena samannāgato niṭṭhāpattagilāno
analyzed: dutiye sappāyāni iti hitāni vuddhi karāni anucchavikam na iva vuṭṭhāti  tamhā iminā atekicchena vāta apamāra ādinā rogena samannāgataḥ niṭṭhāpatta gilāno
translated: In the second advice, “suitable” is beneficial, productive of growth. “Suitable” is suitable, fitting. “Does not recover from that affliction”🔽By this, one who is afflicted with an incurable disease such as a wind-disease, a bile-disease, etc., is called “one who has reached the end of his life.”

original: kathito. Vuṭṭhāti tamhā ābādhāti iminā khipitakakacchutiṇapupphakajarādibhedo appamattaābādho🔽kathito. Labhanto sappāyāni bhojanāni no alabhantoti iminā pana yesaṃ paṭijagganena
analyzed: kathitaḥ vuṭṭhāti tamhā iminā khipitaka kacchu tiṇa pupphaka jarā ādi bhedaḥ appamatta ābādhaḥ  kathitaḥ labhanto sappāyāni bhojanāni no a labhanto ti iminā pana yesam paṭijagganena
translated: “Recovers from that affliction” By this, a slight affliction such as a scratch, a thorn-prick, old age, etc., is called.

original: phāsukaṃ hoti, sabbepi te ābādhā kathitā. Ettha ca patirūpo upaṭṭhāko nāma gilānupaṭṭhākaaṅgehi🔽samannāgato paṇḍito dakkho analaso veditabbo. Gilānupaṭṭhāko anuññātoti bhikkhusaṅghena
analyzed: phāsukam hoti sabbe api te ābādhā kathitāḥ ettha ca patirūpaḥ upaṭṭhākaḥ nāma gilāna upaṭṭhāka aṅgehi  samannāgataḥ paṇḍitaḥ dakkhaḥ analasaḥ veditabbaḥ gilāna upaṭṭhākaḥ anuññātaḥ ti bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: “Obtaining suitable food, not obtaining it” By this, all those who are afflicted are called, by looking after whom one is comfortable. And here, a suitable nurse should be understood as one who is wise, skillful, and not lazy, and who is endowed with the factors of a nurse.🔽“One who is allowed as a nurse” is allowed to be given by the Community of Bhikkhus. For, when that sick person is unable to live by his own nature,

original: dātabboti anuññāto. Tasmiñhi gilāne attano dhammatāya yāpetuṃ asakkonte bhikkhusaṅghena
analyzed: dātabbaḥ ti anuññāto tasmin hi gilāne attanaḥ dhamma tāya yāpetum a sakkonte bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: the Community of Bhikkhus

original: tassa bhikkhuno eko bhikkhu ca sāmaṇero ca “imaṃ paṭijaggathā”ti apaloketvā dātabbā.
analyzed: tassa bhikkhunaḥ ekaḥ bhikkhu ca sāmaṇeraḥ ca imam paṭijaggatha ati apaloketvā dātabbā
translated: He should give it to one monk and one novice monk, saying, “Look after this.”🔽Until they look after it, the sick monk and the two of them may use

original: Yāva pana te taṃ paṭijagganti, tāva gilānassa ca tesañca dvinnaṃ yenattho, sabbaṃ
analyzed: yāva pana te tam paṭijagganti tāva gilānassa ca tesam ca dvinnam sabbam
translated: whatever they need.

original: bhikkhusaṅghasseva bhāro.
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅghassa iva bhāraḥ
translated: The rest is the responsibility of the Sangha of monks.

original: Aññepi gilānā upaṭṭhātabbāti itarepi dve gilānā upaṭṭhāpetabbā. Kiṃ kāraṇā? Yopi
analyzed: aññe api gilānā upaṭṭhātabbā ati itare pi dve gilānā upaṭṭhāpetabbā kim kāraṇā yaḥ api
translated: The other sick monks should be looked after: the other two sick monks should be looked after. Why?

original: hi niṭṭhapattagilāno, so anupaṭṭhiyamāno “sace maṃ paṭijaggeyyuṃ, phāsukaṃ me bhaveyya.
analyzed: hi niṭṭha patta gilānaḥ saḥ anupaṭṭhiyamānaḥ sace mam paṭijaggeyyum phāsukam me bhaveyya
translated: Because if the monk who has recovered from his illness is not looked after, he might think, “If they would look after me, I would be comfortable.

original: Na kho pana maṃ paṭijaggantī”ti manopadosaṃ katvā apāye nibbatteyya. Paṭijaggiyamānassa
analyzed: na kho pana mama paṭijagganti iti manaḥ upadosam katvā apāye nibbatteyya paṭijaggiyamānassa
translated: But they don’t.” And because of his resentment, he might be reborn in hell.

original: panassa evaṃ hoti “bhikkhusaṅghena yaṃ kātabbaṃ, taṃ kataṃ. Mayhaṃ pana kammavipāko
analyzed: panassa evam hoti bhikkhu saṅghena yat kātabbam tat katam mayham pana kamma vipāko
translated: But if he is looked after, he thinks, “The Sangha has done what had to be done. But this is the result of my own actions.”

original: īdiso”ti. So bhikkhusaṅghe mettaṃ paccupaṭṭhāpetvā sagge nibbattissati. Yo pana appamattakena
analyzed: īdiso ti so bhikkhu saṅghe mettam paccupaṭṭhāpetvā sagge nibbattissati yaḥ pana appamattakena
translated: And he will be reborn in heaven after developing good will towards the Sangha. But if the sick monk is not looked after,

original: byādhinā samannāgato labhantopi alabhantopi vuṭṭhātiyeva, tassa vināpi bhesajjena🔽vūpasamanabyādhi bhesajje kate khippataraṃ vūpasammati. So tato buddhavacanaṃ vā
analyzed: byādhinā samannāgataḥ labhanto api a labhanto api vuṭṭhātiyā iva tassa vinā api bhesajjena  vūpasamana byādhi bhesajje kate khippataram saḥ tatas buddha vacanam vā
translated: If he gets them or not, he recovers from his illness.

original: uggaṇhituṃ sakkhissati, samaṇadhammaṃ vā kātuṃ sakkhissati. Iminā kāraṇena “aññepi🔽gilānā upaṭṭhātabbā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: uggaṇhitum sakkhissati samaṇa dhammam vā kātum sakkhissati iminā kāraṇena aññe pi  gilānā upaṭṭhātabbā ti vuttam
translated: If he gets medicine, he recovers more quickly. He will then be able to learn the Buddha’s word or to do the ascetic’s work. This is why it is said that others too should be tended when sick.🔽Does not enter : does not enter into.

original: Neva okkamatīti neva pavisati. Niyāmaṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattanti kusalesu dhammesu🔽magganiyāmasaṅkhātaṃ sammattaṃ. Iminā padaparamo puggalo kathito. Dutiyavārena ugghaṭitaññū🔽gahito sāsane nālakattherasadiso buddhantare ekavāraṃ paccekabuddhānaṃ santike ovādaṃ
analyzed: na iva okkamati iti na iva pavisati niyāmam kusalesu dhammesu sammattanti kusalesu dhammesu  magga niyāma saṅkhātam sammattam iminā pada paramaḥ puggalo kathitaḥ dutiya vārena ugghaṭita ññū  gahitaḥ sāsane nālaka tthera sadisaḥ buddha antare eka vāram paccekabuddhānam santike ovādam
translated: The right path in profitable ideas : the right path called the “path-of-purity” in profitable ideas. By this phrase the type of person called “one of right view” is stated.🔽By the second phrase the type called “one who is convinced by reasoned exposition” is stated. He is like the Elder Nālaka in the Dispensation. He is one who, in the interval between Buddhas, has received advice from Private Buddhas once and has penetrated the Private Buddhas’ knowledge of enlightenment.

original: labhitvā paṭividdhapaccekabodhiñāṇo ca. Tatiyavārena vipañcitaññū puggalo kathito,
analyzed: labhitvā paṭividdha paccekabodhi ñāṇo ca tatiya vārena vipañcitaññū puggalo kathito
translated: By the third phrase the type called “one who is convinced by description” is stated.

original: neyyo pana tannissitova hoti.
analyzed: neyyaḥ pana tad nissitaḥ va hoti
translated: But the type called “one to be guided by a description” is based on that.

original: Dhammadesanā anuññātāti māsassa aṭṭha vāre dhammakathā anuññātā. Aññesampi dhammo🔽desetabboti itaresampi dhammo kathetabbo. Kiṃ kāraṇā? Padaparamassa hi imasmiṃ attabhāve🔽dhammaṃ paṭivijjhituṃ asakkontassāpi anāgate paccayo bhavissati. Yo pana tathāgatassa🔽rūpadassanaṃ labhantopi alabhantopi dhammavinayañca savanāya labhantopi alabhantopi
analyzed: dhamma desanā anuññātā ti māsassa aṭṭha vāre dhamma kathā anuññātā aññesam pi dhammo  desetabbo ti itaresam pi dhammo kathetabbo kim kāraṇā pada paramassa hi imasmin atta bhāve  dhammam paṭivijjhitum a sakkontassa api anāgate paccayaḥ bhavissati yaḥ pana tathāgatassa  rūpa dassanam labhantaḥ api a labhantaḥ api dhamma vinayam ca savanāya labhantaḥ api a labhantaḥ api
translated: “Teaching of the Dhamma is permitted” means that teaching of the Dhamma is permitted eight times a month. “The Dhamma should be taught to others” means that the Dhamma should be taught to others. Why? Because for one who is not able to penetrate the Dhamma in this life, it will be a condition for the future. But for one who, even though he obtains the opportunity to see the Tathāgata, or to hear the Dhamma and Discipline, does not obtain it,🔽

original: dhammaṃ abhisameti, so alabhanto tāva abhisameti. Labhanto pana khippameva abhisamessatīti🔽iminā kāraṇena tesaṃ dhammo desetabbo. Tatiyassa pana punappunaṃ desetabbova.
analyzed: dhammam abhisameti saḥ a labhantaḥ tāva abhisameti labhantaḥ pana khippam eva abhisamessati iti  iminā kāraṇena tesam dhammo desetabbo tatiyassa pana punappunam desetabbaḥ uva
translated: “Teaching of the Dhamma is permitted”: the teaching of the Dhamma is permitted on the eight observance days of the month. “The Dhamma should be taught to others as well”: the Dhamma should be taught to others as well. Why? Because for the one who is not able to penetrate the Dhamma in this life, it will be a condition for the future. But the one who penetrates the Dhamma whether he gets to see the Tathāgata or not, whether he gets to hear the Dhamma and Discipline or not, he penetrates the Dhamma even without getting to see the Tathāgata or hear the Dhamma and Discipline. But the one who gets to see the Tathāgata and hear the Dhamma and Discipline will penetrate the Dhamma quickly. For this reason, the Dhamma should be taught to them. But the Dhamma should be taught again and again to the third one.

original: 3. Saṅkhārasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: saṅkhāra sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . Commentary on the Discourse on Formations

original: 23. Tatiye sabyābajjhanti sadukkhaṃ. Kāyasaṅkhāranti kāyadvāre cetanārāsiṃ. Abhisaṅkharotīti
analyzed: tatiye sa byābajjhanti sa dukkham kāya saṅkhāranti kāya dvāre cetanā rāsim abhisaṅkharoti iti
translated: . In the third , “with violence” means with suffering. “Bodily formations”: a mass of volitions in the bodily door. “Formulates”

original: āyūhati rāsiṃ karoti piṇḍaṃ karoti. Vacīmanodvāresupi eseva nayo. Sabyābajjhaṃ lokanti
analyzed: āyūhati rāsim karoti piṇḍam karoti
translated: He makes it into a heap, he makes it into a lump. The same method applies in the case of the mind door. The world with its stress:

original: sadukkhaṃ lokaṃ. Sabyābajjhā phassā phusantīti sadukkhā vipākaphassā phusanti. Sabyābajjhaṃ
analyzed: sa dukkham lokam sa byābajjhā phassā phusanti iti sa dukkhā vipāka phassā phusanti sa byābajjham
translated: the world with its suffering. Contact with stress: resultants of the kinds described in the preceding paragraph.

original: vedanaṃ vediyatīti sadukkhaṃ vipākavedanaṃ vediyati, sābādhaṃ nirassādanti attho.
analyzed: vedanam vediyati iti sa dukkham vipāka vedanam vediyati sa ābādham nirassādanti attho
translated: Feeling with stress: resultants of the kinds described in the paragraph before the last. The meaning is: with affliction, without consolation.

original: Seyyathāpi sattā nerayikāti yathā niraye nibbattasattā ekantadukkhaṃ vedanaṃ vediyanti,🔽evaṃ vediyatīti attho. Kiṃ pana tattha upekkhāvedanā natthīti? Atthi, dukkhavedanāya
analyzed: sā iyyathā api sattā nerayikā ati yathā niraye nibbatta sattāḥ ekanta dukkham vedanam vediyanti  evam vediyati iti attho kim pana tattha upekkhā vedanā natthi iti atthi dukkha vedanāya
translated: Beings in hell: just as beings born in hell experience only pain,

original: pana balavabhāvena sā abbohārikaṭṭhāne ṭhitā. Iti nirayova nirayassa upamaṃ katvā
analyzed: pana balava bhāvena sā abbohārika ṭṭhāne ṭhitā iti nirayā uva nirayassa upamam katvā
translated: so he experiences pain. But is there no equanimity in hell? There is, but it is submerged by the power of the pain. So the hell realm itself is used as the simile for the hell realm.

original: āhaṭo. Tatra paṭibhāgaupamā nāma kira esā.
analyzed: tatra paṭibhāga aupamā nāma kiraḥ esā
translated: This is called a simile of identity, it seems.

original: Seyyathāpi devā subhakiṇhāti idhāpi devalokova devalokassa upamaṃ katvā āhaṭo. Yasmā
analyzed: sā iyyathā api devā idha api deva lokaḥ uva deva lokassa upamam katvā āhaṭaḥ yasmai
translated: Beings in the Subhakiṇha realm: here too the deva world itself is used as the simile for the deva world.

original: pana heṭṭhimesu brahmalokesu sappītikajjhānavipāko vattati, subhakiṇhesu nippītiko
analyzed: pana heṭṭhimesu brahmalokesu sappītika jjhāna vipāko vattati subha kiṇhesu nippītikaḥ
translated: But in the lower Brahmā-worlds the result of the jhāna that is accompanied by happiness occurs, and in the Subhakiṇha worlds the result of the jhāna that is accompanied by equanimity occurs.

original: ekantasukhova, tasmā te aggahetvā subhakiṇhāva kathitā. Iti ayampi tatra paṭibhāgaupamā nāmāti veditabbā.🔽Vokiṇṇasukhadukkhanti vomissakasukhadukkhaṃ. Seyyathāpi manussāti manussānaṃ hi kālena
analyzed: ekanta sukhaḥ u va tasmā te agga hetvā kathitā iti ayam pi tatra paṭibhāga aupamā nāma ati veditabbā  vokiṇṇa sukha dukkhanti vomissaka sukha dukkham seyyathā api manussā ati manussānam hi kālena
translated: It is only in the Vehapphala worlds that the result of the jhāna that is accompanied by bliss occurs exclusively. That is why only the Vehapphala worlds are mentioned. So this too should be understood as a simile for the reflection there.

original: sukhaṃ hoti, kālena dukkhaṃ. Ekacce ca devāti kāmāvacaradevā. Tesampi kālena sukhaṃ
analyzed: sukham hoti kālena dukkham ekacce ca devā ati kāmāvacara devā tesam pi kālena sukham
translated: “Mixed with pleasure and pain”: with pleasure and pain mixed in. “Like human beings”: for human beings sometimes have pleasure and sometimes have pain. “Some gods”: gods of the sense sphere. They too sometimes have pleasure and sometimes have pain.

original: hoti, kālena dukkhaṃ. Tesaṃ hi hīnatarānaṃ mahesakkhatarā devatā disvā āsanā vuṭṭhātabbaṃ
analyzed: hoti kālena dukkham tesam hi hīnatarānam mahesakkhatarāḥ devatāḥ disvā āsanā vuṭṭhātabbam
translated: For when they see gods of higher rank and greater dignity, they have to get up from their seats,

original: hoti, maggā ukkamitabbaṃ, pārutavatthaṃ apanetabbaṃ, añjalikammaṃ kātabbanti taṃ
analyzed: hoti maggā ukkamitabbam pārutavattham apanetabbam añjali kammam kātabbanti tam
translated: leave their resting places, remove their upper robes, pay homage with joined palms, and do the duties to them;

original: sabbampi dukkhaṃ nāma hoti. Ekacce ca vinipātikāti vemānikapetā. Te hi kālena sampattiṃ
analyzed: sabbam pi dukkham nāma hoti ekacce ca vinipātikā ati vemānika petā te hi kālena sampattim
translated: and all that is painful for them. “Some beings in the states of deprivation”: petas of the kind called “those who live on scraps of food thrown away by others.” They sometimes have good fortune,

original: anubhavanti kālena kammanti vokiṇṇasukhadukkhāva honti. Iti imasmiṃ sutte tīṇi sucaritāni
analyzed: anubhavanti kālena vokiṇṇa sukha dukkhā va honti iti imasmim sutte tīṇi su caritāni
translated: So in this sutta the three kinds of good conduct are stated

original: lokiyalokuttaramissakāni kathitānīti veditabbāni.
analyzed: lokiya lokuttara missakāni kathitāni iti veditabbāni
translated: as a mixture of the mundane and supramundane kinds.

original: 4. Bahukārasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bahukāra sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discourse on the One of Much Service🔽“Bhikkhus, there are these three persons:

original: 24. Catutthe tayome, bhikkhave, puggalāti tayo ācariyapuggalā. Puggalassa bahukārāti
analyzed: catutthe tayo me bhikkhave puggalā ti tayo ācariya puggalā puggalassa bahu kārā ati
translated: “One of much service to a person is one who gives him material support.🔽The Buddha is the Enlightened One.

original: antevāsikapuggalassa bahūpakārā. Buddhanti sabbaññubuddhaṃ. Saraṇaṃ gato hotīti avassayaṃ
analyzed: antevāsika puggalassa bahu upakārā buddhanti sabbaññu buddham saraṇam gataḥ hoti iti avassayam
translated: One who has gone for refuge has gone for reliance.🔽The Dhamma is the supramundane Dhamma that lasts as long as the world lasts.

original: gato hoti. Dhammanti satantikaṃ navalokuttaradhammaṃ. Saṅghanti aṭṭhaariyapuggalasamūhaṃ.
analyzed: gataḥ hoti sata antikam nava lokuttara dhammam saṅgha nti aṭṭha ariya puggala samūham
translated: The Sangha is the community of noble individuals.

original: Idañca pana saraṇagamanaṃ aggahitasaraṇapubbassa akatābhinivesassa vasena vuttaṃ.
analyzed: idam ca pana saraṇa gamanam aggahita saraṇa pubbassa akata abhinivesassa vasena vuttam
translated: And this going for refuge is stated for one who has not already taken the refuges and has not already formed the view .

original: Iti imasmiṃ sutte saraṇadāyako sotāpattimaggasampāpako arahattamaggasampāpakoti tayo
analyzed: iti imasmim sutte saraṇa dāyako sotāpatti magga sampāpako arahatta magga sampāpako ti tayo
translated: So in this sutta the three kinds of teachers who are of much service are stated as

original: ācariyā bahukārāti āgatā, pabbajjādāyako buddhavacanadāyako kammavācācariyo sakadāgāmimaggasampāpako
analyzed: ācariyāḥ bahu kārāḥ ti āgatāḥ pabbajja ādāyakaḥ buddha vacana dāyako kamma vācā ācariyo sakadāgāmi magga sampāpako
translated: the one who gives the going forth, the one who gives the Buddha’s word, and the one who gives the formal support for the Monastic Law. The one who gives the going forth is of much service in the attainment of the stream-entry path,🔽the one who gives the Buddha’s word is of much service in the attainment of the once-return path,

original: anāgāmimaggasampāpakoti ime ācariyā na āgatā, kiṃ ete na bahukārāti? No, na bahukārā.
analyzed: anāgāmi magga sampāpako ti ime ācariyāḥ na āgatā kim ete na bahu kārā ati no na bahu kārā
translated: No, they are not of great service.

original: Ayaṃ pana desanā duvidhena paricchinnā. Tasmā sabbepete bahukārā. Tesu saraṇagamanasmiṃyeva
analyzed: ayam pana desanā duvidhena paricchinnā tasmā bahu kārā tesu saraṇa gamanasmiṃyeva
translated: But this teaching is defined in two ways. Therefore all are of great service.🔽In the going for refuge, however, only one who has not made a commitment is suitable.

original: akatābhiniveso vaṭṭati, catupārisuddhisīlakasiṇaparikammavipassanāñāṇāni pana paṭhamamaggasannissitāni
analyzed: akata abhinivesaḥ vaṭṭati catu pārisuddhi sīla kasiṇa parikamma vipassanā ñāṇāni pana paṭhama magga sannissitāni
translated: The fourfold purification, the virtue, the kasiṇa-device, the preliminary work, and insight-knowledge are based on the first path.

original: honti, upari dve maggā ca phalāni ca arahattamaggasannissitānīti veditabbāni.🔽Iminā puggalenāti iminā antevāsikapuggalena. Na suppatikāraṃ vadāmīti patikāraṃ kātuṃ🔽na sukaranti vadāmi. Abhivādanādīsu anekasatavāraṃ anekasahassavārampi hi pañcapatiṭṭhitena
analyzed: honti upari dve maggā ca phalāni ca arahatta magga sannissitāni iti veditabbāni  iminā puggalena ati iminā antevāsika puggalena na suppatikāram vadāmi iti patikāram kātum  na vadāmi abhivādana ādīsu aneka sata vāram aneka sahassa vāram pi hi pañca patiṭṭhitena
translated: The two higher paths and fruits should be understood as based on the path of arahatship.🔽By this person: by this pupil.🔽I do not say that it is easy to repay: I say that it is not easy to repay.

original: nipatitvā vandanto āsanā vuṭṭhāya paccuggacchanto diṭṭhadiṭṭhakkhaṇe añjaliṃ paggaṇhanto
analyzed: nipatitvā vandantaḥ āsanā vuṭṭhāya paccuggacchantaḥ diṭṭha diṭṭha kkhaṇe añjalim paggaṇhantaḥ
translated: For by bowing down with the five points of the body touching the ground and by worshipping many hundreds of times and many thousands of times in the acts of saluting, etc., and by rising from one’s seat and going forward to meet him and by raising one’s joined palms in the gesture of reverential salutation at every moment one sees him,

original: anucchavikaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ karonto divase divase cīvarasataṃ cīvarasahassaṃ piṇḍapātasataṃ
analyzed: anucchavikam sāmīci kammam karontaḥ divase divase cīvara satam cīvara sahassam piṇḍapāta satam
translated: and he who does the proper service to the teacher, giving him a hundred robes and a thousand meals a day,

original: piṇḍapātasahassaṃ dadamāno cakkavāḷapariyantena sabbaratanamayaṃ āvāsaṃ karonto sappinavanītādinānappakāraṃ
analyzed: piṇḍapāta sahassam dadamāno cakkavāḷa pariyantena sabba ratana mayam āvāsam karonto sappi navanīta ādi nānappakāram
translated: and building a dwelling for him consisting of all the precious stones and extending to the limits of the world-sphere, and providing him with ghee, fresh butter, etc.,

original: bhesajjaṃ anuppadajjamāno neva sakkoti ācariyena katassa patikāraṃ nāma kātunti evamattho veditabbo.
analyzed: bhesajjam an uppadajjamānaḥ na iva sakkoti ācariyena katassa patikāram nāma kātunti evamatthaḥ veditabbo
translated: cannot repay the teacher for what he has done.” The meaning should be understood in this way.

original: 5. Vajirūpamasuttavaṇṇanā🔽25. Pañcame arukūpamacittoti purāṇavaṇasadisacitto. Vijjūpamacittoti ittarakālobhāsanena
analyzed: vaji rūpama sutta vaṇṇanā  pañcame arukū upama citto ti purāṇa vaṇa sadisa cittaḥ vijju upama citto ti ittara kāla ubhāsanena
translated: The explanation of the Vajirūpama Sutta is finished.

original: vijjusadisacitto. Vajirūpamacittoti kilesānaṃ mūlaghātakaraṇasamatthatāya vajirena🔽sadisacitto. Abhisajjatīti laggati. Kuppatīti kopavasena kuppati. Byāpajjatīti pakatibhāvaṃ
analyzed: vijju sadisa cittaḥ kilesānam mūla ghāta karaṇa samattha tāya vajirena  sadisa cittaḥ abhisajjati iti laggati kuppati iti kopa vasena kuppati byāpajjati iti pakati bhāvam
translated: In the fifth, one whose mind is like a wound is one whose mind is like an old sore. One whose mind is like lightning is one whose mind flashes up for a short time. One whose mind is like a diamond is one whose mind is like a diamond in its ability to destroy the roots of defilements.🔽He is hostile: he sticks. He is angry: he is angry in the sense of being enraged. He is spiteful: he abandons his normal state🔽and becomes rotten. He is stubborn: he becomes stiff and rigid. He is contemptuous:

original: pajahati, pūtiko hoti. Patitthīyatīti thinabhāvaṃ thaddhabhāvaṃ āpajjati. Kopanti
analyzed: pajahati pūtikaḥ hoti patitthīyati iti thina bhāvam thaddha bhāvam āpajjati kopanti
translated: he is contemptuous.

original: dubbalakodhaṃ. Dosanti dussanavasena tato balavataraṃ. Appaccayanti atuṭṭhākāraṃ
analyzed: dubbala kodham dosanti dussana vasena tatas balavataram appaccayanti atuṭṭha ākāram
translated: and the weak anger. The hate is stronger than the hate-habit. The discontent is the dissatisfied state.

original: domanassaṃ. Duṭṭhārukoti purāṇavaṇo. Kaṭṭhenāti daṇḍakakoṭiyā. Kaṭhalenāti kapālena.
analyzed: domanassam duṭṭhāruko ti purāṇavaṇaḥ kaṭṭhena ati daṇḍaka koṭiyā kaṭhalena ati kapālena
translated: The old sore is the old wound. The stick is the end of a staff. The club is a skull.

original: Āsavaṃ detīti aparāparaṃ savati. Purāṇavaṇo hi attano dhammatāyeva pubbaṃ lohitaṃ
analyzed: āsavam deti iti apara aparam savati purāṇavaṇaḥ hi attanaḥ dhamma tāya iva pubbam lohitam
translated: It lets out the taint means it trickles out here and there. For the old sore trickles out blood and pus and serum by its very nature.

original: yūsanti imāni tīṇi savati, ghaṭṭito pana tāni adhikataraṃ savati.🔽Evameva khoti ettha idaṃ opammasaṃsandanaṃ – duṭṭhāruko viya hi kodhanapuggalo, tassa🔽attano dhammatāya savanaṃ viya kodhanassapi attano dhammatāya uddhumātassa viya caṇḍikatassa
analyzed: imāni tīṇi savati ghaṭṭitaḥ pana tāni adhikataram  evam eva kho ti ettha idam opamma saṃsandanam duṭṭha ārukaḥ viya hi kodhana puggalo tassa  attanaḥ dhamma tāya savanam viya kodhanassa api attanaḥ dhamma tāya uddhumātassa viya caṇḍikatassa
translated: These three trickle out, but when it is struck it trickles out even more.🔽So too, in the case of the man who is angry …🔽The man who is angry is like the old sore. His conduct is like the trickling out by its very nature.

original: caraṇaṃ, kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭanaṃ viya appamattaṃ vacanaṃ, bhiyyosomattāya🔽savanaṃ viya “mādisaṃ nāma esa evaṃ vadatī”ti bhiyyosomattāya uddhumāyanabhāvo daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: caraṇam kaṭṭhena vā kaṭhalāya vā ghaṭṭanam viya appamattam vacanam bhiyyosomattāya 🔽savanam viya mādisam nāma esaḥ evam vadati iti bhiyyosomattāya uddhumāyana bhāvaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: His conduct is like the trickling out when it is struck. The slight speech is like the striking with the stick or the club. His greater anger is like the greater trickling out.

original: Rattandhakāratimisāyanti rattiṃ cakkhuviññāṇuppattinivāraṇena andhabhāvakaraṇe bahalatame.
analyzed: ratta ndhakāra timisāyanti rattim cakkhu viññāṇa uppatti nivāraṇena andha bhāva karaṇe bahalatame
translated: “In the thick darkness of the night” means in the extreme darkness that prevents the arising of eye-consciousness during the night.

original: Vijjantarikāyāti vijjuppattikkhaṇe. Idhāpi idaṃ opammasaṃsandanaṃ – cakkhumā puriso
analyzed: vijjantarikāya ati vijju patti kkhaṇe idha api idam opamma saṃsandanam cakkhumā puriso
translated: “In the interval between lightning flashes” means at the moment of the arising of lightning. Here too, the correspondence of the simile should be understood in this way: the meditator is like the man with eyes,

original: viya hi yogāvacaro daṭṭhabbo, andhakāraṃ viya sotāpattimaggavajjhā kilesā, vijjusañcaraṇaṃ🔽viya sotāpattimaggañāṇassa uppattikālo, vijjantarikāya cakkhumato purisassa samantā
analyzed: viya hi yogāvacaraḥ daṭṭhabbo andhakāram viya sotāpatti magga vajjhāḥ kilesāḥ vijju sañcaraṇam  viya sotāpatti magga ñāṇassa uppatti kālaḥ vijjantarikāya cakkhumato purisassa samantā
translated: the defilements to be abandoned by the path of stream-entry are like the darkness, the arising of the knowledge of the path of stream-entry is like the lightning flash,

original: rūpadassanaṃ viya sotāpattimaggakkhaṇe nibbānadassanaṃ, puna andhakārāvattharaṇaṃ
analyzed: rūpa dassanam viya sotāpatti magga kkhaṇe nibbāna dassanam puna andhakāra avattharaṇam
translated: the seeing of Nibbāna at the moment of the path of stream-entry is like the man with eyes seeing forms all around him in the interval between the lightning flashes,

original: viya sakadāgāmimaggavajjhā kilesā, puna vijjusañcaraṇaṃ viya sakadāgāmimaggañāṇassa
analyzed: viya sakadāgāmi magga vajjhā kilesā puna vijju sañcaraṇam viya sakadāgāmi magga ñāṇassa
translated: the defilements to be abandoned by the path of once-return are like the darkness that follows, the arising of the knowledge of the path of once-return is like the second lightning flash,

original: uppādo, vijjantarikāya cakkhumato purisassa samantā rūpadassanaṃ viya sakadāgāmimaggakkhaṇe
analyzed: uppādaḥ vijjantarikāya cakkhumataḥ purisassa samantā rūpa dassanam viya sakadāgāmi magga kkhaṇe
translated: the seeing of Nibbāna at the moment of the path of once-return is like the man with eyes seeing forms all around him in the interval between the second lightning flashes,

original: nibbānadassanaṃ, puna andhakārāvattharaṇaṃ viya anāgāmimaggavajjhā kilesā, puna vijjusañcaraṇaṃ🔽viya anāgāmimaggañāṇassa uppādo, vijjantarikāya cakkhumato purisassa samantā rūpadassanaṃ
analyzed: nibbāna dassanam puna andhakāra avattharaṇam viya anāgāmi magga vajjhā kilesā puna vijju sañcaraṇam  viya anāgāmi magga ñāṇassa uppādaḥ vijjantarikāya cakkhumato purisassa samantā rūpa dassanaṃ
translated: and the vision of Nibbāna is like the spreading of the darkness. Then the defilements to be abandoned by the path of non-return are like the descent of the lightning flash,🔽and the arising of the knowledge of the path of non-return is like the flash of lightning. The vision of forms all round by the man with eyes in the flash of lightning is like🔽the reviewing of the knowledge of the path of non-return.

original: viya anāgāmimaggakkhaṇe nibbānadassanaṃ veditabbaṃ.🔽Vajirūpamacittatāyapi idaṃ opammasaṃsandanaṃ – vajiraṃ viya hi arahattamaggañāṇaṃ🔽daṭṭhabbaṃ, maṇigaṇṭhipāsāṇagaṇṭhi viya arahattamaggavajjhā kilesā, vajirassa maṇigaṇṭhimpi🔽vā pāsāṇagaṇṭhimpi vā vinivijjhitvā agamanabhāvassa natthitā viya arahattamaggañāṇena🔽acchejjānaṃ kilesānaṃ natthibhāvo, vajirena nibbiddhavedhassa puna apatipūraṇaṃ viya
analyzed: viya anāgāmi magga kkhaṇe nibbāna dassanam veditabbam  idam opamma saṃsandanam vajiram viya hi arahatta magga ñāṇam  daṭṭhabbam maṇi gaṇṭhi pāsāṇa gaṇṭhi viya arahatta magga vajjhāḥ kilesāḥ vajirassa maṇi gaṇṭhim pi  vā pāsāṇa gaṇṭhim pi vā vinivijjhitvā agamana bhāvassa natthi tā viya arahatta magga ñāṇena  kilesānam natthi bhāvaḥ vajirena nibbiddha vedhassa puna a patipūraṇam viya
translated: The seeing of Nibbāna is like the spreading of the darkness. The defilements to be abandoned by the path of non-return are like the darkness. The arising of the knowledge of the path of non-return is like the flash of lightning. The seeing of Nibbāna at the moment of the path of non-return should be understood as like the man with eyes seeing forms all around him by the light of the flash of lightning.

original: arahattamaggena chinnānaṃ kilesānaṃ puna anuppādo daṭṭhabboti.
analyzed: arahatta maggena chinnānam kilesānam puna anuppādo daṭṭhabbo ti
translated: The application of the simile of the diamond to the diamond-like state of mind should be understood as follows. The knowledge of the path of arahatship should be regarded as like the diamond. The defilements to be abandoned by the path of arahatship are like the knot of gems and the knot of stones. The non-existence of the knowledge of the path of arahatship going forth after piercing through the knot of gems and the knot of stones should be regarded as like the non-existence of the diamond after piercing through the knot of gems and the knot of stones. The non-arising of the defilements that have been cut off by the path of arahatship should be regarded as like the non-replenishment of the hole made by the diamond.

original: 6. Sevitabbasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sevitabba sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of “The Beneficial Discourse” .

original: 26. Chaṭṭhe sevitabboti upasaṅkamitabbo. Bhajitabboti allīyitabbo. Payirupāsitabboti🔽santike nisīdanavasena punappunaṃ upāsitabbo. Sakkatvā garuṃ katvāti sakkārañceva🔽garukārañca katvā. Hīno hoti sīlenātiādīsu upādāyupādāya hīnatā veditabbā. Tattha🔽yo hi pañca sīlāni rakkhati, so dasa sīlāni rakkhantena na sevitabbo. Yo dasa sīlāni
analyzed: chaṭṭhe sevitabbaḥ iti upasaṅkamitabbaḥ bhajitabbaḥ iti allīyitabbaḥ payirupāsitabbaḥ iti  santike nisīdana vasena punappunam upāsitabbo sakkatvā garum katvā ati sakkāram ca iva  garukāram ca katvā hīnaḥ hoti sīlena ati ādīsu upādāya upādāya hīna tā veditabbā tattha  yaḥ hi pañca sīlāni rakkhati saḥ dasa sīlāni rakkhantena na sevitabbaḥ yaḥ dasa sīlāni
translated: 26. Should be attended upon: should be approached. Should be reverenced: should be attended on. Should be worshipped:🔽should be served by sitting in his presence. Should be honored and revered: should be honored and revered🔽with gifts and high rank. He is inferior in virtue: the inferiority should be understood in each case according to the precepts. Herein,🔽one who keeps the five precepts should not be attended upon by one who keeps the ten precepts. One who keeps the ten precepts🔽

original: rakkhati, so catupārisuddhisīlaṃ rakkhantena na sevitabbo. Aññatra anuddayā aññatra🔽anukampāti ṭhapetvā anuddayañca anukampañca. Attano atthāyeva hi evarūpo puggalo🔽na sevitabbo, anuddayānukampāvasena pana taṃ upasaṅkamituṃ vaṭṭati.🔽Sīlasāmaññagatānaṃ satanti sīlena samānabhāvaṃ gatānaṃ santānaṃ. Sīlakathā ca no
analyzed: rakkhati so catu pārisuddhi sīlam rakkhantena na sevitabbaḥ aññatra anuddayā aññatra 🔽anukampā ati ṭhapetvā anuddayam ca anukampañca attanaḥ atthāya iva hi evarūpaḥ puggalo 🔽na sevitabbaḥ anuddaya anukampā vasena pana tam upasaṅkamitum vaṭṭati 🔽sīla sāmañña gatānam satanti sīlena samāna bhāvam gatānam santānam sīla kathā ca no
translated: 26. In the sixth case, one should visit means one should approach. One should attend upon means one should be devoted to. One should honour means one should serve by sitting in his company. One should revere means one should serve by sitting near him again and again. Having honoured and revered means having done honour and having done reverence. He is inferior in morality, etc.: inferiority should be understood in each case according to the context. Herein, one who observes the five precepts should not visit one who observes the ten precepts. One who observes the ten precepts should not visit one who observes the morality of the fourfold restraint. Except out of faith and out of gratitude: except out of faith and gratitude. For such a person should not be visited except out of faith and gratitude. But it is proper to approach him out of faith and gratitude. Among those who are similar in morality: among those who are similar in virtue. In the discussion on virtue

original: bhavissatīti evaṃ samānasīlānaṃ amhākaṃ sīlameva ārabbha kathā bhavissati. Sā ca
analyzed: bhavissati iti evam samāna sīlānam amhākam sīlam eva ārabbha kathā bhavissati sā ca
translated: “It will be”: thus there will be talk about our similar virtue.

original: no pavattinī bhavissatīti sā ca amhākaṃ kathā divasampi kathentānaṃ pavattissati🔽na paṭihaññissati. Sā ca no phāsu bhavissatīti sā ca divasampi pavattamānā sīlakathā
analyzed: no pavattinī bhavissati iti sā ca amhākam kathā divasam pi kathentānam pavattissati  na paṭihaññissati sā ca no phāsu bhavissati iti sā ca divasam pi pavattamānā sīla kathā
translated: “It will be to our delight”: that talk of ours will go on for a whole day without being stopped.

original: amhākaṃ phāsuvihāro sukhavihāro bhavissati. Samādhipaññākathāsupi eseva nayo.🔽Sīlakkhandhanti sīlarāsiṃ. Tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmīti ettha sīlassa asappāye🔽anupakāradhamme vajjetvā sappāye upakāradhamme sevanto tasmiṃ tasmiṃ ṭhāne sīlakkhandhaṃ
analyzed: amhākam phāsu vihāro sukha vihāro bhavissati samādhi paññā kathāsu pi esā iva nayo  sīla kkhandhanti sīla rāsim tattha tattha paññāya anuggahessāmi iti ettha sīlassa asappāye  anupakāra dhamme vajjetvā sappāye upakāra dhamme sevanto tasmim tasmim ṭhāne sīla kkhandham
translated: “It will be to our comfort”: that talk of virtue going on for a whole day will be a comfortable abiding, a pleasant abiding, for us. The same method applies to the talk on concentration and on wisdom.

original: paññāya anuggaṇhāti nāma. Samādhipaññākkhandhesupi eseva nayo. Nihīyatīti attano
analyzed: paññāya anuggaṇhāti nāma samādhi paññā kkhandhesu pi esā iva nayaḥ nihīyati iti attanaḥ
translated: “The aggregate of virtue”: the mass of virtue. “I shall perfect with wisdom”: here, avoiding what is unbeneficial, unwholesome, and unprofitable for virtue, and cultivating what is beneficial, wholesome, and profitable for it, he perfects the aggregate of virtue in this and that respect. The same method applies to the aggregates of concentration and wisdom.

original: hīnataraṃ puggalaṃ sevanto khāraparissāvane āsittaudakaṃ viya satataṃ samitaṃ hāyati
analyzed: hīnataram puggalam sevanto khāra parissāvane āsitta odakam viya satatam samitam hāyati
translated: “It will decline”: by associating with a person of lower status, he declines like water in a pool with no inflow.

original: parihāyati. Tulyasevīti attanā samānasevī. Seṭṭhamupanamanti seṭṭhaṃ puggalaṃ oṇamanto.
analyzed: parihāyati tulya sevī iti attanā samāna sevī seṭṭham upanamanti seṭṭham puggalam oṇamanto
translated: He falls away. A person of equal status: a person of equal status with himself. They approach the best: they bow down to the best person.

original: Udeti khippanti khippameva vaḍḍhati. Tasmā attano uttariṃ bhajethāti yasmā seṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: udeti khippanti khippam eva vaḍḍhati tasmai attanaḥ uttarim bhajetha ati yasmai seṭṭham
translated: He rises quickly: he quickly grows. Therefore: since he who bows down to the best person rises quickly,

original: puggalaṃ upanamanto udeti khippaṃ, tasmā attano uttaritaraṃ visiṭṭhataraṃ bhajetha.
analyzed: puggalam upanamantaḥ udeti khippam tasmai attanaḥ uttaritaram visiṭṭhataram bhajetha
translated: therefore one should serve a person who is superior to oneself, more distinguished than oneself.

original: 7. Jigucchitabbasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: jigucchitabba sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: Commentary on the Seventh Curse

original: 27. Sattame jigucchitabboti gūthaṃ viya jigucchitabbo. Atha kho nanti atha kho assa.
analyzed: sattame jigucchitabbaḥ iti gūtham viya jigucchitabbaḥ atha kho assa
translated: To be despised: to be despised as if he were excrement. Then indeed: then indeed he.

original: Kittisaddoti kathāsaddo. Evameva khoti ettha gūthakūpo viya dussīlyaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: kitti saddo ti kathā saddo evam eva kho ti ettha gūtha kūpaḥ viya dussīlyam daṭṭhabbam
translated: Fame: talk. Just so: here, unvirtuousness should be regarded as a cesspit,

original: Gūthakūpe patitvā ṭhito dhammaniahi viya dussīlapuggalo. Gūthakūpato uddhariyamānena🔽tena ahinā purisassa sarīraṃ āruḷhenāpi adaṭṭhabhāvo viya dussīlaṃ sevamānassāpi
analyzed: gūtha kūpe patitvā ṭhitaḥ viya dussīla puggalaḥ gūtha kūpataḥ uddhariyamānena  tena ahinā purisassa sarīram āruḷhena api a daṭṭha bhāvaḥ viya dussīlam sevamānassa api
translated: the unvirtuous person as a snake of the dhammā species fallen into the cesspit,🔽the unvirtuous person’s action as the man’s action in not touching the snake though it had climbed on his body,🔽the unvirtuous person’s service as the man’s action in not touching the snake though it had climbed on his body,

original: tassa kiriyāya akaraṇabhāvo. Sarīraṃ gūthena makkhetvā ahinā gatakālo viya dussīlaṃ
analyzed: tassa kiriyāya akaraṇa bhāvaḥ sarīram gūthena makkhetvā ahinā gata kālaḥ viya dussīlam
translated: the unvirtuous person’s service as the man’s action in not touching the snake though it had climbed on his body,

original: sevamānassa pāpakittisaddaabbhuggamanakālo veditabbo.
analyzed: sevamānassa pāpa kitti sadda abbhut gamana kālaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: The time to know that the bad report about him is spreading is when he is being avoided.

original: Tindukālātanti tindukarukkhaalātaṃ. Bhiyyosomattāya cicciṭāyatīti taṃ hi jhāyamānaṃ
analyzed: tinduka alātam tinduka rukkha alātam bhiyyosoma ttāya cicciṭāyati iti tam hi jhāyamānam
translated: The flame of a tinduka fruit: the flame of a tinduka fruit. It crackles more and more: for when it is burning,🔽it makes a crackling sound, “crack! crack!” even without being stirred,

original: pakatiyāpi papaṭikāyo muñcantaṃ cicciṭāti “ciṭiciṭā”ti saddaṃ karoti, ghaṭṭitaṃ pana
analyzed: muñcantam cicciṭāti ciṭiciṭāti saddam karoti ghaṭṭitam pana
translated: as it spits out sparks. The meaning is that when it is stirred it makes a sound even more than usual.

original: adhimattaṃ karotīti attho. Evameva khoti evamevaṃ kodhano attano dhammatāyapi uddhato🔽caṇḍikato hutvā carati, appamattakaṃ pana vacanaṃ sutakāle “mādisaṃ nāma evaṃ vadati
analyzed: adhimattam karoti iti evam evam kodhanaḥ attanaḥ uddhataḥ  caṇḍikataḥ hutvā carati appamattakam pana vacanam suta kāle mādisam nāma evam vadati
translated: So too, the angry man: so too, the angry man, even without being stirred by his own nature,🔽goes about excited and harsh. But when a mere word is heard, he goes about even more excited and harsh,🔽more agitated and harsh, thinking, “One like me is being spoken to like this, spoken to like this.”

original: evaṃ vadatī”ti atirekataraṃ uddhato caṇḍikato hutvā carati. Gūthakūpoti gūthapuṇṇakūpo,🔽gūtharāsiyeva vā. Opammasaṃsandanaṃ panettha purimanayeneva veditabbaṃ. Tasmā evarūpo
analyzed: evam vadati iti atirekataram hutvā carati gūtha kūpaḥ iti gūtha puṇṇa kūpaḥ  gūtha rāsiyā iva vai opamma saṃsandanam pana ittha purima nayena iva veditabbam tasmai evarūpaḥ
translated: A cesspit: a pit full of excrement, or a place for excrement.🔽The application of the simile should be understood in the way already stated.🔽Therefore, since such a person should be looked upon with equanimity and not associated with,

original: puggalo ajjhupekkhitabbo na sevitabboti yasmā kodhano atiseviyamāno atiupasaṅkamiyamānopi
analyzed: puggalaḥ ajjhupekkhitabbaḥ na sevitabbaḥ iti yasmā kodhanaḥ atiseviyamānaḥ atiupasaṅkamiyamānaḥ api
translated: if one associates with an angry man too much,

original: kujjhatiyeva, “kiṃ iminā”ti paṭikkamantepi kujjhatiyeva. Tasmā palālaggi viya ajjhupekkhitabbo
analyzed: kujjhatiyā iva kim iminā ati paṭikkamante pi kujjhatiyā iva tasmā palālaggi viya ajjhupekkhitabbaḥ
translated: He is angry even when they approach him, thinking, “What do they want?” and he is angry even when they turn away, thinking, “Why do they not approach?” Therefore he should be looked upon with equanimity like a fire of sticks.

original: na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo. Kiṃ vuttaṃ hoti? Yo hi palālaggiṃ atiupasaṅkamitvā tappati,
analyzed: na sevitabbaḥ na bhajitabbaḥ kim vuttam hoti yaḥ hi palālaggim atiupasaṅkamitvā tappati
translated: He should not be served, associated with, attended on, or revered. What is meant? If one approaches too closely a fire of sticks and warms oneself,

original: tassa sarīraṃ jhāyati. Yo atipaṭikkamitvā tappati, tassa sītaṃ na vūpasammati. Anupasaṅkamitvā🔽apaṭikkamitvā pana majjhattabhāvena tappantassa sītaṃ vūpasammati, tasmā palālaggi
analyzed: tassa sarīram jhāyati yaḥ atipaṭikkamitvā tappati tassa sītam na vūpasammati an upasaṅkamitvā  a paṭikkamitvā pana majjhatta bhāvena tappantassa sītam vūpasammati tasmā palālaggi
translated: one’s body is scorched. If one stands too far away and warms oneself, one’s cold is not relieved. But if one warms oneself neither too closely nor too far away,

original: viya kodhano puggalo majjhattabhāvena ajjhupekkhitabbo, na sevitabbo na bhajitabbo na payirupāsitabbo.
analyzed: viya kodhanaḥ puggalaḥ majjhatta bhāvena ajjhupekkhitabbaḥ na sevitabbaḥ na bhajitabbaḥ na payirupāsitabbaḥ
translated: one’s cold is relieved. Therefore one should look upon an angry person with equanimity like a fire of sticks. He should not be served, associated with, attended on, or revered.

original: Kalyāṇamittoti sucimitto. Kalyāṇasahāyoti sucisahāyo. Sahāyā nāma sahagāmino saddhiṃcarā.
analyzed: kalyāṇa mittaḥ iti suci mittaḥ kalyāṇa sahāyaḥ iti suci sahāyaḥ sahāyāḥ nāma sahagāminaḥ saddhiṃcarā
translated: A good friend is a pure friend. A good companion is a pure companion. Companions are those who travel together, who go along together.

original: Kalyāṇasampavaṅkoti kalyāṇesu sucipuggalesu sampavaṅko, tanninnatappoṇatappabbhāramānasoti attho.
analyzed: kalyāṇa sampavaṅko ti kalyāṇesu suci puggalesu sampavaṅko tad ninna tappoṇa tad pabbhāra mānaso ti attho
translated: A good associate is one who is associated with good people, pure people; the meaning is, one whose mind tends, inclines, and leans towards them.

original: 8. Gūthabhāṇīsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: gūthabhāṇī sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Exposition of the Discourse on the Dung-Beetle

original: 28. Aṭṭhame gūthabhāṇīti yo gūthaṃ viya duggandhakathaṃ katheti. Pupphabhāṇīti yo
analyzed: aṭṭhame gūtha bhāṇī iti yaḥ gūtham viya duggandha katham kathā iti puppha bhāṇī iti yaḥ
translated: 28. The eighth is the one who talks like excrement: he talks like excrement in that his talk is malodorous. The one who talks like a flower:

original: pupphāni viya sugandhakathaṃ katheti. Madhubhāṇīti yo madhu viya madhurakathaṃ katheti.🔽Sabhaggatoti sabhāya ṭhito. Parisaggatoti gāmaparisāya ṭhito. Ñātimajjhagatoti ñātīnaṃ🔽majjhe ṭhito. Pūgamajjhagatoti seṇīnaṃ majjhe ṭhito. Rājakulamajjhagatoti rājakulassa🔽majjhe mahāvinicchaye ṭhito. Abhinītoti pucchanatthāyānīto. Sakkhipuṭṭhoti sakkhiṃ🔽katvā pucchito. Ehambho purisāti ālapanametaṃ. Attahetu vā parahetu vāti attano vā
analyzed: pupphāni viya sugandha katham kathā iti madhubhāṇi iti yaḥ madhu viya madhura katham kathā iti  sabhaggato ti sabhāya ṭhitaḥ parisaggato ti gāma parisāya ṭhitaḥ ñāti majjha gataḥ ti ñātīnam  majjhe ṭhitaḥ pūga majjha gato ti seṇīnam majjhe ṭhitaḥ rāja kula majjha gato ti rāja kulassa  majjhe mahā vinicchaye ṭhitaḥ abhinītaḥ ti pucchana tthāya ānītaḥ sakkhi puṭṭhaḥ ti sakkhim  katvā pucchitaḥ eham bho purisa ati ālapanam etam atta hetu vā para hetu vā ati attanaḥ vā
translated: 28. The eighth kind of talk is called “talk like dung” because it is like dung in being stinking talk. “Talk like a flower” is talk that is like a flower in being fragrant talk. “Talk like honey” is talk that is like honey in being sweet talk.

original: parassa vā hatthapādādihetu vā dhanahetu vā. Āmisakiñcikkhahetu vāti ettha āmisanti
analyzed: parassa vā hattha pāda ādi hetu vā dhana hetu vā āmisa kiñcikkha hetu vā ti ettha āmisanti
translated: “In an assembly” means in a gathering. “In a crowd” means in a gathering of villagers. “In a company of respectable people” means in a gathering of respectable people. “In a company of ascetics” means in a gathering of ascetics. “In a company of brahmans” means in a gathering of brahmans. “In a royal court” means in a gathering of the king’s court. “When summoned as a witness” means when summoned to give evidence. “When questioned as a witness” means when questioned as a witness. “Come here, good man” is an address. “For the sake of self or for the sake of another” means for the sake of oneself or for the sake of another. “For the sake of mere morsels of almsfood” means here

original: lañjo adhippeto. Kiñcikkhanti yaṃ vā taṃ vā appamattakaṃ antamaso tittiriyavaṭṭakasappipiṇḍanavanītapiṇḍādimattakassa
analyzed: lañjaḥ adhippetaḥ yam vā tam vā appamattakam antamasaḥ tittiriya vaṭṭaka sappi piṇḍa navanīta piṇḍa ādi mattakassa
translated: “A mere trifle” means a mere trifle, anything at all, even something as trifling as a single grain of sand, a single grain of gravel, a single grain of salt.

original: lañjassa hetūti attho. Sampajānamusā bhāsitā hotīti jānantoyeva musāvādaṃ kattā hoti.
analyzed: lañjassa hetu uti attho sampajāna musā bhāsitā hoti iti musāvādam kattā hoti
translated: The meaning is: for the sake of a mere trifle. “He speaks with full awareness a deliberate lie” means he speaks a deliberate lie knowing and understanding what he is saying.

original: Nelāti elaṃ vuccati doso, nāssa elanti nelā, niddosāti attho. “Nelaṅgo setapacchādo”ti
analyzed: na ilā ati elam vuccati dosaḥ na assa elanti na ilā niddosā ati attho na ilaṅgo seta pacchādo ti
translated: “Free from stain” : “ela” is a synonym for hate; he has no “ela” , thus he is “nelā” ; the meaning is, he is free from hate, like the virtue spoken of in the passage: “Nelā aṅgaṇam-anuggā” .

original: ettha vuttasīlaṃ viya. Kaṇṇasukhāti byañjanamadhuratāya kaṇṇānaṃ sukhā, sūcivijjhanaṃ
analyzed: ettha vutta sīlam viya byañjana madhura tāya kaṇṇānam sukhā
translated: “Pleasant to the ear” : because of the sweetness of the expression, it is pleasant to the ear, it does not cause ear-ache like the sound of a saw.

original: viya kaṇṇasūlaṃ na janeti. Atthamadhuratāya sakalasarīre kopaṃ ajanetvā pemaṃ janetīti
analyzed: viya kaṇṇa sūlam na janeti attha madhura tāya sakala sarīre kopam a janetvā pa imam janeti iti
translated: Because of the sweetness of the meaning, it does not cause irritation in the whole body, it causes love to arise, thus

By his own energy: by what he has acquired by his own energy.🔽By his own endeavour: by what he has acquired by his own endeavour. translated: By what he

original: vitthārikapañño. Ādikalyāṇantiādīsu ādīti pubbapaṭṭhapanā. Majjhanti kathāvemajjhaṃ.🔽Pariyosānanti sanniṭṭhānaṃ. Itissa te dhammaṃ kathentā pubbapaṭṭhapanepi kalyāṇaṃ

translated: “Good in the beginning, the middle, and the end” : the beginning is the initial establishment of the teaching. The middle is the main body of the teaching.

original: bhaddakaṃ anavajjameva katvā kathenti, vemajjhepi pariyosānepi. Ettha ca atthi desanāya🔽ādimajjhapariyosānāni, atthi sāsanassa. Tattha desanāya tāva catuppadikagāthāya paṭhamapadaṃ
analyzed: bhaddakam anavajjam eva katvā kathenti vemajjhe pi pariyosāne pi ettha ca atthi desanāya  ādi majjha pariyosānāni atthi sāsanassa tattha desanāya tāva catuppadika gāthāya paṭhama padam
translated: The end is the conclusion. Thus, in teaching the Dhamma, the Buddhas teach what is good, excellent, and blameless in the beginning, in the middle, and in the end. original: ādi, dve padāni majjhaṃ, avasānapadaṃ pariyosānaṃ. Ekānusandhikassa suttassa nidānaṃ🔽ādi, anusandhi majjhaṃ, idamavocāti appanā pariyosānaṃ. Anekānusandhikassa paṭhamo

translated: The introduction to a sutta with a single connecting factor is the beginning, the connecting factor is the middle, and the conclusion is the end.

analyzed: udakassa vivaṭṭana kālaḥ viya tasmin āsane nisinnassa uggahetum asamattha kālaḥ udakassa  asaṇṭhāna kālaḥ viya vuṭṭhahitvā asat lakkhaṇa kālaḥ veditabbo  ākiṇṇāni iti pakkhittāni sati sammosāya pakireyya ati muṭṭha sati tāya vikireyya evam eva  kho ti ettha ucchaṅgaḥ viya ucchaṅga paññaḥ puggalo daṭṭhabbo nānā khajjakāni viya nānappakāram

analyzed: vuṭṭhāya gacchantassa asat lakkhaṇa kālo veditabbo  ukkujjo ti upari mukhaḥ ṭhapito saṇṭhāti iti patiṭṭhahati evam eva kho ti ettha upari mukhaḥ  ṭhapitaḥ kumbhaḥ viya puthu paññaḥ puggalo daṭṭhabbo udakassa āsitta kālaḥ viya desanāya  laddha kālaḥ udakassa saṇṭhāna kālaḥ viya tattha nisinnassa uggaṇhana kālo no vivaṭṭana kālo
translated: The time for reviewing should be understood as the time for the one who has risen and is going.

original: viya vuṭṭhāya gacchantassa sallakkhaṇakālo veditabbo.
