original: Itihāsapañcamānanti āthabbaṇavedaṃ catutthaṃ katvā itiha āsa, itiha āsāti īdisavacanapaṭisaṃyutto
analyzed: itihāsa pañcamānanti āthabbaṇa vedam catuttham katvā iti ha āsa iti ha āsa ati īdisa vacana paṭisaṃyuttaḥ
translated: The fifth is history: having made the Atharva Veda the fourth, history is the fifth of these, which is connected with the words “thus it was,” “thus it was said,”🔽and is called the “old stories” or the “science of kingship.”

original: purāṇakathāsaṅkhāto khattavijjāsaṅkhāto vā itihāso pañcamo etesanti itihāsapañcamā.🔽Tesaṃ itihāsapañcamānaṃ vedānaṃ.
analyzed: purāṇa kathā saṅkhātaḥ khattavijjā saṅkhātaḥ vā itihāsaḥ pañcamaḥ etesanti itihāsapañcamā  tesam itihāsa pañcamānam vedānam
translated: Of these five Vedas, the fifth of which is history.

original: Padaṃ tadavasesañca byākaraṇaṃ adhīyati vedeti cāti padako veyyākaraṇo. Lokāyataṃ
analyzed: padam tad avasesam ca byākaraṇam adhīyati veda iti ca ati padakaḥ veyyākaraṇaḥ lokāyatam
translated: He studies the science of grammar, which is the science of words and the rest of it, and he is called a grammarian. The materialist

original: vuccati vitaṇḍavādasatthaṃ. Mahāpurisalakkhaṇanti mahāpurisānaṃ buddhādīnaṃ lakkhaṇadīpakaṃ
analyzed: vuccati vitaṇḍa vāda sattham mahāpurisa lakkhaṇan ti mahā purisānam buddha ādīnam lakkhaṇa dīpakam
translated: is one who expounds the science of disputation. The characteristics of a great man: the science which illustrates the characteristics of great men, such as Buddhas,

original: dvādasasahassaganthapamāṇaṃ satthaṃ, yattha soḷasasahassagāthāpadaparimāṇā buddhamantā
analyzed: dvādasa sahassa gantha pamāṇam sattham soḷasa sahassa gāthā pada parimāṇāḥ buddha mantā
translated: consists of twelve thousand sections. In it there are Buddha’s verses, which are sixteen thousand sections in length.

original: nāma ahesuṃ, yesaṃ vasena “iminā lakkhaṇena samannāgatā buddhā nāma honti, iminā
analyzed: nāma ahesum yesam vasena iminā lakkhaṇena samannāgatāḥ buddhāḥ nāma honti iminā
translated: According to them, “Those who possess these characteristics are Buddhas,

original: paccekabuddhā, dve aggasāvakā, asīti mahāsāvakā, buddhamātā, buddhapitā, aggupaṭṭhākā,
analyzed: paccekabuddhāḥ dve aggasāvakāḥ asīti mahāsāvakāḥ buddha mātā buddha pitā aggupaṭṭhākā
translated: those who possess these are Paccekabuddhas, those who possess these are the two chief disciples, those who possess these are the eighty great disciples, those who possess these are the Buddha’s mother and father, those who possess these are the chief attendant,

original: aggupaṭṭhāyikā, rājā cakkavattī”ti ayaṃ viseso ñāyati. Anavayoti imesu lokāyatamahāpurisalakkhaṇesu
analyzed: aggupaṭṭhāyikā rājā cakkavattī iti ayam viseso ñāyati anavayaḥ ti imesu lokāyata mahāpurisa lakkhaṇesu
translated: The difference is known thus: the former is the chief supporter of the world, the latter is a universal monarch.

original: anūno paripūrakārī, avayo na hotīti vuttaṃ hoti. Avayo nāma yo tāni atthato ca ganthato🔽ca sandhāretuṃ na sakkoti. Atha vā anavayoti anu avayo, sandhivasena ukāralopo. Anu
analyzed: anūnaḥ paripūra kārī avayaḥ na hoti iti vuttam hoti avayaḥ nāma yaḥ tāni atthato ca ganthato  ca sandhāretum na sakkoti atha vā anu sandhi vasena ukāra lopaḥ anu
translated: In the phrase “without deficiency” the word “deficiency” means “without deficiency,” that is, without anything lacking, without anything incomplete.🔽Or alternatively, “without deficiency” means “without deficiency in any respect,” that is, without deficiency in the sense of being incomplete, without deficiency in the sense of being defective.

original: avayo paripuṇṇasippoti attho.
analyzed: avayo paripuṇṇa sippo ti attho
translated: The word “deficiency” is derived from the root ava, to go, with the prefix anu, and the verbal noun ava is declined in the sense of a locative case by the elision of the case ending according to the rule: “avakavakāvacchesu locanīyā” .

original: Tena hīti idaṃ bhagavā naṃ āyācantaṃ disvā “idānissa pañhaṃ kathetuṃ kālo”ti ñatvā
analyzed: tena hi iti idam bhagavā nam āyācantam disvā idānissa pañham kathetum kālo ti ñatvā
translated: “Therefore listen well” : the Exalted One said this, seeing that the time had come to answer the question, after the wanderer had made his request.

original: āha. Tassattho – yasmā maṃ āyācasi, tasmā suṇāhīti. Vivicceva kāmehītiādi visuddhimagge🔽vitthāritameva. Idha panetaṃ tissannaṃ vijjānaṃ pubbabhāgapaṭipattidassanatthaṃ vuttanti
analyzed: āha tassa atthaḥ yasmai mam āyācasi tasmai suṇāhi iti vivicca iva kāmehi itiādi visuddhi magge  vitthāritam eva idha pana etam tissannam vijjānam pubbabhāga paṭipatti dassana tham vuttan ti
translated: The meaning is: “Since you have made your request, therefore listen.”🔽The phrase “quite secluded from sense desires” and so forth has been explained in detail in the Path of Purification .🔽Here it should be understood as said for the purpose of showing the practice that is preliminary to the three kinds of clear knowledge.

original: veditabbaṃ. Tattha dvinnaṃ vijjānaṃ anupadavaṇṇanā ceva bhāvanānayo ca visuddhimagge vitthāritova.
analyzed: veditabbam tattha dvinnam anupada vaṇṇanā ca iva bhāvanā nayo ca visuddhi magge vitthāritaḥ uva
translated: The exposition of the two kinds of clear knowledge and the method of development are given in detail in the Path of Purification .

original: Paṭhamā vijjāti paṭhamaṃ uppannāti paṭhamā, viditakaraṇaṭṭhena vijjā. Kiṃ viditaṃ
analyzed: paṭhamā vijjā ati paṭhamam uppannā ati paṭhamā vidita karaṇa ṭṭhena vijjā kim viditam
translated: The first knowledge: it is the first in arising, thus it is the first. It is knowledge in the sense of making known. What does it make known?

original: karoti? Pubbenivāsaṃ. Avijjāti tasseva pubbenivāsassa aviditakaraṇaṭṭhena tappaṭicchādako🔽moho vuccati. Tamoti sveva moho paṭicchādakaṭṭhena tamoti vuccati. Ālokoti sāyeva
analyzed: karoti pubbenivāsam avijjāti tassa iva pubbenivāsassa a vidita karaṇa ṭṭhena tad paṭicchādakaḥ  moho vuccati tamo ti su eva moho paṭicchādaka ṭṭhena tamo ti vuccati āloko ti sāyā iva
translated: Past lives. Ignorance: it is the delusion that conceals the past lives, in the sense of not making them known.

original: vijjā obhāsakaraṇaṭṭhena ālokoti vuccati. Ettha ca vijjā adhigatāti ayaṃ attho. Sesaṃ🔽pasaṃsāvacanaṃ. Yojanā panettha ayamassa vijjā adhigatā, athassa adhigatavijjassa
analyzed: vijjā obhāsa karaṇa ṭṭhena āloko ti vuccati ettha ca vijjā adhigatā ti ayam attho sesam  pasaṃsā vacanam yojanā pana ittha ayam assa vijjā adhigatā athassa adhigata vijjassa
translated: Darkness: that same delusion is called darkness in the sense of concealing. Light: that same knowledge is called light in the sense of illuminating. And here the meaning is: “The knowledge has been attained by me.” The rest is a statement of praise.

original: avijjā vihatā vinaṭṭhāti attho. Kasmā? Yasmā vijjā uppannā. Itarasmimpi padadvaye
analyzed: avijjā vihatā vinaṭṭhā ati attho kasmā yasmā vijjā uppannā itarasmim pi pada dvaye
translated: The construction here is this: “The knowledge has been attained by him, then ignorance has been dispelled by him who has attained the knowledge.” What is the reason? “Because the knowledge has arisen.” The same method applies in the other two cases as well.🔽As to the simile here, as to means by way of. Tanti is merely a particle.

original: eseva nayo. Yathā tanti ettha yathāti opammaṃ, tanti nipātamattaṃ. Satiyā avippavāsena
analyzed: esa iva nayaḥ yathā tanti ettha yathā ati opammam tanti nipāta mattam satiyā a vippavāsena
translated: Of one who is not negligent through non-abandonment of mindfulness,🔽of one who is ardent through the ardour of energy,

original: appamattassa. Vīriyātāpena ātāpino. Kāye ca jīvite ca anapekkhatāya pahitattassa.
analyzed: appamattassa vīriya ātāpena ātāpino kāye ca jīvite ca an apekkha tāya pahitattassa
translated: of one who is resolute through non-regard for body and life,

original: Pesitattassāti attho. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – yathā appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa🔽viharato avijjā vihaññeyya, vijjā uppajjeyya. Tamo vihaññeyya, āloko uppajjeyya,
analyzed: pesitattassa ati attho idam vuttam hoti yathā appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa  viharataḥ avijjā vihaññeyya vijjā uppajjeyya tamaḥ vihaññeyya ālokaḥ uppajjeyya
translated: The meaning is: he was intent, ardent, and resolute.🔽This is what is meant: just as, when one abides diligent, ardent, and resolute, ignorance is abandoned and knowledge arises, darkness is abandoned and light arises,

original: evameva tassa avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā. Tamo vihato, āloko uppanno. Etassa tena
analyzed: evam eva tassa avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ etassa tena
translated: so too, ignorance was abandoned and knowledge arose, darkness was abandoned and light arose in him.

original: padhānānuyogassa anurūpameva phalaṃ laddhanti.
analyzed: padhāna anuyogassa anurūpam eva phalam laddhanti
translated: He obtained a fruit that was in conformity with his striving and practice.

original: Cutūpapātakathāyaṃ vijjāti dibbacakkhuñāṇavijjā. Avijjāti sattānaṃ cutipaṭisandhippaṭicchādikā avijjā. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.
analyzed: cutūpapāta kathā ayam vijjāti dibba cakkhu ñāṇa vijjā avijjāti sattānam cuti paṭisandhi paṭicchādikā avijjā sesam vutta nayam eva
translated: In the explanation of passing away and reappearance, “knowledge” is the knowledge of the divine eye. “Ignorance” is the ignorance that conceals the passing away and reappearance of beings. The rest is as already stated.

original: Tatiyavijjāya so evaṃ samāhite citteti vipassanāpādakaṃ catutthajjhānacittaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: tatiya vijjāya saḥ evam samāhite citta iti vipassanā pādakam catuttha jjhāna cittam veditabbam
translated: In the third knowledge, the consciousness that is concentrated should be understood as the fourth jhāna consciousness that leads to insight.

original: Āsavānaṃ khayañāṇāyāti arahattamaggañāṇatthāya. Arahattamaggo hi āsavavināsanato
analyzed: āsavānam khaya ñāṇāya ati arahatta magga ñāṇa tthāya arahatta maggaḥ hi āsava vināsanato
translated: For the destruction of the taints: for the knowledge of the path of arahatship. For the path of arahatship is called “the destruction of the taints” because it destroys the taints.

original: āsavānaṃ khayoti vuccati, tatra cetaṃ ñāṇaṃ tattha pariyāpannattāti. Cittaṃ abhininnāmetīti
analyzed: āsavānam khayaḥ ti vuccati tatra ca itam ñāṇam tattha pariyāpanna ttā ati cittam abhininnāmeti iti
translated: And this knowledge is included in that path. He directs his mind to the knowledge of the destruction of the taints:

original: vipassanācittaṃ abhinīharati. So idaṃ dukkhanti evamādīsu ettakaṃ dukkhaṃ, na ito
analyzed: vipassanā cittam abhinīharati saḥ idam dukkhan ti evamādīsu ettakam dukkham na itas
translated: He directs his mind to insight. He understands, penetrates, the four noble truths in their specific nature by the penetration of the taste of their characteristics, thus: “This is the noble truth of suffering,” etc.

original: bhiyyoti sabbampi dukkhasaccaṃ sarasalakkhaṇappaṭivedhena yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti paṭivijjhati,🔽tassa ca dukkhassa nibbattikaṃ taṇhaṃ “ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo”ti, tadubhayampi yaṃ ṭhānaṃ🔽patvā nirujjhati, taṃ tesaṃ apavattiṃ nibbānaṃ “ayaṃ dukkhanirodho”ti. Tassa ca sampāpakaṃ
analyzed: bhiyyas ti sabbam pi dukkha saccam sa rasa lakkhaṇa ppaṭivedhena yathābhūtam pajānāti paṭivijjhati  tassa ca dukkhassa nibbattikam taṇham ayam dukkha samudayaḥ ti tat ubhayam pi yam ṭhānam  patvā nirujjhati tam tesam apavattim nibbānam ayam dukkha nirodho ti tassa ca sampāpakam
translated: He understands, penetrates, the truth of suffering in its entirety, not as though there were a truth of suffering beyond the following:🔽“This is the origin of suffering,” he understands, penetrates, craving which generates that suffering.🔽“This is the cessation of suffering,” he understands, penetrates, the cessation of both of those, which occurs by their non-occurrence.

original: ariyamaggaṃ “ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā”ti sarasalakkhaṇappaṭivedhena yathābhūtaṃ
analyzed: ariya maggam ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati sa rasa lakkhaṇa paṭivedhena yathābhūtam
translated: “This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering,” he understands, penetrates, the noble path which causes that cessation, by the penetration of the taste of their characteristics.

original: pajānāti paṭivijjhatīti evamattho veditabbo.
analyzed: pajānāti paṭivijjhati iti evam atthaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: This is how the meaning should be understood here.

original: Evaṃ sarūpato saccāni dassetvā idāni kilesavasena pariyāyato dassento ime āsavātiādimāha.
analyzed: evam sarūpataḥ saccāni dassetvā idāni kilesa vasena pariyāyataḥ dassentaḥ ime āsavā ti ādim āha
translated: Having thus shown the truths in their specific nature, he now said “These taints” in order to show them by way of the defilements.

original: Tassa evaṃ jānato evaṃ passatoti tassa bhikkhuno evaṃ jānantassa evaṃ passantassa.
analyzed: tassa evam jānataḥ evam passato ti tassa bhikkhuno evam jānantassa evam passantassa
translated: To him who knows thus, who sees thus: to the bhikkhu who knows thus, who sees thus.

original: Saha vipassanāya koṭippattaṃ maggaṃ kathesi. Kāmāsavāti kāmāsavato. Vimuccatīti iminā
analyzed: saha vipassanāya koṭippattam maggam kathesi kāma āsavā ati kāma āsavataḥ vimuccati iti iminā
translated: and he spoke of the path that had reached its culmination together with insight. “He is freed from the taint of sensual desire”: from the taint of sensual desire. “He is freed”:

original: maggakkhaṇaṃ dasseti. Maggakkhaṇe hi cittaṃ vimuccati, phalakkhaṇe vimuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: magga kkhaṇam dasseti magga kkhaṇe hi cittam vimuccati phala kkhaṇe vimuttam hoti
translated: this shows the moment of the path, for it is at the moment of the path that consciousness is freed, and at the moment of fruition that it is “freed” .

original: Vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇanti iminā paccavekkhaṇañāṇaṃ dasseti. Khīṇā jātītiādīhi🔽tassa bhūmiṃ. Tena hi ñāṇena so paccavekkhanto khīṇā jātītiādīni pajānāti. Katamā
analyzed: vimuttasmin vimuttam iti ñāṇam ti iminā paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇam dasseti khīṇā jātī itiādīhi  tassa bhūmim tena hi ñāṇena saḥ paccavekkhantaḥ khīṇā jātī iti ādīni pajānāti katamā
translated: “In him is the knowledge that he is freed”: this shows the knowledge of reviewing. “Destroyed is birth”: etc.🔽shows the plane of that knowledge. For it is by means of that knowledge that he understands that birth is destroyed, etc. But which is his birth that is destroyed, and how does he understand that it is destroyed?

original: panassa jāti khīṇā, kathañca naṃ pajānātīti? Na tāvassa atītā jāti khīṇā pubbeva🔽khīṇattā, na anāgatā, anāgate vāyāmābhāvato, na paccuppannā, vijjamānattā. Yā pana🔽maggassa abhāvitattā uppajjeyya ekacatupañcavokārabhavesu ekacatupañcakkhandhappabhedā
analyzed: panassa jāti khīṇā katham ca nam pajānāti iti na tāva assa atītā jāti khīṇā pubbā eva  khīṇa ttā na anāgatā anāgate vāyāma abhāvato na paccuppannā vijjamāna ttā yā pana  maggassa a bhāvita ttā uppajjeyya eka catu pañca vokāra bhavesu eka catu pañca khandha ppabhedā
translated: His past birth is not destroyed, for it was destroyed already

original: jāti, sā maggassa bhāvitattā anuppādadhammataṃ āpajjanena khīṇā. Taṃ so maggabhāvanāya
analyzed: jāti sā maggassa bhāvita ttā anuppāda dhamma tam āpajjanena khīṇā tam saḥ magga bhāvanāya
translated: by the past path; his future birth is not destroyed, for he has not yet reached the future path; and his present birth is not destroyed, for it has not yet ceased. But that birth which would arise in the future in the five-constituent existence as a result of the non-development of the path, and which would be classified as one or another of the five aggregates according to the case—that birth is destroyed in the sense of being debarred from arising by the path that has been developed. He understands that it is destroyed in the sense of being debarred from arising in the future.

original: pahīnakilese paccavekkhitvā kilesābhāve vijjamānampi kammaṃ āyatiappaṭisandhikaṃ
analyzed: pahīna kilese paccavekkhitvā kilesa abhāve vijjamānam api kammam āyati appaṭisandhikam
translated: Knowing that the defilements are abandoned, he understands that even though kamma still exists, it does not lead to future rebirth.

original: hotīti jānanto pajānāti.🔽Vusitanti vutthaṃ parivutthaṃ, kataṃ caritaṃ niṭṭhitanti attho. Brahmacariyanti maggabrahmacariyaṃ.
analyzed: hoti iti jānantaḥ pajānāti  vusitanti vuttham parivuttham katam caritam niṭṭhitanti atthaḥ brahmacariyanti magga brahmacariyam
translated: Thus he understands.🔽“The spiritual life has been lived”: the spiritual life has been lived out, lived through, lived to its culmination, lived to its consummation.

original: Puthujjanakalyāṇakena hi saddhiṃ satta sekkhā brahmacariyavāsaṃ vasanti nāma, khīṇāsavo
analyzed: puthujjana kalyāṇakena hi saddhim satta sekkhāḥ brahmacariya vāsam vasanti nāma khīṇa asavaḥ
translated: The spiritual life is the life of the path. Seven kinds of disciples live the spiritual life: the seven kinds of noble persons. The disciple in higher training lives the spiritual life; the one beyond training has lived the spiritual life.

original: vutthavāso. Tasmā so attano brahmacariyavāsaṃ paccavekkhanto “vusitaṃ brahmacariya”nti
analyzed: vuttha vāso tasmā so attanaḥ brahmacariya vāsam paccavekkhantaḥ vusitam brahmacariyanti
translated: The latter, reviewing his own spiritual life, understands: “The spiritual life has been lived.”

original: pajānāti. Kataṃ karaṇīyanti catūsu saccesu catūhi maggehi pariññāpahānasacchikiriyābhāvanābhisamayavasena
analyzed: pajānāti katam karaṇīyanti catūsu saccesu catūhi maggehi pariññā apahāna sacchikiriyā bhāvanā abhisamaya vasena
translated: “What had to be done has been done”: the work has been done, the task has been accomplished, the burden has been put down, the true goal has been reached, the fetters of becoming have been destroyed.

original: soḷasavidhampi kiccaṃ niṭṭhāpitanti attho. Puthujjanakalyāṇakādayo hi taṃ kiccaṃ
analyzed: soḷasavidham pi kiccam niṭṭhāpitanti attho puthujjana kalyāṇaka ādayaḥ hi tam kiccam
translated: The work has been done by the seven kinds of disciples, but the one beyond training has done the work.

original: karonti, khīṇāsavo katakaraṇīyo. Tasmā so attano karaṇīyaṃ paccavekkhanto “kataṃ
analyzed: karonti khīṇa asavaḥ kata karaṇīyo tasmā saḥ attanaḥ karaṇīyam paccavekkhanto katam
translated: The latter, reviewing his own work, understands: “What had to be done has been done.”

original: karaṇīya”nti pajānāti. Nāparaṃ itthattāyāti puna itthabhāvāya, evaṃ soḷasavidhakiccabhāvāya🔽kilesakkhayāya vā maggabhāvanākiccaṃ me natthīti pajānāti. Atha vā itthattāyāti itthabhāvato,
analyzed: karaṇīyanti pajānāti na aparam itthattāya ati punar ittha bhāvāya evam soḷasavidha kicca bhāvāya  kilesa kkhayāya vā magga bhāvanā kiccam me natthi iti pajānāti atha vā itthattāya ati ittha bhāvato
translated: He understands: “There is no more of this for me.”🔽Or alternatively, “There is no more of this for me” means “There is no more of this state,”🔽no more of this present continuity of aggregates.🔽He understands: “There is no more of this for me.”🔽Or alternatively, “There is no more of this for me” means “There is no more of this kind.”

original: imasmā evaṃ pakārā idāni vattamānakkhandhasantānā aparaṃ khandhasantānaṃ mayhaṃ natthi,
analyzed: imasmai evam pakārā idāni vattamāna khandha santānāḥ aparam khandha santānam mayham na atthi
translated: He understands: “There is no more of this kind of continuity of aggregates for me.”

original: ime pana pañcakkhandhā pariññātā tiṭṭhanti chinnamūlakā rukkhā viya. Te carimakaviññāṇanirodhena
analyzed: ime pana pañca khandhā pariññātā tiṭṭhanti chinna mūlakāḥ rukkhāḥ viya te carimaka viññāṇa nirodhena
translated: For these five aggregates that have been fully understood remain like a felled tree, like an exhausted speech, like a spent seed, like a broken pot, like a dead corpse.🔽With the cessation of the last consciousness they will be extinguished without remainder.

original: anupādāno viya jātavedo nibbāyissantīti pajānāti. Idha vijjāti arahattamaggañāṇavijjā.
analyzed: anupādānaḥ viya jātavedaḥ nibbāyissanti iti pajānāti idha vijjāti arahatta magga ñāṇa vijjā
translated: Herein, the knowledge of the Arahant is called “true knowledge.”🔽Ignorance is the non-penetration of the Four Noble Truths.

original: Avijjāti catusaccappaṭicchādikā avijjā. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.🔽Anuccāvacasīlassāti yassa sīlaṃ kālena hāyati, kālena vaḍḍhati, so uccāvacasīlo nāma
analyzed: avijjā ati catu sacca paṭicchādikā avijjā sesam vutta nayam eva  an uccāvaca sīlassa ati yassa sīlam kālena hāyati kālena vaḍḍhati saḥ uccāvaca sīlaḥ nāma
translated: The rest is as above.🔽“Of fluctuating virtue”: his virtue sometimes declines and sometimes improves.

original: hoti. Khīṇāsavassa pana sīlaṃ ekantavaḍḍhitameva. Tasmā so anuccāvacasīlo nāma hoti.
analyzed: hoti khīṇāsavassa pana sīlam ekanta vaḍḍhitam eva tasmā so anuccāvaca sīlaḥ nāma hoti
translated: But the virtue of one who is free from lust for sensual pleasures is never impaired. Therefore he is called “of unfluctuating virtue.”

original: Vasībhūtanti vasippattaṃ. Susamāhitanti suṭṭhu samāhitaṃ, ārammaṇamhi suṭṭhapitaṃ.🔽Dhīranti dhitisampannaṃ. Maccuhāyinanti maccuṃ jahitvā ṭhitaṃ. Sabbappahāyinanti
analyzed: vasībhūtanti vasi ppattam su samāhitanti suṭṭhu samāhitam ārammaṇamhi su ṭṭhapitam  dhīram ti dhiti sampannam maccu hāyinam ti maccum jahitvā ṭhitam sabba ppahāyinam ti
translated: “Possessed of mastery”: attained to mastery. “Well-concentrated”: well-concentrated, well-composed, on the object.🔽“Endowed with wisdom”: endowed with steadfastness. “The foe- destroyer”: standing after having abandoned the foe. “The all-abandoner”: standing after having abandoned all evil states.

original: sabbe pāpadhamme pajahitvā ṭhitaṃ. Buddhanti catusaccabuddhaṃ. Antimadehinanti sabbapacchimasarīradhārinaṃ.🔽Taṃ namassanti gotamanti taṃ gotamagottaṃ buddhasāvakā namassanti. Atha vā gotamabuddhassa
analyzed: sabbe pāpa dhamme pajahitvā ṭhitam buddham ti catu sacca buddham antima dehinam ti sabba pacchima sarīra dhārinam  tam namassanti gotamanti tam gotama gottam buddha sāvakāḥ namassanti atha vā gotama buddhassa
translated: “The Enlightened”: the Enlightened One who has realized the Four Noble Truths. “The one who has laid aside the rod”: the one who has laid aside the rod of violence against all living beings.

original: sāvakopi gotamo, taṃ gotamaṃ devamanussā namassantīti attho.🔽Pubbenivāsanti pubbenivutthakkhandhaparamparaṃ. Yovetīti yo aveti avagacchati. Yovedītipi
analyzed: sāvakaḥ api gotamaḥ tam gotamam deva manussāḥ namassanti iti attho  pubbenivāsanti pubbenivuttha khandha paramparam yaḥ veti iti yaḥ aveti avagacchati yaḥ vedi iti pi
translated: “The Gotama”: the disciples of the Buddha of the Gotama clan pay homage to him. Or else, the meaning is that even the disciples of the Gotama Buddha are called “Gotamas,” and gods and men pay homage to that Gotama.

original: pāṭho. Yo avedi, viditaṃ pākaṭaṃ katvā ṭhitoti attho. Saggāpāyañca passatīti cha
analyzed: pāṭhaḥ yaḥ avedi viditam pākaṭam katvā ṭhitaḥ iti attho sagga apāyam ca passati iti cha
translated: “The one who remembers his manifold past abodes”: the one who remembers the succession of aggregates that have been previously lived through. “The one who knows”: the one who penetrates, who understands. The reading “yo avedi” is also found. The meaning is: the one who stands after having made known, after having made evident. “The one who sees heaven and the state beyond”:

original: kāmāvacare nava brahmaloke cattāro ca apāye passati. Jātikkhayaṃ pattoti arahattaṃ
analyzed: kāmāvacare nava brahmaloke cattāro ca apāye passati jāti khayam patto ti arahattam
translated: he sees the six sense-sphere heavens, the nine Brahma-worlds, and the four states beyond . “The one who has attained the destruction of birth”: the one who has attained arahatship.

original: patto. Abhiññāvositoti jānitvā kiccavosānena vosito. Munīti moneyyena samannāgato🔽khīṇāsavamuni. Etāhīti heṭṭhā niddiṭṭhāhi pubbenivāsañāṇādīhi. Nāññaṃ lapitalāpananti
analyzed: pattaḥ abhiññā vosito ti jānitvā kicca vosānena vositaḥ munī iti moneyyena samannāgato  khīṇāsava muni etāhi iti heṭṭhā niddiṭṭhāhi pubbenivāsa ñāṇa ādīhi na aññam lapita lāpanam ti
translated: “He has attained” : he has attained by the attainment of his task. “Sage” : he is endowed with the state of a sage. “With these” : with the knowledge of his past lives, etc., as described above. “No other prattle” :

original: yo panañño tevijjoti aññehi lapitavacanamattameva lapati, tamahaṃ tevijjoti na vadāmi,
analyzed: yaḥ pana aññaḥ tevijjaḥ ti aññehi lapita vacana mattam eva lapati tam aham tevijjaḥ ti na vadāmi
translated: Abhiññāvosito: he has reached the end of his task by knowing the three kinds of clear knowledge. Muni: he is a sage who has attained the state of a sage. Etāhi: by those mentioned above, namely, the knowledge of recollecting past lives, etc. Nāññaṃ lapitalāpananti: I do not call one a triple-knowledge possessor who merely talks and prattles about the three knowledges.

original: attapaccakkhato ñatvā parassapi tisso vijjā kathentamevāhaṃ tevijjoti vadāmīti attho.
analyzed: atta paccakkhataḥ ñatvā parassa api tissaḥ vijjā kathentam eva aham tevijjaḥ iti vadāmi iti attho
translated: The meaning is: I call one a triple-knowledge possessor who, having known by his own superknowledge, teaches the three knowledges to others.

original: Kalanti koṭṭhāsaṃ. Nāgghatīti na pāpuṇāti. Idāni brāhmaṇo bhagavato kathāya pasanno
analyzed: kalanti koṭṭhāsam na agghati iti na pāpuṇāti idāni brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavataḥ kathāya pasannaḥ
translated: Kalanti koṭṭhāsaṃ: he does not reach the goal. Now, the brahmin, pleased with the Blessed One’s talk,

original: pasannākāraṃ karonto abhikkantantiādimāha.🔽9. Jāṇussoṇisuttavaṇṇanā🔽60. Navame yassassūti yassa bhaveyyuṃ. Yaññotiādīsu yajitabboti yañño, deyyadhammassetaṃ
analyzed: pasanna ākāram karontaḥ abhikkanta nti ādim āha          navame yassa bhaveyyum yañño ti ādīsu yajitabbo ti
translated: showing his pleasure, said, “Abhikkantā no gati,” etc.🔽The commentary on the Jāṇussoṇi sutta is finished.

original: nāmaṃ. Saddhanti matakabhattaṃ. Thālipākoti varapurisānaṃ dātabbayuttaṃ bhattaṃ.
analyzed: nāmam mataka bhattam thālipākaḥ ti vara purisānam dātabba yuttam bhattam
translated: In the ninth sutta, yassassū means which would be. In the words yañño, etc., yajitabbo is yañño, this is a name for an offering. Saddha means a funeral meal. Thālipāka means a meal suitable to be given to good men.

original: Deyyadhammanti vuttāvasesaṃ yaṃkiñci deyyadhammaṃ nāma. Tevijjesu brāhmaṇesu dānaṃ
analyzed: deyya dhamman ti vutta avasesam yaṃkiñci deyya dhammam nāma tevijjesu brāhmaṇesu dānam
translated: Any kind of gift is called a gift to be given.

original: dadeyyāti sabbametaṃ dānaṃ tevijjesu dadeyya, tevijjā brāhmaṇāva paṭiggahetuṃ yuttāti
analyzed: dadeyya ati sabbam etam dānam tevijjesu dadeyya tevijjā brāhmaṇā ava paṭiggahetum yuttā ati
translated: He should give the gift to brahmins learned in the Three Vedas: he should give all this gift to brahmins learned in the Three Vedas, showing that only brahmins learned in the Three Vedas are fit to receive it.

original: dasseti. Sesamettha heṭṭhā vuttanayamevāti.
analyzed: dasseti sesam ettha heṭṭhā vutta nayam eva ati
translated: The rest is as stated in the previous case.

original: 10. Saṅgāravasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: saṅgārava sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the tenth sutta is finished.

original: 61. Dasame saṅgāravoti evaṃnāmako rājagahanagare jiṇṇapaṭisaṅkharaṇakārako āyuttakabrāhmaṇo.
analyzed: dasame saṅgāravaḥ ti evaṃnāmakaḥ rājagaha nagare jiṇṇa paṭisaṅkharaṇa kārako āyuttaka brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: In the tenth sutta, Saṅgārava was a brahmin adviser to the king of Rājagaha, who was responsible for repairing old buildings in the city.

original: Upasaṅkamīti bhuttapātarāso hutvā mahājanaparivuto upasaṅkami. Mayamassūti ettha
analyzed: upasaṅkami iti bhutta pāta rāsaḥ hutvā mahā jana parivutaḥ upasaṅkami ettha
translated: He approached: after his breakfast he approached surrounded by a large crowd. We, Master Gotama: here

original: assūti nipātamattaṃ, mayaṃ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā nāmāti idameva atthapadaṃ. Yaññaṃ🔽yajāmāti bāhirasamaye sabbacatukkena sabbaṭṭhakena sabbasoḷasakena sabbadvattiṃsāya
analyzed: assu iti nipāta mattam mayam bho gotama brāhmaṇāḥ nāma ati idam eva attha padam  yajāma ati bāhira samaye sabba catukkena sabba ṭṭhakena sabba soḷasakena sabba dvattiṃsāya
translated: the word “we” is merely a particle; the meaning is that “we brahmins, Master Gotama.”🔽We would perform a sacrifice: at the time of the outsiders, a sacrifice was performed with all the four means, all the eight means, all the sixteen means, all the thirty-two means,

original: sabbacatusaṭṭhiyā sabbasatena sabbapañcasatenāti ca evaṃ pāṇaghātapaṭisaṃyutto yañño
analyzed: sabba catusaṭṭhiyā sabba satena sabba pañca satena ati ca evam pāṇa ghāta paṭisaṃyuttaḥ yañño
translated: all the sixty-four means, all the hundred means, and all the thousand means. A sacrifice was performed in such a way that it was connected with the killing of living beings.

original: nāma hoti. Taṃ sandhāyevamāha. Anekasārīrikanti anekasarīrasambhavaṃ. Yadidanti yā🔽esā. Yaññādhikaraṇanti yajanakāraṇā ceva yājanakāraṇā cāti attho. Ekasmiñhi bahūnaṃ🔽dadantepi dāpentepi bahūsupi bahūnaṃ dentesupi dāpentesupi puññapaṭipadā anekasārīrikā🔽nāma hoti. Taṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ. Tuyhañca tuyhañca yajāmīti vadantassāpi tvañca
analyzed: nāma ha iti tam sandhāya ivam āha aneka sārīrikam iti aneka sarīra sambhavam yat idam iti yā  esā yaññā adhikaraṇanti yajana kāraṇā ca iva yājana kāraṇā ca ati ekasmin hi bahūnam  dadante api dāpente api bahūsu pi bahūnam dente supi dāpente supi puñña paṭipadā aneka sārīrikā  nāma hoti tam sandhāya itam vuttam tuyham ca tuyham ca yajāmi iti vadantaḥ sa api tvam ca
translated: “Many-bodied” means that it has many bodies. “This” refers to the following.🔽“Sacrifice” means the reason for sacrificing and the reason for causing others to sacrifice. For when many people give or cause to give to many,

original: tvañca yajāhīti āṇāpentassāpi ca anekasārīrikāva hoti. Tampi sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ.🔽Yassa vā tassa vāti yasmā vā tasmā vā. Ekamattānaṃ dametīti attano indriyadamanavasena🔽ekaṃ attānameva dameti. Ekamattānaṃ sametīti attano rāgādisamanavasena ekaṃ attānameva
analyzed: tvam ca yajāhi iti āṇāpentassa api ca aneka sārīrikā va hoti tam pi sandhāya itam vuttam  yassa vā tassa vā ati yasmai vā tasmai vā ekam attānam dameti iti indriya damana vasena  ekam attānam eva dameti ekam attānam sameti iti attanaḥ rāga ādi samana vasena ekam attānam eva
translated: the practice of merit is called “many-bodied.” This is what is meant. Even when one says, “I sacrifice for you and for you,” or even when one orders, “You and you sacrifice,”🔽it is still many-bodied. This is what is meant.🔽“For one or another” means “for the sake of one or another.” “One who controls himself” means one who controls himself by controlling his own faculties.

original: sameti. Parinibbāpetīti rāgādiparinibbāneneva parinibbāpeti. Evamassāyanti evaṃ santepi ayaṃ.
analyzed: sameti parinibbāpeti iti rāga ādi parinibbānena iva parinibbāpeti evam assa ayanti evam sante pi ayam
translated: “One who is self-controlled” means one who is self-controlled by being free from lust, etc. “One who attains Nibbāna” means one who attains Nibbāna by the Nibbāna of lust, etc. “Even though it is so” means even though it is like this.

original: Evamidaṃ brāhmaṇassa kathaṃ sutvā satthā cintesi – “ayaṃ brāhmaṇo pasughātakasaṃyuttaṃ
analyzed: evam idam brāhmaṇassa katham sutvā satthā cintesi ayam brāhmaṇaḥ pasu ghātaka saṃyuttam
translated: Having heard this discourse of the brāhmaṇa, the Teacher thought to himself, “This brāhmaṇa speaks of the sacrifice of many creatures, which is connected with the sacrifice of a Pasu,

original: mahāyaññaṃ anekasārīrikaṃ puññapaṭipadaṃ vadeti, pabbajjāmūlakaṃ pana puññuppattipaṭipadaṃ🔽ekasārīrikanti vadeti. Nevāyaṃ ekasārīrikaṃ jānāti, na anekasārīrikaṃ, handassa ekasārīrikañca
analyzed: mahāyaññam aneka sārīrikam puñña paṭipadam vadeti pabbajjā mūlakam pana puññuppatti paṭipadam  eka sārīrikanti vadeti na iva ayam eka sārīrikam jānāti na aneka sārīrikam handassa eka sārīrikam ca
translated: and which is a meritorious performance. But he speaks of the performance of the meritorious act of going forth into homelessness, which is connected with the sacrifice of one creature only.🔽He does not know what it is to sacrifice one creature, nor what it is to sacrifice many creatures. Well, I will teach him the performance of the sacrifice of one creature and the performance of the sacrifice of many creatures.”

original: anekasārīrikañca paṭipadaṃ desessāmī”ti upari desanaṃ vaḍḍhento tena hi brāhmaṇātiādimāha.🔽Tattha yathā te khameyyāti yathā tuyhaṃ rucceyya. Idha tathāgato loke uppajjatītiādi🔽visuddhimagge vitthāritameva. Ethāyaṃ maggoti etha tumhe, ahamanusāsāmi, ayaṃ maggo.
analyzed: aneka sārīrikam ca paṭipadam desessāmi iti upari desanam vaḍḍhentaḥ tena hi brāhmaṇa ati ādim āha  tattha yathā te khameyya ati yathā tuyham rucceyya idha tathāgataḥ loke uppajjati itiādi  visuddhi magge vitthāritam eva etha ayam maggo ti etha tumhe aham anusāsāmi ayam maggo
translated: And increasing his teaching, he said, “Therefore, O brāhmaṇa,” etc.🔽Herein, as it may be agreeable to you is as it may be pleasing to you. Herein, when a Tathāgata arises in the world is explained at length in the Path of Purity. This is the way is this is the way.

original: Ayaṃ paṭipadāti tasseva vevacanaṃ. Yathā paṭipannoti yena maggena paṭipanno. Anuttaraṃ
analyzed: ayam paṭipadā ti tassa iva vevacanam yathā paṭipannaḥ ti yena maggena paṭipannaḥ anuttaram
translated: This is the performance is a synonym for the same. He who walks in this way is he who walks by this way.

original: brahmacariyogadhanti arahattamaggasaṅkhātassa brahmacariyassa anuttaraṃ ogadhaṃ uttamapatiṭṭhābhūtaṃ
analyzed: brahmacariya ogadhanti arahatta magga saṅkhātassa brahmacariyassa anuttaram ogadham uttama patiṭṭhā bhūtam
translated: The supreme depth of the holy life: the supreme depth of the holy life is Nibbāna, which is the supreme foundation of the holy life called the path of arahatship.

original: nibbānaṃ. Iccāyanti iti ayaṃ.🔽Appaṭṭhatarāti yattha bahūhi veyyāvaccakarehi vā upakaraṇehi vā attho natthi. Appasamārambhatarāti
