analyzed: āvuṇitvā tam maṇi kalāpa pantim ubhatas gahetvā piṭṭhim ghaṃsenti tam sandhāya vuttam
translated: After it is spun, the thread is taken in the hands and rubbed together on the back. With reference to this, it is said:

original: – “sottiñca paṭiccā”ti. Cuṇṇanti nhānīyacuṇṇaṃ. Tajjaṃ vāyāmanti ubbaṭṭanaghaṃsanadhovanādikaṃ🔽tadanurūpavāyāmaṃ. Dhammuposathanti sahatantikaṃ navalokuttaradhammaṃ ārabbha upavutthattā
analyzed: sottim ca paṭicca ati cuṇṇanti nhānīya cuṇṇam tajjam vāyāmanti ubbaṭṭana ghaṃsana dhovana ādikam  dhamma uposathanti saha ta ntikam nava lokuttara dhammam ārabbha upavuttha ttā
translated: “And by the thought of the True Idea”: by the thought of the True Idea consisting in the nine supramundane states.

original: ayaṃ uposatho “dhammuposatho”ti vutto. Idhāpi pariyodapanāti pade ṭhatvā purimanayeneva yojanā kātabbā.
analyzed: ayam uposathaḥ dhamma uposathaḥ ti vuttaḥ idha api pariyodapanā ati pade ṭhatvā purima nayena iva yojanā kātabbā
translated: This Uposatha is called “the Uposatha of the True Idea” because it is undertaken by means of the thought of the True Idea. Here too the construction should be made in the way already stated with the words “and by the thought of the True Idea.”

original: Saṅghaṃ anussaratīti aṭṭhannaṃ ariyapuggalānaṃ guṇe anussarati. Usmañca paṭiccāti🔽dve tayo vāre gāhāpitaṃ usumaṃ paṭicca. Usañcātipi pāṭho, ayamevattho. Khāranti chārikaṃ.
analyzed: saṅgham anussarati iti aṭṭhannam ariya puggalānam guṇe anussarati paṭicca ati  dve tayaḥ vāre gāhāpitam usumam paṭicca pāṭhaḥ ayam eva atthaḥ
translated: “He recollects the Community”: he recollects the special qualities of the eight kinds of noble persons .🔽“And by the thought of heat”: by the thought of heat that has been taken up two or three times. The reading is also “and by the thought of fire,” which has the same meaning.🔽“Embers”: cinders.

original: Gomayanti gomuttaṃ vā ajalaṇḍikā vā. Pariyodapanāti idhāpi purimanayeneva yojanā🔽kātabbā. Saṅghuposathanti aṭṭhannaṃ ariyapuggalānaṃ guṇe ārabbha upavutthattā ayaṃ
analyzed: idha api purima nayena iva yojanā  kātabbā saṅgha uposathanti aṭṭhannam ariya puggalānam guṇe ārabbha upavuttha ttā ayam
translated: “Cow-dung”: cow-dung or goat’s dung.🔽“And by the thought of sprinkling”: here too the construction should be made in the way already stated.

original: uposatho “saṅghuposatho”ti vutto.
analyzed: uposatho saṅghuposathaḥ ti vutto
translated: This Uposatha is called “the Community Uposatha” because it is undertaken by means of the special qualities of the eight kinds of noble persons.

original: Sīlānīti gahaṭṭho gahaṭṭhasīlāni, pabbajito pabbajitasīlāni. Akhaṇḍānītiādīnaṃ attho
analyzed: sīlāni iti gahaṭṭhaḥ gahaṭṭha sīlāni pabbajitaḥ pabbajita sīlāni akhaṇḍāni iti ādīnam atthaḥ
translated: “Virtuousness” : the virtuousness of the house-life is the virtuousness of the house-holder, and the virtuousness of the homeless life is the virtuousness of the monk. The meaning of “unbroken” and so on is

original: visuddhimagge vitthāritova. Vālaṇḍupakanti assavālehi vā makacivālādīhi vā kataṃ🔽aṇḍupakaṃ. Tajjaṃ vāyāmanti telena temetvā malassa tintabhāvaṃ ñatvā chārikaṃ pakkhipitvā
analyzed: visuddhi magge vitthāritaḥ uva assa vālehi vā makaci vāla ādīhi vā katam  aṇḍupakam tajjam vā yāmanti telena temetvā malassa tinta bhāvam ñatvā chārikam pakkhipitvā
translated: explained in detail in the Visuddhimagga. “A hair-net” : a net made of horse-hair or of the hair of the makaca deer, etc.

original: vālaṇḍupakena ghaṃsanavāyāmo. Idha pariyodapanāti pade ṭhatvā evaṃ yojanā kātabbā🔽kiliṭṭhasmiñhi ādāse maṇḍitapasādhitopi attabhāvo olokiyamāno na sobhati, parisuddhe
analyzed: vālaṇḍupakena pade evam yojanā kātabbā  kiliṭṭhasmin hi ādāse atta bhāvaḥ olokiyamānaḥ na sobhati parisuddhe
translated: “The effort of rubbing” : after having moistened the dirt with oil, and after having known the state of the dirt’s being soft, the effort of rubbing with a hair-net. Here, the construction of the words “the purification here” should be made in this way:🔽For, when a mirror is dirty, even though the body is adorned and made beautiful, it does not look beautiful when it is looked at;

original: sobhati. Evameva kiliṭṭhena cittena upavuttho uposatho na mahapphalo hoti, parisuddhena🔽pana mahapphalo hotīti. Sīluposathanti attano sīlānussaraṇavasena upavuttho uposatho
analyzed: sobhati evam eva kiliṭṭhena cittena upavutthaḥ uposathaḥ na mahapphalaḥ hoti parisuddhena  pana mahapphalaḥ hoti iti sīluposatham ti attanaḥ sīla anussaraṇa vasena upavutthaḥ uposathaḥ
translated: but when it is clean, it looks beautiful. Even so, the Uposatha undertaken with a defiled mind does not become very fruitful;🔽but when it is undertaken with a pure mind, it becomes very fruitful. “The Uposatha of virtuousness” : the Uposatha undertaken by way of the recollection of one’s own virtuousness is called the Uposatha of virtuousness.

original: sīluposatho nāma. Sīlena saddhinti attano pañcasīladasasīlena saddhiṃ. Sīlañcassa
analyzed: sīluposathaḥ nāma sīlena saddhinti attano pañca sīla dasa sīlena saddhim
translated: “Together with virtuousness” : together with one’s own five precepts or ten precepts.

original: ārabbhāti pañcasīlaṃ dasasīlañca ārabbha.
analyzed: ārabbha ati pañca sīlam dasa sīlam ca ārabbha
translated: “On the Uposatha day” means on the fourteenth, fifteenth, or eighth of the fortnight.

original: Devatā anussaratīti devatā sakkhiṭṭhāne ṭhapetvā attano saddhādiguṇe anussarati.
analyzed: devatāḥ anussarati iti devatā sakkhiṭṭhāne ṭhapetvā attano saddhā ādi guṇe anussarati
translated: “He recollects deities” means he recollects his own special qualities of faith, etc., placing deities in the position of witnesses.

original: Ukkanti uddhanaṃ. Loṇanti loṇamattikā. Gerukanti gerukacuṇṇaṃ. Nāḷikasaṇḍāsanti dhamananāḷikañceva
analyzed: ukkanti uddhanam loṇanti loṇa mattikā gerukanti geruka cuṇṇam nāḷika saṇḍāsanti dhamana nāḷikam ca iva
translated: “A bellows” is a blower. “Salt” is salt-earth. “A sponge” is a piece of sponge. “A tube” is a tube for sucking up water.

original: parivattanasaṇḍāsañca. Tajjaṃ vāyāmanti uddhane pakkhipanadhamanaparivattanādikaṃ
analyzed: parivattana saṇḍāsam ca tajjam uddhane pakkhipana dhamana parivattana ādikam
translated: “The appropriate effort” is the effort to blow, suck, and so on.

original: anurūpaṃ vāyāmaṃ. Idha pariyodapanāti pade ṭhatvā evaṃ yojanā veditabbā – saṃkiliṭṭhasuvaṇṇamayena🔽hi pasādhanabhaṇḍena pasādhitā nakkhattaṃ kīḷamānā na sobhanti, parisuddhasuvaṇṇamayena
analyzed: anurūpam pariyodapanāti pade evam yojanā veditabbā saṃkiliṭṭha suvaṇṇa mayena  hi pasādhana bhaṇḍena pasādhitāḥ nakkhattam kīḷamānāḥ na sobhanti parisuddha suvaṇṇa mayena
translated: Here the construction should be understood in this way: “Just as a piece of gold, though flawless, does not shine until it is cleaned with fire by an expert goldsmith, and only then does it shine;

original: sobhanti. Evameva saṃkiliṭṭhacittassa uposatho na mahapphalo hoti, parisuddhacittassa
analyzed: sobhanti evam eva saṃkiliṭṭha cittassa uposathaḥ na mahapphalaḥ hoti parisuddha cittassa
translated: so too, the Uposatha undertaken with the imperfections of body, speech, and mind unpurified does not shine, but only when it is undertaken with those imperfections purified.”

original: mahapphalo. Devatuposathanti devatā sakkhiṭṭhāne ṭhapetvā attano guṇe anussarantena
analyzed: mahapphalaḥ devatuposathanti devatā sakkhiṭṭhāne ṭhapetvā attanaḥ guṇe anussarantena
translated: “The Uposatha of the deities” is the Uposatha undertaken by recollecting one’s own special qualities of faith, etc., placing deities in the position of witnesses.

original: upavutthauposatho devatuposatho nāma. Sesaṃ imesu buddhānussatiādīsu kammaṭṭhānesu
analyzed: upavuttha uposathaḥ devatuposathaḥ nāma sesam imesu buddha anussati ādīsu kammaṭṭhānesu
translated: The observance day is called the “divine observance day.”🔽The rest of what should be said here has been said in the Path of Purification

original: yaṃ vattabbaṃ siyā, taṃ sabbaṃ visuddhimagge vuttameva.🔽Pāṇātipātanti pāṇavadhaṃ. Pahāyāti taṃ pāṇātipātacetanāsaṅkhātaṃ dussīlyaṃ pajahitvā.🔽Paṭiviratāti pahīnakālato paṭṭhāya tato dussīlyato oratā viratāva. Nihitadaṇḍā nihitasatthāti
analyzed: yat vattabbam siyā tat sabbam visuddhi magge vuttam eva  pāṇa atipātam ti pāṇa vadham pahāya ati tam pāṇa atipāta cetanā saṅkhātam dussīlyam pajahitvā  paṭiviratā ati pahīna kālataḥ paṭṭhāya tatas dussīlyataḥ oratā viratā ava nihita daṇḍā nihita satthā ati
translated: in the chapter on the recollection of the Buddha.🔽Killing breathing things: killing breathing beings. Having abandoned: having given up the unvirtuousness called the volition to kill breathing things.🔽Having shunned: from the time of giving up, he is turned away, he has shunned, that unvirtuousness.

original: parūpaghātatthāya daṇḍaṃ vā satthaṃ vā ādāya avattanato nikkhittadaṇḍā ceva nikkhittasatthā
analyzed: para upaghāta tthāya daṇḍam vā sattham vā ādāya avattanataḥ nikkhitta daṇḍā ca iva nikkhitta satthā
translated: Having laid aside the cudgel and the sword: the meaning is that he has laid aside the cudgel and the sword, having given up taking up the cudgel and the sword for the purpose of striking others.🔽And here, apart from the cudgel, all the rest of the requisites should be understood as the sword,

original: cāti attho. Ettha ca ṭhapetvā daṇḍaṃ sabbampi avasesaṃ upakaraṇaṃ sattānaṃ vihiṃsanabhāvato🔽satthanti veditabbaṃ. Yaṃ pana bhikkhū kattaradaṇḍaṃ vā dantakaṭṭhavāsiṃ vā pipphalakaṃ
analyzed: ca ati atthaḥ ettha ca ṭhapetvā daṇḍam sabbam pi avasesam upakaraṇam sattānam vihiṃsana bhāvataḥ  sattham ti veditabbam yam pana bhikkhū kattaradaṇḍam vā dantakaṭṭhavāsim vā pipphalakam
translated: because they have the nature of injuring beings.

original: vā gahetvā vicaranti, na taṃ parūpaghātatthāya. Tasmā nihitadaṇḍā nihitasatthātveva
analyzed: vā vicaranti na tam tasmai nihita daṇḍāḥ
translated: But the cudgel that monks carry, such as a walking stick, a bamboo staff, or a staff of kalama wood, is not for the purpose of striking others. Therefore it is said that they have laid aside the cudgel and the sword.

original: saṅkhaṃ gacchanti. Lajjīti pāpajigucchanalakkhaṇāya lajjāya samannāgatā. Dayāpannāti🔽dayaṃ mettacittataṃ āpannā. Sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampīti sabbe pāṇabhūte hitena anukampakā,
analyzed: saṅkham gacchanti lajjī iti pāpa jigucchana lakkhaṇāya lajjāya samannāgatā dayā āpannā iti  dayam metta citta tam āpannā sabba pāṇabhūta hita anukampī iti sabbe pāṇabhūte hitena anukampakā
translated: they are called ‘virtuous’. ‘Modest’: endowed with modesty, which has the characteristic of disgust with evil. ‘Compassionate’:🔽they have attained compassion, i.e. loving-kindness. ‘They are merciful to all living beings’: they are merciful with what is good for all living beings,

original: tāya eva dayāpannatāya sabbesaṃ pāṇabhūtānaṃ hitacittakāti attho. Ahampajjāti ahampi🔽ajja. Imināpi aṅgenāti imināpi guṇaṅgena. Arahataṃ anukaromīti yathā purato gacchantaṃ
analyzed: tāya eva dayā āpanna tāya sabbesam pāṇa bhūtānam hita cittakā ati attho ahampajjā ati ahampi  ajja iminā api aṅgena ati iminā api guṇaṅgena arahatam anukaromi iti yathā puratas gacchantam
translated: for all breathing beings. The meaning is: they have a mind that is intent on the welfare of all living beings. ‘I too today’: I too🔽by this factor: by this quality. ‘I imitate the arahants’: just as one who goes behind one who goes in front is called ‘imitating’,

original: pacchato gacchanto anugacchati nāma, evaṃ ahampi arahantehi paṭhamaṃ kataṃ imaṃ guṇaṃ
analyzed: pacchatas gacchantaḥ anugacchati nāma evam aham pi arahantehi paṭhamam katam imam guṇam
translated: so I, doing this quality which was done first by the arahants,

original: pacchā karonto tesaṃ arahantānaṃ anukaromi. Uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissatīti
analyzed: pacchā karontaḥ tesam arahantānam anukaromi uposathaḥ ca me upavutthaḥ bhavissati iti
translated: imitate those arahants. ‘And my observance of the Uposatha will be fulfilled’:

original: evaṃ karontena mayā arahatañca anukataṃ bhavissati, uposatho ca upavuttho bhavissati.
analyzed: evam karontena mayā arahatam ca anukatam bhavissati uposathaḥ ca upavutthaḥ bhavissati
translated: by doing this my imitation of the arahants will be fulfilled, and my observance of the Uposatha will be fulfilled.

original: Adinnādānanti adinnassa parapariggahitassa ādānaṃ, theyyaṃ corikanti attho. Dinnameva
analyzed: adinna ādānam ti a dinnassa para pariggahitassa ādānam theyyam corikam ti atthaḥ dinnam eva
translated: ‘Taking what is not given’: taking what is not given, i.e. what is owned by another, is theft, is the meaning. ‘What is given’:

original: ādiyantīti dinnādāyī. Cittenapi dinnameva paṭikaṅkhantīti dinnapāṭikaṅkhī. Thenetīti🔽theno, na thenena athenena. Athenattāyeva sucibhūtena. Attanāti attabhāvena, athenaṃ
analyzed: ādiyanti iti dinna ādāyī cittena api dinnam eva paṭikaṅkhanti iti dinna pāṭikaṅkhī thena iti iti  thenaḥ na thenena athenena athenattāya iva suci bhūtena attanāti atta bhāvena athenam
translated: “Taking what is given” is “one who takes what is given.” “One who expects what is given” is one who expects only what is given by mind. “One who is not a thief” is one who is not a thief by body or by speech. “By body” is by one’s own person. “By speech” is by sending another.

original: sucibhūtaṃ attabhāvaṃ katvā viharantīti vuttaṃ hoti.🔽Abrahmacariyanti aseṭṭhacariyaṃ. Brahmaṃ seṭṭhaṃ ācāraṃ carantīti brahmacārī. Ārācārīti🔽abrahmacariyato dūrācārī. Methunāti rāgapariyuṭṭhānavasena sadisattā methunakāti
analyzed: suci bhūtam atta bhāvam katvā viharanti iti vuttam hoti  a brahmacariyanti a seṭṭha cariyam brahmam seṭṭham ācāram caranti iti brahmacārī ārācārī iti  a brahmacariyataḥ dūra ācārī methunā ati rāga pariyuṭṭhāna vasena sadisa ttā methunakā ati
translated: “Taking what is given” is “one who takes what is given.” “One who expects what is given” is one who expects only what is given, even by the mind. “One who is pure” is “one who is not impure.” “Not with an impure body” is not with an impure body. “With a pure body” is with a pure body. “With his own body” is with his own person. “One who lives” is one who makes his own person pure.

original: laddhavohārehi paṭisevitabbato methunoti saṅkhaṃ gatā asaddhammā. Gāmadhammāti gāmavāsīnaṃ dhammā.🔽Musāvādāti alikavacanā tucchavacanā. Saccaṃ vadantīti saccavādī. Saccena saccaṃ saṃdahanti
analyzed: laddha vohārehi paṭisevitabbataḥ methunaḥ ti saṅkham gatāḥ asat dhammāḥ gāma dhammā ati gāma vāsīnam dhammāḥ  musā vādā ati alika vacanā tuccha vacanā saccam vadanti iti sacca vādī saccena saccam saṃdahanti
translated: “Not the holy life” is not the best life. “One who lives the holy life” is one who lives the best life. “One who lives far from the holy life” is one who lives far from the holy life. “Sexual intercourse” is sexual intercourse by way of the defilement of lust. “Sexual intercourse” is a term for unwholesome states that should be practiced by those who have received the name. “The village life” is the life of those who live in villages.

original: ghaṭṭentīti saccasandhā, na antarantarā musā vadantīti attho. Yo hi puriso kadāci
analyzed: ghaṭṭenti iti sacca sandhāḥ na antarantarā musā vadanti iti atthaḥ yaḥ hi puriso kadāci
translated: “Lying” is false speech, empty speech. “One who speaks the truth” is one who speaks the truth. “One who is bound by truth” is one who is bound by truth, who is bound by truth. The meaning is that he does not speak lies in between. For whoever sometimes

original: musāvādaṃ vadati, kadāci saccaṃ. Tassa musāvādena antaritattā saccaṃ saccena na ghaṭīyati.🔽Tasmā na so saccasandho. Ime pana na tādisā, jīvitahetupi musā avatvā saccena saccaṃ🔽saṃdahantiyevāti saccasandhā. Thetāti thirā, ṭhitakathāti attho. Eko puggalo haliddirāgo
analyzed: musāvādam vadati kadāci saccam tassa musāvādena saccam saccena na ghaṭīyati  tasmā na saḥ sacca sandhaḥ ime pana na tādisāḥ musā avatvā saccena saccam  saṃdahantiyā iva ati sacca sandhā thetā ati thirā ṭhita kathā ti atthaḥ ekaḥ puggalaḥ haliddi rāgaḥ
translated: He speaks falsely sometimes and truthfully sometimes. Because his truth is obscured by his falsehood, his truth does not tally with his truth.🔽Therefore he is not one whose word is his bond. But these are not like that. Even at the cost of their lives they do not speak falsely, but they bind truth with truth.

original: viya thusarāsimhi nikhātakhāṇu viya assapiṭṭhe ṭhapitakumbhaṇḍamiva ca na ṭhitakatho
analyzed: viya thusarāsimhi nikhāta khāṇu viya assa piṭṭhe ṭhapita kumbhaṇḍam iva ca na ṭhita kathaḥ
translated: Therefore they are ones whose word is their bond. Thet means firm, steadfast, is the meaning. One kind of person is not steadfast in speech, like a person with jaundice, like a stake stuck in a heap of chaff, like a water jug placed on a horse’s back.

original: hoti. Eko pāsāṇalekhā viya indakhīlo viya ca ṭhitakatho hoti, asinā sīsaṃ chindantepi
analyzed: hoti ekaḥ pāsāṇa lekhā viya indakhīlaḥ viya ca ṭhita kathaḥ hoti asinā sīsam chindante pi
translated: But another kind of person is steadfast in speech, like a line drawn on a stone slab, like an iron post. Even if his head were cut off with a sword,

original: dve kathā na katheti. Ayaṃ vuccati theto. Paccayikāti pattiyāyitabbakā, saddhāyikāti🔽attho. Ekacco hi puggalo na paccayiko hoti, “idaṃ kena vuttaṃ, asukena nāmā”ti vutte
analyzed: dve kathā na kathā iti ayam vuccati theto paccayikā ati saddhāyikā ati  attho ekaccaḥ hi puggalaḥ na paccayikaḥ hoti idam kena vuttam asukena nāma ati vutte
translated: he would not speak two kinds of speech. This is called thet. Paccayika means one who should be relied on, one who is trustworthy is the meaning.🔽For one kind of person is not trustworthy. When it is said, “So-and-so said this,”

original: “mā tassa vacanaṃ saddahathā”ti vattabbataṃ āpajjati. Eko paccayiko hoti, “idaṃ kena
analyzed: mā tassa vacanam saddahatha ati vattabba tam āpajjati ekaḥ paccayikaḥ hoti idam kena
translated: he is one who should be told, “Do not believe his word.” But another kind of person is trustworthy. When it is said, “So-and-so said this,”

original: vuttaṃ, asukenā”ti vutte “yadi tena vuttaṃ, idameva pamāṇaṃ, idāni paṭikkhipitabbaṃ
analyzed: vuttam asukena ati vutte yadi tena vuttam idam eva pamāṇam idāni paṭikkhipitabbam
translated: “It was said by so-and-so,” then he is obliged to say: “If he said it, that is the measure. Now there is nothing to be rejected.

original: natthi, evamevaṃ ida”nti vattabbataṃ āpajjati. Ayaṃ vuccati paccayiko. Avisaṃvādakā
analyzed: na atthi evam evam idam ti vattabba tam āpajjati ayam vuccati paccayikaḥ a visaṃvādakā
translated: It is just so.” This is called the “dependent.”

original: lokassāti tāya saccavāditāya lokaṃ na visaṃvādentīti attho.
analyzed: lokassa ati tāya sacca vāditāya lokam na visaṃvādenti iti attho
translated: Not deceiving the world: the meaning is that by virtue of his speaking the truth he does not deceive the world.

original: Surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānanti surāmerayamajjānaṃ pānacetanāsaṅkhātaṃ pamādakāraṇaṃ.
analyzed: surā meraya majja pamāda ṭṭhānam ti surā meraya majjānam pāna cetanā saṅkhātam pamāda kāraṇam
translated: The practice of refraining from liquor, wine, and besotting drink: the practice of refraining from liquor, wine, and the various kinds of intoxicants that induce heedlessness, which is called the intention to refrain from liquor, wine, and besotting drinks.

original: Ekabhattikāti pātarāsabhattaṃ sāyamāsabhattanti dve bhattāni. Tesu pātarāsabhattaṃ
analyzed: ekabhattikā ati pātarāsa bhattam sāyamāsa bhattanti dve bhattāni tesu pātarāsa bhattam
translated: The practice of eating in one part of the day: there are two meals, the morning meal and the evening meal. Of these, the morning meal

original: antomajjhanhikena paricchinnaṃ, itaraṃ majjhanhikato uddhaṃ antoaruṇena. Tasmā antomajjhanhike
analyzed: antar majjhanhikena paricchinnam itaram majjhanhikataḥ uddham antoaruṇena tasmai antar majjhanhike
translated: is limited by the middle of the day, and the other is limited by the time before sunrise. Therefore,

original: dasakkhattuṃ bhuñjamānāpi ekabhattikāva honti. Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ – “ekabhattikā”ti.
analyzed: dasa khattum bhuñjamānā api ekabhattikā ava honti tam sandhāya vuttam ekabhattikā iti
translated: even if one eats ten times within the limits, one is still one who eats in one part of the day. With reference to this it is said: “One who eats in one part of the day.”

original: Rattibhojanaṃ ratti, tato uparatāti rattūparatā. Atikkante majjhanhike yāva sūriyatthaṅgamanā
analyzed: ratti bhojanam ratti tatas atikkante majjhanhike yāva sūriyatthaṅgamanā
translated: The night is the time from the moment the middle of the day has passed until sunrise. The practice of refraining from eating at night is the refraining from eating at night.

original: bhojanaṃ vikālabhojanaṃ nāma, tato viratattā viratā vikālabhojanā.
analyzed: bhojanam vikālabhojanam nāma tatas viratattā viratā vikālabhojanā
translated: Eating at the wrong time is called “food”; he is refrained from that, thus he is “refrained from eating at the wrong time.”

original: Sāsanassa ananulomattā visūkaṃ paṭāṇibhūtaṃ dassananti visūkadassanaṃ, attanā naccananaccāpanādivasena
analyzed: sāsanassa an anuloma ttā visūkam paṭāṇi bhūtam visūka dassanam attanā
translated: Because it is not in conformity with the Dispensation, it is “vulgar” and “like a stage” as a spectacle, thus it is “vulgar spectacle.” Dancing is dancing oneself or having others dance,🔽singing is singing oneself or having others sing,

original: naccañca gītañca vāditañca, antamaso mayūranaccanādivasenāpi pavattānaṃ naccādīnaṃ🔽visūkabhūtaṃ dassanañcāti naccagītavāditavisūkadassanaṃ. Naccādīni hi attanā payojetuṃ
analyzed: naccam ca gītam ca vāditam ca antamasaḥ mayūra naccana ādi vasena api  visūka bhūtam dassanam ca ati nacca gīta vādita visūka dassanam nacca ādīni hi attanā payojetum
translated: music is music oneself or having others play, and vulgar spectacle is a spectacle of dancing, etc., that has become vulgar even through the dancing of peacocks, etc.

original: vā parehi payojāpetuṃ vā payuttāni passituṃ vā neva bhikkhūnaṃ, na bhikkhunīnaṃ vaṭṭanti.🔽Mālādīsu mālāti yaṃkiñci pupphaṃ. Gandhanti yaṃkiñci gandhajātaṃ. Vilepananti chavirāgakaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: vā parehi vā payuttāni passitum vā na iva bhikkhūnam na bhikkhunīnam vaṭṭanti  mālā ādīsu mālā ati yaṃ kiñci puppham gandhanti yaṃ kiñci gandha jātam vilepananti chavi rāga karaṇam
translated: The seeing of dancing, etc., that is not allowable for bhikkhus and bhikkhunis either to perform themselves or to have others perform or to witness,🔽In the case of garlands, etc., “garlands” are any flowers. “Perfumes” are any scents. “ unguents” are any cosmetics.

original: Tattha piḷandhanto dhāreti nāma, ūnaṭṭhānaṃ pūrento maṇḍeti nāma, gandhavasena chavirāgavasena
analyzed: tattha piḷandhantaḥ dhārā iti nāma ūna ṭṭhānam pūrentaḥ maṇḍā iti nāma gandha vasena chavi rāga vasena
translated: Herein, one who wears them is said to “use” them, one who replenishes what is deficient is said to “enjoy” them, and one who makes use of them by way of scent and by way of the disappearance of the skin disease is said to “make use of” them.

original: ca sādiyanto vibhūseti nāma. Ṭhānaṃ vuccati kāraṇaṃ, tasmā yāya dussīlyacetanāya🔽tāni mālādhāraṇādīni mahājano karoti, tato paṭiviratāti attho. Uccāsayanaṃ vuccati
analyzed: ca vibhūsā iti nāma ṭhānam vuccati kāraṇam tasmai yāya dussīlya cetanāya  tāni mālā dhāraṇa ādīni mahājanaḥ karoti tatas paṭiviratā ati attho uccāsayanam vuccati
translated: and adorns himself with them, is called “adorned.” “Ground” is said to be the reason. Therefore, the meaning is: “He refrains from those wearing of garlands, etc.,🔽for which reason the worldling has the volition of immorality.” “High couches” is said to be🔽

original: pamāṇātikkantaṃ, mahāsayanaṃ akappiyattharaṇaṃ, tato paṭiviratāti attho.
analyzed: pamāṇa atikkantam mahā sayanam a kappiya ttharaṇam tatas paṭiviratā ati attho
translated: and adorns himself with them, is called “adorned.” “Ground” is said to be the reason. Therefore, the meaning is: “He refrains from those garlands, etc., which the majority of people do who have the intention to be immoral.” “High couches” are said to be those that exceed the prescribed size. “Large couches” are those that are not suitable for lying down on. The meaning is: “He refrains from those.”

original: Kīvamahapphaloti kittakaṃ mahapphalo. Sesapadesupi eseva nayo. Pahūtarattaratanānanti🔽pahūtena rattasaṅkhātena ratanena samannāgatānaṃ, sakalajambudīpatalaṃ bheritalasadisaṃ
analyzed: kīva mahapphalaḥ ti kittakam mahapphalaḥ sesa padesu pi esa iva nayo  pahūtena ratta saṅkhātena ratanena samannāgatānam sakala jambudīpa talam bherī tala sadisam
translated: “How great a fruit?” means: “What is the great fruit?” The same method applies to the remaining terms. “Rich in precious things” means:

original: katvā kaṭippamāṇehi sattahi ratanehi pūritānanti attho. Issariyādhipaccanti issarabhāvena🔽vā issariyameva vā ādhipaccaṃ, na ettha sāhasikakammantipi issariyādhipaccaṃ. Rajjaṃ
analyzed: katvā kaṭi ppamāṇehi sattahi ratanehi pūrita ananti atthaḥ issariya adhipaccam issara bhāvena  vā issariyam eva vā ādhipaccam na ettha issariya ādhipaccam rajjam
translated: endowed with precious things called “jewels,” which are so numerous that they make the surface of the entire Indian subcontinent resemble the surface of a checkerboard. The meaning is: “filled with seven jewels, each of which is the size of a dung-hill.” “Dominion” means:

original: kāreyyāti evarūpaṃ cakkavattirajjaṃ kāreyya. Aṅgānantiādīni tesaṃ janapadānaṃ nāmāni.
analyzed: kāreyya ati evarūpam cakkavatti rajjam kāreyya aṅga ananti ādīni tesam janapadānam nāmāni
translated: either the state of being a lord or lordship itself. “Not by violence” means: “not by violent action.” “He would rule” means: “he would rule such a universal monarchy.” “The regions” and so on are the names of those countries.

original: Kalaṃ nāgghati soḷasinti ekaṃ ahorattaṃ upavutthauposathe puññaṃ soḷasabhāge katvā
analyzed: ekam ahorattam upavuttha uposathe puññam soḷasa bhāge katvā
translated: It does not equal a sixteenth part. Having divided the merit of the Uposatha undertaken for one day and night into sixteen parts,

original: tato ekaṃ bhāgañca na agghati. Ekarattuposathassa soḷasiyā kalāya yaṃ vipākaphalaṃ,🔽taṃyeva tato bahutaraṃ hotīti attho. Kapaṇanti parittakaṃ.
analyzed: tatas ekam bhāgañca na agghati eka rattuposathassa soḷasiyā kalāya yam vipāka phalam  taṃyeva tatas bahutaram hoti iti parittakam
translated: it does not equal one part. The meaning is that the fruit of the result of the Uposatha for one day and night is greater than that. Small is limited.

original: Abrahmacariyāti aseṭṭhacariyato. Rattiṃ na bhuñjeyya vikālabhojananti uposathaṃ upavasanto
analyzed: a brahmacariyā ati a seṭṭha cariyataḥ rattim na bhuñjeyya vikāla bhojanam ti uposatham upavasanto
translated: Un-Brahma conduct is non-excellent conduct. He should not eat at night, nor at the wrong time during the day. One who undertakes the Uposatha

original: rattibhojanañca divāvikālabhojanañca na bhuñjeyya. Mañce chamāyaṃva sayetha santhateti🔽muṭṭhihatthapādake kappiyamañce vā sudhādiparikammakatāya bhūmiyaṃ vā tiṇapaṇṇapalālādīni🔽santharitvā kate santhate vā sayethāti attho. Etaṃ hi aṭṭhaṅgikamāhuposathanti evaṃ
analyzed: ratti bhojanañca divā vikāla bhojanañca na bhuñjeyya mañce  muṭṭhi hattha pādake kappiya mañce vā sudhā ādi parikammaka tāya bhūmiyam vā tiṇa paṇṇa palāla ādīni  santharitvā kate santhate vā sayetha iti attho etam hi aṭṭhaṅgikam āhu uposatham ti evam
translated: should not eat at night nor at the wrong time during the day. He should sleep on a bed or a straw mat on the ground.🔽The meaning is that he should sleep on a suitable bed with hands and feet drawn in, or on a place plastered with lime, etc., or on a straw mat made by spreading grass, leaves, chaff, etc. This is called the Uposatha with eight parts.

original: pāṇātipātādīni asamācarantena upavutthaṃ uposathaṃ aṭṭhahi aṅgehi samannāgatattā
analyzed: pāṇa atipāta ādīni a samācarantena upavuttham uposatham aṭṭhahi aṅgehi samannāgata ttā
translated: Thus, the Uposatha undertaken by one who does not commit killing, etc., is endowed with eight parts and is called the Uposatha with eight parts.

original: aṭṭhaṅgikanti vadanti. Taṃ pana upavasantena “sve uposathiko bhavissāmī”ti ajjeva
analyzed: aṭṭhaṅgikanti vadanti tam pana upavasantena sve uposathikaḥ bhavissāmi iti ajja eva
translated: They say it has eight factors. But one who is going to observe the Uposatha should decide on the previous day:🔽“Tomorrow I shall be observing the Uposatha. I shall get this and this done.” He should then consider what food, etc., he will need. On the Uposatha day itself,

original: “idañca idañca kareyyāthā”ti āhārādividhānaṃ vicāretabbaṃ. Uposathadivase pātova
analyzed: idam ca idam ca kareyyātha iti āhāra ādi vidhānam vicāretabbam uposatha divase
translated: after he has taken his medicine and eaten what is not set apart for any particular occasion, he should,🔽after he has evacuated urine and excrement,

original: bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā dasasīlalakkhaṇaññuno upāsakassa vā upāsikāya vā santike🔽vācaṃ bhinditvā uposathaṅgāni samādātabbāni. Pāḷiṃ ajānantena pana “buddhapaññattaṃ🔽uposathaṃ adhiṭṭhāmī”ti adhiṭṭhātabbaṃ. Aññaṃ alabhantena attanāpi adhiṭṭhātabbaṃ,🔽vacībhedo pana kātabboyeva. Uposathaṃ upavasantena parūparodhapaṭisaṃyuttā kammantā🔽na vicāretabbā, āyavayagaṇanaṃ karontena na vītināmetabbaṃ, gehe pana āhāraṃ labhitvā
analyzed: bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyāḥ vā dasa sīla lakkhaṇa ññunaḥ upāsakassa vā upāsikāya vā santike  vācam bhinditvā uposathaṅgāni samādātabbāni pāḷim a jānantena pana buddha paññattam  uposatham adhiṭṭhāmi iti adhiṭṭhātabbam aññam a labhantena attanā api adhiṭṭhātabbam  vacībhedaḥ pana uposatham upavasantena para uparodha paṭisaṃyuttā kammantā  na vicāretabbā āya vaya gaṇanam karontena na vītināmetabbam gehe pana āhāram labhitvā
translated: and after he has washed himself,

original: niccabhattikabhikkhunā viya paribhuñjitvā vihāraṃ gantvā dhammo vā sotabbo, aṭṭhatiṃsāya
analyzed: niccabhattika bhikkhunā viya paribhuñjitvā vihāram gantvā dhammaḥ vā sotabbo aṭṭhatiṃsāya
translated: he should enter the house and arrange a seat in a place where he will not disturb anyone else. He should then either sit in the seat or on the floor, not on the bed. He should not observe the Uposatha in a place that is not his own, that is, in a monastery, a rest house, etc., that belongs to the Community or to an individual. He should not observe it in a place that is not level, that is, on a slope or an uneven piece of ground. He should not observe it in a place that is not screened, that is, in a place that is not screened by trees, etc., from the unseemly. He should not observe it in a place that is not free from danger, that is, in a place that is not free from the danger of such things as wild beasts, snakes, criminals, and spirits. He should not observe it in a place that is not free from noise, that is, in a place that is not free from the noise of such things as drums, conches, wood-chimes, and bells. He should not observe it in a place that is not free from company, that is, in a place that is not free from the company of such people as bhikkhunīs, etc. He should not observe it in a place that is not favourable, that is, in a place that is not favourable for the attainment of the noble fruitions. He should not observe it in a place that is not conducive to his own spiritual development. He should not observe it in a place that is not his own, that is, in a monastery, a rest house, etc., that belongs to the Community or to an individual. He should not observe it in a place that is not level, that is, on a slope or an uneven piece of ground. He should not observe it in a place that is not screened, that is, in a place that is not screened by trees, etc.,

original: ārammaṇesu aññataraṃ vā manasikātabbaṃ.
analyzed: ārammaṇesu aññataram vā manasikātabbam
translated: Or he should give attention to any one of the objects of concentration.

original: Sudassanāti sundaradassanā. Obhāsayanti obhāsayamānā. Anupariyantīti vicaranti. Yāvatāti🔽yattakaṃ ṭhānaṃ. Antalikkhagāti ākāsaṅgamā. Pabhāsantīti jotanti pabhā muñcanti.
analyzed: su dassanā ati sundara dassanāḥ obhāsayanti obhāsayamānāḥ anupariyanti iti vicaranti yāvatā iti  yattakam ṭhānam ākāsaṅgamā pabhāsanti iti jotanti pabhāḥ muñcanti
translated: “Shining forth”: illuminating. “Shining all around”: pervading. “As far as”: as much as. “The firmament”: the sky. “Shining”: they shine, they emit radiance.

original: Disāvirocanāti sabbadisāsu virocamānā. Atha vā pabhāsantīti disāhi disā obhāsanti.🔽Virocanāti virocamānā. Veḷuriyanti maṇīti vatvāpi iminā jātimaṇibhāvaṃ dasseti. Ekavassikaveḷuvaṇṇañhi🔽veḷuriyaṃ jātimaṇi nāma. Taṃ sandhāyevamāha. Bhaddakanti laddhakaṃ. Siṅgīsuvaṇṇanti
analyzed: disāvirocanā ati sabba disāsu virocamānā atha vā pabhāsanti iti disāhi disā obhāsanti  virocanā ati virocamānā veḷuriyanti maṇī iti vatvā api iminā jāti maṇi bhāvam dasseti eka vassika veḷu vaṇṇam hi  veḷuriyam jātimaṇi nāma tam sandhāya evam āha bhaddakam ti laddhakam siṅgī suvaṇṇam ti
translated: “Shining forth”: they shine forth from the directions. Or alternatively, “shining forth” means they shine forth from the directions.🔽“Shining all around”: shining all around. “Lapis lazuli”: he shows that it is a precious stone by saying “gem.” For lapis lazuli is a precious stone the colour of a one-year-old’s eyes.🔽He says this referring to that. “Excellent”: approved. “Gold from the Jambu River”: gold that has the colour of the Jambu fruit.

original: gosiṅgasadisaṃ hutvā uppannattā evaṃ nāmakaṃ suvaṇṇaṃ. Kañcananti pabbateyyaṃ pabbate
analyzed: gosiṅga sadisam hutvā uppanna ttā evam nāmakam suvaṇṇam kañcananti pabbateyyam pabbate
translated: “Pure gold”: gold from the mountain. “Well-smelted gold”: gold that is well-refined. “Gold leaf”: gold that is beaten out.

original: jātasuvaṇṇaṃ. Jātarūpanti satthuvaṇṇasuvaṇṇaṃ. Haṭakanti kipillikāhi nīhaṭasuvaṇṇaṃ.
analyzed: jāta suvaṇṇam jātarūpanti satthu vaṇṇa suvaṇṇam haṭakanti kipillikāhi nīhaṭa suvaṇṇam
translated: “Gold ornaments”: gold that is made into ornaments. “Gold coins”: gold that is made into coins. “Gold bullion”: gold that is made into bars.

original: Nānubhavantīti na pāpuṇanti. Candappabhāti sāmiatthe paccattaṃ, candappabhāyāti attho.
analyzed: na anubhavanti iti na pāpuṇanti canda ppabhā ati sāmiatthe paccattam canda ppabhāya ati atthaḥ
translated: “Do not experience” : do not obtain. “The moon’s radiance” : the moon’s radiance is the master, the possessor, the owner, the enjoyer, the experiencer, the one who experiences the fruit of the moon’s radiance.

original: Upavassuposathanti upavasitvā uposathaṃ. Sukhudrayānīti sukhaphalāni sukhavedanīyāni.
analyzed: upavassuposathanti upavasitvā uposatham su khudrayāni iti sukha phalāni sukha vedanīyāni
translated: “Upavasatha” : having observed the uposatha. “Pleasant and delightful” : having pleasant fruit, having pleasant experience.

original: Saggamupenti ṭhānanti saggasaṅkhātaṃ ṭhānaṃ upagacchanti, kenaci aninditā hutvā devaloke
analyzed: saggam upenti ṭhānam ti sagga saṅkhātam ṭhānam upagacchanti kenaci aninditāḥ hutvā deva loke
translated: “They go to a heavenly place” : they go to a place called heaven. Without being reproached by anyone, they are reborn in the heavenly world.

original: uppajjantīti attho. Sesamettha yaṃ antarantarā na vuttaṃ, taṃ vuttānusāreneva veditabbanti.
analyzed: uppajjanti iti attho sesam ettha yat antar antarā na vuttam tat vutta anusārena iva veditabbanti
translated: The rest here should be understood by the method stated above.

original: Mahāvaggo dutiyo.
analyzed: mahā vaggo dutiyaḥ
translated: The second sub-chapter on the Great Man is finished.

original: (8) 3. Ānandavaggo
analyzed: ānanda vaggaḥ
translated: The third sub-chapter on Ānanda

original: 1. Channasuttavaṇṇanā🔽72. Tatiyassa paṭhame channoti evaṃnāmako channaparibbājako. Tumhepi, āvusoti, āvuso,
analyzed: channa sutta vaṇṇanā  tatiyassa paṭhame channaḥ ti evaṃnāmako channa paribbājako tumhe api āvuso ti āvuso
translated: The explanation of the Channa sutta

original: yathā mayaṃ rāgādīnaṃ pahānaṃ paññāpema, kiṃ evaṃ tumhepi paññāpethāti pucchati.
analyzed: yathā mayam rāga ādīnam pahānam paññāpema kim evam tumhe pi paññāpetha ati pucchati
translated: In the first of the third sub-chapter, “Channa” is the wanderer of that name. “You too, friends” : friends, just as we proclaim the abandoning of lust, hatred, and delusion, do you too proclaim the same?🔽He asks this.

original: Tato thero “ayaṃ paribbājako amhe rāgādīnaṃ pahānaṃ paññāpemāti vadati, natthi panetaṃ
analyzed: tatas theraḥ ayam paribbājakaḥ amhe rāga ādīnam pahānam paññāpema iti vadati natthi pana etam
translated: Then the elder says: “This wanderer says that we proclaim the abandoning of lust, hatred, and delusion, but there is no such thing.

original: bāhirasamaye”ti taṃ paṭikkhipanto mayaṃ kho, āvusotiādimāha. Tattha khoti avadhāraṇatthe
analyzed: bāhira samaya iti tam paṭikkhipantaḥ mayam kho āvuso tiādim āha tattha kho ti avadhāraṇa atthe
translated: “In the external occasion,” he rejected it. Therein, kho is a particle in the sense of limitation;

original: nipāto, mayameva paññāpemāti attho. Tato paribbājako cintesi “ayaṃ thero bāhirasamayaṃ
analyzed: nipātaḥ mayam eva paññāpema ti attho tatas paribbājakaḥ cintesi ayam theraḥ bāhira samayam
translated: the meaning is: “We alone instruct.” Then the wanderer thought: “This Elder, having taken away the external occasion,

original: luñcitvā haranto ‘mayamevā’ti āha. Kiṃ nu kho ādīnavaṃ disvā ete etesaṃ pahānaṃ paññāpentī”ti.
analyzed: luñcitvā harantaḥ mayam eva ati āha kim nu kho ādīnavam disvā ete etesam pahānam paññāpenti iti
translated: says: ‘We alone.’ What danger does he see that he instructs in the abandoning of these?”

original: Atha theraṃ pucchanto kiṃ pana tumhetiādimāha. Thero tassa byākaronto ratto khotiādimāha.
analyzed: atha theram pucchantaḥ kim pana tumhā iti ādim āha thero tassa byākarontaḥ rattaḥ kho iti ādim āha
translated: Then, asking the Elder, he said: “But why do you, venerable sir?” The Elder, explaining to him, said: “Lust, friend, is a danger, etc.”

original: Tattha attatthanti diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikaṃ lokiyalokuttaraṃ attano atthaṃ. Paratthaubhayatthesupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: tattha attatthanti diṭṭhadhammika samparāyikam lokiya lokuttaram attanaḥ attham parattha aubhayatthesu pi esa eva nayo
translated: Therein, one’s own welfare is one’s own welfare in the present life and in the life to come, mundane and supramundane. The same method applies in the case of the welfare of others and of both.

original: Andhakaraṇotiādīsu yassa rāgo uppajjati, taṃ yathābhūtadassananivāraṇena andhaṃ karotīti
analyzed: andha karaṇa uti ādīsu yassa rāgaḥ uppajjati tam yathābhūta dassana nivāraṇena andham karoti iti
translated: In the passages beginning with “making darkness,” etc., lust, when it arises, makes one blind by preventing the seeing of things as they really are;

original: andhakaraṇo. Paññācakkhuṃ na karotīti acakkhukaraṇo. Ñāṇaṃ na karotīti aññāṇakaraṇo.
analyzed: andha karaṇaḥ paññā cakkhum na karoti iti a cakkhu karaṇaḥ ñāṇam na karoti iti aññāṇa karaṇaḥ
translated: therefore it is “making darkness.” It does not make the eye of wisdom; therefore it is “making no-eye.” It does not make knowledge; therefore it is “making no-knowledge.”

original: Kammassakatapaññā jhānapaññā vipassanāpaññāti imā tisso paññā appavattikaraṇena nirodhetīti
analyzed: kammassakata paññā jhāna paññā vipassanā paññā ti imāḥ tissaḥ paññāḥ appavatti karaṇena nirodheti iti
translated: The three kinds of understanding, namely, understanding as act of understanding, understanding as act of knowing, and understanding as act of seeing, are stopped by the stopping of occurrence.

original: paññānirodhiko. Aniṭṭhaphaladāyakattā dukkhasaṅkhātassa vighātasseva pakkhe vattatīti
analyzed: paññā nirodhikaḥ aniṭṭha phala dāyaka ttā dukkha saṅkhātassa vighātassa iva pakkhe vattati iti

analyzed: ānanda appamādāya ati āvuso ānanda sace evarūpā paṭipadā atthi alam tumhākam appamādāya

analyzed: yuttam anucchavikam appamādam karotha āvuso ti therassa vacanam anumoditvā pakkāmi

analyzed: imasmim sutte ariya maggaḥ lokuttara missakaḥ kathitaḥ sesam ettha uttānattham eva ati

original: 2. Ājīvakasuttavaṇṇanā

translated: . The second sutta

analyzed: nu sa dhamma ukkaṃsanā ati attanaḥ laddhiyā ukkhipitvā ṭhapanā para dhamma apasādanā ati paresam

analyzed: laddhiyāḥ ghaṭṭanā vambhanā avakkhipanā āyatanā iva dhamma desanā ati kāraṇasmiṃyā iva dhamma desanā

analyzed: attho ca vutto ti mayā pucchita pañhāya attho ca pakāsito attā ca anupanītaḥ ti amhe
translated: The meaning has been stated means: the meaning of the question I asked has been made clear.🔽And I have not led myself means: I have not led myself in this way.

analyzed: evarūpā iti evam attā ca na upanītaḥ pāṭhaḥ
translated: The reading is also “not led” .

original: 3. Mahānāmasakkasuttavaṇṇanā🔽74. Tatiye gilānā vuṭṭhitoti gilāno hutvā vuṭṭhito. Gelaññāti gilānabhāvato. Upasaṅkamīti
analyzed: mahānāma sakka sutta vaṇṇanā 🔽tatiye gilānā vuṭṭhitoti gilānaḥ hutvā vuṭṭhitaḥ gelaññā ati gilāna bhāvataḥ upasaṅkamīti
translated: The commentary on the Mahānāmasakkasutta is finished.

original: bhuttapātarāso mālāgandhādīni ādāya mahāparivāraparivuto upasaṅkami. Bāhāyaṃ gahetvāti🔽na bāhāyaṃ gahetvā ākaḍḍhi, nisinnāsanato vuṭṭhāya tassa santikaṃ gantvā dakkhiṇabāhāyaṃ🔽aṅguṭṭhakena saññaṃ datvā ekamantaṃ apanesīti veditabbo. Athassa “sekhampi kho, mahānāma,
analyzed: bhutta pāta rāsaḥ mālā gandha ādīni ādāya mahā parivāra parivutaḥ upasaṅkami bāhāyam gahetvā ati  na bāhāyam gahetvā ākaḍḍhi nisinnāsanataḥ vuṭṭhāya tassa santikam gantvā dakkhiṇa bāhāyam  aṅguṭṭhakena saññam da tvā ekamantam apanesi iti veditabbaḥ athassa sekham pi kho mahānāma
translated: and after breakfast he took garlands, perfumes, etc., and went to the Blessed One with a great company of lay followers. He took him by the arm:

original: sīla”ntiādinā nayena sattannaṃ sekhānaṃ sīlañca samādhiñca paññañca kathetvā upari🔽arahattaphalavasena asekhā sīlasamādhipaññāyo kathento – “sekhasamādhito sekhaṃ vipassanāñāṇaṃ
analyzed: sīlanti ādinā nayena sattannam sekhānam sīlam ca samādhiñca paññañca kathetvā upari  arahatta phala vasena asekhā sīla samādhi paññāyo kathento sekha samādhito sekham vipassanā ñāṇam
translated: he did not drag him by the arm, but he rose from his seat and went to him and gave him a sign by touching his thumb. He should be understood to have led him to one side. Then, after telling him about the virtue, concentration, and understanding of the seven kinds of trainers beginning with “Mahanama, a trainer of men to be tamed is virtue” ,

original: asekhañca phalañāṇaṃ pacchā, sekhavipassanāñāṇato ca asekhaphalasamādhi pacchā uppajjatī”ti
analyzed: asekham ca phala ñāṇam pacchā sekha vipassanā ñāṇato ca asekha phala samādhi pacchā uppajjati iti
translated: he went on to tell him about the virtue, concentration, and understanding of the non-trainer in the form of the arahant fruit. In doing so he implied that the non-trainer’s understanding consisting in insight knowledge comes after the trainer’s concentration, and that the non-trainer’s concentration consisting in fruition attainment comes after the trainer’s insight knowledge.

original: dīpesi. Yāni pana sampayuttāni samādhiñāṇāni, tesaṃ apacchā apure uppatti veditabbāti.
analyzed: dīpesi yāni pana sampayuttāni samādhi ñāṇāni tesam apacchā apure uppatti veditabbā ti
translated: But the other kinds of concentration and knowledge that are associated with the insight knowledge of the trainer should be understood to arise neither after nor before .

original: 4. Nigaṇṭhasuttavaṇṇanā

original: 75. Catutthe kūṭāgārasālāyanti dve kaṇṇikā gahetvā haṃsavaṭṭakacchannena katāya gandhakuṭiyā.
analyzed: catutthe kūṭāgāra sālāyanti dve kaṇṇikāḥ gahetvā haṃsa vaṭṭaka channena katāya gandhakuṭiyā

original: Aparisesaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ paṭijānātīti appamattakampi asesetvā sabbaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ🔽paṭijānāti. Satataṃ samitanti sabbakālaṃ nirantaraṃ. Ñāṇadassanaṃ paccupaṭṭhitanti
analyzed: aparisesam ñāṇa dassanam paṭijānāti iti appamattakam pi a sesetvā sabbam ñāṇa dassanam  paṭijānāti satatam samitanti sabbakālam nirantaram ñāṇa dassanam paccupaṭṭhitanti
translated: He claims to have knowledge and insight without remainder: he claims to have all knowledge and insight without leaving out the least amount.🔽Always and continuously: at all times, uninterruptedly. Knowledge and insight are present to me: he shows that omniscient knowledge is present to him.

original: sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ mayhaṃ upaṭṭhitamevāti dasseti. Purāṇānaṃ kammānanti āyūhitakammānaṃ.

analyzed: tapasā dukkara tapena navānam kammānanti idāni āyūhitabba kammānam
translated: Of new actions: of actions that should be done now.🔽By not doing: by not doing them. He cuts the stream: he cuts the stream of conditions.

original: Akaraṇāti anāyūhanena. Setughātanti padaghātaṃ paccayaghātaṃ katheti. Kammakkhayā
analyzed: a karaṇā ati an āyūhanena setu ghātam ti pada ghātam paccaya ghātam kathā iti kamma kkhayā
translated: By the destruction of action: by the destruction of the round of action.

original: dukkhakkhayoti kammavaṭṭakkhayena dukkhakkhayo. Dukkhakkhayā vedanākkhayoti dukkhavaṭṭakkhayena
analyzed: dukkha kkhayoti kamma vaṭṭa kkhayena dukkha kkhayo dukkha kkhayā vedanā kkhayo ti dukkha vaṭṭa kkhayena
translated: By the destruction of suffering: by the destruction of the round of suffering. By the destruction of feeling: by the destruction of the round of feeling.

original: vedanākkhayo. Dukkhavaṭṭasmiñhi khīṇe vedanāvaṭṭampi khīṇameva hoti. Vedanākkhayā
analyzed: vedanā khayaḥ dukkha vaṭṭasmin hi khīṇe vedanā vaṭṭam pi khīṇam eva hoti vedanā kkhayā
translated: is the destruction of feeling. For when the round of suffering is exhausted, the round of feeling is exhausted too.🔽With the destruction of feeling, all suffering will be exhausted.

original: sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ nijjiṇṇaṃ bhavissatīti vedanākkhayena pana sakalavaṭṭadukkhaṃ nijjiṇṇameva🔽bhavissati. Sandiṭṭhikāyāti sāmaṃ passitabbāya paccakkhāya. Nijjarāya visuddhiyāti
analyzed: sabbam dukkham nijjiṇṇam bhavissati iti vedanā khayena pana sakala vaṭṭa dukkham nijjiṇṇam eva  bhavissati sandiṭṭhikāya ati sāmam passitabbāya paccakkhāya nijjarāya visuddhiyā ati
translated: With the destruction of feeling, all suffering in the round will be exhausted.

original: kilesajīraṇakapaṭipadāya kilese vā nijjīraṇato nijjarāya sattānaṃ visuddhiyā. Samatikkamo
analyzed: kilesa jīraṇaka paṭipadāya kilese vā nijjīraṇataḥ nijjarāya sattānam visuddhiyā samatikkamaḥ
translated: With the purification by overcoming doubt: with the purification of beings by the practice of overcoming doubt.🔽There is the surmounting: there is the surmounting of all suffering in the round.

original: hotīti sakalassa vaṭṭadukkhassa atikkamo hoti. Idha, bhante, bhagavā kimāhāti, bhante,
analyzed: hoti iti sakalassa vaṭṭa dukkhassa atikkamaḥ hoti idha bhante bhagavā kim āha ati bhante

analyzed: bhagavā imāya paṭipattiyā kim āha kim etaṃ yeva kilesa nijjīraṇaka paṭipadam paññapeti
translated: What did the Blessed One say about this practice? Does he teach only this practice of overcoming the defilements,

original: udāhu aññanti pucchati.
analyzed: udāhu aññanti pucchati
translated: or does he teach others as well?”

original: Jānatāti anāvaraṇañāṇena jānantena. Passatāti samantacakkhunā passantena. Visuddhiyāti
analyzed: jānatā ati anāvaraṇa ñāṇena jānantena passatā ati samanta cakkhunā passantena visuddhiyā ati
translated: Knowing: knowing with unobstructed knowledge. Seeing: seeing with the eye of omniscience. Purification: purification of beings.

original: visuddhisampāpanatthāya. Samatikkamāyāti samatikkamanatthāya. Atthaṅgamāyāti atthaṃ🔽gamanatthāya. Ñāyassa adhigamāyāti saha vipassanāya maggassa adhigamanatthāya. Nibbānassa🔽sacchikiriyāyāti apaccayanibbānassa sacchikaraṇatthāya. Navañca kammaṃ na karotīti🔽navaṃ kammaṃ nāyūhati. Purāṇañca kammanti pubbe āyūhitakammaṃ. Phussa phussa byantī
analyzed: visuddhi sampāpana tthāya samatikkamāya ati samatikkamana tthāya atthaṅgamāya ati atthaṃ gamana tthāya ñāyassa adhigamāya ati saha vipassanāya maggassa adhigamana tthāya nibbānassa  sacchikiriyāya ati apaccaya nibbānassa sacchikaraṇa tthāya navam ca kammam na karoti iti  navam kammam na āyūhati purāṇam ca kammanti pubbe āyūhita kammam phussa phussa
translated: for the attainment of purification. For the surmounting of perceptions: for the purpose of surmounting perceptions. For the stilling of perceptions: for the purpose of stilling perceptions. For the relinquishing of perceptions: for the purpose of relinquishing perceptions. For the destruction of perceptions: for the purpose of the destruction of perceptions. For the abandoning of perceptions: for the purpose of abandoning perceptions. For the fading away of perceptions: for the purpose of the fading away of perceptions. For the cessation of perceptions: for the purpose of the cessation of perceptions. For the relinquishing of the fetters: for the purpose of relinquishing the fetters. For the destruction of the taints: for the purpose of the destruction of the taints. He does not create new kamma: he does not accumulate fresh kamma. But the kamma already done: the kamma already accumulated. He abandons craving: he abandons craving for sense desires, craving for existence, and craving for the cessation of existence. Translation: visuddhiyā samāpattiyāti visuddhiyā samāpattihetubhāvāya | atthaṅgamāyāti atthaṃ gamanatthāya | ñāyassa adhigamāyāti vipassanāsampayuttassa maggassa adhigamatthāya | nibbānassa sacchikiriyāyāti apaccayanibbānassa sacchikiriyāya | navañca kammaṃ na karotīti navaṃ kammaṃ āyūhaṃ na karoti | purāṇañca kammaṃ pajahatīti pubbe āyūhitakammaṃ pajahati | phussa phusayeva khandhānaṃntaṃ karoti |

original: karotīti phusitvā phusitvā vigatantaṃ karoti, vipākaphassaṃ phusitvā phusitvā taṃ🔽kammaṃ khepetīti attho. Sandiṭṭhikāti sāmaṃ passitabbā. Akālikāti na kālantare kiccakārikā.🔽Ehipassikāti “ehi passā”ti evaṃ dassetuṃ yuttā. Opaneyyikāti upanaye yuttā allīyitabbayuttā.🔽Paccattaṃ veditabbā viññūhīti paṇḍitehi attano attano santāneyeva jānitabbā, bālehi
analyzed: karoti iti phusitvā phusitvā vigatantam karoti vipāka phassam phusitvā phusitvā tam 🔽kammam khepeti iti attho sandiṭṭhikā ti sāmam passitabbā akālikā ati na kāla antare kicca kārikā 🔽ehipassikā ati ehi passa ati evam dassetum yuttā opaneyyikā ati upanaye yuttā allīyitabba yuttā 🔽paccattam veditabbā viññūhi iti paṇḍitehi attanaḥ attanaḥ santāneya iva jānitabbā bālehi
translated: For the attainment of purification. For the crossing over: for the purpose of crossing over. For the giving up: for the purpose of giving up. For the destruction: for the purpose of the destruction of the defilements. For the realization of the deathless: for the purpose of realizing the deathless Nibbāna. He does not create new kamma: he does not accumulate new kamma. The old kamma: the kamma accumulated earlier. He wears it down by using it up: he wears it down by making it have no remainder. The meaning is: he exhausts that kamma by experiencing the result of it. It is to be seen here and now: it is to be seen by oneself. It is timeless: it is not effective only at a particular time. It invites one to come and see: it is suitable to be pointed out thus: “Come and see.” It is to be penetrated by an individual: it is to be known by the wise in their own mental continuum.

original: pana dujjānā. Iti sīlavasena dve maggā, dve ca phalāni kathitāni. Sotāpannasakadāgāmino🔽hi sīlesu paripūrakārinoti. Vivicceva kāmehītiādikāya pana samādhisampadāya tayo
analyzed: pana dujjānāḥ iti sīla vasena dve maggā dve ca phalāni kathitāni sotāpanna sakadāgāmino  hi sīlesu paripūra kārinaḥ ti vivicca iva kāmehi iti ādikāya pana samādhi sampadāya
translated: but it is hard to know. So two paths and two fruits are spoken of in terms of virtue. For stream-enterers and once-returners🔽are called “fulfillers of virtue.” But three paths and three fruits are spoken of in terms of the perfection of concentration, which is stated in the passage beginning, “Quite secluded from sense desires” .

original: maggā, tīṇi ca phalāni kathitāni. Anāgāmī ariyasāvako hi samādhimhi paripūrakārīti
analyzed: tīṇi ca phalāni kathitāni anāgāmī ariya sāvakaḥ hi samādhimhi paripūra kārī iti

original: vutto. Āsavānaṃ khayātiādīhi arahattaphalaṃ kathitaṃ. Keci pana sīlasamādhayopi arahattaphalasampayuttāva
analyzed: vuttaḥ āsavānam khaya ati ādīhi arahatta phalam kathitam keci pana sīla samādhayaḥ api arahatta phala sampayuttāḥ ava
translated: The fruit of arahantship is spoken of in terms of the destruction of the taints, and so on. But some say that virtue and concentration are included in the fruit of arahantship here,

original: idha adhippetā. Ekekassa pana vasena paṭipattidassanatthaṃ visuṃ visuṃ tanti āropitāti.
analyzed: idha adhippetā ekekassa pana vasena paṭipatti dassana attham visum visum tanti āropitā ati

analyzed: nivesaka sutta vaṇṇanā

analyzed: pañcame amaccā ati suhajjā ñātī iti sassusasurapakkhikā sālohitā ati samānalohitā

analyzed: dvādasasu koṭṭhāsesu yūsa gatāya ābandhana bhūtāya āpodhātuyā catūsu koṭṭhāsesu paripācana bhūtāya
translated: in the four parts beginning with the fire element, there might be a change in the state of the fire element, which is the ripening aspect;🔽in the six parts beginning with the air element, there might be a change in the state of the air element, which is the distending aspect.

original: tejodhātuyā, chasu koṭṭhāsesu vitthambhanabhūtāya vāyodhātuyā siyā aññathattaṃ. Na
analyzed: tejaḥ dhātuyā chasu koṭṭhāsesu vitthambhana bhūtāya vāyo dhātuyā siyā aññathattam na
translated: But not so for the noble disciple.

analyzed: tu eva iti imesam hi catunnam mahābhūtānam aññamaññabhāva upagamanena siyā aññathattam  ariya sāvakassa pana na tu eva siyāti dasseti ettha ca aññathattanti pasāda aññathattañca

original: candanaṃ tagaramallikā vāti candanatagaramallikānampi gandho paṭivātaṃ na gacchatīti🔽attho. Devalokepi phuṭasumanā nāma hoti, tassā pupphitadivase gandho yojanasataṃ🔽ajjhottharati. Sopi paṭivātaṃ vidatthimattampi ratanamattampi gantuṃ na sakkotīti🔽vadanti. Satañca gandho paṭivātametīti satañca paṇḍitānaṃ buddhapaccekabuddhabuddhaputtānaṃ
analyzed: candanam tagara mallikā vāti gandhaḥ paṭivātam na gacchati iti 🔽attho deva loke pi phuṭasumanā nāma hoti tassā pupphita divase gandhaḥ yojana satam 🔽ajjhottharati saḥ api paṭivātam vidatthi mattam pi ratana mattam pi gantum na sakkoti iti 🔽vadanti satam ca gandho paṭivātam eti iti satam ca paṇḍitānam buddha paccekabuddha buddha puttānam
translated: or he is virtuous. He is of good character: he is of good, of beautiful, character because of that virtue. He is free from stain and blemish, etc.: the meaning of this has been given in detail in the Path of Purification. In all directions: in the four cardinal directions and the four intermediate directions. Ascetics and brahmans: ascetics and brahmans who have quieted evil and put away evil. The scent of flowers does not travel against the wind: the scent of flowers in bloom, etc., does not go against the wind. The scent of sandalwood, tagara, and jasmine does not travel against the wind: the meaning is that the scent of sandalwood, tagara, and jasmine does not go against the wind either. They say that in the deva world there is a flower called “pleasing to the mind” . On the day it is in bloom its scent pervades a hundred leagues and does not go beyond that. They say that it cannot go against the wind even a fathom or an inch. The scent of the virtuous travels with and against the wind: the scent of the virtuous, of the wise, of the Buddhas, Paccekabuddhas, and Buddhas’ disciples,

analyzed: paññāpetvā adāsi therassa api anucchavikam āsanam paññāpayiṃsu nisīdi bhagavā paññatte

analyzed: brahmuno ca brahma parisāya ca brahma pārisajjānam ca dhammīkathā ati evam bhante iti
translated: to the Brahmā and to the Brahmā assembly and to the Brahmā retinue.” “Yes, Lord,”

analyzed: kho bhikkhave abhibhū bhikkhu sikhissa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa paṭissuṇitvā

analyzed: brahmuno ca brahma parisāya ca brahma pārisajjānam ca dhammim katham kathesi there
translated: and he preached the Law to Brahmā, to the company of Brahmās, and to the retinue of Brahmā.

original: dhammaṃ kathente brahmagaṇā ujjhāyiṃsu – “cirassañca mayaṃ satthu brahmalokāgamanaṃ
analyzed: dhammam kathente brahma gaṇāḥ ujjhāyiṃsu cirassan ca mayam satthu brahma loka āgamanam

analyzed: labhimha ayam ca bhikkhu ṭhapetvā satthāram sayam dhamma katham ārabhi iti  satthā tesam anattamana bhāvam ñatvā abhibhum bhikkhum etat avoca ujjhāyanti kho

original: te, brāhmaṇa, brahmā ca brahmaparisā ca brahmapārisajjā ca. Tena hi tvaṃ – brāhmaṇa,
analyzed: te brāhmaṇa brahmā ca brahma parisā ca brahma pārisajjā ca tena hi tvam brāhmaṇa
translated: The Teacher, perceiving their displeasure, said to the Elder Abhibhū, “Brahmā and the company of Brahmās and the retinue of Brahmā are displeased.

analyzed: bhiyyosoma ttāya saṃvejehi iti theraḥ satthu vacanam sampaṭicchitvā aneka vihitam iddhi vikubbanaṃ

analyzed: katvā sahassi lokadhātum sarena viññāpentaḥ ārambhatha nikkamatha ati gāthā dvayam abhāsi
translated: caused a thousand world systems to resound with his voice, and recited the two verses, “Arise, go forth, and strive.”

analyzed: kim pana katvā theraḥ sahassi lokadhātum viññāpesi iti nīla kasiṇam tāva samāpajjitvā
translated: But what did the Elder do to cause a thousand world systems to resound with his voice? First of all he entered into the Ecstasy of the Signless, and then he rose from that Ecstasy and entered into the Ecstasy of the Sphere of Infinite Space.

original: sabbattha andhakāraṃ phari, tato “kimidaṃ andhakāra”nti sattānaṃ ābhoge uppanne ālokaṃ
analyzed: sabbattha andhakāram tatas kim idam andhakāra nti sattānam ābhoge uppanne ālokam

analyzed: dassesi kim ālokaḥ ayanti vicinantānam attānam dassesi sahassa cakkavāḷe deva manussā
translated: When they were wondering, “What is this light? “, he showed himself. Gods and men in the whole of the universe

original: añjaliṃ paggaṇhitvā paggaṇhitvā theraṃyeva namassamānā aṭṭhaṃsu. Thero “mahājano
analyzed: añjalim paggaṇhitvā paggaṇhitvā theram yā iva namassamānāḥ aṭṭhaṃsu theraḥ mahājanaḥ
translated: stood with hands raised in reverential salutation, worshipping the Elder alone. The Elder thought, “Let the great multitude hear my voice

analyzed: mayham dhammam desentassa saram suṇātu iti imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāsi sabbe osaṭāya parisāya
translated: as I preach the Dhamma.” So he spoke these stanzas. All the people in the assembly

analyzed: majjhe nisīditvā dhammaṃ desentassa viya saddam assosuṃ atthaḥ api na esam pākaṭaḥ ahosi

original: Atha kho bhagavā saddhiṃ therena aruṇavatiṃ paccāgantvā piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ🔽piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pucchi – “assuttha no tumhe, bhikkhave, abhibhussa
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā saddhim therena aruṇavatim pacca āgantvā piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattam  piṇḍapāta paṭikkantaḥ bhikkhu saṅgham pucchi assuttha no tumhe bhikkhave
translated: Then the Blessed One, together with the Elder, returned at dawn to Aruṇavati, went for alms, and after the meal🔽returned from his alms round. He asked the community of bhikkhus, “Bhikkhus, did you hear the stanzas spoken by the bhikkhu Abhibhū

original: bhikkhuno brahmaloke ṭhitassa gāthāyo bhāsamānassā”ti. Te “āma, bhante”ti paṭijānitvā
analyzed: bhikkhuno brahma loke ṭhitassa gāthāyaḥ bhāsamānassa ati te āma bhante iti paṭijānitvā
translated: as he stood in the Brahma-world? ” They replied, “Yes, venerable sir.”

original: sutabhāvaṃ āvikarontā tadeva gāthādvayaṃ udāhariṃsu. Satthā “sādhu sādhū”ti sādhukāraṃ
analyzed: suta bhāvam tat eva gāthā dvayam udāhariṃsu satthā sādhu sādhu iti sādhukāram
translated: and they recited the two verses. The Teacher,

original: datvā desanaṃ niṭṭhapesi. Evaṃ tāva idaṃ suttaṃ ito ekatiṃsakappamatthake sikhinā bhagavatā kathitaṃ.
analyzed: da tvā desanam niṭṭhapesi evam tāva idam suttam itas ekatiṃsa kappa matthake sikhinā bhagavatā kathitam
translated: saying “Good! Good!” and giving his approval, concluded the lesson. Thus this Thread was spoken by the Blessed One Sikhi in the past time, one asankheyya and a hundred thousand cycles ago.

original: Amhākaṃ pana bhagavā sabbaññutaṃ patto pavattitavaradhammacakko sāvatthiṃ upanissāya
analyzed: amhākam pana bhagavā sabbaññu tam pattaḥ pavattita vara dhamma cakko sāvatthim upanissāya
translated: But our Blessed One, having reached omniscience, set rolling the Wheel of the Dhamma, and he stayed in dependence on Savatthi,

analyzed: jetavane viharantaḥ jeṭṭha mūla māsa puṇṇama divase bhikkhū āmantetvā imam aruṇavati suttaṃ  paṭṭhapesi ānanda theraḥ bījanim gahetvā bījayamāno āditas paṭṭhāya yāva
translated: in Jeta’s Wood, Anathapindika’s Park. On the night of the full-moon day of the first half of the month of Magha he addressed the bhikkhus, saying: “Bhikkhus, I will teach you the Thread called the Dawn-Exhortation.🔽The venerable Ananda took his winnowing basket and stood fanning the coals, and he learnt the whole Thread by heart without missing a single syllable from the beginning to the end.

original: pariyosānā ekabyañjanampi ahāpetvā sakalasuttaṃ uggaṇhi. So punadivase piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto
analyzed: pariyosānā eka byañjanam pi ahāpetvā sakala suttam uggaṇhi saḥ puna divase piṇḍapāta paṭikkanto
translated: On the following day, after he had returned from his alms round,

original: dasabalassa vattaṃ dassetvā attano divāvihāraṭṭhānaṃ gantvā saddhivihārikantevāsikesu
analyzed: dasabalassa vattam dassetvā attanaḥ divāvihāra ṭṭhānam gantvā saddhivihārika antevāsikesu
translated: he showed his duty to the One of Ten Powers, and then he went to his own place for the day’s abiding. His pupils and his pupils’ pupils

original: vattaṃ dassetvā pakkantesu hiyyo kathitaṃ aruṇavatisuttaṃ āvajjento nisīdi. Athassa
analyzed: vattam dassetvā pakkantesu hiyyas kathitam aruṇavati suttam āvajjentaḥ nisīdi
translated: and after they had shown him the duties, he sat down reflecting on the Discourse on the Dawn which had been told by the Teacher the previous day.

original: sabbaṃ suttaṃ vibhūtaṃ upaṭṭhāsi. So cintesi – “sikhissa bhagavato aggasāvako brahmaloke
analyzed: sabbam suttam vibhūtam upaṭṭhāsi so cintesi sikhissa bhagavataḥ aggasāvakaḥ brahma loke
translated: Then the whole of the Discourse became clear to him. He thought: “The chief disciple of the Lord Buddha Sikhī, standing in the world of Brahmā,

analyzed: ṭhatvā cakkavāḷa sahasse andhakāram vidhametvā sarīra ubhāsam dassetvā attano saddam
translated: having dispelled the darkness in a thousand world-systems, having shown the radiance of his body,

analyzed: dasa pāramiyaḥ pūretvā sabbaññu tam pattaḥ pana sammāsambuddhaḥ kittakam ṭhānam sarena
translated: but what extent will the Perfectly Awakened One, who has attained omniscience after fulfilling the ten perfections,

analyzed: viññāpeyya ati saḥ evam uppannāya vimatiyāḥ vinodana attham bhagavantam

analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā tam attham pucchi etam attham dassetum atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ iti vuttam
translated: at that very moment and asked him about the matter. In order to show this matter it is said: “Then the venerable Ānanda.”

original: Tattha sammukhāti sammukhībhūtena mayā etaṃ sutaṃ, na anussavena, na dūtaparamparāyāti
analyzed: tattha sammukhā ati sammukhībhūtena mayā etam sutam na anussavena na dūta paramparāyā ati
translated: Herein, face to face means: this was heard by me face to face, not by report, not by a succession of messengers.

analyzed: iminā adhippāyena evam āha kīvatakam pahoti sarena viññāpetunti kittakam ṭhānam sarīra ubhāsena
translated: with this intention he said thus. How far can he make himself understood by his voice? How far can he make himself understood by his voice after having dispelled the darkness by the light of his body?

analyzed: vihata ndhakāram katvā sarena viññāpetum sakkoti sāvako so ānanda appameyyā tathāgatā ati
translated: The disciple, Ananda, is immeasurable to the Tathagata.

analyzed: idam bhagavā iminā adhippāyena āha ānanda tvam kim vadesi saḥ padesa ñāṇe ṭhitaḥ sāvako
translated: The Blessed One said thus with this intention – Ananda, what do you say? He is a disciple who is established in the knowledge of a part.

original: Tathāgatā pana dasa pāramiyo pūretvā sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ pattā appameyyā. So tvaṃ nakhasikhāya🔽paṃsuṃ gahetvā mahāpathavipaṃsunā saddhiṃ upamento viya kiṃ nāmetaṃ vadesi. Añño
analyzed: tathāgatāḥ pana dasa pāramiyaḥ pūretvā sabbaññuta ññāṇam pattā appameyyā saḥ tvam nakhasikhāya  paṃsum gahetvā mahā pathavi paṃsunā saddhim upamentaḥ viya kim nāma etam vadesi añño
translated: The Tathagatas, however, having fulfilled the ten perfections, attained omniscience and are immeasurable. You, taking the dust on the tip of a fingernail

analyzed: hi sāvakānam visayaḥ aññaḥ buddhānam aññaḥ sāvakānam gocaraḥ aññaḥ buddhānam aññam
translated: and comparing it with the great earth’s dust, are you not saying something like this? For, the sphere of the disciples is one, that of the Buddhas is another. The domain of the disciples is one, that of the Buddhas is another.

original: sāvakānaṃ balaṃ, aññaṃ buddhānanti. Iti bhagavā iminā adhippāyena appameyyabhāvaṃ vatvā tuṇhī ahosi.

translated: The strength of the disciples is one, that of the Buddhas is another. Thus, after having said about the state of being immeasurable with this intention, the Blessed One became silent.

original: Thero dutiyampi pucchi. Satthā, “ānanda, tvaṃ tāḷacchiddaṃ gahetvā anantākāsena upamento🔽viya, cātakasakuṇaṃ gahetvā diyaḍḍhayojanasatikena supaṇṇarājena upamento viya, hatthisoṇḍāya
analyzed: theraḥ dutiyam pi pucchi satthā ānanda tvam tāḷa chiddam gahetvā ananta ākāsena upamento  viya cātaka sakuṇam gahetvā diyaḍḍha yojana satikena supaṇṇa rājena upamentaḥ viya hatthi soṇḍāya
translated: The Elder asked the question a second time. The Teacher said, “Ānanda, you are like one who, taking a hole in a water-jug, should approach the endless sky;🔽you are like one who, taking a young bird, should approach the king of the Supaṇṇas, who is two and a half leagues in height;🔽you are like one who, taking water in the tip of a lotus-leaf, should approach the great river Ganges;

original: udakaṃ gahetvā mahāgaṅgāya upamento viya, caturatanike āvāṭe udakaṃ gahetvā sattahi🔽sarehi upamento viya, nāḷikodanamattalābhiṃ manussaṃ gahetvā cakkavattiraññā upamento
analyzed: udakam gahetvā mahāgaṅgāya caturatanike āvāṭe udakam gahetvā  sarehi upamentaḥ viya nāḷikā udana matta lābhim manussam gahetvā cakkavatti raññā upamentaḥ
translated: you are like one who, taking water in a four-inch bowl, should approach the seven rivers;🔽you are like one who, taking a man who has obtained only a handful of food, should approach the Universal Monarch;

original: viya, paṃsupisācakaṃ gahetvā sakkena devaraññā upamento viya, khajjopanakappabhaṃ
analyzed: viya paṃsu pisācakam gahetvā sakkena deva raññā upamentaḥ viya khajjopanaka ppabham
translated: you are like one who, taking a goblin of the dust-heap, should approach Sakka, King of the Devas;🔽you are like one who, taking a glow-worm, should approach the light of the sun. Why do you say this?”

original: gahetvā sūriyappabhāya upamento viya kiṃ nāmetaṃ vadesīti dīpento dutiyampi appameyyabhāvameva
analyzed: gahetvā sūriya ppabhāya upamentaḥ viya kim nāma etam vadesi iti dīpentaḥ dutiyam pi appameyya bhāvam eva
translated: Thus did he make clear the fact that the Elder’s question was like each of these things. For the second time he pointed out the immeasurableness of the Buddha’s knowledge and then became silent.

original: vatvā tuṇhī ahosi. Tato thero cintesi – “satthā mayā pucchito na tāva kathesi, handa
analyzed: vatvā tuṇhī ahosi tato thero cintesi satthā mayā pucchitaḥ na tāva kathesi handa
translated: Thereupon the Elder thought to himself, “The Teacher has been asked a question by me, but he has not answered it. Well then,

original: naṃ yāvatatiyaṃ yācitvā buddhasīhanādaṃ nadāpessāmī”ti. So tatiyampi yāci. Taṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: nam yāvatatiyam yācitvā buddha sīha nādam nadāpessāmi iti saḥ tatiyam pi yāci tam dassetuṃ
translated: I will roar the lion’s roar of the Enlightened One.” He asked for the third time. In order to show that,

original: tatiyampi khotiādi vuttaṃ. Athassa bhagavā byākaronto sutā te ānandātiādimāha. Thero
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho tiādi vuttam athassa bhagavā byākarontaḥ sutā te ānanda iti ādim āha theraḥ
translated: “For the third time,” etc., is said. Then, as he was giving his answer, the Blessed One said, “You have heard, Ananda,” etc. The Elder thought,

original: cintesi – “satthā me ‘sutā te, ānanda, sahassī cūḷanikā lokadhātū’ti ettakameva vatvā
analyzed: cintesi satthā me sutā te ānanda sahassī cūḷanikā lokadhātū ti ettakam eva vatvā
translated: “The Teacher has said only this much to me: ‘You have heard, Ananda, of the lesser world system of a thousand worlds.’

original: tuṇhī jāto, idāni buddhasīhanādaṃ nadissatī”ti so satthāraṃ yācanto etassa bhagavā kālotiādimāha.
analyzed: tuṇhī jātaḥ idāni buddha sīha nādam na dissati iti so satthāram yācantaḥ etassa bhagavā kālo ti ādim āha
translated: Now he is going to roar the lion’s roar of the Enlightened One.” So he asked the Teacher, saying, “Now is the time, O Blessed One, now is the time, O Well-Farer, for the Blessed One to roar the lion’s roar.”

original: Bhagavāpissa vitthārakathaṃ kathetuṃ tena hānandātiādimāha. Tattha yāvatāti yattakaṃ🔽ṭhānaṃ. Candimasūriyāti candimā ca sūriyo ca. Pariharantīti vicaranti. Disā bhantīti
analyzed: bhagavā api sa vitthāra katham kathetum tena ha ānanda iti ādim āha tattha yāvatā iti yattakam  ṭhānam candima sūriya ati candimā ca sūriyaḥ ca pariharanti iti vicaranti disā bhanti iti
translated: The Blessed One said, “Well then, Ananda,” in order to give him a detailed explanation. Herein, as far as means as much as.

original: sabbadisā obhāsanti. Virocanāti virocamānā. Ettāvatā ekacakkavāḷaṃ paricchinditvā
analyzed: sabbadisā obhāsanti virocanā ati virocamānāḥ ettāvatā eka cakkavāḷam paricchinditvā
translated: Moon and sun means moon and sun. They revolve means they move. They light up the worlds means they illuminate the worlds. They shine means they shine. So far the single world-sphere has been defined and shown.

original: dassitaṃ hoti. Idāni taṃ sahassaguṇaṃ katvā dassento tāva sahassadhā lokoti āha.
analyzed: dassitam hoti idāni tam sahassa guṇam katvā dassento tāva sahassadhā loko ti āha
translated: Now, in order to show that multiplied a thousand times, he said, “The world-system of a thousand worlds.”

original: Tasmiṃ sahassadhā loketi tasmiṃ sahassacakkavāḷe. Sahassaṃ cātumahārājikānanti sahassaṃ
analyzed: tasmim sahassadhā loke iti tasmim sahassa cakkavāḷe sahassam cātumahārājikānanti sahassam
translated: In that system of a thousand worlds: in that system of a thousand world-spheres. A thousand of the Gods of the Four Kings:
