analyzed: arahatta phalena iva ca magga kiccam kathitam phalam pana javita javena uppajjanataḥ javaḥ ti ca vattum vaṭṭati
translated: and the function of the path is taught by means of the fruit of arahatship. But the fruit is also called “speed” because it arises with the speed of the swift.

original: 8. Potthakasuttavaṇṇanā🔽100. Aṭṭhame navoti karaṇaṃ upādāya vuccati. Potthakoti vākamayavatthaṃ. Majjhimoti🔽paribhogamajjhimo. Jiṇṇoti paribhogajiṇṇo. Ukkhaliparimajjananti ukkhaliparipuñchanaṃ🔽dussīloti nissīlo. Dubbaṇṇatāyāti guṇavaṇṇābhāvena dubbaṇṇatāya. Diṭṭhānugatiṃ āpajjantīti🔽tena kataṃ anukaronti. Na mahapphalaṃ hotīti vipākaphalena mahapphalaṃ na hoti. Na
analyzed: potthaka sutta vaṇṇanā  aṭṭhame navā ti karaṇam upādāya vuccati potthako ti vāka maya vattham majjhimaḥ iti  paribhoga majjhimaḥ jiṇṇo ti paribhoga jiṇṇaḥ ukkhali parimajjanan ti ukkhali paripuñchanam  dussīlaḥ ti nissīlaḥ dubbaṇṇa tāya ati guṇa vaṇṇa abhāvena dubbaṇṇa tāya diṭṭha anugatim āpajjanti iti  tena katam anukaronti na mahat phalam hoti iti vipāka phalena mahat phalam na hoti na
translated: 8. The explanation of the Potthapada Sutta

original: mahānisaṃsanti vipākānisaṃseneva na mahānisaṃsaṃ. Appagghatāyāti vipākagghena appagghatāya.🔽Kāsikaṃ vatthanti tīhi kappāsaaṃsūhi suttaṃ kantitvā katavatthaṃ, tañca kho kāsiraṭṭheyeva🔽uṭṭhitaṃ. Sesaṃ uttānameva. Sīlaṃ panettha missakaṃ kathitanti.
analyzed: mahā nisaṃsanti vipāka anisaṃsena iva na mahā nisaṃsam appaggha tāya ati vipāka agghena appaggha tāya  kāsikam vatthanti tīhi kappāsa aṃsūhi suttam kantitvā kata vattham tat ca kho  uṭṭhitam sesam uttānam eva sīlam pana ittha missakam kathitan ti
translated: In the eighth sutta the word “nine” is used in the sense of a number consisting of nine. Potthapada means a cloth made of bark. Middle-aged means middle-aged in consumption. Old means old in consumption. Rubbing the cooking pot means rubbing the cooking pot. Immoral means without virtue. Because of ugliness means because of ugliness due to the absence of the beauty of virtue. They follow his example means they imitate what he does. It is not very fruitful means it is not very fruitful in the fruit of ripening. It is not very beneficial means it is not very beneficial just by the benefit of ripening. Because of its low value means because of its low value in the ripening. Kāsika cloth means cloth made by weaving three kinds of thread, and that is produced only in the country of Kāsi. The rest is clear. But here virtue is said to be mixed.

original: 9. Loṇakapallasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: loṇakapalla sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The explanation of the Loṇakapalla Sutta

original: 101. Navame yathā yathāyanti yathā yathā ayaṃ. Tathā tathā tanti tathā tathā taṃ🔽kammaṃ. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – yo evaṃ vadeyya – “yathā yathā kammaṃ karoti, tathā tathāssa🔽vipākaṃ paṭisaṃvediyateva. Na hi sakkā katassa kammassa vipākaṃ paṭisedhetuṃ. Tasmā
analyzed: navame yathā yathā āyanti yathā yathā ayam tathā tathā tanti tathā tathā  kammam idam vuttam hoti yaḥ evam vadeyya yathā yathā kammam karoti tathā tathā assa  vipākam paṭisaṃvediyate iva na hi sakkā katassa kammassa vipākam paṭisedhetum tasmā
translated: 101. In the ninth, as, as, it comes to be, as, as, this,🔽So, so, that kamma, so, so, that kamma’s ripening.

original: yattakaṃ kammaṃ karoti, tattakassa vipākaṃ paṭisaṃvediyatevā”ti. Evaṃ santanti evaṃ🔽sante. Brahmacariyavāso na hotīti yaṃ maggabhāvanato pubbe upapajjavedanīyaṃ kammaṃ
analyzed: yattakam kammam karoti tattakassa vipākam paṭisaṃvediyate iva ati evam evam  sante brahmacariya vāsaḥ na hoti iti yam magga bhāvanato pubbe upapajja vedanīyam kammaṃ
translated: This is the meaning. If anyone should say, “As, as, one does kamma, so, so, one experiences its ripening. For it is not possible to prevent the ripening of kamma that has been done. Therefore, as, as, one does kamma, so, so, one experiences its ripening” ,🔽then, if that were so,

original: kataṃ, tassa avassaṃ paṭisaṃvedanīyattā brahmacariyaṃ vutthampi avutthameva hoti.🔽Okāso na paññāyati sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyāti yasmā ca evaṃ sante tena kammāyūhanañceva
analyzed: katam tassa a vassam paṭisaṃvedanīya ttā brahmacariyam vuttham pi a vuttham eva hoti  okāsaḥ na paññāyati sammā dukkhassa anta kiriyāya ati yasmā ca evam sante tena kamma āyūhanam ca iva
translated: then the life of purity would not be manifest.🔽The opportunity is not evident for the complete destruction of suffering.

original: vipākānubhavanā ca hoti, tasmā hetunā nayena vaṭṭadukkhassa antakiriyāya okāso na paññāyati nāma.
analyzed: vipāka anubhavanā ca hoti tasmā hetunā nayena vaṭṭa dukkhassa anta kiriyāya okāsaḥ na paññāyati nāma
translated: And since it is so, then there is the storing of kamma and the experiencing of its result. Therefore the opportunity is not evident for the complete destruction of suffering by a way that can be discerned.

original: Yathā yathā vedanīyanti yena yenākārena veditabbaṃ. Tathā tathāssa vipākaṃ paṭisaṃvediyatīti
analyzed: yathā yathā vedanīyanti yena yena ākārena veditabbam tathā tathā assa vipākam paṭisaṃvediyati iti
translated: As to the way it is to be felt: as to the kind of object it is to be felt as. He experiences the result in accordance with the way it is to be felt:

original: tena tenākārena assa vipākaṃ paccanubhoti. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – yadetaṃ sattasu javanesu
analyzed: tena tena ākārena assa vipākam paccanubhoti idam vuttam hoti yat etam sattasu javanesu
translated: he experiences the result in that kind of way. What is meant is this. The first kind of kamma in the seven impulsions,

original: paṭhamajavanakammaṃ sati paccaye vipākavāraṃ labhantameva diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti,
analyzed: paṭhama javana kammam sati paccaye vipāka vāram labhantam eva diṭṭhadhamma vedanīyam hoti
translated: if it gets an opportunity to do so, is to be felt in the present existence.

original: asati ahosikammaṃ nāma. Yañca sattamajavanakammaṃ sati paccaye upapajjavedanīyaṃ
analyzed: asati ahosikammam nāma yat ca sattama javana kammam sati paccaye upapajja vedanīyam
translated: The seventh kind of kamma, if it gets an opportunity to do so, is to be felt in the next existence.

original: hoti, asati ahosikammaṃ nāma. Yañca majjhe pañcajavanakammaṃ yāva saṃsārappavatti,🔽tāva aparapariyāyavedanīyaṃ nāma hoti. Etesu ākāresu yena yenākārena veditabbaṃ kammaṃ🔽ayaṃ puriso karoti, tena tenevassa vipākaṃ paṭisaṃvediyati nāma. Aṭṭhakathāyañhi
analyzed: hoti asati ahosikammam nāma yat ca majjhe pañcajavana kammam yāva saṃsāra ppavatti  tāva apara pariyāya vedanīyam nāma hoti etesu ākāresu yena yena ākārena veditabbam kammam  ayam puriso karoti tena tena iva assa vipākam paṭisaṃvediyati nāma aṭṭhakathāyan hi
translated: The five kinds of kamma in the middle are to be felt in some subsequent existence.🔽The kamma that a man does in these ways is to be felt in such and such a way.🔽In the commentary it is said that kamma that gets an opportunity to do so is called kamma to be felt according to choice.

original: laddhavipākavārameva kammaṃ yathāvedanīyaṃ kammaṃ nāmāti vuttaṃ. Evaṃ santaṃ, bhikkhave,
analyzed: laddha vipāka vāram eva kammam yathāvedanīyam kammam nāma ati vuttam evam santam bhikkhave
translated: When that is so, bhikkhus,

original: brahmacariyavāso hotīti kammakkhayakarassa brahmacariyassa khepetabbakammasambhavato
analyzed: brahmacariya vāsaḥ hoti iti kamma kkhaya karassa brahmacariyassa khepetabba kamma sambhavataḥ
translated: “The life of purity is lived out” : the life of purity which brings about the destruction of kamma is lived out in the sense that the kamma to be eliminated has been eliminated.

original: vāso nāma hoti, vutthaṃ suvutthameva hotīti attho. Okāso paññāyati sammā dukkhassa
analyzed: vāsaḥ nāma hoti vuttham su vuttham eva hoti iti attho okāsaḥ paññāyati sammā dukkhassa
translated: The meaning is that it has been well lived out.

original: antakiriyāyāti yasmā evaṃ sante tena tena maggena abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇassa nirodhena
analyzed: anta kiriyāya ati yasmai evam sante tena tena maggena abhisaṅkhāra viññāṇassa nirodhena
translated: “The opportunity is present for the complete destruction of suffering” : since it is so, then by the cessation of the consciousness that is the result of kamma through each of the paths,

original: tesu tesu bhavesu āyatiṃ vaṭṭadukkhaṃ na uppajjati, tasmā okāso paññāyati sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya.
analyzed: tesu tesu bhavesu āyatim vaṭṭa dukkham na uppajjati tasmai okāso paññāyati sammā dukkhassa anta kiriyāya
translated: the suffering of the round in future existences does not arise. Therefore the opportunity is present for the complete destruction of suffering.

original: Idāni taṃ yathāvedanīyakammasabhāvaṃ dassento idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassātiādimāha.
analyzed: idāni tam yathāvedanīya kamma sabhāvam dassentaḥ idha bhikkhave ekaccassa ati ādim āha
translated: Now, showing the nature of kamma that is to be experienced here and now, the Exalted One said, “Here, bhikkhus, someone generates desire for the destruction of the taints” .🔽Herein, slight is small, little, trifling, insignificant.

original: Tattha appamattakanti parittaṃ thokaṃ mandaṃ lāmakaṃ. Tādisaṃyevāti taṃsarikkhakameva.
analyzed: tattha appamattakanti parittam thokam mandam lāmakam tādisam yeva ati taṃsa rikkhakam eva
translated: Such as this is of that kind.

original: Diṭṭhadhammavedanīyanti tasmiṃ kammeyeva diṭṭhadhamme vipaccitabbaṃ vipākavāraṃ labhantaṃ
analyzed: diṭṭhadhamma vedanīyanti tasmin kammeya iva diṭṭhadhamme vipaccitabbam vipāka vāram labhantam
translated: To be experienced here and now is to be experienced in this very life, to be experienced in this very world.

original: diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti. Nāṇupi khāyatīti dutiye attabhāve aṇupi na khāyati, aṇumattampi
analyzed: diṭṭhadhamma vedanīyam hoti na aṇupi khāyati iti dutiye atta bhāve na khāyati aṇumattam pi
translated: It is experienced in the present existence. “The knowledge does not appear”: In the second existence, the knowledge does not appear even to the extent of an atom.

original: dutiye attabhāve vipākaṃ na detīti attho. Bahudevāti bahukaṃ pana vipākaṃ kimeva🔽dassatīti adhippāyo. Abhāvitakāyotiādīhi kāyabhāvanārahito vaṭṭagāmī puthujjano dassito.🔽Parittoti parittaguṇo. Appātumoti ātumā vuccati attabhāvo, tasmiṃ mahantepi guṇaparittatāya🔽appātumoyeva. Appadukkhavihārīti appakenapi pāpena dukkhavihārī. Bhāvitakāyotiādīhi
analyzed: dutiye atta bhāve vipākam na deti iti bahukam pana vipākam kim eva  dassati iti adhippāyaḥ abhāvita kāyaḥ ti ādīhi kāya bhāvanā rahitaḥ vaṭṭa gāmī puthujjanaḥ dassitaḥ  parittoti paritta guṇo appātumoti ātumā vuccati atta bhāvo tasmin mahante api guṇa paritta tāya  appa dukkha vihārī iti appakena api pāpena dukkha vihārī bhāvita kāyaḥ ti ādīhi
translated: It is experienced in this very life. “Even a little is not seen”: even a little is not seen in the second existence. The meaning is: it does not give its result in the second existence even to the extent of a little. “How much more so a great deal?” The intention is: how much more so a great deal of result? “One who is undeveloped in body” and so on refers to the worldling who is devoid of the development of the body and who goes on revolving in the round of rebirths.

original: khīṇāsavo dassito. So hi kāyānupassanāsaṅkhātāya kāyabhāvanāya bhāvitakāyo nāma.
analyzed: khīṇāsavaḥ dassitaḥ saḥ hi kāya anupassanā saṅkhātāya kāya bhāvanāya bhāvita kāyaḥ nāma
translated: “Limited” means limited in good qualities. “Limited in life” : “life” is a term for the individual existence. Because of the limitation of good qualities even in a great individual existence, he is “limited in life.” “One who dwells in little suffering” : one who dwells in suffering even because of a little evil. “One who is developed in body” and so on refers to the one whose cankers are destroyed. For he is called “one who is developed in body” because of the development of the body called contemplation of the body.

original: Kāyassa vā vaḍḍhitattā bhāvitakāyo. Bhāvitasīloti vaḍḍhitasīlo. Sesapadadvayepi eseva
analyzed: kāyassa vā vaḍḍhita ttā bhāvita kāyaḥ bhāvita sīlo ti vaḍḍhita sīlo sesa pada dvaye pi esā eva
translated: Or he is “one who is developed in body” because of the increase of the body. “One who is developed in virtue” means one who is increased in virtue. The same method applies to the other two terms.

original: nayo. Pañcadvārabhāvanāya vā bhāvitakāyo. Etena indriyasaṃvarasīlaṃ vuttaṃ, bhāvitasīloti
analyzed: pañca dvāra bhāvanāya vā bhāvita kāyaḥ etena indriya saṃvara sīlam vuttam bhāvita sīlaḥ ti
translated: Or he is “one who is developed in body” because of the development of the five doors. By this he is said to be one who is restrained by virtue of the control of the faculties.

original: iminā sesāni tīṇi sīlāni. Aparittoti na parittaguṇo. Mahattoti attabhāve parittepi🔽guṇamahantatāya mahatto. Appamāṇavihārīti khīṇāsavassetaṃ nāmameva. So hi pamāṇakarānaṃ
analyzed: iminā sesāni tīṇi sīlāni aparittoti na paritta guṇaḥ atta bhāve paritte api  guṇa mahantatāya mahattaḥ appamāṇa vihārī iti khīṇāsavassa etam nāmam eva saḥ hi
translated: “Unbounded”: not of limited excellence. “Great”: great in the excellence of its individual essence, though the individual essence is limited.

original: rāgādīnaṃ abhāvena appamāṇavihārī nāma.
analyzed: rāga ādīnam abhāvena appamāṇavihārī nāma
translated: “One who dwells unbounded”: this is a name only for one whose cankers are destroyed. For he is called “one who dwells unbounded” because of the absence in him of lust, etc., which are the bounds.

original: Paritteti khuddake. Udakamallaketi udakasarāve. Orabbhikoti urabbhasāmiko. Urabbhaghātakoti🔽sūnakāro. Jāpetuṃ vāti dhanajāniyā jāpetuṃ. Jhāpetuntipi pāṭho, ayamevattho. Yathāpaccayaṃ🔽vā kātunti yathā icchati, tathā kātuṃ. Urabbhadhananti eḷakaagghanakamūlaṃ. So panassa🔽sace icchati, deti. No ce icchati, gīvāyaṃ gahetvā nikkaḍḍhāpeti. Sesaṃ vuttanayeneva
analyzed: paritta iti khuddake udaka mallaka iti udaka sarāve orabbhiko uti urabbha sāmiko urabbha ghātako iti  sūna kāraḥ jāpetum vāti dhana jāniyā jāpetum jhāpetum ipi pāṭhaḥ ayam eva atthaḥ yathāpaccayam  vā kātunti yathā icchati tathā kātum urabbha dhanam ti eḷaka agghanaka mūlam saḥ panassa  sace icchati deti no ce icchati gīvāyam gahetvā nikkaḍḍhāpeti sesam vutta nayena iva
translated: “Limited”: small. “A water-purifying gem”: a gem that purifies water. “A goat-herder”: one who tends goats. “A goat-killer”: a butcher.🔽“To make him mutter”: to make him mutter a spell. The reading jhāpetuṃ is also allowable, with the meaning “to make him recite.” “According to his requirements”: according to his wishes.

original: veditabbaṃ. Imasmiṃ pana sutte vaṭṭavivaṭṭaṃ kathitanti.🔽10. Paṃsudhovakasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: veditabbam imasmim pana sutte vaṭṭa vivaṭṭam kathitan ti 🔽paṃsudhovaka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: “A goat-price”: the price of a goat. If he wishes, he gives it to him. If he does not wish, he takes him by the neck and throws him out. The rest should be understood in the way already stated. But in this sutta the round and the revolution are stated.

original: 102. Dasame dhovatīti vikkhāleti. Sandhovatīti suṭṭhu dhovati, punappunaṃ dhovati.🔽Niddhovatīti niggaṇhitvā dhovati. Aniddhantakasāvanti anīhatadosaṃ anapanītakasāvaṃ.
analyzed: dasame dhovati iti vikkhāleti sandhovati iti suṭṭhu dhovati punappunam dhovati  niddhovati iti niggaṇhitvā dhovati an iddhanta kasāvanti an īhata dosam an apanīta kasāvam
translated: 102.In the tenth, he washes: he washes it by rubbing. He rinses: he rinses it well, he rinses it again and again.🔽He cleans: he cleans it by removing. Not having removed the stain: not having removed the fault of not having been washed.

original: Pabhaṅgūti pabhijjanasabhāvaṃ, adhikaraṇīyaṃ ṭhapetvā muṭṭhikāya pahaṭamattaṃ bhijjati.
analyzed: pabhaṅgū iti pabhijjana sabhāvam adhikaraṇīyam ṭhapetvā muṭṭhikāya pahaṭa mattam bhijjati
translated: Fragile: liable to break up, it breaks up as soon as it is tapped with the hand, without being put to any test.

original: Paṭṭikāyāti suvaṇṇapaṭṭakāya. Gīveyyaketi gīvālaṅkāre.
analyzed: paṭṭikāya ati suvaṇṇa paṭṭakāya gīveyyaka iti gīvā alaṅkāre
translated: A gold plate: a gold leaf. A necklace: an ornament for the neck.

original: Adhicittanti samathavipassanācittaṃ. Anuyuttassāti bhāventassa. Sacetasoti cittasampanno.
analyzed: adhicittam ti samatha vipassanā cittam anuyuttassa ati bhāventassa sacetasā iti citta sampannaḥ
translated: Higher consciousness: the consciousness of serenity and insight. Intent upon: developing. Wise: endowed with consciousness.

original: Dabbajātikoti paṇḍitajātiko. Kāmavitakkādīsu kāme ārabbha uppanno vitakko kāmavitakko.🔽Byāpādavihiṃsasampayuttā vitakkā byāpādavihiṃsavitakkā nāma. Ñātivitakkādīsu “amhākaṃ
analyzed: dabba jātiko ti paṇḍita jātiko kāma vitakka ādīsu kāme ārabbha uppannaḥ vitakkaḥ kāma vitakkaḥ  byāpāda vihiṃsa sampayuttāḥ vitakkāḥ byāpāda vihiṃsa vitakkāḥ nāma ñāti vitakka ādīsu amhākam
translated: Of good birth: of good breed. As regards the kinds of thought beginning with lust, the thought that arises in regard to sensual desires is called lustful thought.

original: ñātakā bahū puññavantā”tiādinā nayena ñātake ārabbha uppanno vitakko ñātivitakko.
analyzed: ñātakā bahū puññavantā ati ādinā nayena ñātake ārabbha uppannaḥ vitakkaḥ ñāti vitakkaḥ
translated: The thought associated with ill will and cruelty is called respectively thoughts of ill will and cruelty. As regards the kinds of thought beginning with thoughts of kinsmen, the thought that arises in regard to kinsmen in the way beginning “Our kinsmen are many and powerful” is called thought of kinsmen.

original: “Asuko janapado khemo subhikkho”tiādinā nayena janapadamārabbha uppanno vitakko janapadavitakko.
analyzed: asukaḥ janapadaḥ khemaḥ subhikkho ti ādinā nayena janapadam ārabbha uppannaḥ vitakkaḥ janapada vitakkaḥ
translated: The thought that occurs in the way beginning, “That country is safe and has good harvests” is the thought about the country.

original: “Aho vata maṃ pare na avajāneyyu”nti evaṃ uppanno vitakko anavaññattipaṭisaṃyutto
analyzed: aho vata mama pare na avajāneyyun ti evam uppannaḥ vitakkaḥ anavaññatti paṭisaṃyuttaḥ
translated: The thought that occurs thus, “Oh, that others might not despise me!” is the thought connected with non-despising.

original: vitakko nāma. Dhammavitakkāvasissantīti dhammavitakkā nāma dasavipassanupakkilesavitakkā.🔽So hoti samādhi na ceva santoti so avasiṭṭhadhammavitakko vipassanāsamādhi avūpasantakilesattā
analyzed: vitakkaḥ nāma dhamma vitakkā avasissanti iti dhamma vitakkāḥ nāma dasa vipassanu pakkilesa vitakkā  saḥ hoti samādhi na ca iva santo ti so avasiṭṭha dhamma vitakkaḥ vipassanā samādhi a vūpasanta kilesa ttā
translated: The thought called “thought about ideas” is the ten kinds of thought that are defilements of insight.🔽That concentration is neither peaceful nor sublime, not a blissful state of mental absorption, nor a ground for the development of concentration: that remaining thought about ideas, which is insight concentration, is not peaceful because it does not tranquillize defilements,🔽it is not sublime because it is not a state of bliss,🔽it is not a blissful state of mental absorption because it is not a state of bliss that is a mental absorption,

original: santo na hoti. Na paṇītoti na atappako. Nappaṭippassaddhiladdhoti na kilesapaṭippassaddhiyā🔽laddho. Na ekodibhāvādhigatoti na ekaggabhāvappatto. Sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagatoti
analyzed: santaḥ na hoti na paṇītaḥ ti na atappakaḥ na paṭippassaddhi laddho ti na kilesa paṭippassaddhiyā  laddhaḥ na eka udi bhāva adhigataḥ iti na ekagga bhāva ppatto sa saṅkhāra niggayha vārita gataḥ iti
translated: it is not a ground for the development of concentration because it is not a state of mental absorption.🔽It is reached by surmounting the perception of village, etc.,🔽It is reached by surmounting the perception of town, the perception of city, the perception of human being, and the perception of continuity.

original: sasaṅkhārena sappayogena kilese niggaṇhitvā vāretvā vārito, na kilesānaṃ chinnante
analyzed: sa saṅkhārena sa payogena kilese niggaṇhitvā vāretvā vāritaḥ na chinnante
translated: It is reached by surmounting the perception of earth, the perception of water, the perception of fire, the perception of air, the perception of the base consisting of infinite space, the perception of the base consisting of infinite consciousness, the perception of the base consisting of nothingness, and the perception of the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽It is reached by surmounting the perception of the seen, the perception of the heard, the perception of the sensed, and the perception of the cognized.

original: uppanno, kilese pana vāretvā uppanno.
analyzed: uppannaḥ kilese pana vāretvā uppannaḥ
translated: It is reached by surmounting the perception of the heavenly, the perception of the divine, and the perception of the noble.🔽It is reached by surmounting the perception of what is seen, heard, sensed, or cognized, and of what is encountered, sought, and favored by mind.🔽It is reached by surmounting the perception of the world, the perception of beings, the perception of life, the perception of a person, the perception of an individual, the perception of an embodied being, the perception of an observer, the perception of one who causes to see, the perception of one who knows, and the perception of one who causes to know.

original: Hoti so, bhikkhave, samayoti ettha samayo nāma utusappāyaṃ āhārasappāyaṃ senāsanasappāyaṃ
analyzed: hoti saḥ bhikkhave samayaḥ ti ettha samayaḥ nāma utu sappāyam āhāra sappāyam senāsana sappāyam
translated: “Bhikkhus, there is the possibility that a person here might attain Nibbana.” Here, “possibility” is a term for the suitability of the season, the suitability of the climate, the suitability of the place,

original: puggalasappāyaṃ dhammassavanasappāyanti imesaṃ pañcannaṃ sappāyānaṃ paṭilābhakālo.
analyzed: puggala sappāyam dhammassavana sappāyanti imesam pañcannam sappāyānam paṭilābha kālo
translated: “There comes a time, bhikkhus, when that is so”: here the “time” is the occasion for obtaining the five kinds of requisites, namely, the requisite of robe-material, the requisite of alms food, the requisite of lodging, the requisite of medicine, and the opportunity to hear the Dhamma.🔽“The mind becomes internally steady”: it becomes steady in oneself.

original: Yaṃ taṃ cittanti yasmiṃ samaye taṃ vipassanācittaṃ. Ajjhattaṃyeva santiṭṭhatīti attaniyeva
analyzed: yam tam cittam ti yasmin samaye tam vipassanā cittam ajjhattaṃyā iva santiṭṭhati iti
translated: For what is one’s own is called “internal” here. The object of the mind is also one’s own, but that is not intended here. The meaning is that it becomes steady in the single object of nibbana, having abandoned the diversity of objects.🔽“It becomes unified and concentrated”: it becomes unified and concentrated in nibbana.🔽“It becomes serene”: it becomes serene through the serenity of the jhana factors.🔽“It becomes purified”: it becomes purified through the purification of the jhana factors.🔽“It becomes bright”: it becomes bright through the brightness of the jhana factors.

analyzed: tiṭṭhati niyaka jjhattam hi idha ajjhattam nāma gocara jjhattam pi vaṭṭati puthutta ārammaṇam  pahāya ekasmin nibbāna gocareya iva tiṭṭhati iti vuttam hoti san nisīdati iti suṭṭhu nisīdati

original: Ekodi hotīti ekaggaṃ hoti. Samādhiyatīti sammā ādhiyati. Santotiādīsu paccanīkakilesavūpasamena🔽santo. Atappakaṭṭhena paṇīto. Kilesapaṭippassaddhiyā laddhattā paṭippassaddhaladdho.

translated: In the eleventh case also, “higher consciousness” is concentration and insight. “Three reasons”: three causes.

original: Kālena kālanti kāle kāle, yuttakāleti attho. Kālena kālaṃ samādhinimittaṃ manasikātabbantiādīsu
analyzed: kālena kālanti kāle kāle yutta kāleti attho kālena kālam samādhi nimittam manasikātabba ntiādīsu
translated: “At the appropriate time”: at the right time, is the meaning. In the passages beginning, “The sign of concentration should be given attention from time to time” ,

original: taṃ taṃ kālaṃ sallakkhetvā ekaggatāya yuttakāle ekaggatā manasikātabbā. Ekaggatā
analyzed: tam tam kālam sallakkhetvā ekagga tāya yutta kāle ekagga tā manasikātabbā ekagga tā
translated: after discerning that this or that time is the right time for unification, unification should be given attention at the right time for unification.

original: hi idha samādhinimittanti vuttā. Tatra vacanattho – samādhiyeva nimittaṃ samādhinimittaṃ.
analyzed: hi idha samādhi nimittanti vuttā tatra vacana atthaḥ samādhiyā iva nimittam samādhi nimittam
translated: For unification is called “the sign of concentration” here. The word-meaning is this: the sign of concentration is the sign that is concentration .

original: Sesapadadvayepi eseva nayo. Paggahoti pana vīriyassa nāmaṃ, upekkhāti majjhattabhāvassa.
analyzed: sesa pada dvaye pi esā iva nayo paggaho ti pana vīriyassa nāmam upekkhāti majjhatta bhāvassa
translated: The same method of explanation applies to the other two terms. “Restraint” is a name for energy. “Equanimity” is the state of neutrality.

original: Tasmā vīriyassa yuttakāle vīriyaṃ manasikātabbaṃ, majjhattabhāvassa yuttakāle majjhattabhāve
analyzed: tasmai vīriyassa yutta kāle vīriyam manasikātabbam majjhatta bhāvassa yutta kāle majjhatta bhāve
translated: So at the right time for energy energy should be given attention, and at the right time for neutrality the mind should be placed in neutrality.

original: ṭhātabbanti. Ṭhānaṃ taṃ cittaṃ kosajjāya saṃvatteyyāti kāraṇaṃ vijjati yena taṃ cittaṃ
analyzed: ṭhātabbanti ṭhānam tam cittam kosajjāya saṃvatteyya ati kāraṇam vijjati yena tam cittam
translated: “There is a possibility that the mind will become slack” : there is a cause for the mind to become slack.

original: kosajjabhāve tiṭṭheyya. Itaresupi eseva nayo. Upekkhānimittaṃyeva manasi kareyyāti
analyzed: kosajja bhāve tiṭṭheyya itaresu pi esa iva nayaḥ upekkhā nimittam yā iva manasi kareyya ati
translated: He should attend to the sign of equanimity:

analyzed: ettha ca ñāṇa javam upekkheyya iti ayam atthaḥ āsavānam khayāya ati arahatta phala atthāya  ukkam bandheyya ati aṅgāraka pallam sajjeyya ālimpeyya tattha aṅgāre pakkhipitvā

original: aggiṃ datvā nāḷikāya dhamanto aggiṃ gāhāpeyya. Ukkāmukhe pakkhipeyyāti aṅgāre viyūhitvā
analyzed: aggim da tvā nāḷikāya dhamantaḥ aggim gāhāpeyya ukkā mukhe pakkhipeyya ati aṅgāre viyūhitvā

original: aṅgāramatthake vā ṭhapeyya, mūsāya vā pakkhipeyya. Ajjhupekkhatīti pakkāpakkabhāvaṃ upadhāreti.
analyzed: aṅgāra matthake vā ṭhapeyya mūsāya vā pakkhipeyya ajjhupekkhati iti pakka apakka bhāvam upadhāreti

original: Sammā samādhiyati āsavānaṃ khayāyāti arahattaphalatthāya sammā ṭhapīyati. Ettāvatā🔽hi vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattappatto bhikkhu dassito. Idāni tassa khīṇāsavassa
analyzed: sammā āsavānam khayāya ati arahatta phala atthāya sammā ṭhapīyati ettāvatā  hi vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahatta ppattaḥ bhikkhu dassitaḥ idāni tassa khīṇāsavassa
translated: He is rightly concentrated for the destruction of cankers: he is rightly concentrated for the fruit of arahantship.

original: abhiññāya paṭipadaṃ dassento yassa yassa cātiādimāha. Taṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: abhiññāya paṭipadam dassentaḥ yassa yassa ca atiādim āha tam heṭṭhā vutta nayena iva veditabbam
translated: For by this time the bhikkhu has reached arahantship by developing insight to that degree. Now, showing the path to the direct knowledges of one whose cankers are destroyed, he said, “Whichever of these states” and so on. That should be understood in the way already stated .

original: 107. Catutthe sāmaññatthanti catubbidhaṃ ariyaphalaṃ. Itaraṃ tasseva vevacanaṃ. Sāmaññatthena
analyzed: catutthe sāmañña tthan ti catubbidham ariya phalam itaram tassa iva vevacanam sāmañña tthena
translated: The meaning of recluseship: the four noble fruitions. The other is a synonym for that.

original: vā cattāro maggā, brahmaññatthena cattāri phalāni. Imesu pana catūsupi suttesu khandhalokova kathito.🔽5. Ruṇṇasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vā cattāraḥ maggāḥ brahmaññatthena cattāri phalāni imesu pana catūsu pi suttesu khandha lokaḥ uva kathito  ruṇṇa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: Or, by the meaning of recluseship the four paths, and by the meaning of brahminhood the four fruitions. But in all these four suttas only the world of aggregates is spoken of.🔽The explanation of the sutta on talk.

original: 108. Pañcamaṃ atthuppattiyā nikkhittaṃ. Katarāya atthuppattiyā? Chabbaggiyānaṃ anācāre.
analyzed: pañcamam atthuppattiyā nikkhittam katarāya atthuppattiyā chabbaggiyānam anācāre
translated: The fifth was delivered in response to a need. What was the need? The misconduct of the group of six.

original: Te kira gāyantā naccantā hasantā vicariṃsu. Bhikkhū dasabalassa ārocayiṃsu. Satthā
analyzed: te kira gāyantā naccantā hasantā vicariṃsu bhikkhū dasabalassa ārocayiṃsu satthā
translated: They were said to have wandered about singing, dancing, and laughing. The bhikkhus reported this to the One of Ten Powers. The Teacher

original: te pakkosāpetvā tesaṃ ovādatthāya idaṃ suttaṃ ārabhi. Tattha ruṇṇanti roditaṃ. Ummattakanti🔽ummattakakiriyā. Komārakanti kumārakehi kattabbakiccaṃ. Dantavidaṃsakahasitanti dante🔽dassetvā pāṇiṃ paharantānaṃ mahāsaddena hasitaṃ. Setughāto gīteti gīte vo paccayaghāto
analyzed: te pakkosāpetvā tesam ovāda tthāya idam suttam ārabhi tattha ruṇṇanti roditam ummattakanti  ummattaka kiriyā komārakanti kumārakehi kattabba kiccam danta vidaṃsaka hasitanti dante  dassetvā pāṇim paharantānam mahā saddena hasitam setu ghātaḥ gīta iti gīte vo paccaya ghātaḥ
translated: and he had them summoned and he began this Thread for the purpose of giving them advice. Herein, weeping is crying.🔽foolishness is

original: hotu, sahetukaṃ gītaṃ pajahathāti dīpeti. Naccepi eseva nayo. Alanti yuttaṃ. Dhammappamoditānaṃ
analyzed: hotu sa hetukam gītam pajahatha ati dīpeti nacce pi esā iva nayaḥ alanti yuttam dhamma ppamoditānam
translated: foolish behaviour. Boyishness is the sort of thing done by boys. Teeth-showing, hand-clapping laughter is laughter with a great noise by those who show their teeth and slap their hands. 1 A bridge-breaking song is a song that will be a condition for your destruction; it shows that you should abandon singing with a reason. The same method applies to dancing.2 Suitable is fitting.

original: satanti ettha dhammo vuccati kāraṇaṃ, kenacideva kāraṇena pamuditānaṃ santānaṃ. Sitaṃ🔽sitamattāyāti tasmiṃ sitakāraṇe sati yaṃ sitaṃ karotha, taṃ vo sitamattāya aggadante
analyzed: ettha dhammaḥ vuccati kāraṇam kenacid eva kāraṇena pamuditānam santānam sitam  sita mattāya ati tasmin sita kāraṇe sati yam sitam karotha tam vaḥ sita mattāya aggadante
translated: Satisfied with the delight of the True Idea is here a cause is what is meant. With the satisfaction is with the satisfaction that is the cause of that satisfaction.

original: dassetvā pahaṭṭhākāramattadassanāyayeva yuttanti vuttaṃ hoti.🔽6. Atittisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dassetvā pahaṭṭha ākāra matta dassanāyayā iva yuttanti vuttam hoti  atitti sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The mere satisfaction is the mere showing of the satisfaction that you do when that cause of satisfaction is present. It is as if you were to show your best teeth and merely show the gesture of clapping your hands. This is what is meant.🔽The Discourse on Satisfaction

original: 109. Chaṭṭhe soppassāti niddāya. Paṭisevanāya natthi tittīti yathā yathā paṭisevati,
analyzed: chaṭṭhe soppassāti niddāya paṭisevanāya natthi tittīti yathā yathā paṭisevati
translated: In the sixth case, with sleep is with drowsiness. There is no satisfaction in enjoyment is that the more one enjoys, the more one wants.

original: tathā tathā ruccatiyevāti titti nāma natthi. Sesapadadvayepi eseva nayo. Sace hi🔽mahāsamudde udakaṃ surā bhaveyya, surāsoṇḍo ca maccho hutvā nibbatteyya, tassa tattha
analyzed: tathā tathā titti nāma natthi sesa pada dvaye pi esa iva nayo sace hi  mahā samudde udakam surā bhaveyya surā soṇḍo ca macchaḥ hutvā nibbatteyya tassa tattha
translated: and he would not be satisfied. The same method applies to the other two similes. For if the water in the ocean were to become liquor, and if a fish were to be born there with a taste for liquor, it would not be satisfied even with that.

original: carantassapi sayantassapi titti nāma na bhaveyya. Imasmiṃ sutte vaṭṭameva kathitaṃ.
analyzed: carantassa api sayantassa api titti nāma na bhaveyya imasmin sutte vaṭṭam eva kathitam
translated: There is no such thing as satisfaction. The same method applies to the other two terms. For if the water in the ocean were to become liquor, and if a fish were to be reborn there as a drunkard, then even as it roams about and sleeps there, there would be no satisfaction for it. In this sutta only the round is mentioned.

original: 7. Arakkhitasuttavaṇṇanā🔽110. Sattame avassutaṃ hotīti tintaṃ hoti. Na bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hotīti apāye paṭisandhipaccayatāya🔽na laddhakaṃ hoti. Kālakiriyāti tasseva vevacanaṃ. Sukkapakkhe sagge paṭisandhipaccayatāya
analyzed: arakkhita sutta vaṇṇanā  sattame avassutam hoti iti tintam hoti na bhaddakam maraṇam hoti iti apāye paṭisandhi paccaya tāya  na laddhakam hoti kāla kiriyā ti tassa iva vevacanam sukka pakkhe sagge paṭisandhi paccaya tāya
translated: The explanation of the Arakkha Sutta🔽In the seventh sutta, “it is not good” means it is not pure. “It is not a good death” means that it is not a good death because it is a condition for rebirth in the states of deprivation.

original: bhaddakaṃ hoti laddhakaṃ. Taṃ pana ekantena sotāpannādīnaṃ tiṇṇaṃ ariyasāvakānaṃyeva
analyzed: bhaddakam hoti laddhakam tam pana ekantena sotāpanna ādīnam tiṇṇam ariyasāvakānam yeva
translated: “Death” is a synonym for that. In the bright fortnight, because it is a condition for rebirth in the heavenly world, it is good, it is a good death. But that applies only to the three noble disciples who are stream-enterers and so on.

original: vaṭṭati. Sesamettha uttānamevāti.
analyzed: vaṭṭati sesam ettha uttānam eva ati
translated: The rest is clear.

original: 8. Byāpannasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: byāpanna sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Byapana Sutta

original: 111. Aṭṭhame byāpannanti pakatibhāvaṃ jahitvā ṭhitaṃ. Sesaṃ purimasutte vuttanayameva.
analyzed: aṭṭhame byāpannanti pakati bhāvam jahitvā ṭhitam sesam purima sutte vutta nayam eva
translated: In the eighth sutta, “it is extended” means that it is not in its normal state. The rest is in the same way as in the previous sutta.

original: 9. Paṭhamanidānasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: 9. The first on source

original: 112. Navame nidānānīti kāraṇāni. Kammānaṃ samudayāyāti vaṭṭagāmikammānaṃ piṇḍakaraṇatthāya.
analyzed: navame nidānāni iti kāraṇāni kammānam samudayāya ati vaṭṭa gāmi kammānam piṇḍa karaṇa tthāya
translated: In the ninth the source is the reason. For the arising of kamma : for the making of a mass of kamma that leads to renewed existence.

original: Lobhapakatanti lobhena pakataṃ. Sāvajjanti sadosaṃ. Taṃ kammaṃ kammasamudayāya saṃvattatīti🔽taṃ kammaṃ aññesampi vaṭṭagāmikammānaṃ samudayāya piṇḍakaraṇatthāya saṃvattati. Na
analyzed: lobha pakatam ti lobhena pakatam sa āvajjanti sa dosam tat kammam kamma samudayāya saṃvattati iti  tam kammam aññesam pi vaṭṭa gāmi kammānam samudayāya piṇḍa karaṇa tthāya saṃvattati na
translated: Rooted in greed: made by greed. Reprehensible: with hate. That kamma leads to the arising of kamma : that kamma leads to the making of a mass of kamma that leads to renewed existence.

original: taṃ kammaṃ kammanirodhāyāti taṃ pana kammaṃ vaṭṭagāmikammānaṃ nirodhatthāya na saṃvattati.🔽Sukkapakkhe kammānaṃ samudayāyāti vivaṭṭagāmikammānaṃ samudayatthāya. Iminā nayena
analyzed: tam kammam kamma nirodhāya ati tam pana kammam vaṭṭa gāmi kammānam nirodha tthāya na saṃvattati  sukka pakkhe kammānam samudayāya ati vivaṭṭa gāmi kammānam samudaya tthāya iminā nayena
translated: Not to the cessation of kamma : but that kamma does not lead to the cessation of kamma that leads to renewed existence.

original: sabbaṃ atthato veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: sabbam atthataḥ veditabbam
translated: For the arising of kamma in the bright side : for the arising of kamma that leads to the unwinding of the round. The meaning should be understood in all cases in this way.

original: 10. Dutiyanidānasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya nidāna sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: 10. The second on source

original: 113. Dasame kammānanti vaṭṭagāmikammānameva. Chandarāgaṭṭhāniyeti chandarāgassa kāraṇabhūte.
analyzed: dasame kammānanti vaṭṭa gāmi kammānam eva chanda rāga ṭṭhāniyā iti chanda rāgassa kāraṇa bhūte
translated: In the tenth kamma is kamma that leads to renewed existence. A footing for will and lust : a cause for will and lust.

original: Ārabbhāti āgamma sandhāya paṭicca. Chandoti taṇhāchando. Yo cetaso sārāgoti yo cittassa
analyzed: ārabbha ati āgamma sandhāya paṭicca chando ti taṇhā chandaḥ yaḥ cetaso sārāgaḥ iti yo cittassa
translated: In dependence on : having come to, having taken as a basis. Will : craving-will. What is in the heart’s core : what is in the mind’s core.

original: rāgo rajjanā rajjitattaṃ, etamahaṃ saṃyojanaṃ vadāmi, bandhanaṃ vadāmīti attho. Sukkapakkhe🔽kammānanti vivaṭṭagāmikammānaṃ. Tadabhinivattetīti taṃ abhinivatteti. Yadā vā tena
analyzed: rāgaḥ rajjanā etam aham saṃyojanam vadāmi bandhanam vadāmi iti attho sukka pakkhe  kammānanti vivaṭṭa gāmi kammānam tat abhinivatteti iti tam abhinivatteti yadā vā tena
translated: Greed is the state of being greedy, the state of being attached. The meaning is that I call it a fetter and a bondage.🔽In the bright fortnights: in the fortnights that lead to the turning of the wheel of existence.🔽He turns to that: he turns to it. Or else,

original: vipāko ñāto hoti vidito, tadā te ceva dhamme tañca vipākaṃ abhinivatteti. Iminā ca
analyzed: vipākaḥ ñātaḥ hoti viditaḥ tadā te ca iva dhamme tam ca vipākam abhinivatta iti iminā ca
translated: when the result has been known and recognized by him, then he turns to those states and to their result.

original: padena vipassanā kathitā, tadabhinivattetvāti iminā maggo. Cetasā abhinivijjhitvāti
analyzed: padena vipassanā kathitā tat abhinivattetvā ati iminā maggaḥ cetasā abhinivijjhitvā ati
translated: By this word insight is meant. By “having turned to that” the path is meant. By “having pierced it with the mind”

original: iminā ca maggova. Paññāya ativijjha passatīti saha vipassanāya maggapaññāya nibbijjhitvā
analyzed: iminā ca maggaḥ uva paññāya ativijjha passati iti saha vipassanāya magga paññāya nibbijjhitvā
translated: the path is also meant. By “having pierced it well with wisdom he sees” is meant that he sees having pierced it with the path-wisdom together with insight.

original: passati. Evaṃ sabbattha attho veditabbo. Imasmiṃ pana sutte vaṭṭavivaṭṭaṃ kathitanti.
analyzed: passati evam sabbattha atthaḥ veditabbaḥ imasmin pana sutte vaṭṭa vivaṭṭam kathitan ti
translated: This is how the meaning should be understood in each case. But in this sutta the turning of the wheel of existence is stated.

original: Sambodhavaggo paṭhamo.
analyzed: sambodha vaggo paṭhamaḥ
translated: The first chapter is finished.

original: (12) 2. Āpāyikavaggo
analyzed: āpāyika vaggaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Depravities

original: 1. Āpāyikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: āpāyika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Sutta on the Depravities

original: 114. Dutiyassa paṭhame apāyaṃ gacchissantīti āpāyikā. Nirayaṃ gacchissantīti nerayikā.
analyzed: dutiyassa paṭhame apāyam gacchissanti iti āpāyikā nirayam gacchissanti iti nerayikā
translated: They go to the depravities: they go to the bad destinations. They go to hell: they go to the hells.

original: Idamappahāyāti idaṃ brahmacāripaṭiññatādiṃ pāpadhammattayaṃ avijahitvā. Brahmacāripaṭiññoti
analyzed: idam appahāya ati idam brahmacāri paṭiñña tā ādim pāpa dhamma ttayam a vijahitvā brahmacāri paṭiñño ti
translated: “Having not abandoned that”: without having abandoned that evil state consisting in the pretence of celibacy, etc. “Pretending to be celibate”:

original: brahmacāripaṭirūpako, tesaṃ vā ākappaṃ avijahanena “ahampi brahmacārī”ti evaṃpaṭiñño.🔽Anuddhaṃsetīti akkosati paribhāsati codeti. Natthi kāmesu dosoti kilesakāmena vatthukāme🔽sevantassa natthi doso. Pātabyatanti pivitabbataṃ paribhuñjitabbataṃ nirāsaṅkena
analyzed: brahmacāri paṭirūpako tesam vai ākappam a vijahanena aham pi brahmacārī iti evaṃpaṭiññaḥ  an uddhaṃseti iti akkosati paribhāsati codeti na atthi kāmesu doso ti kilesa kāmena vatthu kāme  sevantassa na atthi doso pātabyatanti pivitabbatam paribhuñjitabbatam nirāsaṅkena
translated: pretending to be celibate, or pretending to be celibate by not abandoning the pretence of celibacy.🔽“He does not accuse”: he does not revile, does not censure, does not admonish. “There is no fault in sensual pleasures”: there is no fault in the enjoyment of sensual pleasures by one who is defiled by sensual lust,

original: cittena pipāsitassa pānīyapivanasadisaṃ paribhuñjitabbataṃ. Imasmiṃ sutte vaṭṭameva kathitaṃ.
analyzed: cittena pipāsitassa pānīya pivana sadisam paribhuñjitabba tam imasmim sutte vaṭṭam eva kathitam
translated: or by one who is defiled by lust for the objects of sensual pleasure. “They are to be used without hesitation”: they are to be used without doubt, as if drinking water when one is thirsty. In this sutta only the round of rebirths is mentioned.

original: 2. Dullabhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dullabha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The discourse on the difficult to do

original: 115. Dutiye kataññū katavedīti “iminā mayhaṃ kata”nti tena katakammaṃ ñatvā viditaṃ pākaṭaṃ katvā paṭikaraṇakapuggalo.
analyzed: dutiye kataññū kata vedī iti iminā mayham katam ti tena kata kammam ñatvā viditam pākaṭam katvā paṭikaraṇaka puggalaḥ
translated: . In the second discourse, one who knows what has been done and is grateful is a person who, having known, having understood, having made clear to himself, “This has been done for me,” repays the favor.

original: 3. Appameyyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: appameyya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The discourse on the immeasurable

original: 116. Tatiye sukhena metabboti suppameyyo. Dukkhena metabboti duppameyyo. Pametuṃ
analyzed: tatiye sukhena metabbā iti suppameyyaḥ dukkhena metabbā iti duppameyyaḥ pametum
translated: . In the third discourse, “to be measured with ease” is to be measured with pleasure; “to be measured with difficulty” is to be measured with pain. To be measured

original: na sakkotīti appameyyo. Unnaḷoti uggatanaḷo, tucchamānaṃ ukkhipitvā ṭhitoti attho.
analyzed: na sakkoti iti appameyyaḥ unnaḷo ti uggata naḷo tuccha mānam ukkhipitvā ṭhitaḥ
translated: He cannot, thus he is immeasurable. He is puffed up: he is swollen with conceit, the meaning is, he stands with his head held high.

original: Capaloti pattamaṇḍanādinā cāpallena samannāgato. Mukharoti mukhakharo. Vikiṇṇavācoti🔽asaññatavacano. Asamāhitoti cittekaggatārahito. Vibbhantacittoti bhantacitto bhantagāvibhantamigasappaṭibhāgo.
analyzed: capalo ti patta maṇḍana ādinā cāpallena samannāgataḥ mukharo ti mukha kharaḥ  asaññata vacanaḥ asamāhitaḥ ti citta ekagga tā rahitaḥ vibbhanta cittaḥ ti bhanta cittaḥ
translated: He is fickle: he is endowed with fickleness, such as the adorning of his bowl, etc. He is garrulous: he is a chatterer. He is a prattler:

original: Pākatindriyoti vivaṭindriyo. Sesamettha uttānamevāti.🔽4. Āneñjasuttavaṇṇanā🔽117. Catutthe tadassādetīti taṃ jhānaṃ assādeti. Taṃ nikāmetīti tadeva pattheti.🔽Tena ca vittiṃ āpajjatīti tena jhānena tuṭṭhiṃ āpajjati. Tatra ṭhitoti tasmiṃ jhāne🔽ṭhito. Tadadhimuttoti tattheva adhimutto. Tabbahulavihārīti tena bahulaṃ viharanto.🔽Sahabyataṃ upapajjatīti sahabhāvaṃ upapajjati, tasmiṃ devaloke nibbattatīti attho.
analyzed: vivaṭ indriyaḥ sesam ettha uttānam eva ati 🔽āneñja sutta vaṇṇanā 🔽catutthe tat assādeti iti tam jhānam assādeti tam nikāmeti iti tat eva pattheti 🔽tena ca vittim āpajjati iti tena jhānena tuṭṭhim āpajjati tatra ṭhitaḥ ti tasmim jhāne 🔽ṭhitaḥ tad adhimutto ti tattha iva adhimuttaḥ tad bahula vihārī iti tena bahulam viharantaḥ 🔽sahabyatam upapajjati iti sahabhāvam upapajjati tasmin deva loke nibbattati iti attho
translated: he is one whose speech is unrestrained. He is not concentrated: he is devoid of one-pointedness of mind. He is of divided mind: he is of distracted mind, a counterpart of a cow or deer that strays from its path.

original: Nirayampi gacchatītiādi nirayādīhi avippamuttattā aparapariyāyavasena tattha gamanaṃ🔽sandhāya vuttaṃ. Na hi tassa upacārajjhānato balavataraṃ akusalaṃ atthi, yena anantaraṃ
analyzed: nirayam pi gacchati itiādi niraya ādīhi a vippamutta ttā apara pariyāya vasena tattha gamanam  sandhāya vuttam na hi tassa upacāra jjhānataḥ balavataram akusalam atthi yena anantaram
translated: “He goes to hell” and so on is said with reference to his going there in the future, since he is not free from hell, etc.🔽For there is no unprofitable state stronger than access jhāna by which he could be reborn in an unhappy destination immediately afterwards.

original: apāye nibbatteyya. Bhagavato pana sāvakoti sotāpannasakadāgāmianāgāmīnaṃ aññataro.
analyzed: apāye bhagavataḥ pana sāvako ti sotāpanna sakadāgāmi anāgāmīnam aññataro
translated: “A disciple of the Blessed One” is one of the stream-enterers, once-returners, and non-returners.

original: Tasmiṃyeva bhaveti tattheva arūpabhave. Parinibbāyatīti appaccayaparinibbānena parinibbāyati.
analyzed: tasmin yeva bhaveti tattha iva arūpa bhave parinibbāyati iti appaccaya parinibbānena parinibbāyati
translated: “In that very same state of existence” is in that same immaterial state of existence. “Attains Nibbāna”: he attains Nibbāna by the Nibbāna element without trace left.

original: Adhippayāsoti adhikappayogo. Sesamettha vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ. Imasmiṃ pana sutte
analyzed: adhippayāsaḥ ti adhika ppayogo sesam ettha vutta nayena iva veditabbam imasmim pana sutte
translated: “With a strong inclination”: with a strong application. The rest should be understood in the way already stated.

original: puthujjanassa upapattijjhānaṃ kathitaṃ, ariyasāvakassa tadeva upapattijjhānañca vipassanāpādakajjhānañca kathitaṃ.
analyzed: puthujjanassa upapatti jhānam kathitam ariyasāvakassa tat eva upapatti jhānañca vipassanā pādaka jhānañca kathitam
translated: But in this sutta the jhāna of the ordinary man is stated, and that of the noble disciple is stated as jhāna that is a basis for insight.

original: 5. Vipattisampadāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vipatti sampadā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the fifth sutta

original: 118. Pañcame sīlavipattīti sīlassa vipannākāro. Sesadvayepi eseva nayo. Natthi dinnanti
analyzed: pañcame sīla vipatti iti sīlassa vipanna ākāro sesa dvaye pi esa eva nayaḥ natthi dinnanti
translated: In the fifth sutta the “failure in virtue” is the failure of virtue. The same method of explanation applies in the other two cases. “There is no gift”

original: dinnassa phalābhāvaṃ sandhāya vadati. Yiṭṭhaṃ vuccati mahāyogo. Hutanti paheṇakasakkāro
analyzed: dinnassa phala abhāvam sandhāya vadati yiṭṭham vuccati mahā yogaḥ hutanti paheṇaka sakkāro
translated: He speaks with reference to the non-existence of the fruit of what is given. “What is given” is a great gift. “What is offered” is a gift of respect.

original: adhippeto. Tampi ubhayaṃ phalābhāvameva sandhāya paṭikkhipati. Sukatadukkaṭānanti
analyzed: tam pi ubhayam phala abhāvam eva sandhāya paṭikkhipati su kata dukkaṭānam ti
translated: He rejects both of these with reference to the non-existence of the fruit. “Good and bad actions”

original: sukatadukkatānaṃ, kusalākusalānanti attho. Phalaṃ vipākoti yaṃ phalanti vā vipākoti
analyzed: su kata dukkatānam kusala akusalānam ti attho phalam vipāko ti yam phalanti vā
translated: means good and bad actions, wholesome and unwholesome actions, is the meaning. “The fruit, the result”

translated: “He goes” means he goes, he proceeds. “The witless one” means the unwise one. In this sutta only the round is spoken of,

analyzed: gāthāsu vaṭṭa vivaṭṭam sattame vaṭṭam eva bhāsitam

original: 8. Dutiyaanuruddhasuttavaṇṇanā🔽131. Aṭṭhame idaṃ te mānasminti ayaṃ te navavidhena vaḍḍhitamānoti attho. Idaṃ te
analyzed: dutiya anuruddha sutta vaṇṇanā  aṭṭhame idam te mānasmin ti ayam te navavidhena vaḍḍhita māno ti atthaḥ idam te

original: 9. Paṭicchannasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: paṭicchanna sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . Commentary on the Paṭicchanna Sutta

original: Vivaṭo virocatīti ettha ekato ubhato attato sabbatthakatoti catubbidhā vivaṭatā veditabbā.
analyzed: vivaṭaḥ virocati iti ettha ekatas ubhatas attataḥ sabbatthakato ti catubbidhā vivaṭa tā veditabbā

original: Tattha ekato vivaṭaṃ nāma asādhāraṇasikkhāpadaṃ. Ubhato vivaṭaṃ nāma sādhāraṇasikkhāpadaṃ.
analyzed: tattha ekatas vivaṭam nāma asādhāraṇa sikkhāpadam ubhatas vivaṭam nāma sādhāraṇa sikkhāpadam
translated: Herein, what is open on one side is a training precept not common to both. What is open on both sides is a training precept common to both.

original: Attato vivaṭaṃ nāma paṭiladdhadhammaguṇo. Sabbatthakavivaṭaṃ nāma tepiṭakaṃ buddhavacanaṃ.
analyzed: vivaṭam nāma paṭiladdha dhamma guṇo sabbatthakavivaṭam nāma tepiṭakam buddha vacanam
translated: What is open on one’s own side is a special quality of the Dhamma that has been obtained. What is open everywhere is the Buddha’s word in the three Piṭakas.

original: 10. Lekhasuttavaṇṇanā🔽133. Dasame abhiṇhanti abhikkhaṇaṃ nirantaraṃ. Āgāḷhenāti gāḷhena kakkhaḷena. Pharusenāti

analyzed: pharusa vacanena gāḷham katvā pharusam katvā vuccamānaḥ api iti atthaḥ amanāpena ati manam  an allīyantena a vaḍḍhantena sandhiyatim eva ati ghaṭiyatiyā iva saṃsandatim eva ati
translated: In the tenth , “constantly” means uninterruptedly. “With a deep” means with a deep, that is, a harsh, voice. “With a harsh” means with a harsh speech. The meaning is that he speaks as if he were speaking deeply and harshly. “With what is disagreeable” means with what is not pleasing,

original: hoti. Sammodatimevāti ekībhāvameva gacchati. Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānamevāti.
analyzed: hoti ekībhāvam eva gacchati sesam sabbattha uttānam eva ati

translated: The Explanation of the Thread on the Warrior-Noble

original: 134. Catutthassa paṭhame yuddhaṃ upajīvatīti yodhājīvo. Rājārahoti rañño anucchaviko.
analyzed: catutthassa paṭhame yuddham upajīvati iti yodhājīvaḥ rājā araho ti raññaḥ anucchaviko

analyzed: viya ca avassam icchitabba ttā aṅganti saṅkhyam gacchati dūre pātī hoti iti udake usabha mattam  thale aṭṭhusabha mattam tatas vā dūre kaṇḍam pāta iti

translated: “Form” and so on are explained in detail in the Visuddhimagga. “This is not mine” and so on is said in order to reject craving, conceit, and views. “He sees with right wisdom” means he sees with right cause, with the wisdom of the path together with insight. “He shatters” means he shatters with the path of arahantship.

original: 4. Uppādāsuttavaṇṇanā
translated: . The Discourse on Arising🔽In the fourth, “the stability of the Dhamma” is the stability of the nature . “The regularity of the Dhamma” is the regularity of the nature .

analyzed: kesakambala sutta vaṇṇanā  pañcame tantāvutānam vatthānam ti paccatte sāmi vacanam tantehi vāyita vatthāni iti  attho kesa kambalo ti manussa kesehi vāyita kambalo puthu samaṇa brāhmaṇa vādānam ti idam pi

original: Paṭibāhatīti paṭisedheti. Khippaṃ uḍḍeyyāti kuminaṃ oḍḍeyya. Chaṭṭhasattamāni uttānatthāneva.

analyzed: assakhaḷuṅka sutta vaṇṇanā

translated: In the eighth sutta, “a wild colt” means a young horse. “This is his speed” means this is his speed of knowledge.

original: vadāmi. Idamassa vaṇṇasmiṃ vadāmīti ayamassa guṇavaṇṇoti vadāmi. Idamassa ārohapariṇāhasminti🔽ayamassa uccabhāvo parimaṇḍalabhāvoti vadāmīti.
analyzed: vadāmi idam assa vaṇṇasmiṃ vadāmi iti ayam assa guṇa vaṇṇo ti vadāmi idam assa āroha pariṇāhasmin ti  ayam assa ucca bhāvo parimaṇḍala bhāvo ti vadāmi iti
translated: I say this is his height and his roundness.

original: 9. Assaparassasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: assa parassa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Explanation of the Horse-Dealer Simile

original: 142. Navame assaparasseti assesu parasse. Purisaparasseti purisesu parasse, purisapuriseti

translated: In the ninth, the horse-dealer’s: the horse-dealer’s is the horse-dealer’s. The man-dealer’s: the man-dealer’s is the man-dealer’s. The man-man’s: the man-man’s is the man-man’s.

original: attho. Imasmiṃ sutte tīṇi maggaphalāni kathitāni. Tattha ayaṃ tīhi maggehi ñāṇajavasampannoti veditabbo.
analyzed: attho imasmin sutte tīṇi magga phalāni kathitāni tattha ayam tīhi maggehi ñāṇa java sampannaḥ ti veditabbo
translated: In this sutta three paths and fruits are spoken of. Herein, he should be understood as endowed with knowledge and swiftness by means of the three paths.

original: 10. Assājānīyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: assājānīya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Explanation of the Thoroughbred Horse Simile

original: 143. Dasame bhadreti bhaddake. Assājānīyeti kāraṇākāraṇaṃ jānanake asse. Purisājānīyesupi
analyzed: dasame bhadra iti bhaddake assājānīya iti kāraṇa akāraṇam jānanake asse
translated: In the tenth, the thoroughbred horse: the thoroughbred horse is the thoroughbred horse. The thoroughbred man: the thoroughbred man is the thoroughbred man.

original: eseva nayo. Imasmiṃ sutte arahattaphalaṃ kathitaṃ. Tatrāyaṃ arahattamaggena ñāṇajavasampannoti veditabbo.
analyzed: esa iva nayaḥ imasmim sutte arahatta phalam kathitam tatra ayam arahatta maggena ñāṇa java sampannaḥ ti veditabbo
translated: The same method applies here. In this sutta the fruit of arahantship is spoken of. Herein, he should be understood as endowed with knowledge and swiftness by means of the path of arahantship.

original: 11. Paṭhamamoranivāpasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: paṭhama mora nivāpa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The First Discourse on the Deer Park in Bārāṇasī

original: 144. Ekādasame accantaniṭṭhoti antaṃ atikkantaniṭṭho, akuppaniṭṭho dhuvaniṭṭhoti attho. Sesaṃ sadisameva.
analyzed: ekādasame accanta niṭṭho ti antam atikkanta niṭṭho akuppa niṭṭho dhuva niṭṭho ti attho sesam sadisam eva
translated: In the eleventh, “one who has gone to the further shore” is one who has gone beyond the end, gone to the unprovoked, gone to the unchangeable, is the meaning. The rest is the same.

original: 12. Dutiyamoranivāpasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya mora nivāpa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the second Moranivāpa Sutta is finished.

original: 145. Dvādasame iddhipāṭihāriyenāti ijjhanakapāṭihāriyena. Ādesanāpāṭihāriyenāti ādisitvā apadisitvā kathanaanukathanakathāpāṭihāriyena.

translated: In the twelfth, “by means of the miracle of supernormal power” is by means of the miracle of success. “By means of the miracle of telepathy” is by means of the miracle of reading thoughts.

original: 13. Tatiyamoranivāpasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tatiya mora nivāpa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the third Moranivāpa Sutta is finished.

original: 146. Terasame sammādiṭṭhiyāti phalasamāpattatthāya sammādiṭṭhiyā. Sammāñāṇenāti phalañāṇena.
analyzed: terasame sammādiṭṭhiyā ati phala samāpatta tthāya sammādiṭṭhiyā sammāñāṇena ati phala ñāṇena
translated: In the thirteenth, “by means of right view” is by means of right view for the attainment of the fruit. “By means of right knowledge” is by means of the knowledge of the fruit.

original: Sammāvimuttiyāti sesehi phalasamāpattidhammehi. Imesu tīsupi suttesu khīṇāsavova kathitoti.
analyzed: sammāvimuttiyā ti sesehi phala samāpatti dhammehi imesu tīsu pi suttesu khīṇāsavaḥ eva kathito ti
translated: “By means of right deliverance” is by means of the remaining states that are factors of the attainment of the fruit. In these three Suttas the one who has destroyed the taints is spoken of.

original: Yodhājīvavaggo catuttho.
analyzed: yodhājīva vaggo catuttho
translated: The fourth sub-chapter on the Householder Warrior is finished.

original: (15) 5. Maṅgalavaggo

translated: The commentary on the Akusalasutta, etc.

original: sāvajjenāti sadosena. Tatiye visamenāti sapakkhalanena. Samenāti apakkhalanena. Catutthe
analyzed: sa avajjena ati sa dosena tatiye visamena ati sa pakkhalanena samena ati a pakkhalanena catutthe
translated: With what is blameworthy: with what is blameable. In the third, with what is uneven: with what is unevenly sloping. With what is even: with what is evenly sloping. In the fourth,

original: asucināti gūthasadisena aparisuddhena amejjhena. Sucināti parisuddhena mejjhena.
analyzed: a sucināti gūtha sadisena a parisuddhena a mejjhena sucināti parisuddhena mejjhena
translated: With what is foul: with what is impure, unclean, like excrement. With what is fair: with what is pure, clean, like gold.

original: Pañcamādīni uttānāneva.🔽10. Pubbaṇhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pañcama ādīni uttānān eva  pubbaṇha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The fifth and the rest are self-evident.🔽The explanation of the first sutta in the Middle Length

original: 156. Dasame sunakkhattantiādīsu yasmiṃ divase tayo sucaritadhammā pūritā honti, so
analyzed: dasame su nakkhatta nti ādīsu yasmin divase tayo su carita dhammā pūritāḥ honti so
translated: . In the tenth, Sunakkhatta, etc.: on whatever day the three kinds of good conduct are fulfilled, that day is called a day with a good conjunction of stars,

original: divaso laddhanakkhattayogo nāma, tenassa sadā sunakkhattaṃ nāma hotīti vuccati. Sveva🔽divaso katamaṅgalo nāma hoti, tenassa sadā sumaṅgalanti vuccati. Pabhātampissa sadā
analyzed: divasaḥ laddha nakkhatta yogaḥ nāma tena assa sadā su nakkhattam nāma hoti iti vuccati su eva  divaso katamaṅgalaḥ nāma hoti tena assa sadā su maṅgalanti vuccati pabhātam pi ssa sadā
translated: and so it is said that he always has a good star. That same day is called a day with a good omen,

original: suppabhātameva, sayanato uṭṭhānampi suhuṭṭhitameva, khaṇopi sukkhaṇova, muhuttopi
analyzed: su pabhātam eva sayanataḥ uṭṭhānam pi suhuṭṭhitam eva khaṇaḥ api su khaṇā uva muhuttaḥ pi
translated: and so it is said that he always has a good omen. His dawn is always a good dawn, his rising from his bed is always a good rising, his moment is always a good moment, his instant is always a good instant. And here a period of ten years is called a moment,

original: sumuhuttova. Ettha ca dasaccharapamāṇo kālo khaṇo nāma, tena khaṇena dasakkhaṇo kālo
analyzed: ettha ca dasa chara pamāṇaḥ kālaḥ khaṇaḥ nāma tena khaṇena dasa kkhaṇaḥ kālaḥ
translated: and a period of ten moments is called a day.

original: layo nāma, tena layena ca dasalayo kālo khaṇalayo nāma, tena dasaguṇo muhutto nāma,
analyzed: layaḥ nāma tena layena ca dasa layaḥ kālo khaṇa layaḥ nāma tena dasaguṇaḥ muhutto nāma
translated: “A day” is the time reckoned as ten “moments” of that kind. “A moment” is the time reckoned as ten “seconds”.

original: tena dasaguṇo khaṇamuhutto nāmāti ayaṃ vibhāgo veditabbo. Suyiṭṭhaṃ brahmacārisūti
analyzed: tena dasaguṇaḥ khaṇa muhuttaḥ nāma ati ayam vibhāgaḥ veditabbaḥ brahmacāri su ti
translated: “A second” is the time reckoned as ten “moments”. This is the analysis to be known.

original: yasmiṃ divase tīṇi sucaritāni pūritāni, tadāssa seṭṭhacārīsu dinnadānaṃ suyiṭṭhaṃ🔽nāma hoti. Padakkhiṇaṃ kāyakammanti taṃ divasaṃ tena kataṃ kāyakammaṃ vaḍḍhikāyakammaṃ
analyzed: yasmin divase tīṇi su caritāni pūritāni tadā assa seṭṭha cārīsu dinna dānam  nāma hoti padakkhiṇam kāya kammanti tam divasam tena katam kāya kammam vaḍḍhi kāya kammam
translated: “The life of one chaste” : on the day on which the three good conduct are fulfilled, the gift given on that day is called “well-placed”.🔽“The right bodily action” : the bodily action done on that day is called “the increased bodily action”. The same method applies to the rest of the terms.

original: nāma hoti. Sesapadesupi eseva nayo. Padakkhiṇāni katvānāti vaḍḍhiyuttāni kāyakammādīni🔽katvā. Labhantatthe padakkhiṇeti padakkhiṇe vaḍḍhiattheyeva labhati. Sesaṃ uttānamevāti.
analyzed: nāma hoti sesa padesu pi esa iva nayo padakkhiṇāni vaḍḍhi yuttāni kāya kamma ādīni  katvā labhanta atthe padakkhiṇā iti padakkhiṇe vaḍḍhi atthe iya iva labhati sesam uttānam eva ati
translated: “Having done the right” : having done the increased bodily action, etc.

original: Maṅgalavaggo pañcamo.🔽Tatiyapaṇṇāsakaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.🔽(16) 6. Acelakavaggavaṇṇanā🔽157-163. Ito paresu āgāḷhā paṭipadāti gāḷhā kakkhaḷā lobhavasena thiraggahaṇā. Nijjhāmāti
analyzed: maṅgala vaggo pañcamaḥ 🔽tatiya paṇṇāsakam niṭṭhitam 🔽acelaka vagga vaṇṇanā 🔽itas paresu āgāḷhā paṭipadā ati gāḷhā kakkhaḷā lobha vasena thira gahaṇā nijjhāmā ati
translated: “One finds the right in the right place” : one finds the increase in the right place. The rest is clear.

original: attakilamathānuyogavasena suṭṭhu jhāmā santattā paritattā. Majjhimāti neva kakkhaḷā🔽na jhāmā majjhe bhavā. Acelakoti niccelo naggo. Muttācāroti vissaṭṭhācāro, uccārakammādīsu🔽lokiyakulaputtācārena virahito ṭhitakova uccāraṃ karoti, passāvaṃ karoti, khādati
analyzed: atta kilamatha anuyoga vasena suṭṭhu jhāmā santattā paritattā majjhimā ati na iva kakkhaḷā  na jhāmā majjhe bhavā acelako ti niccelaḥ naggaḥ mutta ācāro ti vissaṭṭha ācāraḥ uccāra kamma ādīsu  lokiya kula putta ācārena virahitaḥ uccāram karoti passāvam karoti khādati
translated: He is “emaciated” because he has emaciated himself well by undertaking the practice of self-mortification. “Medium” means neither hard nor soft. “Naked” means he is always naked. “Unrestricted in his conduct” means he is unrestricted in his conduct, he is devoid of the conduct of a noble clansman in such things as defecating and urinating. Standing, he defecates and urinates.

original: bhuñjati. Hatthāpalekhanoti hatthe piṇḍamhi niṭṭhite jivhāya hatthaṃ apalekhati,🔽uccārampi katvā hatthasmiṃyeva daṇḍakasaññī hutvā hatthena apalekhati. Bhikkhāya🔽gahaṇatthaṃ “ehi, bhadante”ti vutto na etīti na ehibhadantiko. “Tena hi tiṭṭha, bhante”ti🔽vuttopi na tiṭṭhatīti na tiṭṭhabhadantiko. Tadubhayampi kira so “etassa vacanaṃ kataṃ
analyzed: bhuñjati hattha apalekhano ti hatthe piṇḍamhi niṭṭhite jivhāya hattham apalekhati  uccāram pi katvā hatthasmiṃ yeva daṇḍaka saññī hutvā hatthena apalekhati bhikkhāya  gahaṇa attham ehi bhadanta iti vuttaḥ na eti iti na ehibhadantiko tena hi tiṭṭha bhante iti  vuttaḥ api na tiṭṭhati iti na tiṭṭha bhadantiko tat ubhayam pi kira saḥ etassa vacanam katam
translated: He is “emaciated” because he has emaciated himself well by the practice of mortifying and tormenting himself. “Medium” means neither rough nor emaciated. “Naked” means he is always naked. “Unmannerly” means he is unmannerly in his conduct, and he does not refrain from such things as defecating in the presence of the venerable ones. He defecates and urinates standing up, and he eats and drinks standing up. “He licks his hands” means that when the ball of rice is finished in his hand, he licks his hand with his tongue.

original: bhavissatī”ti na karoti. Abhihaṭanti puretaraṃ gahetvā āhaṭabhikkhaṃ. Uddissakatanti
analyzed: bhavissati iti na karoti abhihaṭanti puretaram gahetvā āhaṭa bhikkham
translated: After defecating, he thinks that his hand is a stick, and he licks his hand. “He does not say ‘Come,’ ” means that when he is told “Come, venerable sir,” he does not come in order to receive alms. “He does not say ‘Stay,’ ” means that when he is told “Stay, venerable sir,” he does not stay. It is said that he does not do either of these things because he thinks “He will do what he said he would do.” “Alms brought back” means alms that are brought back after being received earlier.

original: idaṃ tumhe uddissa katanti evamārocitabhikkhaṃ. Nimantananti “asukaṃ nāma kulaṃ vā
analyzed: idam tumhe uddissa katanti evam ārocita bhikkham nimantananti asukam nāma kulam vā
translated: “Almsfood announced” is almsfood announced thus, “This is for you.”

original: vīthiṃ vā gāmaṃ vā paviseyyāthā”ti evaṃ nimantitabhikkhampi na sādiyati na gaṇhāti.
analyzed: vīthim vā gāmam vā paviseyyātha ati evam nimantita bhikkham pi na sādiyati na gaṇhāti
translated: “An invitation” is an invitation to enter a village, street, or town, “Go and enter such-and-such a village, street, or town.”

original: Na kumbhimukhāti kumbhito uddharitvā dīyamānaṃ bhikkhampi na gaṇhāti. Na kaḷopimukhāti
analyzed: na kumbhi mukhā ati kumbhitaḥ uddharitvā dīyamānam bhikkham pi na gaṇhāti na kaḷopi mukhā ati
translated: “Not from a pot” is almsfood given after taking it out of a pot. He does not accept that either. “Not from a dish” is

original: kaḷopīti ukkhali vā pacchi vā, tatopi na gaṇhāti. Kasmā? “Kumbhikaḷopiyo maṃ nissāya
analyzed: kaḷopī iti ukkhali vā pacchi vā tatas api na gaṇhāti kasmā kumbhi kaḷopiyaḥ mam nissāya
translated: “Dish” is a cooking pot or a frying pan. He does not accept from that either. Why not? “The pot and dish will get a blow with the ladle through me.”

original: kaṭacchunā pahāraṃ labhantī”ti. Na eḷakamantaranti ummāraṃ antaraṃ katvā dīyamānaṃ
analyzed: kaṭacchunā pahāram labhanti iti na eḷakam antaranti ummāram antaram katvā dīyamānam
translated: “Not across the threshold” is almsfood given after putting it across the door bar.

original: na gaṇhāti. Kasmā? “Ayaṃ maṃ nissāya antarakaraṇaṃ labhatī”ti. Daṇḍamusalesupi eseva
analyzed: na gaṇhāti kasmai ayam mam nissāya antara karaṇam labhati iti daṇḍa musalesu pi esā iva
translated: He does not accept that either. Why not? “This will get a place to stand in through me.” The same explanation applies to “not across a sword-blade” and “not across a pestle.”

original: nayo. Dvinnanti dvīsu bhuñjamānesu ekasmiṃ uṭṭhāya dente na gaṇhāti. Kasmā? Kabaḷantarāyo hotīti.
analyzed: dvīsu bhuñjamānesu ekasmin uṭṭhāya dente na gaṇhāti kasmai kabaḷantarāyaḥ hoti iti
translated: “Not from two” is almsfood given by one of two people who are eating. He does not accept that either. Why not? “It would be an obstacle to the mouthful.”

original: Na gabbhiniyātiādīsu pana gabbhiniyā kucchiyaṃ dārako kilamati, pāyantiyā dārakassa
analyzed: na gabbhiniyā ati ādīsu pana gabbhiniyā kucchiyam dārako kilamati pāyantiyā dārakassa
translated: “Not from a pregnant woman” and the rest: in the case of a pregnant woman, the child in the womb is afflicted; in the case of a woman giving suck, the child’s affliction is caused by the milk.

original: khīrantarāyo hoti, purisantaragatāya ratiantarāyo hotīti na gaṇhāti. Na saṅkittīsūti
analyzed: khīra antarāyaḥ hoti purisa antara gatāya rati antarāyaḥ hoti iti na gaṇhāti na saṅkittīsu uti
translated: He does not take it because it would be an obstacle to the milk, and because it would be an obstacle to the pleasure of a woman in the enjoyment of a man.

original: saṅkittetvā katabhattesu. Dubbhikkhasamaye kira acelakasāvakā acelakānaṃ atthāya🔽tato tato taṇḍulādīni samādapetvā bhattaṃ pacanti, ukkaṭṭhācelako tato na paṭiggaṇhāti.🔽Na yattha sāti yattha sunakho “piṇḍaṃ labhissāmī”ti upaṭṭhito hoti, tattha tassa
analyzed: kata bhattesu dubbhikkha samaye kira acelaka sāvakāḥ acelakānam atthāya  tato tato taṇḍula ādīni samādapetvā bhattam pacanti ukkaṭṭha ācelakaḥ tatas na paṭiggaṇhāti  na yattha sā ati yattha su nakhaḥ piṇḍam labhissāmi iti upaṭṭhitaḥ hoti tattha tassa
translated: Not from a group: from those who have cooked a meal after collecting requisites.🔽It seems that on the occasion of a famine the lay followers of the naked ascetics collected rice, etc.,🔽and cooked a meal for them. The strict naked ascetic did not accept it.

original: adatvā āhaṭaṃ na gaṇhāti. Kasmā? Etassa piṇḍantarāyo hotīti. Saṇḍasaṇḍacārinīti samūhasamūhacārinī.
analyzed: a datvā āhaṭam na gaṇhāti kasmai etassa piṇḍa antarāyaḥ hoti iti saṇḍa saṇḍa cārinī iti samūha samūha cārinī
translated: Not where a dog is waiting: he does not take what is brought without giving to a place where he is waiting, thinking, “I shall get alms.” Why not? Because it would be an obstacle to his alms.🔽In a scattered way: in a scattered, scattered way.

original: Sace hi acelakaṃ disvā “imassa bhikkhaṃ dassāmā”ti manussā bhattagehaṃ pavisanti,
analyzed: sace hi acelakam disvā imassa bhikkham dassāma ati manussāḥ bhatta geham pavisanti
translated: For if people see a naked ascetic and think, “We shall give alms to him,”🔽and go into the house to fetch the alms,

original: tesu ca pavisantesu kaḷopimukhādīsu nilīnā makkhikā uppatitvā saṇḍasaṇḍā caranti,
analyzed: tesu ca pavisantesu kaḷopi mukha ādīsu nilīnāḥ makkhikāḥ uppatitvā saṇḍasaṇḍā caranti
translated: while they are doing so flies settle on the food and crawl all over it.

original: tato āhaṭaṃ bhikkhaṃ na gaṇhāti. Kasmā? “Maṃ nissāya makkhikānaṃ gocarantarāyo jāto”ti.
analyzed: tatas āhaṭam bhikkham na gaṇhāti kasmā mam nissāya makkhikānam gocara antarāyaḥ jātaḥ ti
translated: He does not take the alms brought out, thinking, “The flies have had access to the food because of me.”

original: Thusodakanti sabbasassasambhārehi katasovīrakaṃ. Ettha ca surāpānameva sāvajjaṃ,
analyzed: thusodakam ti sabba sassa sambhārehi katasovīrakam ettha ca surā pānam eva sāvajjam
translated: Thus-water: thus-juice made with all kinds of fruit. And here only the surā and the maireya are blameworthy,🔽but this bhikkhu regards all of them as blameworthy.

original: ayaṃ pana sabbesu sāvajjasaññī. Ekāgārikoti yo ekasmiṃyeva gehe bhikkhaṃ labhitvā
analyzed: ayam pana sabbesu sāvajja saññī ekāgāriko ti yaḥ ekasmiṃ yeva gehe bhikkham labhitvā
translated: One-house : one who, having received alms at one house,

original: nivattati. Ekālopikoti ekeneva ālopena yāpeti. Dvāgārikādīsupi eseva nayo. Ekissāpi
analyzed: nivattati ekālopikaḥ ti ekena iva ālopena yāpeti dvāgārika ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ ekissa api
translated: turns back. One-resting-place : one who gets on with one resting-place. The same method applies to the two-house, etc.

original: dattiyāti ekāya dattiyā. Datti nāma ekā khuddakapāti hoti, yattha aggabhikkhaṃ pakkhipitvā
analyzed: dattiyā ati ekāya dattiyā datti nāma ekā khuddaka pāti hoti yattha agga bhikkham pakkhipitvā
translated: One-alms-food : one who lives on one alms-food. Alms-food is a small bowl in which they keep the chief alms and which they give to one who asks for one alms-food.

original: ṭhapenti. Ekāhikanti ekadivasantarikaṃ. Addhamāsikanti addhamāsantarikaṃ. Pariyāyabhattabhojananti
analyzed: ṭhapenti ekāhikanti eka divasa antarikam addhamāsikanti addha māsa antarikam pariyāya bhatta bhojananti
translated: One-session : one who takes his food in one session. Half-month : one who takes it every half-month.

original: vārabhattabhojanaṃ, ekāhavārena dvīhavārena sattāhavārena addhamāsavārenāti evaṃ
analyzed: vāra bhatta bhojanam ekāha vārena dvīha vārena sattāha vārena addha māsa vārena ati evam
translated: As-available-food : food obtained by begging round once a day, once in two days, once in seven days, once a fortnight,

original: divasavārena ābhatabhattabhojanaṃ. Sākabhakkhotiādīni vuttatthāneva.
analyzed: divasa vārena ābhata bhatta bhojanam sākabhakkha uti ādīni vutta tthāni eva
translated: and so on. The root meaning of the words root-food, etc., is given in the Description of the Earth Kasiṇa .

original: Ubbhaṭṭhakoti uddhaṃ ṭhitako. Ukkuṭikappadhānamanuyuttoti ukkuṭikavīriyamanuyutto,
analyzed: ubbhaṭṭhako ti uddham ṭhitakaḥ ukkuṭika ppadhāna manuyutto ti ukkuṭika vīriya manuyutto
translated: Standing : standing all the time. Practising the squatting posture : practising the posture of energy.

original: gacchantopi ukkuṭikova hutvā uppatitvā uppatitvā gacchati. Kaṇṭakāpassayikoti ayakaṇṭake🔽vā pakatikaṇṭake vā bhūmiyaṃ koṭṭetvā tattha cammaṃ attharitvā ṭhānacaṅkamādīni karoti.🔽Seyyanti sayantopi tattheva seyyaṃ kappeti. Sāyaṃ tatiyamassāti sāyatatiyakaṃ. Pāto🔽majjhanhike sāyanti divasassa tikkhattuṃ “pāpaṃ pavāhessāmī”ti udakorohanānuyogaṃ anuyutto viharati.
analyzed: gacchantaḥ api ukkuṭikaḥ uva hutvā uppatitvā uppatitvā gacchati kaṇṭakāpassayikaḥ ti ayakaṇṭake  vā pakati kaṇṭake vā bhūmiyam koṭṭetvā tattha cammaṃ attharitvā ṭhāna caṅkama ādīni karoti  seyyanti sayantaḥ api tattha iva seyyam kappeti sāyam tatiyam assa ati sāyatatiyakam pāto  majjhanhike sāyanti divasassa tikkhattum pāpam pavāhessāmi iti udakorohana anuyogam anuyuttaḥ viharati
translated: Walking, he walks on tiptoe, jumping up and down. The “thorn-dweller”🔽pricks himself on a metal thorn or a wooden thorn stuck into the ground, and he stands, sits, etc., with his skin stuck to the thorns.🔽The “three-time-shower” bathes in the morning, at midday, and in the evening, or he bathes every three days, or every four days, or every five days, or he limits himself to six or seven or eight or nine or ten showers a month.🔽The “later-shower” bathes in the evening. The “morning-midday-later-shower” bathes in the morning, at midday, and in the evening.🔽
