analyzed: ca āvāha vivāha karaṇa tthāya gacchantā tam eva maggam paṭipannā honti saṃvāsāti sahavāsā
translated: who were going along that same road to attend a wedding. “ Living together” : living together.

original: ekatovāsā. Chavo chavāyāti guṇamaraṇena matattā chavo guṇamaraṇeneva matāya chavāya
analyzed: ekatovāsā chavaḥ chavāya ati guṇa maraṇena chavaḥ guṇa maraṇena iva matāya chavāya
translated: “A corpse with a corpse” : a corpse by the death of virtue with a corpse by the death of virtue.🔽“With a queen” : with one who is a queen by virtue.

original: saddhiṃ. Deviyā saddhinti guṇehi devibhūtāya saddhiṃ. Dussīloti nissīlo. Pāpadhammoti
analyzed: saddhim deviyā saddhinti guṇehi devi bhūtāya saddhim dussīlaḥ iti nissīlaḥ pāpa dhammo ti
translated: “Immoral” : without virtue. “Evil-natured” :

original: lāmakadhammo. Akkosakaparibhāsakoti dasahi akkosavatthūhi akkosako, bhayaṃ dassetvā
analyzed: lāmaka dhammo akkosaka paribhāsakaḥ ti dasahi akkosa vatthūhi akkosakaḥ bhayam dassetvā
translated: of bad nature. “Abusive and violent” : abusive by the ten kinds of abuse and violent by the display of weapons.

original: santajjanena paribhāsako. Evaṃ sabbattha attho veditabbo.
analyzed: santajjanena paribhāsakaḥ evam sabbattha atthaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: The meaning should be understood in all cases.🔽“Stingy” : hard and miserly. “Masters and mistresses” : husbands and wives.

original: Kadariyāti thaddhamaccharino. Jānipatayoti jayampatikā. Vadaññūti yācakānaṃ vacanassa🔽atthaṃ jānanti. Saññatāti sīlasaṃyamena samannāgatā. Dhammajīvinoti dhamme ṭhatvā🔽jīvikaṃ kappentīti dhammajīvino. Atthāsaṃ pacurā hontīti vaḍḍhisaṅkhātā atthā etesaṃ
analyzed: kadariyā ati jāni patayaḥ ti jayampatikā yācakānam vacanassa  attham jānanti saññatā ati sīla saṃyamena samannāgatāḥ dhamma jīvinaḥ ti dhamme ṭhatvā  jīvikam kappenti iti dhamma jīvino atthāsam pacurāḥ honti iti vaḍḍhi saṅkhātāḥ atthāḥ etesam
translated: “Generous” : they know the meaning of the words of those who ask.🔽“Self-controlled” : endowed with virtue and restraint. “Living by the Dhamma” : they make their living by the Dhamma,🔽standing on the Dhamma. “They have abundant wealth” : they have much wealth called “increase.”

original: bahū honti. Phāsukaṃ upajāyatīti aññamaññaṃ phāsuvihāro jāyati. Kāmakāminoti kāme kāmayamānā.🔽4. Dutiyasaṃvāsasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bahū honti phāsukam upajāyati iti aññam aññam phāsu vihāraḥ jāyati kāma kāmino ti kāme kāmayamānā 🔽dutiya saṃvāsa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: “They live happily” : they live in mutual comfort. “They desire sensual pleasures” : they desire sensual desires.

original: 54. Catutthe kammapathavasena desanā pavattitā. Sesaṃ tādisameva. Imesu pana dvīsupi suttesu agārikapaṭipadā kathitā. Sotāpannasakadāgāmīnampi vaṭṭati.
analyzed: catutthe kammapatha vasena desanā pavattitā sesam tādisam eva imesu pana dvīsu pi suttesu agārika paṭipadā kathitā sotāpanna sakadāgāmīnam pi vaṭṭati
translated: The teaching in the fourth is given by way of the ten courses of kamma. The rest is the same as before. And in these two Suttas the lay-people’s way of practice is stated. It is suitable for stream-enterers and once-returners.

original: 5-6. Samajīvīsuttadvayavaṇṇanā
translated: EXPLANATIONS OF THE TWO SUTTAS ABOUT SAMAJĪVĪ

original: 55-56. Pañcame tenupasaṅkamīti kimatthaṃ upasaṅkami? Anuggaṇhanatthaṃ. Tathāgato
analyzed: pañcame tena upasaṅkami iti kimattham upasaṅkami anuggaṇhana attham tathāgataḥ
translated: In the fifth , why did he approach? For the sake of favouring them. For the Tathāgata

original: hi taṃ raṭṭhaṃ pāpuṇanto imesaṃyeva dvinnaṃ saṅgaṇhanatthāya pāpuṇāti. Nakulapitā🔽kira pañca jātisatāni tathāgatassa pitā ahosi, pañca jātisatāni mahāpitā, pañca jātisatāni🔽cūḷapitā. Nakulamātāpi pañca jātisatāni tathāgatassa mātā ahosi, pañca jātisatāni🔽mahāmātā, pañca jātisatāni cūḷamātā. Te satthu diṭṭhakālato paṭṭhāya puttasinehaṃ
analyzed: hi tam raṭṭham pāpuṇantaḥ imesam yeva dvinnam saṅgaṇhana tthāya pāpuṇāti nakula pitā  kira pañca jāti satāni tathāgatassa pitā ahosi pañca jāti satāni mahā pitā pañca jāti satāni  cūḷa pitā nakula mātā api pañca jāti satāni tathāgatassa mātā ahosi pañca jāti satāni  mahāmātā pañca jāti satāni cūḷamātā te satthu diṭṭha kālataḥ paṭṭhāya putta sineham
translated: approaches that country for the sake of favouring just these two. Nakula’s father

original: paṭilabhitvā “hantāta, hantātā”ti vacchakaṃ disvā vacchagiddhinī gāvī viya viravamānā
analyzed: paṭilabhitvā hantāta hantāta ati vacchakam disvā vacchagiddhinī gāvī viravamānā
translated: is said to have been the Tathāgata’s father for five hundred births, his grandfather for five hundred births, and his great-grandfather for five hundred births. And Nakula’s mother was the Tathāgata’s mother for five hundred births, his grandmother for five hundred births, and his great-grandmother for five hundred births. From the time they saw the Master they obtained affection for him as a son, and when they saw a calf they would cry out like a cow whose calf has been taken away from her, saying: “Oh, our dear boy! Oh, our dear boy!”

original: upasaṅkamitvā paṭhamadassaneneva sotāpannā jātā. Nivesane pañcasatānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā paṭhama dassanena iva sotāpannā jātā nivesane pañca satānam bhikkhūnam
translated: and as soon as they saw the Exalted One they became stream-enterers.🔽In their house five hundred seats were always set out for the bhikkhus.

original: āsanāni sadā paññattāneva honti. Iti bhagavā tesaṃ anuggaṇhanatthāya upasaṅkami.
analyzed: āsanāni sadā paññattāni eva honti iti bhagavā tesam anuggaṇhana tthāya upasaṅkami
translated: So the Exalted One went there in order to assist them.

original: Aticaritāti atikkamitā. Abhisamparāyañcāti paraloke ca. Samasaddhāti saddhāya samā
analyzed: aticaritā ati atikkamitā abhisamparāyan ca ati para loke ca sama saddhā ati saddhāya samā
translated: “Transgressed”: exceeded. “In the next world”: in the world beyond. “Equal in faith”: equal in faith,

original: ekasadisā. Sīlādīsupi eseva nayo. Chaṭṭhaṃ kevalaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ desitaṃ. Sesamettha tādisameva.
analyzed: eka sadisā sīla ādīsu pi esā iva nayaḥ chaṭṭham kevalam bhikkhūnam desitam sesam ettha tādisam eva
translated: the same in faith. The same method applies to virtue, etc. The sixth is taught only for bhikkhus. The rest is similar here.

original: 7. Suppavāsāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: suppavāsā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Sutta on Suppavāsa.

original: 57. Sattame pajjanikanti tassa nigamassa nāmaṃ. Koliyānanti kolarājakulānaṃ. Āyuṃ
analyzed: sattame pajjanikam ti tassa nigamassa nāmam koliyānam ti kola rāja kulānam āyum
translated: In the seventh sutta, “Pajjanika” is the name of that town. “Koliyans”: of the Koliya royal family.

original: kho pana datvāti āyudānaṃ datvā. Āyussa bhāginī hotīti āyubhāgapaṭilābhinī hoti,
analyzed: kho pana da tvā ati āyu dānam da tvā āyussa bhāginī hoti iti āyu bhāga paṭilābhinī hoti
translated: “Having given life”: having given a life-gift. “She becomes a sharer of life”: she becomes one who gains a share of life.

original: āyuṃ vā bhajanikā hoti, āyuppaṭilābhinīti attho. Sesapadesupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: āyum vā bhajanikā hoti āyu paṭilābhinī iti attho sesa padesu pi esa eva nayo
translated: Or she is a sharer of life, a gainer of life, is the meaning. The same method applies to the rest of the terms.

original: Rasasā upetanti rasena upetaṃ rasasampannaṃ. Ujjugatesūti kāyavaṅkādirahitattā ujukameva
analyzed: raseṇa upetam rasa sampannam kāya vaṅka ādi rahita ttā ujukam eva
translated: “Endowed with taste”: endowed with taste, possessing good taste. “In the straight-going”: because of being straight, without crookedness of body, etc.

original: gatesu khīṇāsavesu. Caraṇūpapannesūti pañcadasahi caraṇadhammehi samannāgatesu. Mahaggatesūti
analyzed: gatesu khīṇāsavesu caraṇa upapannesu iti pañcadasahi caraṇa dhammehi samannāgatesu mahaggatesu iti
translated: When those who are free from cankers have gone. Who have attained to the goal: who have attained the fifteen qualities of the goal. Who have attained to greatness:

original: mahattaṃ gatesu. Khīṇāsavānaññevetaṃ nāmaṃ. Puññena puññaṃ saṃsandamānāti puññena
analyzed: mahattam gatesu khīṇāsavānam aññā iva etam nāmam puññena puññam saṃsandamānā ati puññena
translated: who have attained to greatness. This is a name for those who are free from cankers. Merit with merit is linked: merit is linked with merit.

original: saddhiṃ puññaṃ ghaṭayamānā. Mahapphalā lokavidūna vaṇṇitāti evarūpā dānasaṅkhātā
analyzed: saddhim puññam ghaṭayamānā mahapphalā vaṇṇitā ati evarūpā dāna saṅkhātā
translated: They are heaped up with merit. Praised by the knowers of the world as fruitful: such giving, called “offering,”

original: dakkhiṇā tividhalokaṃ viditaṃ katvā ṭhitattā lokavidūnaṃ buddhānaṃ vaṇṇitā, buddhehi
analyzed: dakkhiṇā tividha lokam viditam katvā ṭhita ttā loka vidūnam buddhānam vaṇṇitā buddhehi
translated: is praised by the Buddhas, the knowers of the world, who stand firm having known the three worlds. The meaning is: it is approved by the Buddhas.

original: pasatthāti attho. Yaññamanussarantāti yaññaṃ dānaṃ anussarantā. Vedajātāti tuṭṭhijātā.
analyzed: pasatthā ti atthaḥ yaññam anussarantā ati yaññam dānam anussarantā veda jātā ati tuṭṭhi jātā
translated: Remembering the sacrifice: remembering the sacrifice, the giving. Who have become aware: who have become satisfied.

original: 8. Sudattasuttavaṇṇanā🔽58. Aṭṭhame saññatānanti kāyavācāhi saṃyatānaṃ. Paradattabhojinanti parehi dinnameva
analyzed: sudatta sutta vaṇṇanā  aṭṭhame para datta bhojinanti parehi dinnam eva
translated: . Commentary

original: bhuñjitvā yāpentānaṃ. Kālenāti yuttappattakālena. Sakkacca dadātīti sahatthā sakkāraṃ
analyzed: bhuñjitvā yāpentānam kālena ati yuttappatta kālena sakkacca dadāti iti sahatthā sakkāram
translated: Sudatta Sutta: The Buddha’s praise of Sudatta, a wealthy man of Savatthi, for his generosity and for his faith in the Buddha.

original: katvā dadāti. Cattāri ṭhānāni anuppavecchatīti cattāri kāraṇāni anuppaveseti dadāti.
analyzed: katvā dadāti cattāri ṭhānāni anuppavecchati iti cattāri kāraṇāni anuppaveseti dadāti
translated: He gives after having made it. He gives after having brought up the four grounds: he gives after having brought up the four reasons.

original: Yasavā hotīti mahāparivāro hoti. Navamaṃ kevalaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ kathitaṃ. Sesamettha tādisameva.
analyzed: yasavā hoti iti mahā parivāraḥ hoti navamam kevalam bhikkhūnam kathitam sesam ettha tādisam eva
translated: He is famous: he has a great retinue. The ninth is told only of monks. The rest here is the same .

original: 10. Gihisāmīcisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: gihisāmīcisutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the tenth Minor Rule is finished.

original: 60. Dasame gihisāmīcipaṭipadanti gihīnaṃ anucchavikaṃ paṭipattiṃ. Paccupaṭṭhito hotīti atiharitvā dātukāmatāya patiupaṭṭhito hoti upagato, bhikkhusaṅghassa cīvaraṃ detīti attho.
analyzed: dasame gihi sāmīci paṭipadanti gihīnam anucchavikam paṭipattim paccupaṭṭhitaḥ hoti iti atiharitvā dātu kāma tāya pati upaṭṭhitaḥ hoti upagataḥ bhikkhu saṅghassa cīvaram deti iti attho
translated: In the tenth , the way of life in conformity with householders’ means the way of life suitable for householders. He is at their service: he is at their service, he has gone to them, because of his desire to give after having brought it; the meaning is, he gives robe-cloth to the Community of monks.

original: Upaṭṭhitāti upaṭṭhāyako. Tesaṃ divā ca ratto cāti ye evaṃ catūhi paccayehi upaṭṭhahanti,🔽tesaṃ divā ca rattiñca pariccāgavasena ca anussaraṇavasena ca sadā puññaṃ pavaḍḍhati.
analyzed: upaṭṭhitā ati upaṭṭhāyako tesam divā ca ratto ca ati ye evam catūhi paccayehi upaṭṭhahanti  tesam divā ca rattiṃ ca pariccāga vasena ca anussaraṇa vasena ca sadā puññam pavaḍḍhati
translated: He is a supporter: he is a supporter. Of them, day and night: of those who support in this way with the four requisites,🔽their merit increases always by way of giving up and by way of recollection.

original: Saggañca kamatiṭṭhānanti tādiso ca bhaddakaṃ kammaṃ katvā saggaṭṭhānaṃ upagacchati.
analyzed: saggam ca tādiso ca bhaddakam kammam katvā saggaṭṭhānam upagacchati
translated: And he goes to heaven, to a place of happiness: and one like that, after having done good kamma, goes to heaven, to a place of happiness.

original: Imesu catūsupi suttesu āgāriyapaṭipadā kathitā. Sotāpannasakadāgāmīnampi vaṭṭati.
analyzed: imesu catūsu pi suttesu āgāriya paṭipadā kathitā sotāpanna sakadāgāmīnam pi vaṭṭati
translated: In these four suttas the lay life is taught. They are suitable for stream-enterers and once-returners.

original: Puññābhisandavaggo paṭhamo.🔽(7) 2. Pattakammavaggo
analyzed: puñña abhisanda vaggaḥ paṭhamaḥ  pattakammavaggaḥ
translated: The first sub-chapter on the outcome of merit is finished.🔽THE SUB-CHAPTER ON THE RIGHT WAY

original: 1. Pattakammasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pattakamma sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The right way

original: 61. Dutiyassa paṭhame aniṭṭhapaṭikkhepena iṭṭhā. Mane kamanti pavisantīti kantā.
analyzed: dutiyassa paṭhame aniṭṭha paṭikkhepena iṭṭhāḥ mane kamanti pavisanti iti kantā
translated: In the first of the second sub-chapter, the desirable is the opposite of the undesirable.🔽The desirable is what is pleasing, what is delightful.

original: Manaṃ appāyanti pavaḍḍhentīti manāpā. Dullabhāti paramadullabhā. Bhogāti bhuñjitabbā
analyzed: manam appāyanti pavaḍḍhenti iti manāpā dullabhā ati parama dullabhā bhogā ati bhuñjitabbā
translated: The very desirable is what is extremely difficult to obtain.🔽The enjoyments are the objects of enjoyment, such as visible forms, etc.

original: rūpādayo visayā. Sahadhammenāti dhammeneva saddhiṃ uppajjantu, mā dhammūpaghātaṃ
analyzed: rūpa ādayaḥ visayā saha dhammena ati dhammena iva saddhim uppajjantu mā dhamma upaghātam
translated: “Together with the Dhamma” means “may they arise together with the Dhamma, not by destroying the Dhamma,

original: katvā adhammenāti. Athavā sahadhammenāti sakāraṇena, tena tena senāpatiseṭṭhiṭṭhānādikāraṇena
analyzed: katvā adhammena ati athavā sahadhammena ati sa kāraṇena tena tena senāpati seṭṭhi ṭṭhāna ādi kāraṇena
translated: not by the unwholesome.” Or alternatively, “together with the Dhamma” means “together with the reason,” with this or that reason, such as the position of general or treasurer, etc.🔽The meaning is: “may they arise together with that.” “Glory” is the possession of a retinue.

original: saddhiṃyeva uppajjantūti attho. Yasoti parivārasampatti. Saha ñātībhīti ñātakehi
analyzed: saddhiṃyā iva uppajjantu iti atthaḥ yasā iti parivāra sampatti saha ñātībhi iti ñātakehi
translated: “Together with kinsmen” means together with relatives.

original: saddhiṃ. Saha upajjhāyehīti sukhadukkhesu upanijjhāyitabbattā upajjhāyasaṅkhātehi
analyzed: saddhim saha upajjhāyehi iti sukha dukkhesu upanijjhāyitabba ttā upajjhāya saṅkhātehi
translated: “Together with friends” means together with those who are called friends because they should be relied upon in times of happiness and sorrow.

original: sandiṭṭhasambhattehi saddhiṃ.
analyzed: sandiṭṭha sambhattehi saddhim
translated: “Together with those who are dear” means together with those who are dear because they are seen and heard.

original: Akiccaṃ karotīti akātabbaṃ karoti. Kiccaṃ aparādhetīti kattabbayuttakaṃ kiccaṃ akaronto
analyzed: akiccam karoti iti akātabbam karoti kiccam aparādheti iti kattabba yuttakam kiccam akarontaḥ
translated: He does what should not be done: he does what should not be done. He fails in what should be done: he fails in what should be done, in what is suitable to be done.

original: taṃ aparādheti nāma. Dhaṃsatīti patati parihāyati. Abhijjhāvisamalobhanti abhijjhāsaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: tam aparādha iti nāma dhaṃsati iti patati parihāyati abhijjhā visamalobhanti abhijjhā saṅkhātam
translated: He stumbles: he falls, he declines. Covetousness and unjust greed: unjust greed called covetousness.

original: visamalobhaṃ. Pajahatīti nudati nīharati. Mahāpaññoti mahantapañño. Puthupaññoti
analyzed: visama lobham pajahati iti nudati nīharati mahā paññā iti mahanta pañño puthu paññā iti
translated: He abandons: he removes, he takes out. Greatly wise: having great wisdom. Broadly wise:

original: puthulapañño. Āpātadasoti taṃ taṃ atthaṃ āpāteti tameva passati, sukhumampissa atthajātaṃ
analyzed: puthula paññaḥ āpāta dasaḥ ti tam tam attham āpāta iti tam eva passati sukhumam pissa attha jātam
translated: having broad wisdom. He sees what is advantageous: he sees this and that advantage. Even a subtle matter

original: āpātaṃ āgacchatiyevāti attho.
analyzed: āpātam āgacchatiyā iva ati attho
translated: comes to his notice: the meaning is, even a subtle matter comes to his notice.

original: Uṭṭhānavīriyādhigatehīti uṭṭhānasaṅkhātena vīriyena adhigatehi. Bāhābalaparicitehīti
analyzed: uṭṭhāna vīriya adhigatehi iti uṭṭhāna saṅkhātena vīriyena adhigatehi bāhā bala paricitehi iti
translated: By exertion and energy: by what is called exertion and by energy. By the strength of his arms:

original: bāhābalena paricitehi vaḍḍhitehi. Sedāvakkhittehīti avakkhittasedehi, sedaṃ muñcitvā
analyzed: bāhā balena paricitehi vaḍḍhitehi seda avakkhittehi iti avakkhitta sedehi sedam muñcitvā
translated: by the strength of his arms, by his increase. By the sweat of his brow: by the sweat that has been shed.

original: vāyāmena payogena samadhigatehīti attho. Dhammikehīti dhammayuttehi. Dhammaladdhehīti
analyzed: vāyāmena payogena samadhigatehi iti atthaḥ dhammikehi iti dhamma yuttehi dhamma laddhehi iti
translated: By effort and application: the meaning is, by what is gained by effort and by application. By what is righteous: by what is connected with the Dhamma. By what is his own:

original: dasakusalakammapathadhamme akopetvā laddhehi. Pattakammānīti yuttakammāni anucchavikakammāni.
analyzed: dasa kusala kamma patha dhamme a kopetvā laddhehi patta kammāni iti yutta kammāni anucchavika kammāni
translated: and he has acquired them without violating the principles of the ten courses of wholesome kamma.🔽He has done what should be done: he has done what is fitting, what is suitable.🔽He has made them happy: he has made them happy. He has satisfied them: he has satisfied them, made them strong.

original: Sukhetīti sukhitaṃ karoti. Pīṇetīti pīṇitaṃ balasampannaṃ karoti. Ṭhānagataṃ hotīti
analyzed: sukheti iti sukhitam karoti pīṇeti iti pīṇitam bala sampannam karoti ṭhāna gatam hoti iti
translated: He has made them his own: he has made them his own.🔽What is it? In the case of the four kinds of what should be done,🔽what is acquired through wealth is his own only if it is one of the four kinds of what should be done.

original: kāraṇagataṃ hoti. Kiṃ pana tanti? Catūsu pattakammesu ekaṃ bhogehi kattabbakammaṃ
analyzed: kāraṇa gatam hoti kim pana tanti catūsu patta kammesu ekam bhogehi kattabba kammaṃ
translated: What is acquired through virtue is his own only if it is what should be done by virtue.🔽What is acquired through kindness is his own only if it is what should be done by kindness.🔽What is acquired through ability is his own only if it is what should be done by ability.

original: bhogajātameva ṭhānagataṃ. Pattagatanti yuttappattaṭṭhānagataṃ. Āyatanaso paribhuttanti
analyzed: bhoga jātam eva ṭhāna gatam patta gatanti yutta patta ṭṭhāna gatanti
translated: What is acquired through wealth is his own only if it is one of the four kinds of what should be done.

original: kāraṇeneva paribhuttaṃ bhogajātaṃ hoti.🔽Pariyodhāya saṃvattatīti pidahitvā vattati. Yathā aggiādīhi uppannāsu āpadāsu, evaṃ
analyzed: kāraṇena iva paribhuttam bhoga jātam hoti  pariyodhāya saṃvattati iti pidahitvā vattati yathā aggi ādīhi uppannāsu āpadāsu evam
translated: What is acquired through virtue is his own only if it is what should be done by virtue.🔽What is acquired through kindness is his own only if it is what should be done by kindness.🔽What is acquired through ability is his own only if it is what should be done by ability.🔽What is acquired through wealth is his own only if it is one of the four kinds of what should be done.🔽What is acquired through virtue is his own only if it is what should be done by virtue.

original: ādittagehanibbāpanādīnaṃ atthāya dhanapariccāgaṃ katvā tāsaṃ āpadānaṃ maggaṃ pidahati
analyzed: āditta geha nibbāpana ādīnam atthāya dhana pariccāgam katvā tāsam āpadānam maggam pidahati
translated: What is acquired through kindness is his own only if it is what should be done by kindness.🔽What is acquired through ability is his own only if it is what should be done by ability.🔽What is acquired through wealth is his own only if it is one of the four kinds of what should be done.🔽What is acquired through virtue is his own only if it is what should be done by virtue.🔽What is acquired through kindness is his own only if it is what should be done by kindness.

original: nivāreti. Sotthiṃ attānaṃ karotīti nirupaddavaṃ khemaṃ attānaṃ karoti. Ñātibalinti
analyzed: nivāreti sotthim attānam karoti iti nirupaddavam khemam attānam karoti ñāti balin ti
translated: What is acquired through ability is his own only if it is what should be done by ability.🔽What is acquired through wealth is his own only if it is one of the four kinds of what should be done.🔽What is acquired through virtue is his own only if it is what should be done by virtue.🔽What is acquired through kindness is his own only if it is what should be done by kindness.🔽What is acquired through ability is his own only if it is what

original: ñātakānaṃ baliṃ. Atithibalinti āgantukānaṃ baliṃ. Pubbapetabalinti paralokagatānaṃ🔽ñātakānaṃ baliṃ. Rājabalinti rañño kattabbayuttakaṃ rājabaliṃ. Devatābalinti devatānaṃ
analyzed: ñātakānam balim atithi balinti āgantukānam balim pubbapeta balinti para loka gatānam  ñātakānam balim rāja balinti rañño kattabba yuttakam rāja balim devatā balinti devatānam
translated: the offering to relatives. The offering to guests: the offering to visitors. The offering to ancestors: the offering to relatives who have passed away. The offering to the king: the offering to the king that is appropriate for him. The offering to the deities:

original: kattabbabaliṃ. Sabbametaṃ tesaṃ tesaṃ yathānucchavikavasena dātabbadānassa adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: kattabba balim sabbam etam tesam tesam yathānucchavika vasena dātabba dānassa adhivacanam
translated: The “gift to relatives” is the gift to one’s relatives. The “gift to guests” is the gift to visitors. The “gift to the departed” is the gift to one’s deceased relatives. The “gift to the king” is the gift to the king, which is due to him. The “gift to the deities” is the gift to the deities, which is due to them. All these are terms for the gifts that should be given according to one’s means.

original: Khantisoracce niviṭṭhāti adhivāsanakkhantiyañca susīlatāya ca niviṭṭhā. Ekamattānaṃ
analyzed: khanti soracce niviṭṭhāti adhivāsana khantiyam ca su sīla tāya ca niviṭṭhā eka mattānam
translated: “Steadfast in patience and self-control”: steadfast in the patience of endurance and in the self-control of good conduct.🔽“Taming themselves alone”: they tame their own self alone, their own person, by taming the faculties.

original: damentīti ekaṃ attanova attabhāvaṃ indriyadamena damenti. Samentīti attano cittaṃ
analyzed: damenti iti ekam attanā uva atta bhāvam indriya damena damenti samenti iti attanā cittam
translated: “They calm themselves”: they calm their own mind by calming the defilements.

original: kilesavūpasamanena samenti. Parinibbāpentīti kilesaparinibbāneneva parinibbāpenti.🔽Uddhaggikantiādīsu uparūparibhūmīsu phaladānavasena uddhamaggamassāti uddhaggikā.
analyzed: kilesa vūpasamanena samenti parinibbāpenti iti kilesa parinibbānena iva parinibbāpenti  uddhaggika nti ādīsu upari upari bhūmīsu phala dāna vasena uddha maggam assa ati uddhaggikā
translated: “They attain complete extinction”: they attain complete extinction by means of the extinction of the defilements.🔽“The upward way” and so forth: they are “the upward way” because they give their fruit in the higher and higher stages.

original: Saggassa hitāti tatrupapattijananato sovaggikā. Nibbattanibbattaṭṭhāne sukhova vipāko
analyzed: saggassa hitā ti sovaggikāḥ nibbatta nibbatta ṭhāne sukhaḥ uva vipākaḥ
translated: “The way to heaven” because they lead to the heavenly existences. The ripening of their fruit is pleasant in the place of rebirth.

original: assāti sukhavipākā. Suṭṭhu aggānaṃ dibbavaṇṇādīnaṃ dasannaṃ visesānaṃ nibbattanato
analyzed: assa ati sukha vipākā suṭṭhu aggānam dibba vaṇṇa ādīnam dasannam visesānam nibbattanato
translated: It is “blissful” because it produces the ten special qualities beginning with the divine colour of the noble person.

original: saggasaṃvattanikā, evarūpaṃ dakkhiṇaṃ patiṭṭhāpetīti attho.
analyzed: sagga saṃvattanikā evarūpam dakkhiṇam patiṭṭhāpeti iti attho
translated: It is “conducive to heaven” because it leads to heaven. The meaning is that he establishes such an offering.

original: Ariyadhamme ṭhitoti pañcasīladhamme patiṭṭhito. Pecca sagge pamodatīti paralokaṃ
analyzed: ariya dhamme ṭhito ti pañca sīla dhamme patiṭṭhito pecca sagge pamodati iti para lokam
translated: “Established in the Dhamma of the noble ones”: established in the five precepts. “He rejoices in heaven after death”: having gone to the other world,

original: gantvā yattha sagge paṭisandhiṃ gaṇhāti, tattha modati. Sotāpannasakadāgāmino vā
analyzed: gantvā yattha sagge paṭisandhim gaṇhāti tattha modati sotāpanna sakadāgāminaḥ vā
translated: wherever he takes rebirth in heaven, there he rejoices.

original: hontu anāgāmī vā, sabbesaṃ ayaṃ paṭipadā labbhatevāti.
analyzed: hontu anāgāmī vā sabbesam ayam paṭipadā labbhateva ati
translated: Whether he is a stream-enterer or a once-returner or a non-returner, this is the way for all.

original: 2. Ānaṇyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ānaṇya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the second sutta

original: 62. Dutiye adhigamanīyānīti pattabbāni. Kāmabhogināti vatthukāme ca kilesakāme ca🔽paribhuñjantena. Atthisukhādīsu atthīti uppajjanakasukhaṃ atthisukhaṃ nāma. Bhoge
analyzed: dutiye adhigamanīyāni iti pattabbāni kāma bhoginā ati vatthu kāme ca kilesa kāme ca  paribhuñjantena atthi sukha ādīsu atthi iti uppajjanaka sukham atthi sukham nāma bhoge
translated: In the second sutta, “to be attained” means to be reached. “One who enjoys sensual pleasures”: one who enjoys sense pleasures and defilements.🔽In the case of the pleasures of wealth, etc., the pleasure that arises is called the pleasure of existence.🔽The pleasure that arises in one who enjoys wealth is called the pleasure of wealth.

original: paribhuñjantassa uppajjanakasukhaṃ bhogasukhaṃ nāma. Anaṇosmīti uppajjanakasukhaṃ
analyzed: paribhuñjantassa uppajjanaka sukham bhoga sukham nāma anaṇaḥ asmi iti uppajjanaka sukham
translated: The pleasure that arises in one who thinks “I am free from debt”

original: ānaṇyasukhaṃ nāma. Niddoso anavajjosmīti uppajjanakasukhaṃ anavajjasukhaṃ nāma.
analyzed: ānaṇya sukham nāma niddosaḥ anavajjaḥ asmi iti uppajjanaka sukham anavajja sukham nāma
translated: The pleasure of being free from debt is the pleasure that arises when one thinks, “I am free from debt, free from blame.”

original: Bhuñjanti bhuñjamāno. Paññā vipassatīti paññāya vipassati. Ubho bhāgeti dve koṭṭhāse,
analyzed: bhuñjanti bhuñjamānaḥ paññāḥ vipassati iti paññāya vipassati ubhaḥ bhāge iti dve koṭṭhāse
translated: “He eats, he eats” : he who eats. “Wisdom sees” : wisdom sees. “Both sides” : two sides.🔽The first three are one side, and the pleasure of being free from blame is the other side.

original: heṭṭhimāni tīṇi ekaṃ koṭṭhāsaṃ, anavajjasukhaṃ ekaṃ koṭṭhāsanti evaṃ paññāya passamāno
analyzed: heṭṭhimāni tīṇi ekam koṭṭhāsam anavajja sukham ekam koṭṭhāsanti evam paññāya passamāno
translated: Thus seeing with wisdom,

original: dve koṭṭhāse jānātīti attho. Anavajjasukhassetanti etaṃ tividhampi sukhaṃ anavajjasukhassa🔽soḷasiṃ kalaṃ nāgghatīti.🔽3. Brahmasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dve koṭṭhāse jānāti iti attho anavajja sukhassa etan ti etam tividham pi sukham anavajja sukhassa  sa uḷasim kalam nāgghati iti  brahma sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: he knows the two sides. The meaning is, he knows the two sides. “The sixteenth part of the pleasure of being free from blame” : this threefold pleasure does not equal even the sixteenth part of the pleasure of being free from blame.🔽The Brahmasutta is commented on in the same way as the third sutta in the Tikanipata. The only difference is the word with the deity. In the fourth sutta, everything is clear in meaning.

original: 63. Tatiyaṃ tikanipāte vaṇṇitameva. Sapubbadevatānīti padamattameva ettha visesoti. Catutthe sabbaṃ uttānatthameva.🔽5. Rūpasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tatiyam tika nipāte vaṇṇitam eva sa pubbadevatāni iti pada mattam eva ettha visesaḥ ti catutthe sabbam uttānattham eva  rūpa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Rūpasutta is commented on in the same way as the first sutta in the Tikanipata.

original: 65. Pañcame rūpe pamāṇaṃ gahetvā pasanno rūpappamāṇo nāma. Rūpappasannoti tasseva
analyzed: pañcame rūpe pamāṇam gahetvā pasannaḥ rūpappamāṇaḥ nāma rūpa ppasannaḥ ti tassa iva
translated: In the fifth sutta, one who is confirmed in the view that “The world is limited” after having grasped the measure of material form is called “one who is confirmed in the view that the world is limited by material form.” “One who is confirmed in the view that the world is limited by material form” is a synonym for that view.

original: atthavacanaṃ. Ghose pamāṇaṃ gahetvā pasanno ghosappamāṇo nāma. Cīvaralūkhapattalūkhesu
analyzed: attha vacanam ghose pamāṇam gahetvā pasannaḥ ghosappamāṇaḥ nāma cīvara lūkha patta lūkhesu
translated: One who is confirmed in the view that “The world is limited” after having grasped the measure of sound is called “one who is confirmed in the view that the world is limited by sound.” “One who is confirmed in the view that the world is limited by sound” is a synonym for that view. One who is confirmed in the view that “The world is limited” after having grasped the measure of the coarseness of robes and the coarseness of bowls is called “one who is confirmed in the view that the world is limited by robes and bowls.” “One who is confirmed in the view that the world is limited by robes and bowls” is a synonym for that view.

original: pamāṇaṃ gahetvā pasanno lūkhappamāṇo nāma. Dhamme pamāṇaṃ gahetvā pasanno dhammappamāṇo
analyzed: pamāṇam gahetvā pasannaḥ lūkhappamāṇaḥ nāma dhamme pamāṇam gahetvā pasannaḥ dhamma ppamāṇaḥ
translated: When he is confirmed by taking the measure of the mental-phenomena, he is called “confirmed by the measure of the mental-phenomena” .🔽The other terms are synonyms for those.

original: nāma. Itarāni tesaṃyeva atthavacanāni. Sabbasatte ca tayo koṭṭhāse katvā dve koṭṭhāsā🔽rūpappamāṇā, eko na rūpappamāṇo. Pañca koṭṭhāse katvā cattāro koṭṭhāsā ghosappamāṇā,
analyzed: nāma itarāni tesam yeva atthavacanāni sabba satte ca tayo koṭṭhāse katvā dve koṭṭhāsā  rūpa ppamāṇāḥ ekaḥ na rūpa ppamāṇo pañca koṭṭhāse katvā cattāro koṭṭhāsāḥ ghosa ppamāṇā
translated: And all beings are divided into three classes, two classes being “confirmed by the measure of the visible-form” and one class “not confirmed by the measure of the visible-form” .🔽When they are divided into five classes, four classes are “confirmed by the measure of the sound” and one class “not confirmed by the measure of the sound” .

original: eko na ghosappamāṇo. Dasa koṭṭhāse katvā nava koṭṭhāsā lūkhappamāṇā, eko na lūkhappamāṇo.
analyzed: ekaḥ na ghosa ppamāṇaḥ dasa koṭṭhāse katvā nava koṭṭhāsāḥ lūkha ppamāṇāḥ ekaḥ na lūkha ppamāṇo
translated: When they are divided into ten classes, nine classes are “confirmed by the measure of the visible-form” and one class “not confirmed by the measure of the visible-form” .

original: Satasahassaṃ koṭṭhāse katvā pana eko koṭṭhāsova dhammappamāṇo, sesā na dhammappamāṇāti veditabbā.
analyzed: sata sahassam koṭṭhāse katvā pana ekaḥ koṭṭhāsaḥ va dhamma ppamāṇaḥ sesā na dhamma ppamāṇā ti veditabbā
translated: But when they are divided into a hundred thousand classes, only one class is “confirmed by the measure of the mental-phenomena” and the rest are “not confirmed by the measure of the mental-phenomena” .

original: Rūpe pamāṇiṃsūti ye rūpaṃ disvā pasannā, te rūpe pamāṇiṃsu nāma, pasīdiṃsūti attho.
analyzed: rūpe pamāṇiṃsu iti ye rūpam disvā pasannā te rūpe nāma pasīdiṃsu iti attho
translated: “They took the measure of the visible-form”: those who are confirmed after seeing the visible-form are called “those who took the measure of the visible-form” ; the meaning is that they were confirmed.🔽“They followed the sound”: they followed the sound; the meaning is that they were confirmed by taking the measure of the sound.

original: Ghosena anvagūti ghosena anugatā, ghosappamāṇaṃ gahetvā pasannāti attho. Chandarāgavasūpetāti
analyzed: ghosena ghosena anugatā ghosa ppamāṇam gahetvā pasannā ati chanda rāga vasu upetā ati
translated: “They were overcome by desire and lust” .

original: chandassa ca rāgassa ca vasaṃ upetā. Ajjhattañca na jānātīti niyakajjhatte tassa🔽guṇaṃ na jānāti. Bahiddhā ca na passatīti bahiddhāpissa paṭipattiṃ na passati. Samantāvaraṇoti🔽samantato āvārito, samantā vā āvaraṇamassāti samantāvaraṇo. Ghosena vuyhatīti ghosena
analyzed: chandassa ca rāgassa ca vasam upetāḥ ajjhattam ca na jānāti iti niyaka jjhatte tassa  guṇam na jānāti bahiddhā ca na passati iti bahiddhā api sa paṭipattim na passati samanta āvaraṇaḥ ti  samantataḥ āvāritaḥ samantā vai āvaraṇam assa ati samanta āvaraṇaḥ ghosena vuyhati iti ghosena
translated: and he is under the sway of both desire and lust. He does not know what is within himself: he does not know the virtue that is within himself. He does not see what is without: he does not see the practice that is without himself. He is completely covered: he is completely covered over, or he has a complete covering. He is carried away by talk: he is carried away by talk.

original: niyati, na guṇena. Ajjhattañca na jānāti, bahiddhā ca vipassatīti niyakajjhatte guṇaṃ🔽na jānāti, bahiddhā panassa paṭipattiṃ passati. Bahiddhā phaladassāvīti tassa parehi
analyzed: niyati na guṇena ajjhattam ca na jānāti bahiddhā ca vipassati iti niyaka jjhatte guṇaṃ  na jānāti bahiddhā pana assa paṭipattim passati bahiddhā phala dassāvī iti tassa parehi
translated: and he is under the sway of both desire and lust. He does not know what is within himself: he does not know the virtues of the one who is within himself. He does not see what is without: he does not see the practice of the one who is without himself. He is completely shut in: he is shut in on all sides, or he has a shut-inness on all sides. He is carried away by what is heard: he is carried away by what is heard, not by virtue. He does not know what is within himself, but he sees what is without: he does not know the virtues of the one who is within himself, but he sees the practice of the one who is without himself. He is a fruit-observer outside: he is a fruit-observer outside, seeing the fruit of honour given by others to the one who is without himself. He is a vision-observer without hindrance: he is a vision-observer without obstruction. He is not carried away by what is heard: he is not carried away by what is heard.🔽. Commentary

original: kataṃ bahiddhā sakkāraphalaṃ passanto. Vinīvaraṇadassāvīti vivaṭadassāvī. Na so ghosena🔽vuyhatīti so ghosena na nīyati.
analyzed: katam bahiddhā sakkāra phalam passantaḥ vinīvaraṇa dassāvī iti vivaṭa dassāvī na saḥ ghosena  vuyhati iti saḥ ghosena na nīyati
translated: In the sixth, “he is not a fruit-observer outside” means that he is not a fruit-observer outside, not seeing the fruit of honour given by others to the one who is without himself. “He is not a vision-observer without hindrance” means that he is not a vision-observer without obstruction. “He is not carried away by what is heard” means that he is not carried away by what is heard.

original: 6. Sarāgasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sa rāga sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . Commentary on the Sixth Sutta

original: 66. Chaṭṭhe mohajaṃ cāpaviddasūti mohajaṃ cāpi aviddasū apaṇḍitā. Savighātanti sadukkhaṃ.
analyzed: chaṭṭhe moha jam moha jam ca api a viddasū apaṇḍitā sa vighātam ti sa dukkham
translated: In the sixth, “he is not a fruit-observer outside” means that he is not a fruit-observer outside, not seeing the fruit of honour given by others to the one who is without himself. “He is not a vision-observer without hindrance” means that he is not a vision-observer without obstruction. “He is not carried away by what is heard” means that he is not carried away by what is heard.

original: Dukhudrayanti āyatiñca dukkhavaḍḍhidāyakaṃ. Acakkhukāti paññācakkhurahitā. Yathā🔽dhammā tathā santāti yathā rāgādayo dhammā ṭhitā, tathā sabhāvāva hutvā. Na tassevanti
analyzed: āyatim ca dukkha vaḍḍhi dāyakam acakkhukā ati paññā cakkhu rahitā yathā  dhammā tathā santā ati yathā rāga ādayaḥ dhammā tathā sabhāvā ava hutvā na
translated: “The low-down” : that which gives rise to the increase of suffering in the future. “Blind” : devoid of the eye of wisdom. “As are the dhammas, so are they” : they are just as they are, with the nature of lust, etc. “Not his own” :

original: maññareti mayaṃ evaṃsantā evaṃsabhāvāti tassa na maññare, na maññantīti attho. Imasmiṃ🔽suttepi gāthāsupi vaṭṭameva kathitaṃ.
analyzed: maññare iti mayam evaṃsantāḥ evaṃsabhāvā ati tassa na maññare na maññanti iti atthaḥ imasmin  sutte pi gāthāsu pi vaṭṭam eva kathitam
translated: Dukkhudrayaṃ means giving rise to the increase of suffering in the future. Acakkhukā means devoid of the eye of wisdom. Yathā dhammā tathā santāti means they are just as they are, i.e., they are just as they are in their own nature, i.e., as lust, etc. Na tassevaṃ maññare means they do not think thus, i.e., they do not think: “We are such and such, we are of such and such a nature.” In this sutta and in the verses, only the round of existence is spoken of.

original: 7. Ahirājasuttavaṇṇanā🔽67. Sattame imāni cattāri ahirājakulānīti idaṃ daṭṭhavisāneva sandhāya vuttaṃ. Ye
analyzed: ahirāja sutta vaṇṇanā  sattame imāni cattāri ahi rāja kulāni iti idam sandhāya vuttam ye
translated: . Commentary to the Ahirāja Sutta

original: hi keci daṭṭhavisā, sabbete imesaṃ catunnaṃ ahirājakulānaṃ abbhantaragatāva honti.🔽Attaguttiyāti attano guttatthāya. Attarakkhāyāti attano rakkhaṇatthāya. Attaparittāyāti
analyzed: hi keci daṭṭha visā sabbete imesam catunnam ahi rāja kulānam abbhantara gatā ava honti  atta guttiyā ati attanaḥ gutta atthāya atta rakkhāya ati attanaḥ rakkhaṇa tthāya atta parittāya ati
translated: In the seventh sutta, these four royal families of snakes are mentioned. This refers to the daṭṭhavisā only. For whatever snakes there are that are daṭṭhavisā, all of them are included in these four royal families of snakes.

original: attano parittāṇatthāya. Parittaṃ nāma anujānāmīti attho.
analyzed: attanaḥ parittāṇa tthāya parittam nāma anujānāmi iti
translated: Attaguttiyā means for the protection of themselves. Attarakkhāya means for the protection of themselves. Attaparittāyāti means for the protection of themselves. The meaning is: I allow paritta.

original: Idāni yathā taṃ parittaṃ kātabbaṃ, taṃ dassento virūpakkhehi metiādimāha. Tattha
analyzed: idāni yathā tam parittam kātabbam tam dassentaḥ virūpa kkhehi mā iti ādim āha tattha
translated: Now, showing how that should be done in brief, he said “By Virūpakkhas” , etc. Herein,

original: virūpakkhehīti virūpakkhanāgakulehi. Sesesupi eseva nayo. Apādakehīti apādakasattehi.
analyzed: virūpakkhehi iti virūpakkha nāga kulehi sesesu pi esa eva nayaḥ apādakehi iti apādaka sattehi
translated: By Virūpakkhas : by the Virūpakkha-race of Nāgas. The same method of explanation applies in the other cases. By the legless : by the legless creatures.

original: Sesesupi eseva nayo. Sabbe sattāti ito pubbe ettakena ṭhānena odissakamettaṃ kathetvā
analyzed: sesesu pi esā iva nayaḥ sabbe sattā ti itas pubbe ettakena ṭhānena odissaka mettam kathetvā
translated: The same method of explanation applies in the other cases. All creatures : after previously stating the loving-kindness in general terms up to this point,

original: idāni anodissakamettaṃ kathetuṃ idamāraddhaṃ. Tattha sattā pāṇā bhūtāti sabbānetāni🔽puggalavevacanāneva. Bhadrāni passantūti bhadrāni ārammaṇāni passantu. Mā kañci pāpamāgamāti
analyzed: idāni anodissaka mettam kathetum idam āraddham tattha sattā pāṇāḥ bhūtā ati sabbānetāni  puggala vevacanāni eva bhadrāni passantu uti bhadrāni ārammaṇāni passantu mā kañci pāpam āgamā ti

analyzed: dalidda iti ādīhi pavatta paccaya vipatti kasiravuttika iti ādīhi ājīva upāya vipatti  dubbaṇṇaḥ ti ādīhi atta bhāva vipatti bahu ābādhaḥ iti ādīhi dukkha kāraṇa samāyogaḥ na

original: saroruhaṃ. Iminā sukkhavipassakakhīṇāsavaṃ dasseti. So hi jhānābhiññānaṃ abhāvena

original: dasseti. So hi jhānābhiññānaṃ bhāvena paripuṇṇaguṇattā samaṇapadumo nāma hoti. Samaṇesu
analyzed: dasseti saḥ hi jhāna abhiññānam bhāvena paripuṇṇa guṇa ttā samaṇapadumaḥ nāma hoti samaṇesu

original: samaṇasukhumāloti sabbesupi etesu samaṇesu sukhumālasamaṇo muducittasarīro kāyikacetasikadukkharahito

original: kiriyajjhānāneva adhippetāni. Sesaṃ uttānatthamevāti.🔽8. Saṃyojanasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kiriya jhānānā eva adhippetāni sesam uttānattham eva ati  saṃyojana sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The four jhanas: here only functional jhanas are intended, even for those whose cankers are destroyed and for Buddhas. The rest is clear in meaning.🔽The explanation of the sutta on the fetters.

original: 88. Aṭṭhame sāsane laddhappatiṭṭhattā sotāpannova samaṇamacaloti vutto, nātibahuguṇattā
analyzed: aṭṭhame sāsane laddha ppatiṭṭha ttā sotāpannaḥ iva samaṇam acalaḥ iti vuttaḥ na ati bahuguṇa ttā
translated: In the eighth, the stream-enterer is called a “monk unshaken” because he has attained steadiness in the Dispensation.🔽The once-returner is called a “white-lotus monk” because he has not many special qualities like a lotus that has not many petals.

original: na bahupattaṃ viya saroruhaṃ sakadāgāmī samaṇapuṇḍarīkoti, tato bahutaraguṇattā satapattaṃ
analyzed: na bahu pattam viya saroruham sakadāgāmī samaṇa puṇḍarīkaḥ ti tatas bahutara guṇattā sata pattam
translated: The non-returner is called a “hundred-petaled lotus”

original: viya saroruhaṃ anāgāmī samaṇapadumoti, thaddhabhāvakarānaṃ kilesānaṃ sabbaso samucchinnattā
analyzed: viya saroruham anāgāmī samaṇa padumo ti thaddha bhāva karānam kilesānam sabbaso
translated: and like a lotus in a lake, a non-returner is a monk’s lotus.

original: mudubhāvappatto khīṇāsavo samaṇasukhumāloti.🔽9. Sammādiṭṭhisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: mudu bhāva ppatto khīṇa āsavaḥ samaṇa sukhu mālā ti  sammādiṭṭhi sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: and because he has cut out all the defilements that cause rigidity, he has attained suppleness. A perfected one is a monk’s delicate flower.🔽The explanation of the first sutta

original: 89. Navame sammādiṭṭhikotiādīhi aṭṭhaṅgikamaggavasena paṭhamasutte viya satta sekhā
analyzed: navame sammādiṭṭhikā ti ādīhi aṭṭhaṅgika magga vasena paṭhama sutte viya satta sekhā
translated: In the ninth sutta, “one with right view” and so on refer to the seven kinds of trainee mentioned in the first sutta under the heading of the eight factors of the path.

original: gahitā. Dutiyavāre dasaṅgikamaggavasena vā arahattaphalañāṇaarahattaphalavimuttīhi
analyzed: gahitā dutiya vāre dasaṅgika magga vasena vā arahatta phala ñāṇa arahatta phala vimuttīhi
translated: In the second case, either the path consisting of ten factors is mentioned together with the knowledge of the fruit of arahantship and the deliverance of the fruit of arahantship,

original: saddhiṃ, aṭṭhaṅgikamaggavasena vā sukkhavipassakakhīṇāsavo kathito, tatiyavāre ubhatobhāgavimutto,🔽catutthavāre tathāgato ca tathāgatasadisakhīṇāsavo cāti. Iti idaṃ suttaṃ paṭhamasutte
analyzed: saddhim aṭṭhaṅgika magga vasena vā sukkha vipassaka khīṇa āsavaḥ kathitaḥ tatiya vāre ubhatobhāga vimutto  catuttha vāre tathāgato ca tathāgata sadisa khīṇa āsavo ca ati iti idam suttam paṭhama sutte
translated: or the dry insight worker and the perfected one are mentioned under the heading of the eight factors of the path. In the third case, the one of twofold deliverance is mentioned.🔽In the fourth case, the Tathāgata and the perfected one who is the Tathāgata’s equal are mentioned. Thus this sutta is explained in terms of the same persons mentioned in the first sutta.

original: kathitapuggalānaṃ vaseneva kathitaṃ, desanāmattameva panettha nānanti.
analyzed: kathita puggalānam vasena iva kathitam desanā mattam eva pana ittha nānanti
translated: Only the teaching is different.

original: 10. Khandhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: khandha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the tenth sutta

original: 90. Dasame paṭhamavāre arahattatthāya payogaṃ anārabhitvā ṭhito pamādavihārī sekhapuggalo
analyzed: dasame paṭhama vāre arahatta tthāya payogam an ārabhitvā ṭhitaḥ pamāda vihārī sekha puggalo
translated: In the first section of the tenth sutta, the trainee who has not yet begun to strive for arahantship and who is negligent in practice is mentioned.

original: kathito. Dutiyavāre anuppāditajjhāno āraddhavipassako appamādavihārī sekhapuggalo
analyzed: kathitaḥ dutiya vāre anuppādita jhānaḥ āraddha vipassakaḥ appamāda vihārī sekha puggalo
translated: The second type is the trainee who has not yet reached jhāna but is engaged in insight and lives devoted to development.

original: kathito. Tatiyavāre āraddhavipassako appamādavihārī aṭṭhavimokkhalābhī sekhapuggalo
analyzed: kathitaḥ tatiya vāre āraddha vipassakaḥ appamāda vihārī aṭṭha vimokkha lābhī sekha puggalo
translated: The third type is the trainee who is engaged in insight and lives devoted to development and has attained the eight liberations.

original: kathito, catutthavāre paramasukhumālakhīṇāsavoti.
analyzed: kathito catuttha vāre
translated: The fourth type is the one who has reached the ultimate, subtle, and sublime state of the cankers’ destruction.

original: Macalavaggo catuttho.
analyzed: macala vaggo catutthaḥ
translated: The fourth sub-chapter on the steadfast is finished.

original: (10) 5. Asuravaggo
analyzed: asura vaggo
translated: The fifth sub-chapter on the asura

original: 1. Asurasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: asura sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the first sutta in the sub-chapter on the asura

original: 91. Pañcamassa paṭhame asuroti asurasadiso bībhaccho. Devoti devasadiso guṇavasena abhirūpo pāsādiko.
analyzed: pañcamassa paṭhame asuro ti asura sadisaḥ bībhacchaḥ devo ti deva sadisaḥ guṇa vasena abhirūpo pāsādiko
translated: An asura is one who is fearful like an asura. A god is one who is beautiful and inspiring like a god.

original: 2. Paṭhamasamādhisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: paṭhama samādhi sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The first explanation of concentration

original: 92. Dutiye ajjhattaṃ cetosamathassāti niyakajjhatte appanācittasamādhissa. Adhipaññādhammavipassanāyāti🔽saṅkhārapariggāhakavipassanāñāṇassa. Tañhi adhipaññāsaṅkhātañca, pañcakkhandhasaṅkhātesu
analyzed: dutiye ajjhattam cetaḥ samathassa ati niyaka ajjhatte appanā citta samādhissa adhi paññā dhamma vipassanāya ati  saṅkhāra pariggāhaka vipassanā ñāṇassa tat hi adhi paññā saṅkhātañca pañca kkhandha saṅkhātesu
translated: In the second sutta, “the stilling of the mind within” is the concentration of the jhāna that is attained in one’s own mind. “Insight into principles that is higher understanding”

original: ca dhammesu vipassanābhūtaṃ, tasmā “adhipaññādhammavipassanā”ti vuccatīti.🔽3. Dutiyasamādhisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ca dhammesu vipassanā bhūtam tasmai adhipaññā dhamma vipassanā iti vuccati iti 🔽dutiya samādhi sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: is the knowledge of insight that discerns formations. For that is higher understanding, and it is insight into principles that are called the five aggregates.

original: 93. Tatiye yogo karaṇīyoti yuttappayuttatā kattabbā. Chandoti kattukamyatāchando.
analyzed: tatiye yogo karaṇīyo ti yutta ppayutta tā kattabbā chando ti kattu kamya tā chando
translated: In the third, “the endeavour should be made” means that what is fitting and what is not should be done. “Will” is will to act.

original: Vāyāmoti payogo. Ussāhoti tato adhimattataraṃ vīriyaṃ. Ussoḷhīti paṅkalaggasakaṭauddharaṇasadisaṃ
analyzed: vāyāmo ti payogo ussāho ti tatas adhimattataram vīriyam ussoḷhi iti paṅka lagga sakaṭa uddharaṇa sadisam
translated: “Exertion” is effort. “Zeal” is energy higher than that. “Perseverance” is great energy like that needed to pull out a bogged cart.

original: mahāvīriyaṃ. Appaṭivānīti anivattanatā.
analyzed: mahā vīriyam a paṭivānīti a nivattana tā
translated: “Fortitude” is non-returning.

original: 4. Tatiyasamādhisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tatiya samādhi sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: Commentary on the Third Jhana Sutta

original: 94. Catutthe evaṃ kho, āvuso, saṅkhārā daṭṭhabbātiādīsu, āvuso, saṅkhārā nāma aniccato
analyzed: catutthe evam kho āvuso saṅkhārāḥ daṭṭhabbā ati ādīsu āvuso saṅkhārāḥ nāma aniccato
translated: In the fourth, “Friends, formations should be seen thus” and so on: “Friends, formations should be seen as impermanent,

analyzed: daṭṭhabbā aniccataḥ sammasitabbā aniccataḥ passitabbā tathā dukkhataḥ anattato ti  evam atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo evam kho āvuso cittam saṇṭhapetabbam ti ādīsu pi paṭhama jhāna vasena  āvuso cittam saṇṭhapetabbam paṭhama jhāna vasena sannisādetabbam paṭhama jhāna vasena
translated: they should be pondered as impermanent, they should be looked upon as impermanent. So too with painful and not-self.🔽This is the meaning to be seen. “Friends, consciousness should be steadied” and so on: “Friends, consciousness should be steadied in the first jhana, it should be steadied in the second jhana,

original: ekodi kātabbaṃ, paṭhamajjhānavasena samādahitabbaṃ. Tathā dutiyajjhānādivasenāti
analyzed: eka udi kātabbam paṭhama jhāna vasena samādahitabbam tathā dutiya jhāna ādi vasena ati
translated: it should be steadied in the third jhana, it should be steadied in the fourth jhana. So too with the base consisting of boundless space and so on.

original: evaṃ attho daṭṭhabbo. Imesu tīsupi suttesu samathavipassanā lokiyalokuttarāva kathitā.
analyzed: evam attho daṭṭhabbo imesu tīsu pi suttesu samatha vipassanā lokiya lokuttarā ava kathitā
translated: The meaning should be understood in this way. In these three suttas serenity and insight are spoken of as mundane and supramundane.

original: 5. Chavālātasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: chavālāta sutta vaṇṇanā

analyzed: chaṭṭhe sabbam uttāna ttham eva  khippanisanti sutta vaṇṇanā  sattame khippa nisantī iti sīgham jānitum samatthaḥ sutānam ca dhammānam ti

translated: He is not one who speaks pleasantly. He is not one who speaks well: he does not have a pleasant voice. The negative particle no is to be construed with each of the following terms. He is not one who is endowed with speech that is complete, unconfused, unadulterated,

The meaning should be understood in this way in all cases.🔽The explanation of the tenth sutta is finished.🔽The eighth was told by way of the inclination of the person and by way of the manifestation of the knowledge of the ten powers. translated: In the fourth, the “shallow” and the “deep-looking” are as follows. A pond of dark water with the colour of old leaves is called “deep-looking”; one with clear water like a polished gem is called “shallow-looking”.

translated: In the second, he is straight by being upright. He is swift by being swift in his pace. He is patient by being patient in his endurance.🔽He is honest by being honest in his virtue. The third sutta🔽In the third, the shadow of the goad: the shadow of a goad held up for the purpose of striking. Is present:🔽it is present by his discerning, “I must catch its speed.” He makes an effort: he makes an effort🔽to be stirred to urgency. He is pierced by the hair: he is pierced by the goad piercing his hair. He is pierced by the hide:🔽he is pierced by the goad piercing his hide. He is pierced to the bone:🔽he is pierced by the goad piercing his bone.

original: vedhena viddho. Kāyenāti nāmakāyena. Paramasaccanti nibbānaṃ. Sacchikarotīti passati.🔽Paññāyāti sahavipassanāya maggapaññāya.
analyzed: vedhena viddhaḥ kāyena ati nāmakāyena paramasaccam ti nibbānam sacchikaroti iti passati  paññāya ati saha vipassanāya magga paññāya
translated: In the second, with the whip’s shadow: with the shadow of the whip raised for the purpose of striking. Pierced by the bone-piercer: pierced by the goad that has penetrated the bone. With the body: with the mental body. The ultimate truth: Nibbāna. He realizes: he sees. With understanding: with the understanding of the path that is accompanied by insight.
